Example: 秋は紅葉が美しく、空も高く澄んだ青色に見え、散歩する人々の表情も穏やかになる aki wa kōyō ga utsukushiku, sora mo takaku suminda aoi-iro ni mie, sanpo suru hitobito no hyōjō mo odayaka ni naru (In autumn, the leaves turn beautifully red, the sky looks high and clear blue, and the expressions of people strolling become peaceful) 秋の夜長に、虫の音が響き渡り、月が静かな湖面に映えて幻想的な雰囲気を作り出す aki no yonaga ni, mushi no oto ga hibikiwataru, tsuki ga shizukana komen ni haete gensōteki na fun'iki o tsukuri dasu (On long autumn nights, the sounds of insects echo, and the moon reflects on the quiet lake, creating a magical atmosphere)

Word/Phrase: 雨
Romaji: ame
Meaning: hujan
Example: 昨日の天気予報では雨が降ると言っていたのに、今朝は強い日差しで目が覚めた Kinō no tenki yohō de wa ame ga furu to itte ita noni, kesā wa tsuyoi hizashi de me ga sameta (Yesterday’s weather forecast said it would rain, but I woke up to strong sunlight this morning)

Word/Phrase: 嵐
Romaji: arashi
Meaning: storm
Example: 嵐が近づいているので、外に出ている物を片付け、窓を閉めておいた方がいいですよ arashi ga chikazuite iru node, soto ni dete iru mono o katazuke, mado o shimete oita hō ga ii desu yo (Because a storm is approaching, it’s better to put away anything outside and close the windows) 嵐の後は空が透き通るように澄み渡り、とても美しくなることが多いです arashi no ato wa sora ga sukitoōru yō ni sumiwataru, totemo utukushiku naru koto ga ōi desu (After a storm, the sky often clears up so transparently that it becomes incredibly beautiful)

Word/Phrase: 冬
Romaji: fuyu
Meaning: winter
Example: 冬は寒くて雪が降るので、私は家で温かいコーヒーを飲みながら本を読むのが好きです fuyu wa samukute yuki ga furu node, watashi wa ie de atatakai kōhī o nomi nagara hon o yomu no ga suki desu (Because winter is cold and snowy, I enjoy reading books at home while sipping warm coffee) 冬休みには、毎年北海道へ家族全員で旅行し、温泉につかりながら美しい雪景色を楽しむのが私たちの伝統です fuyuyasumi ni wa, maiden nen Hokkaidō e kazoku zen'in de ryokō shi, onsen ni tsukari nagara utsukushī yukigeshi o tanoshimu no ga watashitachi no dentō desu (Every winter vacation, our family tradition is to travel to Hokkaido, soak in hot springs, and enjoy the beautiful snowy landscapes together)

Word/Phrase: 春
Romaji: haru
Meaning: spring
Example: 春が近づくと、桜の木が少しずつ緑に変わり、空も青く晴れてきます haru ga chikazukuto, sakura no ki ga sukoshizutsu midori ni kawari, sora mo aoku harete kimasu (As spring draws near, the cherry blossom trees slowly shift to green, and the sky transforms into a bright, cloudless blue) 春休みの終わりに、新学期の準備をしながら、友達と公園で最後のピクニックを楽しみました haruyasumi no owari ni, shingakki no junbi o shinagara, tomodachi to kōen de saigo no pikunikku o tanoshimimashita (At the end of spring break, while preparing for the new school term, I enjoyed a final picnic in the park with my friends)

Word/Phrase: 雲
Romaji: kumo
Meaning: cloud
Example: 青空に広がる真っ白な雲が、風に吹かれて絶えず姿を変え、遠くの山々を優しく覆っていく。 Aozora ni hirogaru masshiro na kumo ga, kaze ni fukarete taezu sugata o kae, tōku no yamazumi o yasashiku ōtte iku. (The pure white clouds spreading across the blue sky, constantly changing shape as the wind blows, gently cover the distant mountains.) 空に浮かぶ雲をぼんやりと眺めていると、時間がゆっくりと流れるような気になり、心が静かに落ち着いていく。 Sora ni ukabu kumo o bonyari to nagamete iru to, jikan ga yukkuri to nagareru yō na ki ni nari, kokoro ga shizuka ni ochitsuite iku.( As one gazes absently at the clouds drifting in the sky, time seems to flow slowly, and the heart quietly settles.)

Word/Phrase: 曇り
Romaji: kumori
Meaning: mendung
Example: 空が曇りがちな季節になると、窓から見える灰色の空に心が重くなる人が多いが、そんな時こそ部屋に花を飾ったり、好みの音楽を流すことで、気分を上向きに保つ工夫が必要だ。 kumori gachi na kisetsu ni naru to, mado kara mieru haiiro no sora ni kokoro ga omoku naru hito ga ooi ga, sonna toki koso heya ni hana o kazattari, konomi no ongaku o nagasu koto de, kibun o ue mukini tamotsu kufū ga hitsuyō da. (When the season tends to be overcast, many feel weighed down by the gray sky outside their windows, but it’s precisely then that arranging flowers in the room or playing favorite music can help maintain a positive mood.) 曇りの日が続くと、太陽の光を浴びる機会が減るため、体内時計が乱れやすくなるが、朝晩の短い散歩を習慣にするだけで、その影響を和らげることができる。 kumori no hi ga tsuzuku to, taiyō no hikari o abiru kikai ga heru tame, tainai dokei ga midare yasuku naru ga, asaban no mijikai sanpo o shūkan ni suru dake de, sono eikyō o yawarageru koto ga dekiru. (When cloudy days persist, reduced sunlight exposure can disrupt the body’s internal clock, but simply making short morning or evening walks a habit can mitigate the effect.)

Word/Phrase: 夏
Romaji: natsu
Meaning: summer
Example: 夏休みの時、家族と一緒に南の島へ旅行し、透き通った海で泳ぎました。 Natsuyasumi no toki, kazoku to issho ni minami no shima e ryokō shi, sukitootta umi de oyogimashita. (During summer vacation, I traveled to a southern island with my family and swam in the crystal-clear sea.) 夏祭りで友達と一緒に屋台を回り、花火を見ながら冷たいかき氷を食べました。 Natsumatsuri de tomodachi to issho ni yatai o mawari, hanabi o minagara tsumetai kakigōri o tabemashita. (At the summer festival, I went around the food stalls with friends, ate cold shaved ice, and watched the fireworks.)

Word/Phrase: 天気
Romaji: tenki
Meaning: cuaca
Example: 今日も空は青く澄み渡り、とても気持ちのいい天気ですね Kyō mo sora wa aoku sumiwatari, totemo kimochi no ii tenki desu ne (Hari ini langit biru cerah dan cuaca sangat menyenangkan) 今日の天気は公園でピクニックをするのに最適で、風も心地よく吹いています Kyō no tenki wa kōen de pikunikku o suru no ni saiteki de, kaze mo kokochi yoku fuite imasu (Cuaca hari ini sangat cocok untuk piknik di taman, dengan angin bertiup nyaman)

Word/Phrase: 梅雨
Romaji: tsuyu
Meaning: musim hujan
Example: 日本では、梅雨が続く6月ごろ、湿気が高くなるため、食べ物や衣類の管理に特に注意が必要になる。 Nihon de wa, tsuyu ga tsuzuku rokugatsu goro, shitsuki ga takaku naru tame, tabemono ya irui no kanri ni tokuni chūi ga hitsuyō ni naru. (In Japan, around June when the rainy season continues, humidity rises, making it especially important to carefully manage food and clothing.) 梅雨が終わると、一気に気温が上がり、学校が夏休みに入るので、子どもたちが待ち望む時期でもある。 Tsuyu ga owaru to, ikki ni kion ga agari, gakkō ga natsuyasumi ni hairu node, kodomotachi ga machinozomu jiki demo aru.

Word/Phrase: 雨天
Romaji: uten
Meaning: cuaca hujan
Example: 雨天決行のイベントでは、参加者全員に防水グッズが配布されます uten ketsukou no ibento de wa, sanka-sha zen'in ni bousui guzzu ga haifu saremasu (Di acara yang tetap dilaksanakan meskipun cuaca hujan, semua peserta akan menerima perlengkapan tahan air) 雨天時の工事現場では、作業員の安全確保のため特別な対策が講じられています utenji no kouji genba de wa, sagyouin no anzen kakuhou no tame tokubetsu na taisaku ga koujirarete imasu (Ketika cuaca hujan di lokasi konstruksi, tindakan khusus diterapkan untuk menjamin keselamatan pekerja)

Word/Phrase: 雪
Romaji: yuki
Meaning: snow
Example: 雪が降り始めたので、外に出る前に厚手のコートを着て、マフラーと手袋も忘れないでください yuki ga furihajimeta node, soto ni deru mae ni atsude no kōto o kite, mafurā to tebukuro mo wasurenai de kudasai (Snow has started to fall, so before going outside, please wear a thick coat and don’t forget your scarf and gloves) 冬の雪は白くてきれいですが、道が凍結して滑りやすくなるため、歩くときは足元に十分注意してください fuyu no yuki wa shirokute kirei desu ga, michi ga tōketsu shite suberiyasuku naru tame, aruku toki wa ashimoto ni jūbun chūi shite kudasai (The snow in winter is white and beautiful, but the roads freeze and become slippery, so please pay close attention to your footing when walking)

Word/Phrase: 晴れ
Romaji: hare
Meaning: cerah
Example: 今日も空が晴れていて、風が心地よく吹き、気持ちがいいです Kyō mo sora ga harete ite, kaze ga kokochiyoku fuki, kimochi ga ii desu (Today the sky is clear again, the wind blows pleasantly, and it feels wonderful.) 太陽の光が強くて、公園でピクニックをするのに最適な晴れの日です Taiyō no hikari ga tsuyokute, kōen de pikunikku o suru no ni saiteki na hare no hi desu (The sunlight is strong, making it the perfect clear day for a picnic in the park.)

Word/Phrase: 半袖
Romaji: hansode
Meaning: short sleeves
Example: 夏になると、毎日の通勤でも汗をかきにくい半袖のポロシャツを選ぶようになります natsu ni naru to, mainichi no tsūkin demo ase o kaki nikui hansode no poloshatsu o erabu yō ni narimasu (When summer arrives, I start choosing short-sleeved polo shirts for my daily commute to avoid sweating too much) 夏休みの旅行準備で、軽くて乾きやすい半袖のアウトドアウェアを何着も用意しました natsuyasumi no ryokō junbi de, karukute kawaki yasui hansode no autodōawea o nanki mo yōi shimashita (For my summer vacation trip preparations, I got several lightweight, quick-drying short-sleeved outdoor shirts ready)

Word/Phrase: 背広
Romaji: sebiro
Meaning: suit
Example: 会社で重要な会議がある日、多くの社員はきちんと背広を着て出席し、プロフェッショナルな印象を与えようと努めている。 kaisha de jūyō na kaigi ga aru hi, ōku no shain wa kichinto sebiro o kite shusseki shi, purofesshonaru na inshō o ataeyō to tsutomete iru. (On days when there are important meetings at the company, many employees make an effort to attend wearing well-fitted suits to project a professional image.) 背広はビジネスシーンに欠かせないが、手入れに手間がかかるため、忙しい人ほど定期的にクリーニング店を利用する傾向にある。 sebiro wa bijinesu shīn ni kakasenai ga, teire ni tema ga kakaru tame, isogashii hito hodo teiki-teki ni kurīningu-ten o riyō suru keikō ni aru. (While suits are indispensable in business settings, their high-maintenance nature means that busier individuals tend to rely on regular dry-cleaning services.)

Word/Phrase: 制服
Romaji: seifuku
Meaning: seragam
Example: 学校で制服を着ることは、規則を守る第一歩だとよく言われますが、そのポケットに入れた学生証やメモが、忙しい朝を助けてくれることもあります。 Gakkō de seifuku o kiru koto wa, kisoku o mamoru daiippo da to yoku iwaremasu ga, sono poketto ni ireta gakuseishō ya memo ga, isogashī asa o tasukete kureru koto mo arimasu. (At school, wearing a uniform is often said to be the first step in following rules, but the student ID and notes kept in its pockets can also help during busy mornings.) 制服の手入れは、特に暑い季節になると、洗濯だけでなくアイロンがけまで必要で、毎日の準備に予想以上の時間を取られることがあります。 Seifuku no teire wa, tokuni atsuī kisetsu ni naru to, sentaku dake de naku airon-gake made hitsuyō de, mainichi no junbi ni yosō ijō no jikan o torareru koto ga arimasu. (Maintaining a uniform, especially in hot seasons, requires not just washing but also ironing, which can take more time than expected for daily preparation.)

Word/Phrase: 袖
Romaji: sode
Meaning: sleeve
Example: 袖が長すぎて、仕事中にコーヒーカップを倒してしまい、書類が台無しになりました sode ga nagasugite, shigoto-chū ni kōhī kappu o taoshite shimai, shorui ga dainashi ni narimashita (Because my sleeves were too long, I knocked over my coffee cup during work and ruined the documents.) このコートは袖の内側に隠しポケットがあり、小さな貴重品を安全に保管できます kono kōto wa sode no uchigawa ni kakushi poketto ga ari, chiisa na kichōhin o anzen ni hokan dekimasu (This coat has a hidden pocket inside the sleeve, allowing you to securely store small valuables.)

Word/Phrase: 浴衣
Romaji: yukata
Meaning: yukata
Example: 夏祭りの夜、浴衣を着た人々が提灯の明かりに照らされながら、屋台のにぎやかな声と共に歩いている光景は、日本の夏ならではの風物詩だ。 Natsu matsuri no yoru, yukata o kita hitobito ga chōchin no akari ni terasare nagara, yatai no nigiyaka na koe to tomo ni aruite iru kōkei wa, Nihon no natsu narade wa no fūbutsushi da. (The sight of people in yukata walking under the glow of paper lanterns, accompanied by the lively voices of festival stalls, is a unique summer scene in Japan.) 最近では、浴衣を選ぶ際に、伝統的な柄だけでなく、現代的なデザインや色使いを取り入れたものも増え、若者を中心に新しい着こなしが広まっている。 Saikin de wa, yukata o erabu sai ni, dentōteki na gara dake de naku, gendaiteki na dezain ya iro-zukai o toriireta mono mo fue, wakamono o chūshin ni atarashī kikonasu ga hiromatte iru. (Lately, when choosing a yukata, not only traditional patterns but also modern designs and color schemes have become more common, spreading new ways of wearing them, especially among young people.)

Word/Phrase: 帯
Romaji: obi
Meaning: pita
Example: 帯はとてもきれいな色で、友達からのプレゼントでした obi wa totemo kirei na iro de, tomodachi kara no purezento deshita (The obi had a very beautiful color and was a gift from a close friend I cherish.) この帯は着物に合わせて選びましたが、伝統的な柄と現代的なデザインを組み合わせたものです kono obi wa kimono ni awasete erabanimashita ga, dentō-teki na gara to gendai-teki na dezain o kumiawaseta mono desu (I chose this obi to match the kimono, but it combines traditional patterns with a modern design.)

Word/Phrase: 赤
Romaji: aka
Meaning: red
Example: 赤いリンゴがテーブルの上に置いてあります そのリンゴは光沢がありとても甘くて美味しそうです akai ringo ga tēburu no ue ni oite arimasu sono ringo wa kōshaku ga ari totemo amakute oishisō desu (A red apple is placed on the table; it has a shine and looks very sweet and delicious) 赤い服を着た女性が公園で子供たちと楽しそうに遊んでいます 特に春になると明るい赤色の服を好む人が増えるようです akai fuku o kita josei ga kōen de kodomotachi to tanoshisō ni asonde imasu tokuni haru ni naru to akarui akairo no fuku o konomu hito ga fueru yō desu (A woman in a red dress is happily playing with children in the park; especially in spring, more people seem to prefer bright red clothing.)

Word/Phrase: 青
Romaji: ao
Meaning: biru
Example: 青い空を見上げると、雲の形が変化していく様子が面白く、心が自然と落ち着きます aoi sora o miageru to, kumo no katachi ga henka shite iku yousu ga omoshiroku, kokoro ga shizen to ochitsukimasu (When I look up at the blue sky and watch the shapes of the clouds transform, my heart naturally calms down) 青い服を着て海辺を歩くと、風が服を通して肌に触れ、少し冷たく感じますが、その清涼感が夏の暑さを和らげてくれます aoi fuku o kite umibe o aruku to, kaze ga fuku o tooshite hada ni fure, sukoshi tsumetaku kanjimasu ga, sono seiryōkan ga natsu no atsusa o yawaragete kuremasu (When I wear blue clothes and walk along the beach, the wind touches my skin through the fabric, feeling slightly cold, but that coolness soothes the summer heat)

Word/Phrase: 茶色
Romaji: chairo
Meaning: brown
Example: 日差しを浴びて輝く茶色の毛並みを持つあの野良猫は、ベンチの下で丸くなり、時折伸びをしながらも、通行人の足元をすり抜ける。 hizashi o abite kagayaku chairo no ke namomi o motsu ano nora neko wa, benchi no shita de maruku nari, tokidoki nobi o shinagara mo, tsūkōnin no ashimoto o surinukeru. (The stray cat with brown fur that shines in the sunlight curls up under the bench, occasionally stretching while slipping through the passersby’s feet.) 古本屋の棚に積もった埃の中、茶色に変色した表紙の本を探すうち、いつの間にかあの茶トラが店の奥でくつろぎ、店主も知らぬ間に常連客のように居座っていた。 furuhon’ya no tana ni tsumotta hokori no naka, chairo ni henshoku shita hyōshi no hon o sagasu uchi, itsu no ma ni ka ano cha-tora ga mise no oku de kutsurogi, ten’nu mo shiranu ma ni jōrenkyaku no yō ni izuwatte ita. (While searching for a book with a brown-discolored cover among the dusty shelves of the used bookstore, that brown tabby had somehow settled in the back of the shop, lounging like a regular customer without the owner even noticing.)

Word/Phrase: 黄色
Romaji: kiiro
Meaning: yellow
Example: 公園の一角に広がる黄色の花畑は、春風に揺れながら訪れる人々の目を楽しませ、 kōen no ikkaku ni hirogaru kiiro no hanabatake wa, harukaze ni yurenagara otozureru hitobito no me o tanoshimasete, (Hamparan bunga kuning yang membentang di sudut taman, bergoyang ditiup angin semi, menyenangkan mata para pengunjung) 黄色に塗られた古い駅舎は、長い間この町のシンボルとして親しまれてきました。 kiiro ni nurareta furui ekisha wa, nagai aida kono machi no shinboru toshite shitashimarete kimashita. (Stasiun tua yang dicat kuning telah lama akrab sebagai simbol kota ini.)

Word/Phrase: 紺
Romaji: kon
Meaning: navy
Example: 今日、会議室でプレゼン資料を確認している紺のスーツの男性は、誰よりも集中した様子だった。 Kyō, kaigishitsu de purezen shiryō o kakunin shite iru kon no sūtsu no dansei wa, dare yori mo shūchū shita samada datta. (Today, the man in the navy suit checking presentation materials in the meeting room looked more focused than anyone else.) 就職初日、紺のネクタイを選んだ彼は、エレベーターの中で深呼吸をしながら自分の決意を確かめていた。 Shūshoku shonichi, kon no nekutai o eranda kare wa, erebētā no naka de shinkokyū o shinagara jibun no ketsui o tashikamete ita. (On his first day at work, he chose a navy tie and confirmed his resolve while taking deep breaths in the elevator.)

Word/Phrase: 黒
Romaji: kuro
Meaning: black
Example: その猫はとても静かで、黒い毛が日光に輝いて見えます sono neko wa totemo shizuka de, kuroi ke ga nikkō ni kagayaite miemasu (The cat is very quiet, and its black fur glistens beautifully in the sunlight) 黒い猫が庭の木陰でゆっくりと昼寝をしながら、時折耳をピクピクさせています kuroi neko ga niwa no kokage de yukkuri to hirune o shinagara, tokidoki mimi o pikupiku sasete imasu (A black cat is taking a slow nap in the shade of the garden, occasionally twitching its ears.)

Word/Phrase: 緑
Romaji: midori
Meaning: green
Example: 公園の緑が目に映るたび、日々の疲れが癒やされて、新しい季節への希望が湧いてきます Kōen no midori ga me ni utsuru tabi, hibino tsukare ga iyasarete, atarashī kisetsu e no kibō ga waki te kimasu (Every time the park’s lush greenery catches my eye, my daily weariness fades, and hope for the new season swells within me) 緑豊かな森を散策していると、木々から漂う土の香りと鳥のさえずりが、心の奥深くに平穏をもたらしてくれます Midori yutaka na mori o sansaku shite iru to, kigi kara tadayou tsuchi no kaori to torino saezuri ga, kokoro no okufukaku ni heion o motarasu te kuremasu (As I stroll through the verdant forest, the earthy scent drifting from the trees and the birds’ songs bring a deep, tranquil peace to the depths of my soul)

Word/Phrase: 紫
Romaji: murasaki
Meaning: purple
Example: 紫の花が春風に揺れながら公園の一角を彩り、訪れる人々の心を和ませていた。 Murasaki no hana ga harukaze ni yure nagara kōen no ikkaku o irodori, otozureru hitobito no kokoro o yasumashite ita. (The purple flowers swayed in the spring breeze, adorning a corner of the park and soothing the hearts of visitors.) 子供たちは紫の花畑で追いかけっこをしながら、時折立ち止まって花びらの触り心地を楽しんでいた。 Kodomotachi wa murasaki no hanabatake de oikakekko o shinagara, tokidoki tachidomatte hanabira no sawari-gokochi o tanoshinde ita. (The children played tag in the field of purple flowers, occasionally stopping to enjoy the texture of the petals.)

Word/Phrase: 白
Romaji: shiro
Meaning: white
Example: 白い壁の部屋は明るく広々とした印象を与え、リラックスできる空間になります。 shiroi kabe no heya wa akaruku hirobiroshita inshō o atae, rirakkusu dekiru kūkan ni narimasu. (A room with white walls gives a bright and spacious impression, creating a relaxing atmosphere.) この伝統的な日本の結婚式では、花嫁は純白の打掛を着て、神聖な雰囲気を醸し出しています。 kono dentōteki na Nihon no kekkonshiki de wa, hanayome wa junpaku no uchikake o kite, shinsei na fun'iki o kamishidashite imasu. (At this traditional Japanese wedding, the bride wears a pure white uchikake, exuding a sacred atmosphere.)

Word/Phrase: 朱
Romaji: shu
Meaning: bright red
Example: 朱色に塗られた古びた神社の扉がゆっくりと開かれるや否や、中からは桜の花びらを思わせる甘い香りが漂い、参拝者たちの心を和ませた shu-iro ni nurareta furubita jinja no tobira ga yukkuri to akareru ya inya, naka kara wa sakura no hanabira o omowaseru amai kaori ga tadayoi, sanpeisha-tachi no kokoro o yawarageta (The moment the weathered shrine door, painted a deep vermilion, slowly creaked open, a sweet fragrance reminiscent of cherry blossoms drifted out, soothing the hearts of the worshippers) 祖母が炉端で焼いた朱色を帯びた餅菓子の香りは、今も尚、子供時代の記憶を鮮やかに呼び覚まし、懐かしさと共に胸に迫る sobo ga roba de yaita shu-iro o obita mochigashi no kaori wa, ima mo nao, kodomo jidai no kioku o azayaka ni yobi-samashi, natsukashisa to tomo ni mune ni semaru (The scent of the rice cakes, tinged with crimson, that my grandmother baked by the hearth still vividly awakens memories of childhood, pressing upon my heart with a wave of nostalgia)

Word/Phrase: 灰
Romaji: hai
Meaning: gray
Example: 火事の後で、家の灰が風に飛ばされて、近所の庭に散らばってしまった Kaji no ato de, ie no hai ga kaze ni tobasarete, kinjō no niwa ni chirabatte shimatta (After the fire, the gray remnants of the house were blown by the wind and scattered across the neighborhood gardens) 工場の煙突から排出される灰が、周辺の環境に悪影響を及ぼしている Kōjō no entotsu kara haishutsu sareru hai ga, shūhen no kankyō ni akueikyō o oyboshi te iru (The gray emissions released from the factory chimney are negatively affecting the surrounding environment)

Word/Phrase: 後
Romaji: ato
Meaning: after
Example: この仕事を終えた後で、同僚たちと近くのレストランへ行き、久しぶりに楽しい時間を過ごすつもりだ。 kono shigoto o oeta ato de, dōryō-tachi to chikaku no resutoran e iki, hisashiburi ni tanoshii jikan o sugosu tsumori da. (after finishing this work, I plan to go to a nearby restaurant with my colleagues and spend a fun time together for the first time in a while) プロジェクトの締め切りは来月末だが、提出が終わった後、チーム全員で結果を確認するための打ち合わせを行う予定である。 purojekuto no shimekiri wa raigetsumatsu da ga, teishutsu ga owatta ato, chīmu zen’in de kekka o kakunin suru tame no uchiawase o okonau yotei de aru. (while the project deadline is at the end of next month, after submission, we plan to hold a meeting where the entire team will confirm the results.)

Word/Phrase: 前
Romaji: mae
Meaning: before
Example: 駅の改札を出たら、前の駅で降りてしまったことに気がつき、急いでタクシーに乗った。 Eki no kaisatsu o detara, mae no eki de orite shimatta koto ni ki ga tsuki, isoide takushī ni notta. (After exiting the ticket gate, I realized I had gotten off at the previous station and hurriedly took a taxi.) 図書館で借りた本を読み始める前に、前書きに書いてある注意事項をよく読まなければならない。 Toshokan de karita hon o yomihajimeru mae ni, maegaki ni kaite aru chūi jikō o yoku yomanakereba naranai. (Before starting to read the book borrowed from the library, I must carefully read the precautions written in the preface.)

Word/Phrase: 絵
Romaji: e
Meaning: drawing
Example: 小さい頃から絵を描くのが好きで、今でも休みの日はよく絵を描いています。 Chiisai koro kara e o kaku no ga suki de, ima demo yasumi no hi wa yoku e o kaite imasu. (Since I was little, I’ve loved drawing, so even now I often spend my days off sketching.) 友達に「この絵、上手！」と言われた時は、とても嬉しくて、もっと頑張ろうと思いました。 Tomodachi ni "kono e, jouzu!" to iwareta toki wa, totemo ureshikute, motto ganbarou to omoimashita. (When my friend said, “This drawing is great!” I was so happy that I decided to work even harder.)

Word/Phrase: 話
Romaji: hanashi
Meaning: cerita
Example: 友達と話をすることで、毎日のストレスが軽減され、心が落ち着きます tomodachi to hanashi o suru koto de, mainichi no sutoresu ga keigen sa re, kokoro ga ochitsukimasu (By talking with friends, my daily stress is reduced, and my mind feels at ease) 先週の旅行で出会った人と話をして、その国の文化や習慣について深く理解することができました senshuu no ryokou de deatta hito to hanashi o shite, sono kuni no bunka ya shuukan ni tsuite fukaku rikai suru koto ga dekimashita (Last week, I traveled and talked with someone I met there, which helped me deeply understand the country’s culture and customs)

Word/Phrase: 歌
Romaji: uta
Meaning: song
Example: 歌を歌うのはとても楽しいですけど、歌が上手に歌えないと恥ずかしいです uta o utau no wa totemo tanoshii desu kedo, uta ga jōzu ni utaenai to hazukashii desu (While singing songs is truly enjoyable, it can feel quite embarrassing when you struggle to sing them well) 歌を聴くのが好きな友達と一緒にカラオケボックスで、お互いのお気に入りの曲を歌い合いました uta o kiku no ga suki na tomodachi to issho ni karaoke bokkusu de, otagai no okiniiri no kyoku o utaiaimashita (I went to a karaoke box with a friend who loves listening to songs, and we took turns singing each other’s favorite tunes)

Word/Phrase: 裏
Romaji: ura
Meaning: bagian belakang
Example: そのレストランは表向き新鮮な食材を使っていると宣伝しているが、裏では全く違う現実があった。 sono resutoran wa omote muki shinsen na shokuzai o tsukatte iru to senden shite iru ga, ura de wa mattaku chigau genjitsu ga atta. (While that restaurant advertises using fresh ingredients on the surface, a completely different reality existed behind the scenes.) 有名店の裏側で使われているのは、実はいつも冷凍食品や安い輸入肉だという噂を聞き、驚いた。 yūmeiten no uragawa de tsukawarete iru no wa, jitsu wa itsumo reitō shokuhin ya yasui yunyū niku da to iu uwasa o kiki, odorita. (I was shocked to hear rumors that what is actually used behind the scenes at that famous restaurant is always frozen food and cheap imported meat.)

Word/Phrase: 間
Romaji: aida/ma
Meaning: antara
Example: この試験期間中、ほっとできるのは、次の試験までの短い間だけで、その時間にこの映画を観る予定だ。 Kono shiken kikanchū, hotto dekiru no wa, tsugi no shiken made no mijikai aida dake de, sono jikan ni kono eiga o miru yotei da. (During this exam period, the only time I can relax is the brief interval until the next test, and I plan to watch this movie then.) 友達との待ち合わせが終わった後、次の待ち合わせまでの間、図書館で集中して勉強することができた。 Tomodachi to no machiawase ga owatta ato, tsugi no machiawase made no aida, toshokan de shūchū shite benkyō suru koto ga dekita. (After finishing one meetup with friends, I managed to focus and study at the library during the gap before the next appointment.)

Word/Phrase: 左
Romaji: hidari
Meaning: left
Example: 左のドアを開けて冷蔵庫から牛乳を取り、朝食の準備を手伝ってもらえますか？ hidari no doa o akete reizōko kara gyūnyū o tori, chōshoku no junbi o tetsudatte moraemasu ka? (Could you open the left door, take the milk from the refrigerator, and help prepare breakfast?) 左側の道をまっすぐ進み、信号を渡った後に左に曲がると、目的の図書館が見えてきます hidari-gawa no michi o massugu susumi, shingō o watattara hidari ni magattara, mokuteki no toshokan ga miete kimasu (Go straight on the left-side road, and after crossing the traffic light and turning left, you’ll see the library you’re looking for.)

Word/Phrase: 東
Romaji: higashi
Meaning: east
Example: 東の空が夕焼けで美しいオレンジ色に染まり、今日も平和な一日が終わります Higashi no sora ga yūyake de utsukushī orenji-iro ni somari, kyō mo heiwa na ichinichi ga owarimasu (The eastern sky is beautifully dyed in a stunning orange by the evening glow, marking the end of another peaceful day) 東の国から留学してきたクラスメイトと共に、伝統的な茶道や祭りを体験しながら日本の深い文化を学びました Higashi no kuni kara ryūgaku shite kita kurasumēto to tomo ni, dentō-teki na sadō ya matsuri o taikenshinagara Nihon no fukai bunka o manabimashita (I studied the profound aspects of Japanese culture with a classmate who came from an eastern country on exchange, experiencing traditional tea ceremonies and festivals together)

Word/Phrase: 北
Romaji: kita
Meaning: north
Example: 北海道から来た留学生は、初めての雪に目を輝かせ、北の大地で育ったからこそ、厳しい冬を乗り越える知恵を私たちに教えてくれた。 Hokkaidō kara kita ryūgakusei wa, hajimete no yuki ni me o kagayakase, kita no daichi de sodatta kara koso, kibishī fuyu o norikoeru chie o watashitachi ni oshiete kureta. (The exchange student from Hokkaido sparkled at her first snow, and precisely because she grew up in the northern land, she shared with us the wisdom to endure harsh winters.) 北の風が吹き付ける中、祖父は「北の方角を忘れるな」とよく言い、それは単なる方向ではなく、人生の指針だと今でも思い出す。 Kita no kaze ga fukitsukeru naka, sofu wa "kita no hōgaku o wasureru na" to yoku ii, sore wa tan'naru hōkō de naku, jinsei no shishin da to ima demo omoidasu. (As the northern wind blew fiercely, my grandfather often said, "Never forget the northern direction," and even now, I recall that it wasn’t just about direction, but a guiding principle in life.)

Word/Phrase: 前
Romaji: mae
Meaning: depan
Example: 前の日曜日、公園で友達と一緒にピクニックを楽しみました mae no nichiyōbi, kōen de tomodachi to issho ni pikunikku o tanoshimimashita (Last Sunday, I enjoyed a picnic with my friends in the park) その前、私たちは近所のスーパーマーケットで食材を買い揃えました sono mae, watashitachi wa kinjo no sūpāmāketto de shokuzai o koroesoemashita (Before that, we bought all the groceries we needed at the local supermarket)

Word/Phrase: 真ん中
Romaji: mannaka
Meaning: tengah2
Example: 真ん中のテーブルに花瓶を置き、来客用のお菓子と紅茶セットを左右対称に並べてください mannaka no tēburu ni kabin o oki, raikyaku-yō no okashi to kōcha setto o sayū tōshō ni narabete kudasai (Please place the vase in the center of the table and arrange the guest snacks and tea set symmetrically on both sides) 真ん中の席は空いていますが、エアコンの風が直接当たるので、長時間座ると体調を崩すかもしれません mannaka no seki wa aite imasu ga, eakon no kaze ga chokusetsu ataru node, chōjikan suwaru to taichō o kusuru kamoshiremasen (The middle seat is available, but the air conditioner blows directly on it, so sitting there for a long time might make you feel unwell)

Word/Phrase: 周り
Romaji: mawari
Meaning: sekitar
Example: 周りの人たちがみんな楽しそうに話しているので、つい私も会話に加わってしまいました mawari no hito-tachi ga minna tanoshisō ni hanashite iru node, tsui watashi mo kaiwa ni kuwawatte shimaimashita (Because everyone around me was chatting cheerfully, I ended up joining the conversation without thinking) 周りの景色が季節ごとに変化するので、毎回新しい発見があり、散歩が楽しみです mawari no keshiki ga kisetsugoto ni henka suru node, maikai atarashī hakken ga ari, sanpo ga tanoshimi desu (The surrounding scenery changes with each season, so I always find something new, making my walks something to look forward to)

Word/Phrase: 右
Romaji: migi
Meaning: right
Example: 右の道をまっすぐ行って、2つ目の信号を過ぎたところに、大きな図書館と公園があります migi no michi o massugu itte, futatsu me no shingou o sugita tokoro ni, ookina toshokan to koen ga arimasu (If you go straight on the right road and pass the second traffic light, there is a large library and park) 右手に持っているその古びた本は、祖父から受け継いだ貴重な初版の小説です migite ni motte iru sono furubita hon wa, sofu kara uketsuida kichou na shohan no shousetsu desu (The old book you're holding in your right hand is a valuable first edition novel passed down from my grandfather)

Word/Phrase: 南
Romaji: minami
Meaning: south
Example: 南の国へ旅行に行って、白い砂浜でゆっくり過ごしたいです Minami no kuni e ryokō ni itte, shiroi sunahama de yukkuri sugoshitai desu (I want to travel to a southern country and relax slowly on the white sandy beaches) その国は海がきれいで、空も青く、一年を通して暖かい気候です Sono kuni wa umi ga kirei de, sora mo aoku, ichinen o tōshite atatakai kikō desu (That country has beautiful seas, blue skies, and a warm climate all year round)

Word/Phrase: 中
Romaji: naka
Meaning: inside
Example: この学校の図書館の中では、数学の参考書を借りて勉強する生徒が多いが、私にとっては先生の授業が一番の理解への近道だった。 kono gakkō no toshokan no naka de wa, suugaku no sankosho o karite benkyō suru seito ga ōi ga, watashi ni totte wa sensei no jugyō ga ichiban no rikai e no chikamichi datta. (While many students borrow math reference books to study in this school’s library, for me, the teacher’s lessons were the best shortcut to understanding.) 公園の中心に立つ大きなけやきの木は、子どもたちが集まって遊ぶ場所として、長年地域の人に愛されている。 kōen no chūshin ni tatsu ōkina keyaki no ki wa, kodomotachi ga atsumatte asobu basho to shite, naganen chiiki no hito ni aisarete iru. (The large zelkova tree standing in the center of the park has been cherished by locals for years as a place where children gather to play.)

Word/Phrase: 西
Romaji: nishi
Meaning: west
Example: 西の空が夕焼けで真っ赤に染まり、海とのコントラストが息をのむほど美しかった。 Nishi no sora ga yūyake de makka ni somari, umi to no kontorasuto ga iki o nomu hodo utsukushikatta. (The western sky turned deep red with the evening glow, and the contrast with the ocean was breathtakingly beautiful.) 西の方向に進むと、古い石畳の道が続き、その先には歴史ある神社が静かにたたずんでいる。 Nishi no hōkō ni susumu to, furui ishidatami no michi ga tsuzuki, sono saki ni wa rekishi aru jinja ga shizuka ni tatazunde iru. (If you head west, an old cobblestone path stretches on, and at the end stands a historic shrine quietly.)

Word/Phrase: 表
Romaji: omote
Meaning: bagian depan
Example: 表紙のデザインはこの商品の第一印象を決めるため、とても重要です Hyōshi no dezain wa kono shōhin no daiichinshō o kimaru tame, totemo jūyō desu (Cover desain menentukan kesan pertama produk ini, jadi sangat penting) この本の表紙は手触りも良く、視覚的にも美しいデザインになっています Kono hon no hyōshi wa tezawari mo yoku, shikakuteki ni mo utsukushī dezain ni natte imasu (Sampul buku ini tidak hanya indah secara visual, tetapi juga nyaman saat disentuh)

Word/Phrase: 下
Romaji: shita
Meaning: bawah
Example: この階段の下には、古い石碑とベンチが並んだ小さな公園があり、地元の人々に愛されている Kono kaidan no shita ni wa, furui sekihi to benchi ga nanda chiisana kōen ga ari, jimoto no hitobito ni aisarete iru (Under these stairs, there is a small park with an old stone monument and benches lined up, beloved by the locals) この階段の下に隠された地下通路は、戦時中に避難所として使われていた Kono kaidan no shita ni kakusareta chika tsūro wa, senjichū ni hinanjo toshite tsukawarete ita (The underground passage hidden beneath these stairs was used as a shelter during the war)

Word/Phrase: 傍
Romaji: soba
Meaning: sebelah
Example: 傍で見ていると、彼はとても優しい人だと気づきました soba de mite iru to, kare wa totemo yasashii hito da to kizukimashita (When I stood beside him and watched, I realized he was an incredibly kind person) 傍にいるだけで安心する人がいる soba ni iru dake de anshin suru hito ga iru (There are people whose mere presence beside me brings a deep sense of comfort and peace)

Word/Phrase: 外
Romaji: soto/gai
Meaning: outside
Example: 外の空気は新鮮で、心地よい風が肌を優しく包み、疲れた体を癒してくれます Soto no kūki wa shinsen de, kokochi yoi kaze ga hada o yasashiku tsutsumi, tsukareta karada o iyashite kuremasu (The fresh outside air wraps your skin with a pleasant breeze, soothing your tired body and mind)

Word/Phrase: 隣
Romaji: tonari
Meaning: sebelah
Example: 隣に住むおばあさんは、朝の散歩で会うといつも「元気？」と声をかけてくれるので、近所の人たちも自然と挨拶するようになった Tonari ni sumu obāsan wa, asa no sanpo de au to itsumo "genki?" to koe o kakete kureru node, kinjo no hito-tachi mo shizen to aisatsu suru you ni natta (The elderly woman living next door always greets people with "How are you?" during her morning walks, so the neighbors have naturally started exchanging greetings too) 隣の公園は子どもたちが放課後に集まる場所で、ベンチで本を読む人や犬の散歩をする人がよく見られるようになった Tonari no kōen wa kodomo-tachi ga hōkago ni atsumaru basho de, benchi de hon o yomu hito ya inu no sanpo o suru hito ga yoku mirareru you ni natta (The park next door is where children gather after school, and now you often see people reading books on the benches or walking their dogs)

Word/Phrase: 上
Romaji: ue
Meaning: atas
Example: 山の上に小さな家があり、周りを緑豊かな森に囲まれています Yama no ue ni chiisana ie ga ari, mawari o midori yutaka na mori ni kakomarete imasu (Di atas gunung terdapat rumah kecil yang dikelilingi hutan hijau yang subur) その家の上からは美しい景色が見え、特に夕暮れ時の空は息をのむほどです Sono ie no ue kara wa utsukushii keshiki ga mie, tokuni yūgure-doki no sora wa iki o nomu hodo desu (Dari atas rumah itu pemandangan yang indah terlihat, terutama langit saat senja yang sangat memukau)

Word/Phrase: 後ろ
Romaji: ushiro
Meaning: belakang
Example: 後ろの机に置いた本を取ってくれませんか。今日の授業で使う予定なので、急いでいます。 ushiro no tsukue ni oita hon o totte kuremasen ka. kyō no jugyō de tsukau yotei nano de, isoide imasu. (Can you please get the book I left on the desk behind me? I need it for today’s class, so I’m in a hurry.) 後ろの方に座っている人は新しく転校してきた生徒だそうです。先週からこのクラスにいます。 ushiro no hō ni suwatte iru hito wa atarashiku tenkō shite kita seito da sō desu. senshū kara kono kurasu ni imasu. (The person sitting in the back is apparently a new transfer student. They’ve been in this class since last week.)

Word/Phrase: 横
Romaji: yoko
Meaning: sebelah
Example: 横の席に座っている人は、私の大学時代からの親友で、毎週末一緒に図書館で勉強しています yoko no seki ni suwatte iru hito wa, watashi no daigaku jidai kara no shin'yū de, mai shūmatsu issho ni toshokan de benkyō shite imasu (The person sitting in the seat next to me has been my close friend since university, and we study together at the library every weekend) 横に並んで公園の散歩道を歩きながら、私たちは将来の夢や過去の失敗についてよく語り合います yoko ni narande kōen no sanpomichi o arukinagara, watashitachi wa shōrai no yume ya kako no shippai ni tsuite yoku katariaimasu (While walking side by side along the park’s path, we often discuss our dreams for the future and past mistakes)

Word/Phrase: 値引き
Romaji: nebiki
Meaning: diskon
Example: 値引きをしてもらったら、もっと安く買えるのに、お店の人が断ってしまった nebiki o shite morattara, motto yasuku kaeru noni, o-mise no hito ga kotowatte shimatta (If they had given me a discount, I could have bought it for a much lower price, but the store staff turned down my request) 値引きの条件を教えてください。もし値引きができるなら、今すぐ商品を購入したいです nebiki no jōken o oshiete kudasai. Moshi nebiki ga dekiru nara, ima sugu shōhin o kōnyū shitai desu. (Please tell me the conditions for a discount. If a discount is possible, I would like to purchase the product immediately)

Word/Phrase: 金額
Romaji: kingaku
Meaning: amount of money
Example: 支払いを迷った際、商品の金額以上にその耐久性や機能性が将来的な節約につながると考え、購入を決断した。 shiharai o mayotta sai, shōhin no kingaku ijō ni sono taikyūsei ya kinōsei ga shōraitekina setsuyaku ni tsunagaru to kangaete, kōnyū o ketsudan shita. (When hesitating to pay, I decided to purchase because I thought the product’s durability and functionality would lead to long-term savings beyond its price.) 今月の家計簿を見直し、予想外の出費が重なったため、この金額を確保するには無駄な支出を削減する必要があると痛感した。 kongetsu no kakeibo o minaoshi, yosōgai no shishutsu ga kasanatta tame, kono kingaku o kakuhosuru ni wa muda na shishutsu o sakugen suru hitsuyō ga aru to tsūkan shita. (After reviewing this month’s household budget, I realized that unexpected expenses had piled up, making it necessary to cut unnecessary spending to secure this amount.)

Word/Phrase: 小切手
Romaji: kogitte
Meaning: cek
Example: 小切手は銀行で現金に換えることができますが、手数料がかかる場合があります Kogitte wa ginkō de genkin ni kaeru koto ga dekimasu ga, tesūryō ga kakaru baai ga arimasu (Cheques can be exchanged for cash at banks, but there may be fees involved) この小切手は有効期限が切れているので、銀行での取り扱いができなくなっています Kono kogitte wa yūkōkigen ga kirete iru node, ginkō de no toriatukai ga dekinaku natte imasu (The validity period of this cheque has expired, so it can no longer be processed at the bank)

Word/Phrase: 残高
Romaji: zandaka
Meaning: saldo
Example: 銀行の残高を確認したところ、予想よりも少なかったので、先月の支出を見直す必要があると感じました Ginkō no zandaka o kakunin shita tokoro, yosō yori mo sukunakatta node, sengetsu no shishutsu o minaosu hitsuyō ga aru to kanjimashita (When I checked my bank balance, it was less than expected, so I felt the need to review last month's expenses) 今月の残高が予算を下回っているため、今後の出費を抑えて貯蓄に努めなければなりません Kongetsu no zandaka ga yosan o shitamawatte iru tame, kongoji no shuppi o osaete chochiku ni tsutome nakereba narimasen (Since this month's balance is below budget, I must restrain future spending and focus on saving)

Word/Phrase: 賞金
Romaji: shoukin
Meaning: hadiah uang
Example: 賞金をもらったら、新しい自転車を買って、毎日の通勤をもっと快適にしたいです shoukin o morattara, atarashii jitensha o katte, mainichi no tsūkin o motto kaiteki ni shitai desu (If I receive the prize money, I want to buy a new bicycle and make my daily commute much more comfortable) この国際ピアノコンクールの賞金は非常に高額で、最終選考に残った参加者たちはプロのピアニストを目指して日夜努力を重ねています kono kokusai piano konkūru no shoukin wa hijō ni kōgaku de, saishū senkō ni nokotta sankasha-tachi wa puro no pianisuto o mezashite nichiya doryoku o kasanete imasu (The prize money for this international piano competition is extremely substantial, and the participants who made it to the final round are practicing day and night to become professional pianists)

Word/Phrase: 貿易
Romaji: boueki
Meaning: trade
Example: 日本と中国の間で行われている貿易は、両国の経済を支える重要な柱であり、長い歴史の中で強い絆を作り上げてきた。 Nihon to Chūgoku no aida de okonawarete iru bōeki wa, ryōkoku no keizai o sasaeru jūyō na hashira de ari, nagai rekishi no naka de tsuyoi kizuna o tsukuriagete kita. (Trade conducted between Japan and China serves as a vital pillar supporting both economies, forging strong bonds over a long history.) 自動車や電子部品を輸出する日本と、衣類や工業品を輸入する中国との関係は、互いの発展に欠かせないものとなっている。 Jidōsha ya denshi buhin o yushutsu suru Nihon to, irui ya kōgyōhin o yunyū suru Chūgoku to no kankei wa, tagai no hattatsu ni kakasenai mono to natte iru.| (The relationship between Japan, which exports automobiles and electronic components, and China, which imports clothing and industrial goods, has become indispensable to mutual development.)

Word/Phrase: 営業
Romaji: eigyou
Meaning: sales
Example: この店の営業時間は朝から晩までと長いですが、スタッフはその時間内に商品の説明や購入の相談に親切に応じています。 Kono mise no eigyou jikan wa asa kara ban made to nagai desu ga, sutaffu wa sono jikan-nai ni shōhin no setsumei ya kōnyū no sōdan ni shinsetsu ni ōjite imasu. (This store has long business hours from morning to night, and during that time, staff kindly assist with product explanations and purchase consultations.) 営業中はお客様の質問に対応するスタッフもいますが、営業が終わると、翌日の準備で忙しくなるため、電話での問い合わせは受け付けません。 Eigyou-chū wa o-kyaku-sama no shitsumon ni taiō suru sutaffu mo imasu ga, eigyou ga owaru to, yokujitsu no junbi de isogashiku naru tame, denwa de no toiwase wa uketsuke masen. (While there are staff available to handle customer questions during business hours, once the store closes, they become busy preparing for the next day and do not accept phone inquiries.)

Word/Phrase: 領収書
Romaji: ryoushuusho
Meaning: kwitansi
Example: 会社から支給された経費で商品を購入した際、領収書を受け取ったものの、帰宅途中でカバンから落としてしまい、後日確認しようとした時には見つからなかった。 kaisha kara shikyuu sareta keihi de shouhin o kounyuu shita sai, ryoushuusho o uke totta mono no, kitaku tochuu de kaban kara otoshite shimai, gojitsu kakunin shiyou to shita toki ni wa mitsukaranakatta. (When I bought goods using company-provided expenses, I received a receipt, but on my way home, it fell out of my bag, and when I tried to check it later, it was gone.) 出張時の交通費や宿泊費の領収書は、必ず封筒に入れて整理し、1年以上保存することが求められるため、社員は毎月確認の手間をかけている。 shucchouji no koutsuuhi ya shukuhakuhi no ryoushuusho wa, kanarazu fuutou ni irete seiri shi, ichinen ijou hozon suru koto ga motomerareru tame, shain wa maitsuki kakunin no temae o kake te iru. (Receipts for transportation and accommodation expenses during business trips must be organized in envelopes and stored for over a year, so employees take the trouble to check them every month.)

Word/Phrase: 保証書
Romaji: hoshousho
Meaning: garansi
Example: この商品は保証書が付いていますが、万一破損した場合は購入店で保証書を提示して無償修理を受けられます kono shōhin wa hoshōsho ga tsuite imasu ga, man'ichi hasnoshita baai wa kōnyūten de hoshōsho o teiji shite mushō shūri o ukera remasu (Produk ini dilengkapi dengan garansi, dan jika terjadi kerusakan, Anda dapat menerima perbaikan gratis dengan menunjukkan garansi di toko pembelian) この保証書は購入日から1年間有効ですので、期限内に故障が発生した場合は指定のサービスセンターに修理を依頼してください kono hoshōsho wa kōnyūbi kara 1-nenkan yūkō desu node, kigen-nai ni koshō ga hassei shita baai wa shitei no sābisu sentā ni shūri o irai shite kudasai (Garansi ini berlaku selama 1 tahun sejak tanggal pembelian, jadi jika terjadi kerusakan dalam periode tersebut, harap meminta perbaikan di pusat layanan yang ditunjuk)

Word/Phrase: 代
Romaji: dai
Meaning: biaya
Example: 代金は先月支払ったはずですが、領収書を再発行していただけますか？ Daikin wa sengetsu shiharatta hazudesuga, ryōshūsho o sai hakkō shite itadakemasu ka? ("I believe I paid the fee last month, could you reissue the receipt?") このサービスの利用代は月額3,000円です。 Kono sābisu no riyōdai wa getsugaku san-zen en desu. ("The monthly usage fee for this service is 3,000 yen.")

Word/Phrase: 罰金
Romaji: bakkin
Meaning: denda
Example: この会社では、遅刻をすると罰金がかかることがあり、従業員は時間厳守を心がけている kono kaisha de wa, chikoku o suru to bakkin ga kakaru koto ga ari, jūgyōin wa jikan genshu o kokoro ga ke te iru (At this company, employees are careful to be punctual because there are times when they get fined for being late) 速い運転をしたので、警察から罰金を払わなければならず、免許に点数が加算されることになった hayai unten o shita node, keisatsu kara bakkin o harawanakereba narazu, menkyo ni tensū ga kasan sareru koto ni natta (Because I drove too fast, I not only had to pay a fine to the police but also got penalty points added to my license)

Word/Phrase: 家賃
Romaji: yachin
Meaning: biaya sewa rumah
Example: 都心の家賃が高すぎたため、駅から遠い物件を選んだ結果、通勤時間は増えたものの、友人とのシェアハウスで生活費を抑えることができた。 Toshin no yachin ga takasugitame, eki kara tōi bukken o eranda kekka, tsūkin jikan wa fueta mono no, yūjin to no sheahausu de seikatsuhi o osaeru koto ga dekita. (Because the rent in the city center was too high, I chose a place far from the station, which increased my commute time, but I was able to reduce living expenses by sharing a house with friends.) 毎月の家賃に加え、光熱費や食費がかさむため、貯金ができず、やむを得ず週末にアルバイトを始めた。 Maitsuki no yachin ni kuwae, kōnetsuhi ya shokuhi ga kasamu tame, chokin ga dekizu, yamu o ezu shūmatsu ni arubaito o hajimeta. (In addition to the monthly rent, utilities and groceries add up, making it impossible to save money, so I had no choice but to start a part-time job on weekends.)

Word/Phrase: 物価
Romaji: bukka
Meaning: harga pokok
Example: 物価が上がると、家計のやりくりが難しくなり、特に低所得の世帯では生活費の負担が大きくなります bukka ga agaru to, kakei no yarikuri ga muzukashiku nari, tokuni teishotoku no setai de wa seikatsuhi no futan ga ōkiku narimasu (When prices rise, managing household finances becomes difficult, and the burden of living expenses grows heavier, especially for low-income families) 最近の物価高騰により、多くの消費者が日用品の購入を控えるようになり、小売業界全体に影響が広がっています saikin no bukka kōtō ni yori, ōku no shōhisha ga nichiyōhin no kōnyū o hikaeru yō ni nari, kourigyōkai zentai ni eikyō ga hirogatte imasu (Due to the recent surge in prices, many consumers have started cutting back on purchasing daily necessities, causing a widespread impact on the entire retail industry)

Word/Phrase: 口座
Romaji: kouza
Meaning: account
Example: 銀行の口座を開設する前に、必要な書類を全て揃えて、手続きの流れを事前に確認してください Ginkō no kōza o kaisetsu suru mae ni, hitsuyō na shorui o subete soroete, tesūtsuki no nagare o jizen ni kakunin shite kudasai (Before opening a bank account, gather all the required documents and check the procedure in advance) 口座の残高をチェックしたら、今月は無駄遣いを控えて、計画的に貯金を増やしていこうと思います Kōza no zandaka o chekku shitara, kongetsu wa mudazukai o koeraete, keikakuteki ni chokin o fuya shite ikō to omoimasu (After checking my account balance, I think I’ll cut unnecessary spending this month and work on increasing my savings systematically)

Word/Phrase: 電卓
Romaji: dentaku
Meaning: calculator
Example: 最近の電卓は小型ながらも多機能で、税金の計算や為替レートの変換も簡単にできるため、ビジネスの現場でも重宝されている。 Saikin no dentaku wa kogata nagara mo takinō de, zeikin no keisan ya kawase retto no henkan mo kantan ni dekiru tame, bijinesu no genba demo chōhō sarete iru. (Recent calculators, despite being compact, are highly functional—capable of easily handling tax calculations and currency conversions—which makes them indispensable in business settings.) 電卓を使って細かい支出を計算しているうちに、毎月の貯金目標を達成するためには、無駄な出費を見直す必要があると気づいた。 Dentaku o tsukatte komakai shishutsu o keisan shite iru uchi ni, maitsuki no chokin mokuhyō o tassei suru tame ni wa, muda na shuppi o minaosu hitsuyō ga aru to kizuitta. (While using a calculator to tally up minor expenses, I realized that to meet my monthly savings goal, I needed to review unnecessary spending.)

Word/Phrase: 電源
Romaji: dengen
Meaning: power outlet
Example: 最近のオフィスでは、電源を切る前にデータを保存するよう、社員に毎回注意喚起している。 Saikin no ofisu de wa, dengen o kiru mae ni dēta o hozon suru yō, shain ni maikai chūi kan'ki shite iru. (In recent offices, employees are reminded every time to save their data before turning off the power.) この工場の機械は、電源を入れると同時に動き出し、設定された手順で製品を組み立て始める。 Kono kōjō no kikai wa, dengen o ireru to dōji ni ugokidashi, settei sa reta tejun de seihin o kumitate hajimeru.

Word/Phrase: 携帯
Romaji: keitai
Meaning: mobile phone
Example: 携帯を忘れてしまい、友達に連絡が取れなかったので、とても困りました Keitai o wasurete shimatte, tomodachi ni renraku ga torenakatta node, totemo komarimashita (I forgot my phone, so I couldn't contact my friend and was very troubled) 携帯の充電が切れて、急に電車が止まった時、地図を見られなくて大変でした Keitai no jūden ga kirete, kyū ni densha ga tomatta toki, chizu o mirarenakute taihen deshita (My phone ran out of battery, and when the train suddenly stopped, I couldn't check the map, which was very difficult)

Word/Phrase: 電報
Romaji: denpou
Meaning: telegram
Example: 父は昔、電報で結婚の知らせを家族全員に送りました。 Chichi wa mukashi, denpou de kekkon no shirase o kazoku zen'in ni okurimashita. (Father once sent a telegram to the entire family to announce his marriage.) 母は封を開ける前からその電報の重要さに気づき、手が震えるほど驚きました。 Haha wa fuu o akeru mae kara sono denpou no juuyousa ni kizuki, te ga furueru hodo odorokimashita. (Mother sensed the telegram’s importance even before opening it and was so shocked her hands trembled.)

Word/Phrase: 葬式
Romaji: soushiki
Meaning: funeral
Example: 葬式の後に、家族全員で写真を撮り、故人を偲びながら一枚の思い出を残すことにしました soushiki no ato ni, kazoku zen'in de shashin o tori, kojin o shinobinagara ichimai no omoide o nokosu koto ni shimashita (After the funeral, the whole family took a photo together to preserve a memory while reminiscing about the deceased) 葬式の後で、家族はお寺の庭園を散策しながら、故人が生前好きだったお茶を飲み、昔の思い出話に花を咲かせました soushiki no ato de, kazoku wa otera no teien o sansaku shinagara, kojin ga seizen suki datta ocha o nomi, mukashi no omoidebanashi ni hana o sakasemashita (After the funeral, the family strolled through the temple garden, drank the tea the deceased had loved in life, and shared fond memories of the past)

Word/Phrase: 事件
Romaji: jiken
Meaning: event, incident
Example: 事件はとても大きく、警察がたくさんの人を調べました Jiken wa totemo ōkiku, keisatsu ga takusan no hito o shirabemashita. (The incident was very serious, and the police questioned many people to uncover the truth behind it) 事件の後、町は少し静かになりましたが、まだ不安な気分が残っています Jiken no ato, machi wa sukoshi shizuka ni narimashita ga, mada fuan na kibun ga nokotte imasu. (After the incident, the town grew quieter, but an uneasy atmosphere still lingers among the residents)

Word/Phrase: 忘年会
Romaji: bounenkai
Meaning: pesta akhir tahun
Example: 会社で毎年恒例の忘年会は、社員が一年の労をねぎらい、親睦を深める貴重な機会となっている。 Kaisha de maitoshi kōrei no bōnenkai wa, shain ga ichinen no rou o negirai, shinboku o fukameru kichō na kikai to natte iru. (At the company, the annual tradition of the bōnenkai has become a valuable opportunity for employees to appreciate each other’s hard work over the year and strengthen their bonds.) 今年は忘年会が中止になったため、同僚たちとの交流が不足し、寂しさを感じている人も少なくないようだ。 Kotoshi wa bōnenkai ga chūshi ni natta tame, dōryō-tachi to no kōryū ga fusoku shi, sabishisa o kanjite iru hito mo sukunaku nai you da. (This year, since the bōnenkai was canceled, many people seem to feel lonely due to the lack of interaction with their colleagues.)

Word/Phrase: 番組
Romaji: bangumi
Meaning: acara, program
Example: この番組はとても面白いですそして私は毎週欠かさず見ます kono bangumi wa totemo omoshiroi desu soshite watashi wa maishū kakasazu mimasu (This program is very interesting, and I never miss watching it every week) この番組は子供向けの教育的なアニメーションで私は毎晩子供と一緒に楽しみながら見ます kono bangumi wa kodomo-muke no kyōikuteki na animēshon de watashi wa maiban kodomo to issho ni tanoshiminagara mimasu (This program is an educational animation for children, and I enjoy watching it with my child every evening)

Word/Phrase: 種目
Romaji: shumoku
Meaning: event
Example: このスポーツ大会では、瞬発力を要する短距離走から、持久力と戦術眼が問われる長距離走に至るまで、多様な種目が選手の適性に応じて設定されている。 kono supōtsu taikai de wa, shunpatsuryoku o yō suru tan kyori sō kara, jikyūryoku to senjutsu-gan ga toware ru chō kyori sō ni itaru made, tayō na shumoku ga senshu no tekisei ni ōjite settei sa re te i ru. (At this sports event, a diverse range of competitions—from short-distance running, which demands explosive power, to long-distance running, which tests endurance and tactical insight—are organized to match the athletes' aptitudes.) 学校の体育カリキュラムは、個人の運動能力を総合的に育むため、陸上の跳躍系種目や投擲系種目、さらに協調性を養う球技系種目まで、段階的に組み込まれている。 gakkō no taiiku karikyuramu wa, kojin no undō nōryoku o sōgōteki ni hagukumu tame, rikujō no chōyaku-kei shumoku ya tōteki-kei shumoku, sara ni kyōchōsei o yashinau kyūgi-kei shumoku made, dankai-teki ni kumikoma re te i ru. (The school’s physical education curriculum systematically incorporates a progression of events—from track and field jumping and throwing disciplines to ball games designed to cultivate teamwork—aimed at holistically developing individual athletic abilities.)

Word/Phrase: 飴
Romaji: ame
Meaning: hard candy
Example: 子供の頃、おばあさんがよく飴を買ってくれました。 Kodomo no koro, obāsan ga yoku ame o katte kuremashita. (When I was a child, my grandmother would often buy me hard candy as a little treat after school.) 甘くて美味しい飴は、私にとって特別な思い出です。特に、その包み紙に書かれた優しいメッセージが今でも心に残っています。 Amakute oishii ame wa, watashi ni totte tokubetsu na omoide desu. Tokuni, sono tsutsumi-gami ni kakareta yasashii messēji ga ima demo kokoro ni nokotte imasu. (Sweet and delicious hard candy holds a special place in my memories, especially the kind messages written on the wrappers that still warm my heart to this day.)

Word/Phrase: 調味料
Romaji: chomiryou
Meaning: bumbu masak
Example: 料理がおいしくなるかどうかは、使う調味料の種類や量、そして組み合わせ方次第で、全く違った味に変わるものだ ryouri ga oishiku naru ka dou ka wa, tsukau chomiryou no shurui ya ryou, soshite kumiawasekata shidai de, mattaku chigatta aji ni kawaru mono da (The deliciousness of a dish can completely change depending on the types, amounts, and combinations of seasonings used) スーパーで調味料を選ぶとき、料理のレシピだけでなく、自分の好みに合うものを見つけるのが楽しみの一つだ suupaa de chomiryou o erabu toki, ryouri no reshipi dake de naku, jibun no konomi ni au mono o mitsukeru no ga tanoshimi no hitotsu da (When choosing seasonings at the supermarket, finding ones that suit not just the recipe but also your own taste is one of the joys)

Word/Phrase: 餌
Romaji: esa
Meaning: pet food
Example: ペットを飼う時、栄養バランスのとれた餌を選ぶことは、その健康を長く保つために欠かせない要素だ。 petto o kau toki, eiyō baransu no toreta esa o erabu koto wa, sono kenkō o nagaku tamotsu tame ni kakasenai yōsoda. (When keeping pets, choosing nutritionally balanced food is an indispensable factor in maintaining their long-term health.) 釣り用の餌を工夫することで、普段はなかなか釣れない深い場所にいる魚も、簡単に釣り上げられるようになる。 tsuri-yō no esa o kūfū suru koto de, fudan wa nakanaka tsurenai fukai basho ni iru sakana mo, kantan ni tsuriagerareru yō ni naru.　(By carefully preparing fishing bait, even fish that usually live in deep, hard-to-reach areas can be caught more easily.)

Word/Phrase: 唐揚げ
Romaji: karaage
Meaning: fried chicken
Example: 唐揚げはとても美味しいですが、油が多いので、食べ過ぎないように気をつけてください karaage wa totemo oishii desu ga, abura ga ōi node, tabesuginai yō ni ki o tsukete kudasai (Karaage is very delicious, but since it contains a lot of oil, make sure to eat it in moderation to stay healthy) 唐揚げを作る時は、肉を小さく切ってから、小麦粉と卵を混ぜた衣を付け、十分に揚げてカリッとさせます karaage o tsukuru toki wa, niku o chiisaku kitte kara, komugiko to tamago o mazeta koromo o tsuke, jūbun ni agete kari kari to sasemasu (When making karaage, cut the meat into small pieces, coat it in a batter of flour and egg, then deep-fry it thoroughly until it becomes crispy)

Word/Phrase: 小麦粉
Romaji: komugiko
Meaning: flour
Example: 小麦粉を使って、バターと卵を混ぜ合わせ、ふわふわのスポンジケーキを焼き上げました Komugiko o tsukatte, batā to tamago o mazeawase, fuwafuwa no suponjikēki o yakiaagemashita (I used wheat flour, mixed it with butter and eggs, and baked a fluffy sponge cake) 小麦粉はパンやクッキー、パスタなどの基本的な材料として世界中で広く利用されており、特にフランスのバゲットやイタリアのピザ生地には欠かせない食材です Komugiko wa pan ya kukkī, pasuta nado no kihonteki na zairyō toshite sekaijū de hiroku riyō sarete ori, tokuni Furansu no bagetto ya Itaria no pizza kiji ni wa kakasenai shokuzai desu (Wheat flour is widely used around the world as a fundamental ingredient for bread, cookies, pasta, and more, and it is an essential food item for French baguettes and Italian pizza dough)

Word/Phrase: 薬
Romaji: kusuri
Meaning: meds
Example: 薬を飲むと頭痛が治まるので、毎日朝食後に水で飲んでいます kusuri o nomu to zutsū ga osamarunode, mainichi chōshoku go ni mizu de nonde imasu (I take medicine because it relieves my headache, so I drink it with water after breakfast every morning) 薬局で薬を買う前に、薬剤師に副作用や飲み合わせについて相談した方がいいです yakkyoku de kusuri o kau mae ni, yakuzai-shi ni fukusayō ya nomiawase ni tsuite sōdan shita hō ga ii desu (Before buying medicine at the pharmacy, you should consult the pharmacist about side effects and drug interactions)

Word/Phrase: 味噌
Romaji: miso
Meaning: miso
Example: 味噌汁は朝ごはんの定番で、温かい味噌汁を飲むと体がポカポカして、一日の始まりに心まで温まります misoshiru wa asagohan no teiban de, atatakai misoshiru o nomu to karada ga pokapoka shite, ichinichi no hajimari ni kokoro made atatamarimasu (Warm miso soup is a breakfast staple that not only warms your body but also soothes your heart as you start the day.) 朝ごはんに味噌汁を食べる習慣がある人は、栄養バランスが整い、健康に良いと医師にも推奨されています asagohan ni misoshiru o taberu shūkan ga aru hito wa, eiyō baransu ga tono i, kenkō ni ii to ishi ni mo suisen sarete imasu (People who have the habit of eating miso soup for breakfast are often praised by doctors for its balanced nutrition and health benefits.)

Word/Phrase: ネギ
Romaji: negi
Meaning: daun bawang
Example: 焼き肉屋で炭火にあぶられた肉の脂が、隣に置かれた刻みネギと反応し、香ばしい香りを店内に広げる瞬間こそ、食欲を最大限に刺激する。 yakinikuya de tanka ni aburareta niku no abura ga, tonari ni okareta kizami negi to hannō shi, köbashii kaori o tennai ni hirogeru shunkan koso, shokuyoku o saidaigen ni shigekisuru. (The moment the fat of charcoal-grilled meat reacts with chopped negi placed beside it, spreading a fragrant aroma throughout the restaurant, is what maximizes one's appetite.) 冷蔵庫に常備されたネギが、鍋物の出汁に溶け込むや否や、ただの野菜だったそれが、奥深い旨味を引き出す「隠し味」へと変貌を遂げる。 reizōko ni jōbi sareta negi ga, nabemono no dashi ni tokekomu ya inaya, tada no yasai datta sore ga, okubukai umami o hikidasu "kakushiaji" e to henbō o toitogeru.= (The negi always stocked in the fridge, the moment it melts into the broth of a hot pot, transforms from a mere vegetable into a "secret ingredient" that draws out profound savor.)

Word/Phrase: 肉
Romaji: niku
Meaning: daging
Example: 肉は体に必要な栄養素ですけど、毎日食べすぎると健康に悪影響を及ぼすことがありますよ niku wa karada ni hitsuyō na eiyōso desu kedo, mainichi tabesugiru to kenkō ni akueikyō o oyobosu koto ga arimasu yo (While meat is a necessary nutrient for the body, eating too much every day can sometimes have negative effects on your health) このレストランの肉料理はとても美味しいです特にステーキは柔らかくてジューシーで、ソースの風味も絶妙です kono resutoran no nikuryōri wa totemo oishii desu tokuni sutēki wa yawarakakute jūshī de, sōsu no fūmi mo zetsumyō desu (The meat dishes at this restaurant are very delicious—especially the steak, which is tender and juicy, with a perfectly balanced sauce flavor)

Word/Phrase: お茶
Romaji: ocha
Meaning: green tea
Example: お茶を飲むと、少しリラックスできますが、毎日たくさん飲みすぎると、体に悪い影響があるかもしれません ocha o nomu to, sukoshi rirakkusu dekimasu ga, mainichi takusan nomisugiru to, karada ni warui eikyō ga aru kamoshiremasen (Drinking green tea can help you relax a little, but if you drink too much of it every day, it might negatively affect your health) 日本の伝統的なお茶の作法は、静かで優雅な動作を重んじ、心を落ち着かせる効果があると言われています Nihon no dentōteki na ocha no sahō wa, shizuka de yūga na dōsa o omonji, kokoro o ochitsukaseru kōka ga aru to iwarete imasu (The traditional Japanese green tea ceremony values quiet and graceful movements, which are said to have a calming effect on the mind)

Word/Phrase: お菓子
Romaji: okashi
Meaning: snack
Example: お菓子を食べすぎると、歯が悪くなるだけでなく、健康にも影響が出るかもしれません okashi o tabesugiru to, ha ga waruku naru dake de naku, kenkou ni mo eikyou ga deru kamoshiremasen (If you eat too many sweets, not only might your teeth decay, but your health could also be affected) お菓子作りは細かい作業が多いですが、完成した時の喜びは何物にも代えがたいです okashi tsukuri wa komakai sagyou ga ooi desu ga, kansei shita toki no yorokobi wa nanimono ni mo kaegatai desu (Making sweets involves a lot of detailed work, but the joy of completion is incomparable to anything else)

Word/Phrase: おかず
Romaji: okazu
Meaning: lauk
Example: 日本の食卓では、ご飯と一緒に食べるおかずが欠かせません。特に、野菜と魚を組み合わせた和風サラダは、味の調和が取れていて、多くの人に好まれています。 Nihon no shokutaku de wa, gohan to issho ni taberu okazu ga kakasemasen. Tokuni, yasai to sakana o kumiawaseta wafū sarada wa, aji no chōwa ga totte ite, ōku no hito ni konomarete imasu. (On Japanese dining tables, okazu to eat with rice is indispensable. Especially, Japanese-style salads combining vegetables and fish have a balanced flavor and are loved by many.) 塩気の強いおかずでも、ご飯の量を調節すれば、ちょうどいい味に仕上がります。そのため、おかずの塩加減を生かして、食事を楽しむことができます。 Shioke no tsuyoi okazu demo, gohan no ryō o chōsetsu sureba, chōdo ii aji ni shiagari masu. Sono tame, okazu no shiokajigen o ikashite, shokujī o tanoshimu koto ga dekimasu. (Even with salty okazu, adjusting the amount of rice can achieve the perfect taste. Thus, one can enjoy the meal by making the most of the okazu’s saltiness.)

Word/Phrase: 酒
Romaji: sake
Meaning: alcohol
Example: 酒を飲むと、少し頭が痛くなることがありますが、友達と一緒に飲むと楽しいです sake o nomu to, sukoshi atama ga itaku naru koto ga arimasu ga, tomodachi to issho ni nomu to tanoshii desu (While drinking alcohol sometimes gives me a slight headache, I really enjoy having a few drinks with friends and sharing good conversation) 友達と一緒に酒を飲みながら、お互いの近況を話して笑い合う時間は、日々のストレスを忘れてリラックスできる貴重なひとときです tomodachi to issho ni sake o nomi nagara, otagai no kinkyō o hanashite warai au jikan wa, hibi no sutoresu o wasurete rirakkusu dekiru kitōna hitotoki desu (Spending time drinking alcohol with friends, sharing updates about our lives, and laughing together is a precious moment that helps me forget daily stress and truly relax)

Word/Phrase: 刺身
Romaji: sashimi
Meaning: sashimi
Example: 鮮度を重んじる刺身は、職人の包丁さばきで引き出される魚の旨味と、わさびの辛みが醤油と絡み合う瞬間に、日本料理の奥深さを感じさせる。 sensoku o omonjeru sashimi wa, shokunin no hōchō-sabaki de hiki-dasareru sakana no umami to, wasabi no karami ga shōyu to karami-au shunkan ni, Nihon ryōri no okuyukasa o kanjisaseru. (The exquisite freshness of sashimi, where the umami of fish—drawn out by the chef’s knife work—blends with the spiciness of wasabi in soy sauce, reveals the profound depth of Japanese cuisine.) 割烹着姿の板前が、氷を敷き詰めた皿に並べた刺身を、食べ頃のタイミングで提供することで、その繊細な味わいが最大限に引き立てられる。 kappōgi-sugata no itamae ga, kōri o shikitsumeta sara ni narabeta sashimi o, tabegoro no taimingu de teikyō suru koto de, sono sensai na ajiwai ga saidaigen ni hikitatareru. (A chef in traditional attire, serving sashimi arranged on ice-chilled plates at the perfect moment, elevates its delicate flavor to its fullest potential.)

Word/Phrase: 砂糖
Romaji: satou
Meaning: sugar
Example: 砂糖を使ってケーキを作りましたが、少し甘すぎたので次は量を減らそうと思います satou o tsukatte kēki o tsukurimashita ga, sukoshi amasugita node tsugi wa ryō o herasō to omoimasu (I used sugar to bake a cake, but it turned out a bit too sweet, so next time I think I’ll reduce the amount) 砂糖は健康に悪いと言われますが、少量なら問題ないと私は考えています satou wa kenkō ni warui to iwaremasu ga, shōryō nara mondainai to watashi wa kangaete imasu (They say sugar is bad for your health, but I believe a small amount is not an issue)

Word/Phrase: 塩
Romaji: shio
Meaning: salt
Example: 料理を作るとき、塩の量を調整することで、食材の持ち味を生かしながら、料理全体の味をまとめることができます。 ryōri o tsukuru toki, shio no ryō o chōsei suru koto de, shokuzai no mochiaji o ikashinagara, ryōri zentai no aji o matomeru koto ga dekimasu. (When cooking, adjusting the amount of salt allows you to bring out the natural flavors of the ingredients while harmonizing the overall taste of the dish.) 健康を考えるなら、塩分の取り過ぎに注意し、バランスの良い食生活を送るよう、日々の食事で気をつける必要があります。 kenkō o kangaeru nara, shiobun no torisugini chūi shi, baransu no yoi shokuseikatsu o okuru yō, hibijitsu no shokujide ki o tsukeru hitsuyō ga arimasu. (If you consider health, you must be careful not to consume too much salt and strive for a balanced diet in your daily meals.)

Word/Phrase: 汁
Romaji: shiru
Meaning: sup
Example: 「このスープの汁はとても濃くて、野菜の味がよく出ていますね。特ににんじんの甘さが強く感じられます」 (Kono sūpu no shiru wa totemo kokute, yasai no aji ga yoku dete imasu ne. Toku ni ninjin no amasa ga tsuyoku kanjiraremasu) (The soup's broth is very rich and thick, with the flavors of the vegetables coming through beautifully. In particular, the natural sweetness of the carrots stands out prominently.) --- 「母の手作りラーメンは、豚骨からとった汁がコクと深みがあり、一口食べるたびに幸せな気分になります」 (Haha no tezukuri rāmen wa, tonkotsu kara totta shiru ga koku to fukami ga aru, hitokuchi taberu tabi ni shiawase na kibun ni narimasu) (My mother's homemade ramen has a pork bone broth that is rich and deeply flavorful, making me feel happy with every bite I take.)

Word/Phrase: 食
Romaji: shoku
Meaning: food
Example: 日本の食文化は、季節ごとに変わる食材を活かした料理が特徴で、その奥深さに世界中から注目されている。 Nihon no shoku bunka wa, kisetsugoto ni kawaru shokuzai o ikashita ryōri ga tokuchō de, sono okubukasa ni sekaijū kara chūmoku sarete iru. (Japanese food culture is renowned worldwide for its depth, characterized by dishes that make the most of seasonal ingredients.) 食に対する関心が高まる中、若者の間で、地産地消の食材を使った料理が人気を集めている。 Shoku ni taisuru kanshin ga takamaru naka, wakamono no aida de, jisan-jishō no shokuzai o tsukatta ryōri ga ninki o atsumete iru. (As interest in food grows, dishes made with locally sourced ingredients are gaining popularity among young people.)

Word/Phrase: 酢
Romaji: su
Meaning: cuka
Example: 日本の食卓でよく見られる酢飯は、酢の酸味がご飯の甘みを引き立て、誰もが一度は食べたことがあるほど親しまれています。 Nihon no shokutaku de yoku mirareru suhan wa, su no sanmi ga gohan no amami o hikitate, dare mo ga ichido wa tabeta koto ga aru hodo shitashimarete imasu. (The vinegared rice often seen on Japanese tables, where the sourness of vinegar brings out the sweetness of rice, is so familiar that everyone has tried it at least once.) 酢豚や酢漬けの野菜など、酢を使った料理は多くの家庭で作られ、食欲をそそる香りが食卓を楽しい雰囲気に変えます。 Subuta ya suzuke no yasai nado, su o tsukatta ryōri wa ōku no katei de tsukurare, shokuyoku o sosoru kaori ga shokutaku o tanoshī fun'iki ni kaemasu. (Dishes like sweet and sour pork and pickled vegetables, made with vinegar, are prepared in many households, and their appetizing aroma transforms the dining table into a cheerful atmosphere.)

Word/Phrase: 食べ物
Romaji: tabemono
Meaning: makanan
Example: 日本人は昔から、季節に合った食べ物を選ぶことで、体の調子を整えてきました。例えば、夏は冷たいそうめんや果物で、暑さを乗り切ります。 Nihonjin wa mukashi kara, kisetsu ni atta tabemono o erabu koto de, karada no choushi o todaetekimashita. Tatoeba, natsu wa tsumetai soumen ya kudamono de, atsusa o norikirimasu. (Since ancient times, Japanese people have maintained their health by choosing seasonal foods. For example, in summer, they overcome the heat with cold sōmen noodles and fruits.) 食べ物の好みは人それぞれですが、子どもの頃に食べたものが、大人になっても好きな理由になることがよくあります。母の作る味は、一生忘れられないものです。 Tabemono no konomi wa hito sorezore desu ga, kodomo no koro ni tabeta mono ga, otona ni natte mo suki na riyuu ni naru koto ga yoku arimasu. Haha no tsukuru aji wa, isshou wasurerarenai mono desu. (Food preferences vary from person to person, but what one ate as a child often becomes the reason for their likes as an adult. The taste of a mother’s cooking is something one never forgets in their lifetime.)

Word/Phrase: 卵
Romaji: tamago
Meaning: egg
Example: 卵を焼くときは、フライパンに油を少し入れてから卵を割ってください。 Tamago o yaku toki wa, furaipan ni abura o sukoshi irete kara tamago o watte kudasai. (When frying an egg, first add a little oil to the pan before cracking the egg open.) 卵は火が弱い方が美味しく焼けますよ。特に、ゆっくり加熱すると黄身がとろとろになります。 Tamago wa hi ga yowai hō ga oishiku yakemasu yo. Tokuni, yukkuri kanetsu suru to kimi ga torotoro ni narimasu. (Eggs taste better when cooked over low heat—especially since slow heating makes the yolk deliciously runny.)

Word/Phrase: 豆腐
Romaji: toufu
Meaning: tahu
Example: 豆腐は栄養が豊富で、肉を食べない人でも十分なタンパク質を摂ることができる食品として注目されている。 tōfu wa eiyō ga hōfude, niku o tabenai hito demo juubun na tanpaku-shitsu o toru koto ga dekiru shokuhin toshite chuumoku sarete iru. (Tofu, rich in nutrients, is gaining attention as a food that allows even those who don’t eat meat to get enough protein.) 世界各地で豆腐を使った料理が広まり、味や調理法も国によって大きく異なるが、どれも健康に配慮した食生活に欠かせない。 sekaikakuchi de tōfu o tsukatta ryouri ga hiromari, aji ya chōrihō mo kuni ni yotte ōkiku kotonaru ga, dore mo kenkō ni hairyo shita shokuseikatsu ni kakasenai. (Tofu-based dishes have spread globally, with flavors and cooking methods varying greatly by country, yet all remain essential to health-conscious diets.)

Word/Phrase: 豆乳
Romaji: tounyu
Meaning: soy milk
Example: 最近、健康を考える人が増え、豆乳を選ぶ理由の一つは、栄養が豊富で胃にやさしいからだ。 Saikin, kenkō o kangaeru hito ga fuete, tōnyu o erabu wake no hitotsu wa, eiyō ga hōfu de i ni yasashii karada. (Recently, as more people think about their health, one reason they choose soy milk is because it’s rich in nutrients and gentle on the stomach.) 朝食後に豆乳を飲む習慣をつけると、カフェインの代わりに体を温め、一日の活動をスムーズに始められる。 Chōshoku-go ni tōnyu o nomu shūkan o tsukeru to, kafein no kawari ni karada o atatame, ichinichi no katsudō o sumūzu ni hajimerareru. (Developing a habit of drinking soy milk after breakfast warms the body as an alternative to caffeine, allowing for a smooth start to the day’s activities.)

Word/Phrase: 野菜
Romaji: yasai
Meaning: sayur
Example: 野菜を食べると、栄養バランスが整い、健康的な生活を送るための基礎になります yasai o taberu to, eiyō baransu ga todoroi, kenkōteki na seikatsu o okuru tame no kiso ni narimasu (Memakan sayuran membantu menyeimbangkan nutrisi dan menjadi dasar untuk menjalani hidup sehat) 野菜はビタミンやミネラルが豊富に含まれているため、積極的に日々の食事に取り入れることが推奨されています yasai wa bitamin ya mineraru ga hōfu ni fukumarete iru tame, sekkyokuteki ni hibi no shokiji ni toriireru koto ga suisensarete imasu (Sayuran kaya akan vitamin dan mineral, sehingga sangat disarankan untuk secara aktif memasukkannya ke dalam makanan sehari-hari)

Word/Phrase: 薬缶
Romaji: yakan
Meaning: kettle
Example: 薬缶でお湯を沸かしてから、急須に茶葉を入れ、ゆっくりと熱湯を注ぎました。 Yakan de o-yu o wakashite kara, kyūsu ni cha-ba o ire, yukkuri to nettō o sogimashita. (After boiling water in the yakkan, I put tea leaves in the teapot and slowly poured the hot water.) 薬缶はキッチンにある便利な道具で、お湯を沸かすのに使いますが、熱くなるので取り扱いには注意が必要です。 Yakan wa kicchin ni aru benri na dōgu de, o-yu o wakasu no ni tsukaimasu ga, atsuku naru node toriai ni wa chūi ga hitsuyō desu. (A yakkan is a useful kitchen tool for boiling water, but it gets very hot, so you need to handle it with care.)

Word/Phrase: 暖房
Romaji: danbou
Meaning: pemanas
Example: 冬になると、暖房を使わないと寒くて寝られないです fuyu ni naru to, danbou o tsukawanai to samukute nerarenai desu (When winter arrives, I can’t sleep without turning on the heater because the cold becomes unbearable) このオフィスの暖房設備は古くて効率が悪いので、来月新しいシステムに交換する予定です kono ofisu no danbou setsubi wa furukute kōritsu ga warui node, raigetsu atarashī shisutemu ni kōkan suru yotei desu (The heating system in this office is old and inefficient, so we plan to replace it with a new one next month)

Word/Phrase: 電話
Romaji: denwa
Meaning: telepon
Example: 電話をかける前に、メモを書いておいた方がいいです その電話番号を忘れないようにするためです denwa o kakeru mae ni, memo o kaite oite oku hou ga ii desu sono denwa bangou o wasurenai you ni suru tame desu (It's better to write a note before making a phone call so you don't forget the phone number) 電話で話すよりも、直接会って話した方がいいこともあります denwa de hanasu yori mo, chokusetsu atte hanashita hou ga ii koto mo arimasu (Sometimes it's better to talk in person than over the phone)

Word/Phrase: 丼
Romaji: donburi
Meaning: mangkok besar
Example: 牛丼は安くて美味しいので、毎日食べたいですけど、健康を考えると我慢しています gyūdon wa yasuku te oishī node, mainichi tabetai desu kedo, kenkou o kangaeru to gaman shite imasu (Beef bowls are cheap and delicious, so I want to eat them every day, but I restrain myself for the sake of my health) このレストランの丼物メニューはボリューム満点で、特に天丼と親子丼がおすすめですが、一人前の量が多すぎて、友達とシェアするのが理想的です kono resutoran no donburimono menyū wa boryūmu manten de, tokuni tendon to oyakodon ga osusume desu ga, ichininmae no ryō ga ōsugite, tomodachi to shea suru no ga risōteki desu (The rice bowl menu at this restaurant is packed with volume, especially the tempura bowl and chicken-and-egg bowl, which are highly recommended, but the single serving is too large, so sharing with a friend is ideal)

Word/Phrase: 道具
Romaji: dougu
Meaning: perkakas
Example: 道具を使って料理を作るとき、きれいに切るために包丁を使います。包丁は料理の道具で、とても便利です dougu o tsukatte ryōri o tsukuru toki, kirei ni kiru tame ni hōchō o tsukaimasu. hōchō wa ryōri no dougu de, totemo benri desu (When preparing meals using kitchen tools, a sharp knife is essential for cutting ingredients neatly. A knife is a fundamental cooking tool and incredibly useful for efficiency) 道具を使う前に、必ず安全な使い方を確認し、適切な保護具を着用して事故を防ぎましょう dougu o tsukau mae ni, kanarazu anzen na tsukaikata o kakunin shi, tekisetsu na hogogu o chakuyō shite jiko o fusegimashou (Before operating any tools, always verify the correct and safe usage methods, wear appropriate protective gear, and take precautions to avoid accidents)

Word/Phrase: 灰皿
Romaji: haizara
Meaning: asbak
Example: 灰皿にタバコの灰を落として、周りに散らばった火種を消火器で確実に消し止めた haizara ni tabako no hai o otoshite, mawari ni chirabatta hidane o shōkaki de kakujitsu ni keshitometa (He dropped cigarette ashes into the ashtray and carefully extinguished all the embers around it with a fire extinguisher) 灰皿がいっぱいになったので、デザインの良い新しい灰皿を探しに家具店まで出かけた haizara ga ippai ni nattanode, dezain no yoi atarashii haizara o sagashi ni kaguya made dekaketa (The ashtray was full, so I went all the way to the furniture store to find a well-designed new one)

Word/Phrase: 箸
Romaji: hashi
Meaning: sumpit
Example: 箸を使うときは、食べ物を落とさないように気をつけてください hashi o tsukau toki wa, tabemono o otosanai yō ni ki o tsukete kudasai (When using chopsticks, be careful not to drop your food) 箸の使い方を教えてもらったので、今から練習して上手に使えるようになりたいです hashi no tsukaikata o oshiete moratta node, ima kara renshū shite jōzu ni tsukaeru yō ni naritai desu (Since someone taught me how to use chopsticks, I will practice now so I can become skilled at using them)

Word/Phrase: 引き出し
Romaji: hikidashi
Meaning: laci
Example: 引き出しからノートを取り出して、机の上に広げて宿題を始めました hikidashi kara nōto o toridashite, tsukue no ue ni hirogete shukudai o hajimemashita (Saya mengeluarkan buku catatan dari laci, membentangkannya di atas meja, lalu mulai mengerjakan PR) 引き出しの中に、昔の家族写真や手紙が整理されずに詰まっています hikidashi no naka ni, mukashi no kazoku shashin ya tegami ga seiri sa rezu ni tsumatte imasu (Di dalam laci, foto-foto keluarga lama dan surat-surat tersumbat tanpa dirapikan)

Word/Phrase: 椅子
Romaji: isu
Meaning: chair
Example: 椅子の上に読みかけの小説を置いていたら、突然の強風で庭まで飛ばされてしまった isu no ue ni yomikake no shōsetsu o oite itara, totsuzen no kyōfū de niwa made tobasa rete shimatta (I had left my half-read novel on the chair, but a sudden gust of wind blew it all the way to the garden) 古びた木製の椅子がついに脚の部分から割れてしまったので、週末に家具屋へ行って耐久性の高い新しいものを選ばなければならない furubita mokusei no isu ga tsuini ashi no bubun kara warete shimatta node, shūmatsu ni kaguya e itte taikyūsei no takai atarashii mono o erabanakereba narani (The leg of my old wooden chair finally cracked, so I need to go to the furniture store this weekend to pick out a new, more durable one)

Word/Phrase: 壁
Romaji: kabe
Meaning: dinding
Example: 壁に大きな本棚を取り付けようとしたが、壁が石膏ボードだと知って断念した kabe ni ookina hondana o toritsuke you to shita ga, kabe ga sekkou boodo da to shitte dannen shita (I tried to install a large bookshelf on the wall, but gave up when I found out it was made of drywall) 壁に隠し扉があるという噂を聞き、何年もかけてその場所を探し続けた kabe ni kakushi to ga aru to iu uwasa o kiki, nannen mo kakete sono basho o sagashi tsuduketa (After hearing rumors of a hidden door in the wall, I spent years searching for its location)

Word/Phrase: 鏡
Romaji: kagami
Meaning: mirror
Example: 古くから日本の家には、朝起きてすぐ鏡の前に立ち、髪を整えたり化粧を直したりする習慣がある。 furuku kara nihon no ie ni wa, asa okite sugu kagami no mae ni tachi, kami o totonoetari keshō o naoshitari suru shūkan ga aru. (Since long ago, Japanese homes have had the custom of standing in front of a mirror right after waking up to tidy one’s hair or fix one’s makeup.) 祭りの日に神社で見かける銅製の鏡は、時代を超えて受け継がれてきた技術が光る、貴重な文化財だ。 matsuri no hi ni jinja de mikakeru dōsei no kagami wa, jidai o koete uketsugarete kita gijutsu ga hikaru, kichō na bunkazai da. (The bronze mirrors seen at shrines during festivals are precious cultural treasures that reflect the techniques passed down through the ages.)

Word/Phrase: 鍵
Romaji: kagi
Meaning: key
Example: 鍵をなくしてしまったので、今日一日中ずっと家に入ることができませんでした。 kagi o nakushite shimatta node, kyō ichinichijū zutto ie ni hairu koto ga dekimasen deshita. (I lost my key, so I couldn’t get into my house at all for the entire day.) 鍵屋さんに連絡を取り、緊急で新しい鍵を作成してもらう手配を済ませました。 kagi-ya-san ni renraku o tori, kinkyū de atarashii kagi o sakusei shite morau tehai o suma shimashita. (I contacted a locksmith and arranged to have a new key made urgently.)

Word/Phrase: 家具
Romaji: kagu
Meaning: furniture
Example: 家具を買う前に、まず部屋のサイズや配置、インテリアのテイストを総合的に検討しましょう。 Kagu o kau mae ni, mazu heya no saizu ya haichi, intoria no teisuto o sōgōteki ni kentō shimashō. (Before purchasing furniture, carefully consider the room’s dimensions, layout, and interior style as a whole.) 高級な家具を選ぶ際は、素材の質や耐久性、メンテナンスのしやすさも重要なポイントです。 Kōkyū na kagu o erabu sai wa, sozai no shitsu ya taikyūsei, mente-nansu no shiyasusa mo jūyō na pointo desu. (When choosing high-end furniture, the quality of materials, durability, and ease of maintenance are also crucial factors.)

Word/Phrase: 家事
Romaji: kaji
Meaning: house chores
Example: 家事をする時間が少なくなったので、週末に一緒に掃除や洗濯をして、来週の準備を整えましょう Kaji o suru jikan ga sukunakunatta node, shūmatsu ni issho ni sōji ya sentaku o shite, raishū no junbi o totonoemashō (Since I have less time for house chores now, let’s clean and do laundry together on the weekend to prepare for next week) 家事は大変ですが、家族の健康と快適な生活のために、毎日コツコツと取り組んでいます Kaji wa taihen desu ga, kazoku no kenkō to kaiteki na seikatsu no tame ni, mainichi kotskotsu to torikumonde imasu (Though house chores are tough, I steadily work on them every day for my family’s health and a comfortable life.)

Word/Phrase: 缶切り
Romaji: kankiri
Meaning: pembuka kaleng
Example: 台所で料理をしている時、缶詰のふたが固くて開かないことがありますが、缶切りを使えば簡単に開くので、とても便利です。 daidokoro de ryouri o shite iru toki, kanzume no futa ga katakute akinai koto ga arimasu ga, kankiri o tsukae ba kantan ni aku node, totemo benri desu. (When cooking in the kitchen, sometimes the lid of a can is too tight to open, but with a can opener, it opens easily, making it very convenient.) 先週、引っ越しの準備をしていたら、缶切りが見つからず、古い缶詰を開けるのに苦労しました。 senshuu, hikkoshi no junbi o shite ita ra, kankiri ga mitsukara zu, furui kanzume o akeru no ni kurō shimashita. (Last week, while preparing for a move, I couldn’t find the can opener and struggled to open an old can.)

Word/Phrase: 窓
Romaji: mado
Meaning: window
Example: 窓から見える山はとてもきれいで、毎日見ていると心が落ち着きます mado kara mieru yama wa totemo kirei de, mainichi mite iru to kokoro ga ochitsukimasu (The mountain visible from the window is very beautiful, and looking at it every day calms my heart) 窓辺で本を読みながら、遠くから聞こえてくる鳥のさえずりに耳を傾ける時間が一番好きです madogiwa de hon o yominagara, tōku kara kikoete kuru torino saezuri ni mimi o katamukeru jikan ga ichiban suki desu (I love the time when I read a book by the window and listen to the distant chirping of birds the most)

Word/Phrase: 目覚まし時計
Romaji: mezamashi tokei
Meaning: jam beker
Example: 目覚まし時計が鳴ったので、私はすぐに起きましたが、まだ眠くて仕事に集中できませんでした mezamashitokei ga natta node, watashi wa sugu ni okimashita ga, mada nemukute shigoto ni shūchū dekimasen deshita (Because the alarm clock rang, I woke up immediately, but I was still sleepy and couldn’t focus on work) 目覚まし時計をセットするのを忘れて、朝からバタバタして遅刻しそうになりました mezamashitokei o setto suru no o wasurete, asa kara batabata shite chikoku shisō ni narimashita (I forgot to set the alarm clock, rushed around in the morning, and almost ended up being late)

Word/Phrase: 鍋
Romaji: nabe
Meaning: panci
Example: 冬になると、私たちは家族や友人と一緒に、よく鍋を囲んで食べます。 Fuyu ni naru to, watashitachi wa kazoku ya yūjin to issho ni, yoku nabe o kakonde tabemasu. (When winter comes, we often gather with family and friends to eat nabe together.) 特に、外が冷え込む寒い日には、体が温まる温かい鍋が何よりも心地よく感じられます。 Toku ni, soto ga hiekomu samui hi ni wa, karada ga atatamaru atatakai nabe ga nani yori mo kokochi yoku kanjiraremasu. (Specially on freezing cold days when the outside chills, a warm nabe that heats up the body feels better than anything else.)

Word/Phrase: 荷物
Romaji: nimotsu
Meaning: luggage
Example: 空港へ向かう途中、大きな荷物を両手で抱えていたら、急に肩が痛くなり始めた。それでも、飛行機に乗り遅れないように、歯を食いしばって歩き続けた。 kūkō e mukau tochū, ōkina nimotsu o ryōte de kakaete ita ra, kyū ni kata ga itaku narihajimeta. sore demo, hikōki ni noriokurenai yō ni, ha o kuishibatte aruki tsuzuketa. (On the way to the airport, while carrying a large piece of luggage in both arms, my shoulders suddenly started to hurt. Even so, to avoid missing the flight, I gritted my teeth and kept walking.) 引っ越しの準備で、荷物を梱包しているとき、古いアルバムが出てきた。懐かしい写真を見ながら、つい手を止めてしまい、作業が遅れてしまった。 hikkoshi no junbi de, nimotsu o konpaku shite iru toki, furui arubamu ga dete kita. natsukashī shashin o minagara, tsui te o tomete shimai, sagyō ga okurete shimatta. (While packing luggage for the move, an old photo album came out. As I looked at the nostalgic pictures, I unconsciously stopped working, and the task was delayed.)

Word/Phrase: お風呂
Romaji: ofuro
Meaning: bath
Example: お風呂に入る前に、石鹸で汚れを落としておけば、湯船につかったときに肌がすべすべになる Ofuro ni hairu mae ni, sekken de yogore o otoshite okeba, yubune ni tsukatta toki ni hada ga subesube ni naru (If you remove dirt with soap before bathing, your skin will feel smooth when you soak in the tub) 仕事で疲れた日は、お風呂で温まりながら好きな音楽を聞くと、明日へのエネルギーが湧いてくる Shigoto de tsukareta hi wa, ofuro de atatamarinagara suki na ongaku o kiku to, ashita e no enerugī ga wai te kuru (On days when you're tired from work, warming up in the bath while listening to your favorite music can recharge your energy for tomorrow)

Word/Phrase: 押し入れ
Romaji: oshiire
Meaning: lemari
Example: 押し入れの中に古い写真や手紙がたくさん入っていて、時々見返すと懐かしい気持ちになる oshiire no naka ni furui shashin ya tegami ga takusan haitte ite, tokidoki mikaesu to natsukashii kimochi ni naru (Whenever I sort through the old photos and letters stored in the closet, a wave of nostalgia washes over me, reminding me of cherished memories) 押し入れを整理すると、子供の頃のおもちゃや服、さらには忘れていた大切なアルバムまで出てきて、家族と一緒に見返す楽しい時間を過ごした oshiire o seiri suru to, kodomo no koro no omocha ya fuku, sarani wa wasurete ita taisetsu na arubamu made dete kite, kazoku to issho ni mikaesu tanoshii jikan o sugoshita (While organizing the closet, I found not only old toys and clothes from my childhood but also a precious album I had forgotten about, and I spent a joyful time reminiscing with my family)

Word/Phrase: 冷房
Romaji: reibou
Meaning: AC
Example: 夏は暑くて大変です特に電車の中は暑くて冷房が効いていないと我慢できません natsu wa atsuku te taihen desu tokuni densha no naka wa atsuku te reibou ga kite inai to gaman dekimasen (Summer is extremely difficult due to the heat, and inside crowded trains, it becomes unbearable if the air conditioning isn’t functioning properly.) オフィスの冷房が壊れたまま数日放置されていて、社員全員が不満を抱えています ofisu no reibou ga Kowareta mama suujitsu houchisarete ite, shain zen'in ga fumanto o kakaete imasu (The office air conditioning has been broken and left unfixed for several days, leaving all employees frustrated and uncomfortable.)

Word/Phrase: 冷蔵庫
Romaji: reizoko
Meaning: kulkas
Example: 家で料理を始める前に、冷蔵庫の中身を確認するのが習慣です。もし牛乳や卵が残っていれば、無駄に買い物をしなくても済みます。 ie de ryōri o hajimeru mae ni, reizōko no nakami o kakunin suru no ga shūkan desu. moshi gyūnyū ya tamago ga nokotte ireba, muda ni kaimono o shinakute mo sumimasu. (Before starting to cook at home, it’s a habit to check the refrigerator.
