Example: 私達は最初にこのプロジェクトの基本計画を練り、その後詳細なスケジュールを立てた watashitachi wa saisho ni kono purojekuto no kihon keikaku o neri, sono go shōsai na sukejūru o tatera (First, we worked out the basic plan for this project, then created a detailed schedule) 最初の授業で、先生は今学期の目標と評価基準について詳しく説明した saisho no jugyō de, sensei wa kon gakki no mokuhyō to hyōka kijun ni tsuite kuwashiku setsumei shita (In the first class, the teacher explained the goals and evaluation criteria for this term in detail)

Word/Phrase: 最後
Romaji: saigo
Meaning: last
Example: 最後の試験まであと一週間しかないので、毎日図書館で勉強しています saigo no shiken made ato isshūkan shika nai node, mainichi toshokan de benkyō shite imasu (There is only one week left until the final exam, so I study at the library every day) 最後のチャンスを逃さないように、全力で準備を進めています saigo no chansu o nogasanai yō ni, zenryoku de junbi o susumete imasu (So as not to miss the last opportunity, I am preparing with all my might)

Word/Phrase: 億
Romaji: oku
Meaning: ratus juta
Example: 日本は世界でも人口が多い国の一つで、約一億二千万人が暮らしている。 Nihon wa sekai demo jinkō ga ōi kuni no hitotsu de, yaku ichioku nisenman-nin ga kurashiteiru. (Japan is one of the most populous countries in the world, with approximately 120 million people living there.) この大規模なプロジェクトは、五百億円以上の予算が組まれており、多くの専門家が参加している。 Kono daikibo na purojekuto wa, gohyaku oku-en ijō no yosan ga kumareteori, ōku no senmonka ga sanka shiteiru. (This large-scale project has a budget exceeding 500 billion yen, with many experts participating in it.)

Word/Phrase: 平均
Romaji: heikin
Meaning: average
Example: 日本の小中学生の身長を調べたデータによると、男子の平均は165センチメートル、女子は158センチメートルで、食生活や睡眠時間が成長に大きく関係していることが分かってきた。 Nihon no shōchūgakusei no shinchō o shirabeta dēta ni yoru to, danshi no heikin wa hyaku rokujū go sentimētoru, joshi wa hyaku gojū hachi sentimētoru de, shokuseikatsu ya suimin jikan ga seichō ni ōkiku kankei shite iru koto ga wakatte kita. (According to data surveying the heights of elementary and junior high school students in Japan, the average for boys is 165 cm and for girls is 158 cm, and it has become clear that diet and sleep duration are closely related to growth.) この市では平均所得が全国の数字を上回り、住民の生活水準が高まる一方で、教育や医療への投資も増え、地域全体の発展につながっている。 Kono shi de wa heikin shotoku ga zenkoku no sūji o uwamawari, jūmin no seikatsu suijun ga takamaru ichimen de, kyōiku ya iryō e no tōshi mo fue, chiiki zentai no hatten ni tsunagatte iru. (In this city, where the average income exceeds national figures, the standard of living for residents is improving, and increased investment in education and healthcare is contributing to the overall development of the region.)

Word/Phrase: 多数
Romaji: tasuu
Meaning: majority
Example: 多数の参加者がこのイベントで熱心に議論し、新しいプロジェクトの方向性について意見を交わした tasuu no sanka-sha ga kono ibento de nesshin ni giron shi, atarashii purojekuto no hōkōsei ni tsuite iken o kawashita (A large number of participants passionately discussed and exchanged opinions on the direction of the new project at this event) --- 多数の科学者が長年にわたりこの現象を研究し、複数の仮説を実験を通じて検証してきた tasuu no kagakusha ga naganen ni watari kono genshō o kenkyū shi, fukusū no kasetsu o jikken o tsūjite kenshō shite kita (A majority of scientists have studied this phenomenon for many years, verifying multiple hypotheses through experiments)

Word/Phrase: 缶
Romaji: kan
Meaning: kaleng
Example: 缶を集めてリサイクルするのは環境保護につながり、未来の子供たちのためにもとても大切なことです kan o atsumete risaikuru suru no wa kankyō hogo ni tsunagari, mirai no kodomo-tachi no tame ni mo totemo taisetsu na koto desu (Collecting cans for recycling is connected to environmental protection and is very important for the future of our children) 缶を捨てる前に、中身をきれいに洗って乾かすことで、リサイクルの効率も上がります kan o suteru mae ni, nakami o kirei ni araitte kawakasu koto de, risaikuru no kōritsu mo agarimasu (Before throwing away cans, washing and drying the inside cleanly also improves recycling efficiency)

Word/Phrase: 網棚
Romaji: amidana
Meaning: rak (semacam di kereta)
Example: 電車に乗るとすぐ、空いている網棚を見つけて荷物をしまい、隣の乗客に軽く会釈した。 densha ni noru to sugu, aiteiru amidana o mitsukete nimotsu o shimai, tonari no jōkyaku ni karuku eshaku shita. (As soon as I boarded the train, I found an empty overhead rack to stow my luggage and gave a slight nod to the passenger beside me.) 出発間近の混雑した車内で、網棚にバッグを上げようと何度も手を伸ばした。 shuppatsu makan no konmatsu shita shanai de, amidana ni baggu o ageyou to nando mo te o nobashita. (In the crowded train just before departure, I repeatedly reached up to lift my bag onto the overhead rack.)

Word/Phrase: 爆弾
Romaji: bakudan
Meaning: bom
Example: 駅のロッカーで不審な荷物が見つかり、爆弾の可能性があると判断されたため、一時的に駅構内が封鎖された。 Eki no rokkaa de fushin na nimotsu ga mitsukari, bakudan no kanōsei ga aru to handan sa reta tame, ichijiteki ni eki konai ga fūsa sa reta. (At the station, a suspicious package was found in a locker, and since it was judged to possibly be a bomb, the station was temporarily locked down.) 先月、公園で爆弾らしき物体が発見され、周辺の道路が通行止めになったが、幸いにも偽物だったことが後にわかった。 Sengetsu, kōen de bakudan rashiki buttai ga hakken sa re, shūhen no dōro ga tsūkōdome ni natta ga, saiwai ni mo nisemono datta koto ga nochi ni wakatta. (Last month, an object resembling a bomb was discovered in a park, causing nearby roads to be closed, but it was later found to be a fake.)

Word/Phrase: 別
Romaji: betsu
Meaning: something different
Example: 別の道を歩いていると、新しい風景や出会いに恵まれ、予期せぬ発見があるかもしれません betsu no michi o aruite iru to, atarashii fūkei ya deai ni megumare, yoki se nu hakken ga aru kamo shirenai (If you walk down a different path, you might encounter new scenery and people, leading to unexpected discoveries) この本は前のシリーズと全く別の歴史的背景を持つテーマで構成されており、読者に新たな視点を提供します kono hon wa mae no shirīzu to mattaku betsu no rekishiteki haikei o motsu tēma de kōsei sa re te o ri, doku sha ni arata na shiten o teikyō shi masu (This book is composed of themes with completely different historical backgrounds from the previous series, offering readers fresh perspectives)

Word/Phrase: 瓶
Romaji: bin
Meaning: botol kaca
Example: 瓶の中に水が入っているので、飲みたい時に飲めます bin no naka ni mizu ga haitte iru node, nomitai toki ni nomemasu (Karena ada air di dalam botol, Anda bisa minum ketika ingin minum) 瓶を洗ってから、新しいジュースを入れました bin o aratte kara, atarashii jūsu o iremashita (Saya mencuci botol lalu memasukkan jus baru ke dalamnya)

Word/Phrase: 蓋
Romaji: futa
Meaning: lid
Example: 蓋を閉める前に、中の食べ物が冷めないように、少し温めておいた方がいいです Futa o shimeru mae ni, naka no tabemono ga samenai yō ni, sukoshi atatamete oite oku hō ga ii desu (Sejak sebelum menutup tutupnya, agar makanan di dalamnya tidak dingin, lebih baik sedikit dipanaskan terlebih dahulu) この蓋のデザインはとてもきれいで、箱の見た目もよくなります Kono futa no dezain wa totemo kirei de, hako no mitame mo yoku narimasu (Rancangan tutup ini sangat indah, sehingga kotaknya juga terliihat bagus)

Word/Phrase: 宝庫
Romaji: houko
Meaning: harta karun
Example: この図書館は本の宝庫で、歴史や科学、小説など、いろいろなジャンルの本がたくさんあります kono toshokan wa hon no hōko de, rekishi ya kagaku, shōsetsu nado, ironna janru no hon ga takusan arimasu (This library is a treasure trove of books, with many books from various genres like history, science, and novels)

Word/Phrase: 小包
Romaji: kodzutsumi
Meaning: parsel
Example: 郵便局に持っていく前に、小包の中身が壊れていないか、もう一度よく調べましょう。 yūbinkyoku ni motte iku mae ni, kozutsumi no nakami ga kowarete inai ka, mō ichido yoku shirabemashō. (Before taking the package to the post office, carefully check once more that the contents are not broken.) 重さが規定内の小包なら、窓口で手続きをすれば、その日のうちに発送できます。 omosa ga kitei nai no kozutsumi nara, madoguchi de tetsuzuki o sureba, sono hi no uchi ni hassō dekimasu. (If the package is within the weight limit, you can complete the procedures at the counter and ship it the same day.)

Word/Phrase: 細かいお金
Romaji: komakai okane
Meaning: uang receh
Example: 細かいお金を財布に入れておくと、コンビニで小さな買い物をする時に便利です komakai okane o saifu ni irete okuto, konbini de chiisana kaimono o suru toki ni benri desu (It is convenient to keep small change in your wallet when making small purchases at a convenience store, as it saves time and avoids fumbling for exact amounts.)

Word/Phrase: 丸
Romaji: maru
Meaning: lingkaran
Example: 丸いお月様が夜空の中央に静かに輝き、周りの星々を優しく照らしていました marui o-tsuki-sama ga yozora no chūō ni shizuka ni kagayaki, mawari no hoshiboshi o yasashiku terashite imashita (The beautifully round moon glowed quietly at the center of the night sky, gently illuminating the surrounding stars) 子供たちが公園で丸い風船を追いかけながら、楽しそうに笑い合っていました kodomotachi ga kōen de marui fūsen o oikakena gara, tanoshisō ni waraiatte imashita (The children were happily chasing a round balloon in the park, laughing joyfully together)

Word/Phrase: 物
Romaji: mono
Meaning: thing
Example: この高価な物を購入する前に、その必要性について一度冷静に考え直してみるべきではないだろうか。 Kono kōka na mono o kōnyū suru mae ni, sono hitsuyōsei ni tsuite ichido reisei ni kangaenaoshite miru beki de wa nai darō ka. (Before purchasing this expensive thing, shouldn’t you reconsider its necessity with a calm mind at least once?) 友達が手渡してくれた小さな箱の中に入っていた手作りの物は、決して金額では測れないほどの価値を持っている。 Tomodachi ga tewatashite kureta chiisana hako no naka ni haitte ita tezukuri no mono wa, kesshite kingaku de wa hakarenai hodo no kachi o motte iru. (The handmade thing inside the small box my friend handed to me holds a value that can never be measured in monetary terms.)

Word/Phrase: 中身
Romaji: nakami
Meaning: konten
Example: この袋の中身は何ですか、一緒に開けて内容を確認してみましょう kono fukuro no nakami wa nan desu ka, issho ni akete naiyō o kakunin shite mimashō (Apa yang ada di dalam kantong ini? Mari kita buka bersama dan periksa isinya) この本の中身はとても面白いですし、ストーリーもわかりやすく、簡単に読めます kono hon no nakami wa totemo omoshiroi deshishi, sutōrī mo wakariyasuku, kantan ni yomemasu (Isi buku ini sangat menarik, alur ceritanya mudah dipahami, dan bisa dibaca dengan mudah)

Word/Phrase: 何か
Romaji: nanika
Meaning: something
Example: 何か食べたいですが、近くに何か美味しいレストランやおすすめの料理はありませんか？ nanika tabetai desu ga, chikaku ni nanika oishii resutoran ya osusume no ryouri wa arimasen ka? (I feel like eating something—do you know any delicious restaurants or recommended dishes nearby?) 何か問題がありましたか？もし何かあれば、すぐに担当者までご連絡いただけますようお願いします。 nanika mondai ga arimashita ka? moshi nanika areba, sugu ni tantousha made go renraku itadakemasu you onegai shimasu. (Did you encounter any issues? If there’s anything, please contact the person in charge immediately.)

Word/Phrase: 荷物
Romaji: nimotsu
Meaning: luggage
Example: 空港へ向かう途中、大きな荷物を両手で抱えていたため、電車の乗り換えのたびに苦労し、最後には肩が痛くなってしまった。 kūkō e mukau tochū, ōkina nimotsu o ryōte de kakaete ita tame, densha no norikae no tabi ni kurō shi, saigo ni wa kata ga itaku natte shimatta. (On the way to the airport, because I was carrying large luggage in both arms, I struggled every time I transferred trains, and in the end, my shoulders started to hurt.) 海外旅行の準備で荷物を詰めているとき、液体物の量が制限を超えていないか、何度も計り直さなければならなかった。 kaigai ryokō no junbi de nimotsu o tsumete iru toki, ekitai-butsu no ryō ga seigen o koete inai ka, nando mo hakari naosanakereba naranakatta. (While packing luggage for an overseas trip, I had to remeasure the amount of liquids several times to ensure they didn’t exceed the limit.)

Word/Phrase: 人形
Romaji: ningyou
Meaning: doll
Example: 祭りの屋台で、手作りの人形が並べられているのを見かけ、子供たちが目を輝かせながら選んでいた。 Matsuri no yatai de, tezukuri no ningyō ga naraberarete iru no o mikake, kodomotachi ga me o kagayakase nagara erande ita. (At a festival stall, children’s eyes sparkled as they picked out handmade dolls displayed in a row.) 祖母の家には、大切に飾られた古い人形がいくつもあり、それぞれが家族の思い出と共にある。 Sobo no ie ni wa, taisetsu ni kazarareta furui ningyō ga ikutsu mo ari, sorezore ga kazoku no omoide to tomo ni aru.

Word/Phrase: 贈り物
Romaji: okurimono
Meaning: gift
Example: 母の誕生日を迎える来週までに、心のこもった贈り物を見つけようと、デパートの売り場を回るつもりだ。 haha no tanjōbi o mukaeru raishū made ni, kokoro no komotta okurimono o mitsukeyō to, depāto no uriba o mawaru tsumori da. (With my mother’s birthday approaching next week, I intend to browse the department store’s aisles to find a gift filled with sincerity.) 友達がくれた贈り物の中には、手作りのカードと共に、過去の楽しい思い出が写真で綴られたアルバムが入っていた。 tomodachi ga kureta okurimono no naka ni wa, tezukuri no kādo to tomo ni, kako no tanoshii omoide ga shashin de tsuzurareta arubamu ga haitte ita. (Among the gifts my friend gave me was an album, paired with a handmade card, that chronicled our joyful memories in photographs.)

Word/Phrase: お年玉
Romaji: otoshidama
Meaning: new year’s gift
Example: 子供たちが新年の初日に両親からもらうお年玉は、きれいな飾り袋に入った新札で、その金額を知るたびに喜びの声を上げます。 Kodomo-tachi ga shinnen no shonichi ni ryōshin kara morau otoshidama wa, kirei na kazari-bukuro ni haitta shinsatsu de, sono kingaku o shiru tabi ni yorokobi no koe o agemasu. (When children receive otoshidama from their parents on New Year’s Day, it comes in beautiful decorated envelopes with crisp bills, and each time they learn the amount, they cheer with joy.) お正月に家族が集まる中で、祖父母は孫にお年玉を手渡し、その笑顔を見るのが何よりの幸せだと言います。 Oshōgatsu ni kazoku ga atsumaru naka de, sofubo wa mago ni otoshidama o tewatashi, sono egao o miru no ga nani yori no shiawase da to iimasu. (As the family gathers for New Year’s, grandparents say that handing otoshidama directly to their grandchildren and seeing their smiles is their greatest happiness.)

Word/Phrase: 再入国ビザ
Romaji: sainyuukoku biza
Meaning: visa masuk kembali
Example: 再入国ビザを取るために、事前に必要な書類を確認しておくことが大切です sainyuukoku biza o toru tame ni, jizen ni hitsuyō na shorui o kakunin shite oku koto ga taisetsu desu (Before applying for a re-entry visa, it is crucial to verify all required documents in advance to avoid delays) 再入国ビザがあれば、出国後も日本に戻ってくることができますし、手続きがスムーズに進みます sainyuukoku biza ga areba, shukkoku go mo nihon ni modotte kuru koto ga dekimasu shi, tetsuzuki ga sumūzu ni susumimasu (Having a re-entry visa not only allows you to return to Japan after leaving but also ensures the process goes smoothly)

Word/Phrase: 作品
Romaji: sakuhin
Meaning: karya
Example: この監督が手掛けた最新作品は、複雑な人間関係を描きつつも、観る者に希望を与える珠玉の一作だと評価されている。 kono kantoku ga tegakatta saishin sakuhin wa, fukuzatsu na ningen kankei o egaki tsutsu mo, miru mono ni kibō o ataeru shugyoku no issaku da to hyōka sarete iru. (The director’s latest work, while depicting complex human relationships, is praised as a masterpiece that gives viewers hope.) 美術館で展示中のその作品は、光と影の対比を巧みに操り、見る角度によって表情を変える不思議な魅力を持っている。 bijutsukan de tenjichū no sono sakuhin wa, hikari to kage no taihi o takumi ni ayatsuri, miru kakudo ni yotte hyōjō o kaeru fushigi na miryoku o motte iru. (The piece currently on display at the museum, skillfully manipulating contrasts of light and shadow, has a mysterious charm that changes expression depending on the viewer’s angle.)

Word/Phrase: 生物
Romaji: seibutsu
Meaning: makhluk hidup
Example: 生物の勉強は面白いですけど、難しい問題もたくさんあります Seibutsu no benkyō wa omoshiroi desu kedo, muzukashii mondai mo takusan arimasu (Studying living organisms is fascinating, but there are also many challenging questions to solve) 生物の実験では、植物や動物の生き方を観察し、環境との関係性を深く分析します Seibutsu no jikken de wa, shokubutsu ya dōbutsu no ikikata o kansatsu shi, kankyō to no kankeisei o fukaku bunsekishimasu (In experiments with living organisms, we observe how plants and animals live and analyze their deep relationships with the environment)

Word/Phrase: 線
Romaji: sen
Meaning: garis
Example: この駅から先の線路は工事中で、来週まで電車が運休するため、通学に使う学生たちはバスに乗り換えなければならない。 Kono eki kara saki no senro wa kōji-chū de, raishū made densha ga unkyū suru tame, tsūgaku ni tsukau gakusei-tachi wa basu ni norikaenakereba naranai. (Since the train tracks ahead of this station are under construction and trains will be suspended until next week, students who use them for commuting to school must switch to buses.) 公園の地面に白い線が引いてあり、そこは自転車の駐輪場として使われているが、時々車が止まっていて問題になっている。 Kōen no jimen ni shiroi sen ga hiite ari, soko wa jitensha no chūrinjō to shite tsukawarete iru ga, tokidoki kuruma ga tomatte ite mondai ni natte iru. (White lines are drawn on the ground in the park to mark a bicycle parking area, but sometimes cars park there, causing issues.)

Word/Phrase: 信号
Romaji: shingou
Meaning: signal/traffic light
Example: 信号が青になったので、交差点を確認しながらみんなで一緒に横断歩道を渡りました Shingō ga ao ni natta node, kōsaten o kakunin shinagara minna de issho ni ōdan hodō o watarimashita (When the traffic light turned green, we all carefully checked the intersection and crossed the pedestrian crossing together) 信号を無視して道路を渡ると、重大な事故に遭う可能性があるので十分注意してください Shingō o mushi shite dōro o wataru to, jūdai na jiko ni au kanōsei ga aru node jūbun chūi shite kudasai (If you ignore the traffic signal and cross the road, you may be involved in a serious accident, so please be very careful)

Word/Phrase: 包み
Romaji: tsutsumi
Meaning: paket
Example: 包みを持って駅まで歩き、電車に乗る前にコンビニで切手を買うのを忘れないようにしました。 tsutsumi o motte eki made aruki, densha ni noru mae ni konbini de kitte o kau no o wasurenai you ni shimashita. (I carried the package while walking to the station and made sure not to forget to buy stamps at the convenience store before boarding the train.) 友達は包みを開けて、中に手作りのセーターと心のこもった手紙が入っているのを見つけ、感動のあまり涙を浮かべました。 tomodachi wa tsutsumi o akete, naka ni tejina no sētā to kokoro no komotta tegami ga haitte iru no o mitsuke, kandou no amari namida o ukabemashita. (My friend opened the package, found a hand-knitted sweater and a heartfelt letter inside, and was so moved that tears welled up in their eyes.)

Word/Phrase: 指輪
Romaji: yubiwa
Meaning: cincin
Example: 指輪を買う前に、店員さんにサイズを測ってもらいました。指輪は結婚式のプレゼントにするつもりです yubiwa o kau mae ni, ten'in-san ni saizu o hakatte moraimashita. yubiwa wa kekkonshiki no purezento ni suru tsumori desu (Before buying the ring, I asked the store clerk to measure my size. I plan to give it as a wedding gift.) 指輪はデザインが繊細で、宝石の輝きも美しく、友達だけでなく家族まで感心してしまいました yubiwa wa dezain ga sensai de, hōseki no kagayaki mo utsukushiku, tomodachi dake de naku kazoku made kanshin shite shimaimashita (The ring had an intricate design and the sparkle of the gemstone was stunning, impressing not just my friends but even my family.)

Word/Phrase: 材料
Romaji: zairyou
Meaning: bahan
Example: 料理の味を決めるのは、使う材料の質であり、特に野菜や魚は新鮮さが重要だ。そのため、市場でその日に採れたものを選ぶ人が多い。 ryōri no aji o kimeru no wa, tsukau zairyō no shitsu de ari, tokuni yasai ya sakana wa shinsen-sa ga jūyō da. Sono tame, ichiba de sono hi ni toreta mono o erabu hito ga ōi. (What determines the taste of a dish is the quality of the ingredients used, and freshness is especially important for vegetables and fish. For this reason, many people choose items harvested that day at the market.) このレシピでは、普通の小麦粉ではなく、グルテンフリーの材料を使う必要がある。健康を考える人が増えている今、こうした特殊な材料の需要も高まっている。 kono reshipi de wa, futsū no komugiko de wa naku, guruten-furī no zairyō o tsukau hitsuyō ga aru. Kenkō o kangaeru hito ga fuete iru ima, kōshita tokushu na zairyō no juyō mo takamatte iru. (In this recipe, instead of regular wheat flour, gluten-free ingredients are required. With more people becoming health-conscious these days, the demand for such special ingredients is also increasing.)

Word/Phrase: 整備士
Romaji: seibishi
Meaning: mekanik
Example: 車を長く安全に使うため、整備士はエンジンの汚れを取り除き、細部まで丁寧に調整する。さらに、運転手に適切なアドバイスも提供する。 kuruma o nagaku anzen ni tsukau tame, seibishi wa enjin no yogore o torinozoki, saibu made teinei ni chōsei suru. sarani, unten shu ni tekisetsu na adobaisu mo teikyō suru. (Agar mobil dapat digunakan dengan aman dalam jangka panjang, mekanik membersihkan kotoran pada mesin dan melakukan penyesuaian dengan teliti hingga detail terkecil. Selain itu, mereka juga memberikan saran yang tepat kepada pengemudi.) 毎日忙しく働く整備士は、様々な車両の点検を徹底的に行い、エンジンやブレーキの不具合を素早く見つけ出して修理する。 mainichi isogashiku hataraku seibishi wa, samazama na sharyō no tenken o tettōteki ni okonai, enjin ya burēki no fugō o subayaku mitsukedashite shūri suru. (Mekanik yang bekerja sibuk setiap hari melakukan pemeriksaan menyeluruh pada berbagai jenis kendaraan, lalu dengan cepat menemukan dan memperbaiki kerusakan pada mesin atau rem.)

Word/Phrase: お坊
Romaji: obou
Meaning: monk
Example: お坊さんは寺で毎日朝から晩までお経を読み、信者たちの悩みを聞いて慰めの言葉をかけます o-bōsan wa tera de mainichi asa kara ban made o-kyō o yomi, shinja-tachi no nayami o kiite nagusame no kotoba o kakemasu (The monk chants sutras at the temple from morning till night every day and listens to the worries of his followers, offering words of comfort) お坊さんは朝早く起きて、お寺の境内を丁寧に掃除し、その後、村人たちに教えを説きに行きます o-bōsan wa asa hayaku okite, o-tera no keidai o teinei ni sōji shi, sono go, murabito-tachi ni oshie o toki ni ikimasu (The monk wakes up early each morning to carefully clean the temple grounds, then goes to preach teachings to the villagers)

Word/Phrase: 天皇
Romaji: tennou
Meaning: emperor
Example: 日本の歴史の中で、国民の心を一つにする天皇の役割はとても大きく、長い間、尊敬の対象となってきました。 Nihon no rekishi no naka de, kokumin no kokoro o hitotsu ni suru tennō no yakuwari wa totemo ōkiku, nagai aida, sonkei no taishō to natte kimashita. (Throughout Japanese history, the Emperor’s role in uniting the people’s hearts has been very significant, and for a long time, has been an object of respect.) 天皇の誕生日が近づくと、街には国旗が飾られ、多くの人々が祝賀の気持ちを表すために集まります。 Tennō no tanjōbi ga chikadzu to, machi ni wa kokki ga kazari rare, ōku no hitobito ga shukuga no kimochi o arawasu tame ni atsumarimasu. (As the Emperor’s birthday approaches, national flags are displayed across towns, and many people gather to express their celebratory feelings.)

Word/Phrase: 弁護士
Romaji: bengoshi
Meaning: lawyer
Example: 弁護士に相談したいのですが、どの弁護士が信頼できるかわからないです bengoshi ni soudan shitai no desu ga, dono bengoshi ga shinrai dekiru ka wakarimasen (I want to consult with a lawyer, but I don’t know which one is trustworthy) 弁護士は法律の専門家なので、複雑な契約書の審査や交渉の代理も行い、難しい問題も解決できます bengoshi wa houritsu no senmonka na node, fukuzatsu na keiyakusho no shinsa ya koushou no dairi mo okonai, muzukashii mondai mo kaiketsu dekimasu (Since lawyers are legal experts, they can review complex contracts, act as agents in negotiations, and solve difficult problems)

Word/Phrase: 部長
Romaji: bucho
Meaning: senior manager
Example: 部長は毎日朝早く出社して、チームの進捗を確認し、必要なサポートを提供しています Buchō wa mainichi asa hayaku shussha shite, chīmu no shinchoku o kakunin shi, hitsuyō na sapōto o teikyō shite imasu (The senior manager comes to the office early every morning to check the team's progress and provide necessary support) 部長は四半期ごとの会議で、部門の目標達成に向けた戦略を詳細に説明し、質問に丁寧に回答しました Buchō wa shihan'ki-goto no kaigi de, bumon no mokuhyō tassei ni muketa senryaku o shōsai ni setsumei shi, shitsumon ni teinei ni kaitō shimashita (The senior manager explained the department's strategic plan for achieving quarterly goals in detail during the meeting and carefully answered all questions)

Word/Phrase: 大統領
Romaji: daitouryou
Meaning: presiden
Example: アメリカの大統領は国民の代表として、国の方向を決める重要な役割を果たしています Amerika no daitouryou wa kokumin no daihyou toshite, kuni no houkou o kimeru juuyou na yakuwari o hatashite imasu (The President of the United States plays a crucial role as the representative of the people in determining the direction of the nation) 彼は大統領に選ばれた時、国民から大きな期待を受けました Kare wa daitouryou ni erabareta toki, kokumin kara ookina kitai o uke mashita (When he was elected president, he received immense expectations from the citizens)

Word/Phrase: 読者
Romaji: dokusha
Meaning: reader
Example: この小説を手に取った読者は、主人公の選択がその後の物語にどのように影響を与えていくのか、最後まで目が離せなかったに違いない。 Kono shousetsu o te ni totta dokusha wa, shujinkou no sentaku ga sono go no monogatari ni dono you ni eikyou o ataete iku no ka, saigo made me ga hanasenakatta ni chigainai. (Readers who picked up this novel must have been unable to look away until the end, wondering how the protagonist’s choices would continue to shape the story.) 社会問題を扱うこの記事を読んだ読者からは、「自分にもできることは何か」と問い合わせが相次ぎ、編集部に届いている。 Shakai mondai o atukau kono kiji o yonda dokusha kara wa, "jibun ni mo dekiru koto wa nani ka" to toiawase ga aitsugi, henshuubu ni todoite iru. (After reading this article on social issues, many readers have contacted the editorial department one after another, asking, "What can I do to help?")

Word/Phrase: 泥棒
Romaji: dorobou
Meaning: maling
Example: 泥棒が家に入って、お金や宝石を盗んだ。警察に連絡したので、すぐに捕まってくれた dorobou ga ie ni haitte, okane ya hōseki o nusunda. keisatsu ni renraku shita node, sugu ni tsukamatte kureta (The thief broke into the house and stole money and jewels. Since we called the police right away, they managed to catch him quickly) 泥棒は夜中に静かに窓から入ってきた。私たちは寝ていたから、全然気づかなかった dorobou wa yonaka ni shizuka ni mado kara haitte kita. watashitachi wa nete ita kara, zenzen kizukanakatta (The thief slipped in through the window in the dead of night while we were asleep, so we didn’t notice anything at all)

Word/Phrase: 同僚
Romaji: douryou
Meaning: colleague
Example: 同僚と一緒に新しいプロジェクトの計画を練るため、週末にオフィスで集中的に作業しました。 dōryō to issho ni atarashī purojekuto no keikaku o neru tame, shūmatsu ni ofisu de shūchūteki ni sagyō shimashita. (My colleagues and I worked intensively in the office over the weekend to plan a new project.) 同僚は困難な状況でも常に冷静で、チーム全員を励ましながら問題解決に導いてくれます。 dōryō wa konnan na jōkyō demo tsune ni reisei de, chīmu zen’in o hagukumashinagara mondai kaiketsu ni michibite kuremasu. (Even in difficult situations, my colleague remains calm, encouraging the entire team while guiding us toward problem-solving.)

Word/Phrase: 不動産屋
Romaji: fudousanya
Meaning: real estate agent
Example: 不動産屋に相談したら、希望に合った物件を複数紹介してくれて、内見の手配もしてくれた fudōsan-ya ni sōdan shitara, kibō ni atta bukken o fukusū shōkai shite kurete, naiken no tehai mo shite kureta (When I consulted a real estate agent, they introduced multiple properties that matched my preferences and even arranged the viewings for me) 不動産屋は地域の市場動向や法律にも詳しいので、初心者でも安心して契約手続きを進められる fudōsan-ya wa chiiki no shijō dōkō ya hōritsu ni mo kuwashii node, shoshinsha demo anshin shite keiyaku tetsuzuki o susumerareru (Real estate agents are knowledgeable about local market trends and laws, so even beginners can proceed with contract procedures with confidence)

Word/Phrase: 学長
Romaji: gakuchou
Meaning: rektor
Example: 大学の象徴たる学長が、学生の声に耳を傾ける姿勢は、キャンパス内外で高く評価されており、特に進路や研究の壁に直面する者にとって心強い存在となっている。 Daigaku no shōchō taru gakuchō ga, gakusei no koe ni mimi o katamukeru shisei wa, kyanpasu naigai de takaku hyōka sarete ori, tokuni shinro ya kenkyū no kabe ni chokumen suru mono ni totte kokodzuyoi sonzai to natte iru. (Sikap rektor sebagai simbol universitas yang mendengarkan suara mahasiswa sangat dihargai baik di dalam maupun luar kampus, dan menjadi keberadaan yang menguatkan hati terutama bagi mereka yang menghadapi dinding dalam karir dan penelitian.) 学長主導のもと進められた改革案は、教授陣の反対を押し切りつつも、理事会との協議を経て実現に至り、今後の教育方針に新たな地平を切り開くこととなった。 Gakuchō shudō no moto susumerareta kaikaku-an wa, kyōjurin no hantai o oshikiritsutsu mo, rijikai to no kyōgi o hete jitsugen ni itari, kongo no kyōiku hōshin ni aratana chihei o kirihiraku koto to natta. (Rencana reformasi yang dipimpin rektor, meskipun mendorong penolakan dari para profesor, berhasil direalisasikan setelah melalui konsultasi dengan dewan pengawas, dan membuka cakrawala baru untuk kebijakan pendidikan ke depan.)

Word/Phrase: 博士
Romaji: hakase
Meaning: phd
Example: 博士は大学の研究室で最先端の実験を指導し、学生たちに論文執筆のアドバイスも行っています Hakase wa daigaku no kenkyūshitsu de saisentan no jikken o shidō shi, gakusei-tachi ni ronbun shippitsu no adobaisu mo okonatte imasu. (A PhD professor supervises cutting-edge experiments in the university lab and also advises students on writing academic papers) 博士は長年にわたる研究の末、環境科学分野で画期的な発見を成し遂げ、国際学会で高く評価されました Hakase wa naganen ni wataru kenkyū no sue, kankyō kagaku bun’ya de kakitekina hakken o nasitoge, kokusai gakkai de takaku hyōka saremashita. (After years of research, the PhD made a groundbreaking discovery in environmental science, earning high acclaim at an international conference)

Word/Phrase: 飛行士
Romaji: hikoushi
Meaning: pilot
Example: 飛行士になる道は簡単ではなく、何年も飛行学校で過ごし、空の天気や機体の仕組みを細かく学ばなければならない。 hikōshi ni naru michi wa kantan de naku, nannen mo hikōgakkō de sugoshi, sora no tenki ya kitai no shikumi o komakaku manabanakereba narana. (The path to becoming a pilot is not easy; you must spend years at flight school, meticulously studying weather patterns and aircraft mechanics.) 飛行士の仕事は、ただ飛行機を飛ばすだけではなく、乗客を守り、もしトラブルが起きても落ち着いて対処する技術が求められる。 hikōshi no shigoto wa, tada hikōki o tobasu dake de naku, jōkyaku o mamori, moshi toraburu ga okitemo ochitsuite taisho suru gijutsu ga motomerareru.　 (A pilot’s job isn’t just about flying planes—it requires protecting passengers and handling any trouble calmly with skill.)

Word/Phrase: 翻訳家
Romaji: honyakuka
Meaning: translator
Example: 翻訳家は外国の小説や専門書を日本語に訳し、文化的なニュアンスも伝える繊細な仕事を担っています honyakuka wa gaikoku no shōsetsu ya senmonsho o nihongo ni yakushi, bunka-teki na nyuansu mo tsutaeru sensai na shigoto o ninatte imasu (Translators handle the delicate task of converting foreign novels and technical books into Japanese while conveying cultural nuances) 翻訳家は単に言葉を置き換えるだけでなく、原文の意図や文体を忠実に再現し、読者が自然に理解できるよう努めなければなりません honyakuka wa tanni kotoba o okikaeru dake de naku, genbun no ito ya buntai o chūjitsu ni saigen shi, dokusha ga shizen ni rikai dekiru yō tsutomenakereba narimasen (They must not only replace words but faithfully recreate the original intent and style so readers can understand naturally)

Word/Phrase: 員
Romaji: in
Meaning: member/staff
Example: 会社の新しい社員は、毎日朝早くから働いています。彼はとても真面目で、同僚からも信頼されています。 Kaisha no atarashii shain wa, mainichi asa hayaku kara hataraite imasu. Kare wa totemo majime de, dōryō kara mo shinrai sarete imasu. (The new company employee works diligently every morning from early hours, demonstrating great sincerity and earning the trust of his coworkers.) この病院の医療スタッフは全員が有能な看護師や医師で構成されており、患者からの評判も非常に高いです。 Kono byōin no iryō sutaffu wa zen'in ga yūnō na kangoshi ya ishi de kōsei sarete ori, kanja kara no hyōban mo hijō ni takai desu. (All the medical staff at this hospital consist of highly skilled nurses and doctors, and they receive exceptionally high praise from patients.)

Word/Phrase: 医者
Romaji: isha
Meaning: dokter
Example: 病院で待っている間、医者が次々と患者を診ているのを見て、仕事の大変さがよくわかりました。 byōin de matte iru aida, isha ga tsugitsugi to kanja o mi te iru no o mite, shigoto no taihensa ga yoku wakarimashita. (While waiting at the hospital, watching the doctor examine patient after patient, I truly understood how demanding their job is.) 小さな町の医者は、診療所で診察するだけでなく、夜間に急患の電話にも対応しています。 chiisa na machi no isha wa, shinryōjo de shinsatsu suru dake de naku, yakan ni kyūkan no denwa ni mo taiō shite imasu. (The doctor in this small town not only examines patients at the clinic but also responds to emergency calls at night.)

Word/Phrase: 課長
Romaji: kacho
Meaning: kadiv
Example: 課長は毎日忙しいです 会社で仕事がたくさんあります だから、休みの日もよく残業をしています kachō wa mainichi isogashii desu kaisha de shigoto ga takusan arimasu dakara, yasumi no hi mo yoku zangyō o shite imasu (Section chief is busy every day with a lot of work at the company, so he often works overtime even on holidays) 課長は私に新しいプロジェクトを任せました このプロジェクトは会社の将来にとても重要なので、全力で取り組むつもりです kachō wa watashi ni atarashii purojekuto o makasemashita kono purojekuto wa kaisha no shōrai ni totemo jūyō nanode, zenryoku de torikumu tsumori desu (My section chief entrusted me with a new project, and since it’s very important for the company’s future, I plan to work on it with all my effort)

Word/Phrase: 科学者
Romaji: kagakusha
Meaning: scientist
Example: 科学者は新しい薬の開発に多くの時間を費やし、人類の健康改善に貢献しています kagakusha wa atarashī kusuri no kaihatsu ni ōku no jikan o tsuiyashi, jinrui no kenkō kaizen ni kōken shite imasu (Scientists spend much time developing new medicines to contribute to improving human health) 科学者は地球温暖化の影響を調査し、持続可能な解決策を模索するために国際チームと協力しています kagakusha wa chikyū ondanka no eikyō o chōsa shi, jizoku kanō na kaitōsaku o mosaku suru tame ni kokusai chīmu to kyōryoku shite imasu (Scientists investigate the effects of global warming and collaborate with international teams to explore sustainable solutions)

Word/Phrase: 介護士
Romaji: kaigoshi
Meaning: care worker
Example: 介護士は毎日、お年寄りの体を洗ったり、食事を手伝ったりしています。彼らはとても大切な仕事をしています kaigoshi wa mainichi, o-toshi-yori no karada o arattari, shokuji o tetsudattari shite imasu. Karera wa totemo taisetsu na shigoto o shite imasu (Care workers bathe elderly individuals and assist with meals every day. They perform incredibly vital work that supports the well-being of aging communities.) 介護士として働く人は、高齢者の生活全般をサポートし、時には家族と連携してケアプランを立てることもあります kaigoshi toshite hataraku hito wa, kōreisha no seikatsu zenpan o sapōto shi, tokini wa kazoku to renkei shite kea puran o tateru koto mo arimasu (As care workers, they support all aspects of elderly life and sometimes collaborate with families to create tailored care plans.)

Word/Phrase: 会計士
Romaji: kaikeishi
Meaning: akuntan
Example: 会計士は企業の財務報告書を監査し、税務申告書の作成や経営コンサルティングも行います kaikeishi wa kigyō no zaimu hōkokusho o kanshi shi, zeimu shinkokusho no sakusei ya keiei konsarutingu mo okonaimasu (Accountants audit financial statements for corporations, prepare tax returns, and also provide management consulting services) 会計士になるためには、難関の国家試験に合格し、実務経験を積む必要があります kaikeishi ni naru tame ni wa, nankan no kokka shiken ni gōkaku shi, jitsumu keiken o tsumu hitsuyō ga arimasu (To become an accountant, one must pass a challenging national examination and gain practical work experience)

Word/Phrase: 看護士
Romaji: kangoshi
Meaning: nurse
Example: 病院で働く看護士たちは、患者の回復を願いながら、夜遅くまで診察の準備や薬の管理に追われている。 byōin de hataraku kangoshi-tachi wa, kanja no kaifuku o negainagara, yoru osoku made shinsatsu no junbi ya kusuri no kanri ni owarete iru. (Nurses working in hospitals, while wishing for their patients' recovery, are busy preparing for examinations and managing medications late into the night.) 看護士という仕事は体力も必要だが、患者から「ありがとう」の言葉をかけられると、どんなに大変でもやりがいを感じることができる。 kangoshi to iu shigoto wa tairyoku mo hitsuyō da ga, kanja kara "arigatō" no kotoba o kakerare to, donna ni taihen demo yarigai o kanjiru koto ga dekiru.

Word/Phrase: 管理人
Romaji: kanrinin
Meaning: admin
Example: このアパートの管理人は、朝から共有部分の掃除を終えると、ごみ置き場で分別ルールを守れているか確認しに行く。 kono apāto no kanrinin wa, asa kara kyōyū bubun no sōji o oeru to, gomi okiba de bunbetsu rūru o mamorete iru ka kakunin shi ni iku. (The admin of this apartment finishes cleaning the shared areas in the morning, then heads to the trash area to check if the sorting rules are being followed.) 先月、管理人が企画した夏祭りの準備中、住民から「エアコンが壊れた」と急な連絡があったが、30分以内に業者を手配した。 sengetsu, kanrinin ga kikaku shita natsumatsuri no junbi chū, jūmin kara "eakon ga kowareta" to kyū na renraku ga atta ga, 30-pun inai ni gyōsha o tehai shita. (Last month, while preparing for the summer festival planned by the admin, a resident suddenly reported "the air conditioner is broken," but the admin arranged a repair service within 30 minutes.)

Word/Phrase: 管理人
Romaji: kanrinin
Meaning: pengawas
Example: このアパートでは、朝早くから管理人が共有エリアの安全を確認し、掃除を終えると、住民の声に耳を傾けるためのメモを手放さない。 kono apāto de wa, asa hayaku kara kanrinin ga kyōyū eria no anzen o kakunin shi, sōji o oe ru to, jūmin no koe ni mimi o katamuku tame no memo o tebanasanai. (Di apartemen ini, sejak pagi buta pengawas memastikan keamanan area bersama, dan setelah menyelesaikan pembersihan, ia selalu siap mencatat suara penghuni dengan buku catatan di tangan.) 火災対策として、管理人は消火器やスプリンクラーの作動チェックを欠かさず、非常時の避難がスムーズに行えるよう、表示板の更新も忘れない。 kasai taisaku toshite, kanrinin wa shōkaki ya supurinkurā no sādō chekku o kakasazu, hijōji no hinan ga sumūzu ni okonareru yō, hyōjiban no kōshin mo wasurenai. (Sebagai langkah pencegahan kebakaran, pengawas tak pernah melewatkan pemeriksaan fungsi pemadam api dan sprinkler, serta selalu memperbarui papan petunjuk agar evakuasi darurat berjalan lancar.)

Word/Phrase: 歌手
Romaji: kashu
Meaning: singer
Example: 世界的に活躍する歌手のライブでは、観客が一体となって歌い、踊る様子が印象的だった。 sekai-teki ni katsuyaku suru kashu no raibu de wa, kankyaku ga ittai to natte utai, odoru yōsu ga inshō-teki datta. (At the globally active singer’s live performance, the sight of the audience uniting to sing and dance left a strong impression.) 来月リリースされる歌手の新作アルバムは、ファンの間で期待が高まる一方、予約数が過去最高を記録している。 raigetsu risu sareru kashu no shinsaku arubamu wa, fan no aida de kitai ga takamaru ippō, yoyaku-sū ga kako saikō o kiroku shite iru. (The singer’s upcoming new album, set for release next month, has sparked soaring expectations among fans, with pre-order numbers hitting an all-time high.)

Word/Phrase: 警察
Romaji: keisatsu
Meaning: police
Example: 警察が犯人を逮捕したおかげで、夜道を歩く人も減り、子どもたちが公園で遊ぶ姿が戻ってきた。 Keisatsu ga hannin o taiho shita okage de, yoru michi o aruku hito mo heri, kodomo-tachi ga kōen de asobu sugata ga modotte kita. (Thanks to the police arresting the criminal, fewer people walk alone at night, and children playing in the park have returned.) 警察官が交差点で手を振って車を止めるたび、通勤中の人たちも自然とスピードを落とし、安全運転を心がけるようになる。 Keisatsu-kan ga kōsaten de te o hutte kuruma o tomeru tabi, tsūkin-chū no hitotachi mo shizen to supīdo o otoshi, anzen unten o kokoro gakeru yō ni naru. (Every time a police officer waves to stop cars at an intersection, even commuters naturally slow down and become more mindful of safe driving.)

Word/Phrase: 建築家
Romaji: kenchikuka
Meaning: architect
Example: 建築家が設計した住宅は、周りの環境と調和しながら、住む人のライフスタイルに合わせて細かく考えられている。 kenchikuka ga sekkei shita juutaku wa, mawari no kankyou to chouwa shinagara, sumu hito no raifusutairu ni awasete komakaku kangaerarete iru. (The houses designed by the architect are carefully planned to harmonize with the surrounding environment while matching the residents' lifestyles.) 建築家は、依頼主の要望を聞き入れつつ、安全性や機能性を重視しながら、何度も図面を書き直している。 kenchikuka wa, irainushi no youbou o kikiiretsutsu, anzensei ya kinousei o juushi shinagara, nando mo zumen o kakinaoshite iru. (The architect revises the blueprints repeatedly, carefully listening to the client's requests while prioritizing safety and functionality.)

Word/Phrase: 研究者
Romaji: kenkyusha
Meaning: researcher
Example: 研究者は実験をしてデータを集めますそしてそのデータを分析して研究を進めます kenkyūsha wa jikken o shite dēta o atsumemasu soshite sono dēta o bunseki shite kenkyū o susumemasu (Researchers conduct experiments to collect data, then analyze it to advance their studies) 研究者は学術会議で最新の発見を発表し、他の専門家と意見交換を行って知識を深めます kenkyūsha wa gakujutsu kaigi de saishin no hakken o happyō shi, hoka no senmonka to iken kōkan o okonatte chishiki o fukamemasu (At academic conferences, researchers present their latest findings and engage in discussions with other experts to deepen their understanding)

Word/Phrase: 講師
Romaji: koushi
Meaning: pemateri
Example: 講師の先生は毎週水曜日と金曜日に英語の授業を行い、 学生たちの発音や文法の質問にも丁寧に答えてくれます Kōshi no sensei wa maishū suiyōbi to kinyōbi ni eigo no jugyō o okonai, gakusei-tachi no hatson ya bunpō no shitsumon ni mo teinei ni kotaete kuremasu (The instructor conducts English classes every Wednesday and Friday, and also patiently answers students' questions about pronunciation and grammar) このセミナーの講師は、10年以上の経験を持つビジネスコンサルタントで、 参加者から高い評価を得ています Kono seminā no kōshi wa, jū-nen ijō no keiken o motsu bijinesu konsarutanto de, sanka-sha kara takai hyōka o ete imasu (The seminar's lecturer is a business consultant with over 10 years of experience, and is highly regarded by the participants)

Word/Phrase: 教師
Romaji: kyoushi
Meaning: guru
Example: 教師が持つ温かさは、生徒が知識を吸収する土台となり、質問しやすい雰囲気を作ることで、学びへの興味をさらに広げていく。 Kyōshi ga motsu atatakasa wa, seito ga chishiki o kyūshū suru doda to nari, shitsumon shiyasui fun’iki o tsukuru koto de, manabi e no kyōmi o sarani hirogete iku. (The warmth a teacher possesses becomes the foundation for students to absorb knowledge, and by creating an atmosphere where questions are easy to ask, it further expands their interest in learning.) 教師の授業中の姿勢が生徒の意欲に影響を与えるため、常に明るく前向きな態度を示すことで、生徒たちも自然と参加意欲を高めていくものだ。 Kyōshi no jugyōchū no shisei ga seito no iyoku ni eikyō o ataeru tame, tsune ni akaruku maemuki na taido o shimesu koto de, seito-tachi mo shizen to sanka iyoku o takamete iku mono da. (Because a teacher's demeanor during class affects students' motivation, consistently showing a bright and positive attitude naturally increases their willingness to participate.)

Word/Phrase: 目上
Romaji: meue
Meaning: atasan
Example: 先輩は目上の人だから、丁寧な言葉を使って話すべきです senpai wa meue no hito dakara, teinei na kotoba o tsukatte hanasu beki desu (Since your senior is a person of higher status, you should speak using polite language) 目上の人に対しては、常に礼儀正しく振る舞うことが大切で、社会での信頼を築く基礎となります meue no hito ni taishite wa, tsune ni reigitadashiku furumau koto ga taisetsu de, shakai de no shinrai o kizuku kiso to narimasu (It is important to always behave politely toward those of higher status, as it forms the foundation for building trust in society)

Word/Phrase: 持ち主
Romaji: mochinushi
Meaning: owner
Example: 図書館で見つけた古い本には、名前が書いてあったが、その持ち主がだれなのか、今でも謎のままである。 toshokan de mitsuketa furui hon ni wa, namae ga kaite atta ga, sono mochinushi ga dare nano ka, ima demo nazo no mama de aru. (The old book found in the library had a name written in it, but the identity of its owner remains a mystery even now.) 駅前で迷子になった犬は、首輪に持ち主の連絡先が書いてあったおかげで、無事に家族のもとへ帰ることができた。 ekimae de maigo ni natta inu wa, kubiwa ni mochinushi no renrakusaki ga kaite atta okage de, buji ni kazoku no moto e kaeru koto ga dekita. (The lost dog found near the station had its owner’s contact details on its collar, so it was safely returned to its family.)

Word/Phrase: 留学生
Romaji: ryuugakusei
Meaning: foreign student
Example: この大学には世界中からたくさんの留学生が日本語や日本の文化を学びに来ています kono daigaku ni wa sekaijū kara takusan no ryūgakusei ga nihongo ya nihon no bunka o manabi ni kite imasu (At this university, many foreign students from around the world come to study Japanese language and culture)

Word/Phrase: 作家
Romaji: sakka
Meaning: pengarang
Example: あの作家はとても面白い小説を書くので、多くの人が新しい作品を楽しみにしています ano sakka wa totemo omoshiroi shōsetsu o kaku node, ōku no hito ga atarashii sakuhin o tanoshimi ni shite imasu (That author writes very interesting novels, so many people eagerly await their new works and discuss them online before release.)

Word/Phrase: 生徒
Romaji: seito
Meaning: murid
Example: 難しい問題があったので、生徒たちは先生に質問したり、友達と協力したりして解決しようとしました muzukashii mondai ga atta node, seito-tachi wa sensei ni shitsumon shitari, tomodachi to kyōryoku shitari shite kaiketsu shiyō to shimashita (Because there was a difficult problem, the students tried to solve it by asking the teacher questions and collaborating with their friends to find a solution.) 新学期が始まり、生徒たちは新しい教室で緊張しながらも、お互いに自己紹介をしてクラスの雰囲気を和ませようと努力していた shin gakki ga hajimari, seito-tachi wa atarashii kyōshitsu de kinchō shinagara mo, otagai ni jiko shōkai o shite kurasu no fun'iki o nawamasetō to doryoku shite ita (As the new term began, the students, though nervous in their new classroom, introduced themselves to each other and made an effort to create a warm and friendly atmosphere in the class.)

Word/Phrase: 選手
Romaji: senshu
Meaning: player
Example: 昨日行われた試合で、日本の選手たちは最後まであきらめずに頑張りました kinō okonawareta shiai de, Nihon no senshu-tachi wa saigo made akiramezu ni ganbarimashita (In yesterday’s match, the Japanese players never gave up and kept pushing themselves until the final moment.)

Word/Phrase: 社長
Romaji: shacho
Meaning: direktur utama
Example: 社長は、来週の重要な顧客との打ち合わせのために、資料の準備を社員たちに依頼しました Shachō wa, raishū no jūyō na kokyaku to no uchiawase no tame ni, shiryō no junbi o shain-tachi ni irai shimashita (The president requested the employees to prepare materials for the important meeting with a client next week) 社長は、今期の売上目標達成に向けて、全従業員に対して特別なモチベーション向上プログラムを実施することを発表しました Shachō wa, konkai no uriage mokuhyō tassei ni mukete, zen jūgyōin ni taishite tokubetsu na mochibēshon kōjō puroguramu o jisshi suru koto o happyō shimashita (The president announced the implementation of a special motivation enhancement program for all employees to achieve this term's sales targets)

Word/Phrase: 写真家
Romaji: shashinka
Meaning: photographer
Example: あの写真家が撮る景色はいつも美しくて、私もいつかあんな風に写真を撮ってみたいです ano shashinka ga toru keshiki wa itsumo utsukushikute, watashi mo itsuka anna fū ni shashin o totte mitai desu (The scenery that photographer takes is always beautiful, and I also want to try taking photos like that someday)

Word/Phrase: 小説家
Romaji: shousetsuka
Meaning: novelist
Example: 私が一番好きな小説家は、身近な出来事を元にして、心温まる物語を書くことで有名です Watashi ga ichiban suki na shōsetsuka wa, mijika na dekigoto o moto ni shite, kokoro atatamaru monogatari o kaku koto de yūmei desu (My favorite novelist is famous for crafting heartwarming stories inspired by ordinary life experiences)

Word/Phrase: 主人公
Romaji: shujinkou
Meaning: main character
Example: この小説では、田舎から上京した主人公が、夢を叶えるために朝早くから夜遅くまで働く姿と、出会う人々から学ぶ大切な教訓が細かく描かれている。 Kono shōsetsu de wa, inaka kara jōkyō shita shujinkō ga, yume o kanaeru tame ni asa hayaku kara yoru osoku made hataraku sugata to, deau hitobito kara manabu taisetsu na kyōkun ga komakaku egakarete iru. (In this novel, the protagonist who moved to the city from the countryside is depicted in detail—working from early morning to late at night to fulfill their dreams, while learning important lessons from the people they meet.) 主人公は、厳しい現実に直面しながらも、周囲の支えによって少しずつ自信をつけていく過程が、読者の心を揺さぶるように書かれている。 Shujinkō wa, kibishī genjitsu ni chokumen shinagara mo, shūi no sasae ni yotte sukoshi zutsu jishin o tsukete iku katei ga, dokusha no kokoro o yusaburu yō ni kakarete iru. (The protagonist, while facing harsh realities, gradually gains confidence through the support of those around them—a process written in a way that deeply moves the reader’s heart.)

Word/Phrase: 首相
Romaji: shushou
Meaning: prime minister
Example: 今週末、首相は隣国の指導者と会談するため、海外へ出発する予定です Konshūmatsu, shushō wa ringoku no shidōsha to kaidan suru tame, kaigai e shuppatsu suru yotei desu (This weekend, the Prime Minister is scheduled to depart overseas to hold talks with the leader of the neighboring country) 首相は国会で新たな経済政策について詳細な説明を行い、与党と野党双方から質問を受けた Shushō wa kokkai de aratana keizai seisaku ni tsuite shōsai na setsumei o okonai, yotō to yatō ryōhō kara shitsumon o uketa (The Prime Minister provided a detailed explanation of the new economic policies in the Diet and faced questions from both the ruling and opposition parties)

Word/Phrase: 宇宙飛行士
Romaji: uchuuhikoushi
Meaning: astronot
Example: 宇宙飛行士が宇宙ステーションで過ごす間、地球の写真を撮ったり、無重力の環境で植物の成長を観察したりする。 uchuuhikoushi ga uchū sutēshon de sugosu aida, chikyū no shashin o tottari, mujūryoku no kankyō de shokubutsu no seichō o kansatsu shitari suru. (While astronauts spend time in space stations, they take photos of Earth and observe plant growth in zero-gravity environments.) 宇宙飛行士は、宇宙船の故障を直すために、何時間も船外活動をしながら、冷静に作業を続けることがある。 uchuuhikoushi wa, uchūsen no koshō o naosu tame ni, nanjikan mo sen’gai katsudō o shinagara, reisei ni sagyō o tsuzukeru koto ga aru. (To fix spacecraft malfunctions, astronauts sometimes perform hours of extravehicular activities while calmly continuing their work.)

Word/Phrase: 署名
Romaji: shomei
Meaning: tanda tangan
Example: この新しいスマートフォンの契約手続きでは、 公的な身分証明書を提示した後、契約書への署名が 必ず求められますので、ご注意ください。 kono atarashii sumātofon no keiyaku tetsuzuki de wa, kōteki na mibun shōmeisho o teiji shita ato, keiyaku-sho e no shomei ga kanarazu motomeraremasu node, gochūi kudasai. (In this new smartphone contract procedure, after presenting an official ID, signing the contract is always required, so please be careful.) 不動産取引の最終段階においては、 売主と買主の双方が契約書に署名し、 公証人の立会いのもとで手続きを完了させます。 fudōsan torihiki no saishū dankai ni oite wa, urinushi to kaishi no sōhō ga keiyaku-sho ni shomei shi, kōshōnin no tachiai no moto de tetsuzuki o kanryō sasemasu. (In the final stage of a real estate transaction, both the seller and buyer sign the contract, and complete the procedure in the presence of a notary public.)

Word/Phrase: 地図
Romaji: chizu
Meaning: map
Example: 初めての場所へ行く時は、いつも事前にインターネットで地図を調べてから出かけるようにしています Hajimete no basho e iku toki wa, itsumo jizen ni intānetto de chizu o shirabete kara dekakeru yō ni shite imasu (When I visit an unfamiliar place, I always check the map online in advance before heading out.) 旅行の計画を立てる際、現地の地図を詳しく確認して、観光スポットの場所や移動ルートをメモすることが大切です Ryokō no keikaku o tateru sai, genchi no chizu o kuwashiku kakunin shite, kankō supotto no basho ya idō rūto o memo suru koto ga taisetsu desu (When planning a trip, it’s important to carefully check the local map, note the locations of tourist spots, and outline your travel routes.)

Word/Phrase: 絵葉書
Romaji: ehagaki
Meaning: picture postcard
Example: 旅行先で、美しい風景の絵葉書を見つけたので、家族全員に一枚ずつ購入して郵送することにしました ryokōsaki de, utsukushī fūkei no ehagaki o mitsuketa node, kazoku zen’in ni ichimai zutsu kōnyū shite yūsō suru koto ni shimashita (At my travel destination, I found beautiful scenic postcards, so I decided to buy one for each family member and mail them) 古本屋で偶然見つけた昭和時代の絵葉書コレクションは、懐かしい街並みや風俗が描かれていて、歴史資料としても価値があると思います furuhonyade,ūchinami mitsuketa shōwa jidai no ehagaki korekushon wa, natsukashī machinami ya fūzoku ga egakarete ite, rekishi shiryō toshite mo kachi ga aru to omoimasu (The collection of Showa-era picture postcards I accidentally found in a used bookstore depicts nostalgic streetscapes and customs, and I think it’s valuable as historical material)

Word/Phrase: 袋
Romaji: fukuro
Meaning: kantong
Example: スーパーのレジ袋に野菜や洗剤などを詰め込んだら、重みで底が伸びてしまい、駐車場まで運ぶ間に破れないかと心配になった。 suupā no rejī fukuro ni yasai ya senzai nado o tsumekondara, omomi de soko ga nobite shimai, chūshajō made hakobu aida ni yaburenai ka to shinpai ni natta. (After stuffing vegetables and detergent into the supermarket’s plastic bag, the bottom stretched from the weight, making me worry it might tear before I reached the parking lot.) 引っ越しの日、段ボールと一緒に使っていた古い袋が突然破れ、中から出てきた本や服を慌てて拾い集めた。 hikkoshi no hi, dangōru to issho ni tsukatte ita furui fukuro ga totsuzen yabure, naka kara dete kita hon ya fuku o awatete hiroidzumeta. (On moving day, an old bag I’d been using alongside cardboard boxes suddenly tore, and I frantically gathered the books and clothes that spilled out.)

Word/Phrase: 封筒
Romaji: fuutou
Meaning: amplop
Example: 先日書いたお礼の手紙を、お気に入りの封筒に入れて送る準備をしています senjitsu kaita orei no tegami o, okiniiri no fuutou ni irete okuru junbi o shite imasu (I am preparing to send the thank-you letter I wrote the other day, carefully placing it in my favorite envelope before sealing it.) 手作りの便せんと共に、上質な封筒を選んで友人に季節の挨拶状を送った tezukuri no binsen to tomo ni, joushitsu na fuutou o erande yuujin ni kisetsu no aisatsu-jou o okutta (Along with handmade stationery, I selected a high-quality envelope to send my friend a seasonal greeting card.)

Word/Phrase: 現金
Romaji: genkin
Meaning: uang cash
Example: この店ではクレジットカードが使えないので、買い物の前に現金を用意しておく必要があります kono mise de wa kurejittokādo ga tsukaenai node, kaimono no mae ni genkin o yōi shite oku hitsuyō ga arimasu (Before shopping at this store, you must prepare cash in advance because they do not accept credit cards here)

Word/Phrase: 葉書
Romaji: hagaki
Meaning: postcard
Example: 旅行中、観光地で買った葉書に、両親への温かいメッセージと写真を何枚か貼り、早速投函しました Ryokōchū, kankōchi de katta hagaki ni, ryōshin e no atatakai messēji to shashin o nan-mai ka hari, sassoku tōkan shimashita (While traveling, I bought a postcard at a tourist spot, wrote a warm message to my parents, attached some photos, and mailed it right away) 夏休みに家族で訪れた海辺の町で、手書きの葉書を友人全員に送ることに決め、毎晩少しずつ書き進めました Natsuyasumi ni kazoku de otozureta umibe no machi de, tesaki no hagaki o yūjin zen’in ni okuru koto ni kime, maiban sukoshi zutsu kakishinemashita (During summer vacation, my family visited a seaside town, and I decided to send handwritten postcards to all my friends, writing a little each night)

Word/Phrase: はんこ
Romaji: hanko
Meaning: cap
Example: 郵便局で荷物を受け取る際、本人確認のためにはんこを押す必要があります yūbinkyoku de nimotsu o uketoru sai, honnin kakunin no tame ni hanko o osu hitsuyō ga arimasu (When receiving a package at the post office, you need to press your personal seal for identity verification) この伝統的な工芸品は、職人が一つ一つ手作業ではんこを彫っています kono dentōteki na kōgeihin wa, shokunin ga hitotsu hitotsu tezukuri de hanko o horite imasu (This traditional craft is hand-carved one by one by artisans to create personal seals)

Word/Phrase: 紙
Romaji: kami
Meaning: paper
Example: メモを取りたいのですが、近くにペンと紙が見つからなくて困っています Memo o toritai no desu ga, chikaku ni pen to kami ga mitsukaranakute komatte imasu (I wanted to jot down some important notes during the meeting, but I couldn’t find a pen and paper anywhere nearby, so I ended up struggling to remember everything.)

Word/Phrase: 漫画
Romaji: manga
Meaning: komik
Example: 日本の漫画は、絵と文章が組み合わさって、読む人に新しい世界を想像させる力があります。 Nihon no manga wa, e to bunshō ga kumiawasatte, yomu hito ni atarashī sekai o sōzō saseru chikara ga arimasu. (Japanese manga, which combines illustrations and text, has the power to make readers imagine new worlds.) 学校が終わった後、図書館で友達と一緒に、面白そうな漫画を探すのが毎週の楽しみです。 Gakkō ga owatta ato, toshokan de tomodachi to issho ni, omoshirosō na manga o sagasu no ga maishū no tanoshimi desu. (After school, searching for interesting manga with friends at the library has become a weekly pleasure.)

Word/Phrase: 日記
Romaji: nikki
Meaning: diary
Example: 今日、友達と公園で会って、お弁当を食べながら、長い時間を楽しく過ごしました。 Kyō, tomodachi to kōen de atte, obentō o tabenagara, nagai jikan o tanoshiku sugoshimashita. (Today, I met a friend at the park, ate a boxed lunch together, and spent a long, enjoyable time.) 学校で起こった面白い出来事や、先生からのアドバイスを詳しく日記に書き留め、明日提出するレポートの準備も進めました。 Gakkō de okotta omoshiroi dekigoto ya, sensei kara no adobaisu o kuwashiku nikki ni kakitome, ashita teishutsu suru repōto no junbi mo susumemashita. (I wrote down the interesting events that happened at school and the advice from my teacher in my diary in detail, and also made progress on preparing the report due tomorrow.)

Word/Phrase: 札
Romaji: satsu
Meaning: lembaran
Example: コンビニのATMで現金を引き出そうとしたとき、手にしていた一万円札が小さく破れているのに気づきました。しかし、機械がそれを拒否したため、仕方なく銀行へ行き、新しい札と交換してもらうことにしました。 konbini no ATM de genkin o hikidashō to shita toki, te ni shite ita ichiman-en satsu ga chiisaku yaburete iru no ni kizukimashita. Shikashi, kikai ga sore o kyohi shita tame, shikata naku ginkō e iki, atarashii satsu to kōkan shite morau koto ni shimashita. (When trying to withdraw cash at a convenience store ATM, I noticed that the 10,000-yen bill I was holding was slightly torn. However, since the machine rejected it, I had no choice but to go to the bank and exchange it for a new bill.) --- 海外旅行の支度中、財布にしまってあったドル札の枚数が予定より少ないことに気がつきました。そのため、空港の両替カウンターで足りない分を補うべく、日本円の紙幣を持って急いで家を出ました。 kaigai ryokō no shitaku-chū, saifu ni shimatte atta doru-satsu no maisū ga yotei yori sukunai koto ni kigatsukimashita. Sono tame, kūkō no ryōgae kauntā de tarinai bun o oginau beku, Nihon-en no shihei o motte isoide ie o demashita. (While preparing for an overseas trip, I realized that the number of dollar bills I had stored in my wallet was fewer than planned. To make up for the shortage at the airport exchange counter, I hurriedly left home with Japanese banknotes in hand.)

Word/Phrase: 説明書
Romaji: setsumeisho
Meaning: buku petunjuk
Example: 説明書を読んでから、この機械を操作する際は安全対策を必ず確認してください setsumeisho o yonde kara, kono kikai o sousa suru sai wa anzen taisaku o kanarazu kakunin shite kudasai (Before operating this machine, make sure to read the manual and confirm all safety precautions) 説明書に記載されている手順を正確に守らないと、製品の保証が適用されなくなる場合があります setsumeisho ni kisai sarete iru tejun o seikaku ni mamoranai to, seihin no hoshō ga tekiyō sarenaku naru baai ga arimasu (If you do not follow the steps outlined in the manual accurately, the product warranty may become void)

Word/Phrase: 写真
Romaji: shashin
Meaning: photograph
Example: 旅行先で美しい写真を残すには、光の向きや影のバランスを考えながら、被写体と背景の関係を工夫することが大切です。 Ryokōsaki de utsukushii shashin o nokosu ni wa, hikari no muki ya kage no baransu o kangaenagara, hishaitai to haikei no kankei o kufū suru koto ga taisetsu desu. (To capture beautiful photographs while traveling, it’s important to carefully consider the direction of light and balance of shadows while creatively arranging the relationship between the subject and background.) 先日見せてもらった京都の写真の中で、特に紅葉が映える寺院の構図は、季節感と歴史の深みを同時に伝える素晴らしい一枚だった。 Senjitsu misete moratta Kyōto no shashin no naka de, toku ni kōyō ga haeru jiin no kōzu wa, kisokkan to rekishi no fukami o dōji ni tsutaeru subarashii ichimai datta. (Among the Kyoto photographs you showed me the other day, the composition of the temple with vibrant autumn leaves was an outstanding shot that conveyed both seasonal beauty and historical depth.)

Word/Phrase: 資料
Romaji: shiryou
Meaning: dokumen
Example: プロジェクトチームは、関連する資料を一つ一つ確認しながら、三週間かけてようやく必要なデータを揃えたため、予定より遅れたが質の高い結果が得られた。 purojekuto chiimu wa, kanren suru shiryou o hitotsu hitotsu kakunin shinagara, san shuukan kakete youyaku hitsuyou na deeta o soroeta tame, yotei yori okureta ga shitsu no takai kekka ga erareta. (The project team carefully checked each relevant document one by one, taking three weeks to finally gather the necessary data, which delayed the schedule but resulted in high-quality outcomes.) 来週の会議で議論する前に、配布された資料を全員がしっかり読み、疑問点や重要な部分に印をつけておくことが求められている。 raishuu no kaigi de giron suru mae ni, haifusareta shiryou o zen'in ga shikkari yomi, gimon ten ya juuyou na bubun ni shirushi o tsukete oku koto ga motomerarete iru. (Before discussing in next week's meeting, everyone is required to thoroughly read the distributed documents and mark any questions or important sections.)

Word/Phrase: 書道
Romaji: shodou
Meaning: kaligrafi
Example: 書道を学ぶ友人は、繊細な線と力強さを兼ね備えた文字を生み出すため、毎晩遅くまで黙々と筆を動かし続けている。 shodō o manabu tomodachi wa, sensai na sen to chikara-zuosa o kanebitsuta moji o umidasu tame, maiban osoku made mokumoku to fude o ugokashi tsudzukete iru. (The friend studying calligraphy keeps silently moving the brush late into the night to create characters that balance delicate lines with powerful strokes.) --- 書道の作品を完成させるには、墨の濃さや筆の速度、さらには紙の吸い込み具合までを計算しながら、一画一画に精神を集中させる必要がある。 shodō no sakuhin o kansei saseru ni wa, sumi no kosa ya fude no sokudo, sarani wa kami no suikomi guai made o keisan shinagara, ikkaku ikkaku ni seishin o shūchū saseru hitsuyō ga aru. (To complete a calligraphy piece, one must concentrate their mind on each stroke while calculating ink density, brush speed, and even how the paper absorbs it.)

Word/Phrase: 用紙
Romaji: youshi
Meaning: form
Example: 用紙が足りないので、来週の会議の資料を印刷するために、コンビニに買いに行きます yōshi ga tarinai node, raishū no kaigi no shiryō o insatsu suru tame ni, konbini ni kai ni ikimasu (There isn’t enough paper for printing next week’s meeting materials, so I’m going to the convenience store to buy some) この用紙はA4サイズで、環境保護のためにも両面に印刷して提出してください kono yōshi wa ē-fō saizu de, kankyō hogō no tame ni mo ryōmen ni insatsu shite teishutsu shite kudasai (This form is A4-sized; for environmental protection, please print on both sides and submit it)

Word/Phrase: ばかり
Romaji: bakari
Meaning: only, nothing but, constantly
Example: この会社では、新入社員の山田さんが毎晩遅くまで残業ばかりしており、 kono kaisha de wa, shinnyūshain no Yamada-san ga maiban osoku made zangyō bakari shite ori, (At this company, the new employee Mr. Yamada is constantly doing nothing but working overtime until late every night, そのせいで体調を崩しそうになっているが、上司からはまだまだ頑張れと言われている。 sono sei de taichō o kuzushi-sō ni natte iru ga, jōshi kara wa madamada ganbare to iwarete iru.) and seems about to fall ill because of it, yet his boss still tells him to "keep pushing harder.") 学校のテストが近づいているのに、弟は部屋で新しいゲームばかりやっていて、 gakkō no tesuto ga chikadzuite iru no ni, otōto wa heya de atarashī gēmu bakari yatte ite, (Even though school exams are approaching, my younger brother is doing nothing but playing new games in his room, 宿題も復習も全然せず、母から心配されている。 shukudai mo fukushū mo zenzen sezu, haha kara shinpai sarete iru.) neither doing his homework nor reviewing, which is worrying our mother.)

Word/Phrase: または
Romaji: matawa
Meaning: or, both, also
Example: このレストランでは、注文のときに日本語または英語を使うことができるので、外国人のお客さんも安心して利用できます。 Kono resutoran de wa, chūmon no toki ni nihongo matawa eigo o tsukau koto ga dekiru node, gaikokujin no okyakusan mo anshin shite riyō dekimasu. (At this restaurant, you can use either Japanese or English when ordering, so even foreign customers can use it with peace of mind.) この国際会議では、発表は日本語または英語で行われるため、通訳が必要な場合は事前に申し込みをお願いします。 Kono kokusai kaigi de wa, happyō wa nihongo matawa eigo de okonawareru tame, tsūyaku ga hitsuyō na baai wa jizen ni mōshikomi o onegai shimasu. (At this international conference, presentations will be given in either Japanese or English, so if you need an interpreter, please apply in advance.)

Word/Phrase: 辺り
Romaji: atari
Meaning: sekitar
Example: この辺りは、昔は静かな住宅街だったが、最近では多くのカフェやレストランができて賑やかになった。 kono atari wa, mukashi wa shizukana jūtaku-gai datta ga, saikin de wa ōku no kafe ya resutoran ga dekite nigiyaka ni natta. (Di sekitar sini, dulu merupakan kawasan perumahan yang tenang, tetapi belakangan ini banyak kafe dan restoran baru dibuka sehingga menjadi ramai.)

Word/Phrase: 売店
Romaji: baiten
Meaning: kios
Example: 駅の売店でおにぎりとコーヒーを買い、電車に乗る前に朝食にしました eki no baiten de onigiri to koohii o kai, densha ni noru mae ni choushoku ni shimashita (I bought onigiri and coffee at a station kiosk and had them for breakfast before boarding the train)

Word/Phrase: バス停
Romaji: basutei
Meaning: halte bis
Example: バス停のベンチは、高齢者や身体の不自由な方が優先的に座れるように設計されています basutei no benchi wa, kōreisha ya shintai no fujiyū na kata ga yūsen-teki ni suwareru yō ni sekkei sarete imasu (The bus stop bench is designed so that elderly people and those with physical disabilities can sit with priority) バス停までの道のりは、歩道が整備されており、夜間でも街灯が明るく安全に歩けるようになっています basutei made no michinori wa, hodō ga seibi sarete ori, yakan demo gaitō ga akaruku anzen ni arukeru yō ni natte imasu (The path to the bus stop has well-maintained sidewalks and bright streetlights, allowing for safe walking even at night)

Word/Phrase: 牧場
Romaji: bokujo
Meaning: ranch
Example: 牧場で育てられた牛の肉は、風味が豊かで健康的な脂質を含んでいます Bokujo de sodaterareta ushi no niku wa, fūmi ga yutaka de kenkōteki na shishitsu o fukundeimasu (The beef raised on the ranch is rich in flavor and contains healthy fats) 牧場の広大な敷地では、馬が自由に駆け回り、羊がのんびりと草を食む光景が見られます Bokujo no kōdai na shikichi de wa, uma ga jiyū ni kake-mawari, hitsuji ga nonbiritori kusa o hamu kōkei ga mirare masu (On the ranch’s vast grounds, you can see horses running freely and sheep leisurely grazing on the grass)

Word/Phrase: 病院
Romaji: byouin
Meaning: hospital
Example: 病院に行ったら、先生に風邪を治す薬をもらいました Byōin ni ittara, sensei ni kaze o naosu kusuri o moraimashita. (When I went to the hospital, the doctor gave me medicine to treat my cold.) 病院の待合室で長時間待たされた後、ようやく診察を受けることができた Byōin no machiaishitsu de chōjikan matasareta ato, yōyaku shinsatsu o ukeru koto ga dekita. (After waiting for a long time in the hospital waiting room, I was finally able to see the doctor for my examination.)

Word/Phrase: 地方
Romaji: chihou
Meaning: wilayah (luas, include beberapa prefektur)
Example: 地方の人たちは、毎年伝統的な祭りを盛大に開催し、先祖から受け継いだ文化を大切に守り続けています chihō no hitotachi wa, maiden dentōteki na matsuri o seidai ni kaisai shi, senzo kara uketsuida bunka o taisetsu ni mamori tsudzukete imasu (Orang-orang di wilayah ini mengadakan festival tradisional dengan meriah setiap tahun dan terus menjaga budaya warisan dari nenek moyang mereka)

Word/Phrase: 地下
Romaji: chika
Meaning: basement
Example: 地下に大きな図書館があり、学生たちが日々勉強に励んでいます chika ni ōkina toshokan ga ari, gakusei-tachi ga hibijibi benkyō ni hagende imasu (There is a large library underground where students study diligently every day) 地下鉄の駅構内は複雑な通路で知られており、初心者は迷うことが多いです chikatetsu no ekikōnai wa fukuzatsu na tsūro de shirareteori, shoshinsha wa mayou koto ga ōi desu (The underground subway station is known for its complex passageways, and beginners often get lost)

Word/Phrase: 地球
Romaji: chikyuu
Meaning: bumi
Example: 地球は青く美しい惑星で、宇宙から見るとその壮大さに息を飲みます chikyuu wa aoku utsukushī wakusei de, uchuu kara miru to sono soudaisa ni iki o nomimasu (The Earth is a beautifully blue planet, and when viewed from space, its grandeur takes your breath away) 地球の表面積の約70パーセントは海に覆われており、残りの30パーセントが陸地です chikyuu no hyōmenseki no yaku 70 paasento wa umi ni oowarete ori, nokori no 30 paasento ga rikuchi desu (About 70 percent of the Earth's surface is covered by oceans, while the remaining 30 percent is land)

Word/Phrase: 駐車場
Romaji: chuushajou
Meaning: parking lot
Example: 駐車場が満車で、10分間待たなければならなかった chuushajou ga manchā de, juppunkan mata nakereba naranakatta (The parking lot was full, so I had to wait for 10 minutes) 駐車場の料金が高すぎて、別の場所を探すことにした chuushajou no ryōkin ga takasugite, betsu no basho o sagasu koto ni shita (The parking fee was too expensive, so I decided to look for another place)

Word/Phrase: 台所
Romaji: daidokoro
Meaning: kitchen
Example: 台所で夕食の準備をしている間、子供たちがリビングで宿題をしていました。 daidokoro de yūshoku no junbi o shite iru aida, kodomotachi ga ribingu de shukudai o shite imashita. (While I was preparing dinner in the kitchen, the children were doing their homework in the living room.) 台所の流しの下に古い食器がしまってあるのを、今日やっと見つけました。 daidokoro no nagashi no shita ni furui shokki ga shimatte aru no o, kyō yatto mitsukemashita. (I finally found the old dishes stored under the kitchen sink today.)

Word/Phrase: どこか
Romaji: dokoka
Meaning: somewhere
Example: この人はどこかで見たことがあるが、どこだったか思い出せない。 Kono hito wa dokoka de mita koto ga aru ga, doko datta ka omoidase nai. (Though I feel like I’ve seen this person somewhere before, I can’t recall where it was.) 駅で待っている間、どこかで聞いたことのある音楽が流れてきた。 Eki de matte iru aida, dokoka de kiita koto no aru ongaku ga nagarete kita. (While waiting at the station, music that I’d heard somewhere before started playing.)

Word/Phrase: 道
Romaji: dou
Meaning: prefektur regional
Example: 北海道の広大な道をドライブすると、雄大な自然の景色に圧倒されます Hokkaidou no koudai na dou o doraibu suru to, yuudai na shizen no keshiki ni attousaremasu (When driving through the vast roads of Hokkaido, you will be overwhelmed by the majestic natural scenery) 大阪府と兵庫県を結ぶ道は、歴史的な観光地が点在し、多くの旅行者を魅了しています Ōsaka-fu to Hyōgo-ken o musubu dou wa, rekishiteki na kankōchi ga tenzai shi, ooku no ryokōsha o miryoku shite imasu (The road connecting Osaka Prefecture and Hyogo Prefecture is dotted with historical tourist spots, captivating many travelers)

Word/Phrase: 動物園
Romaji: doubutsuen
Meaning: zoo
Example: 動物園で象の大きな耳と長い鼻に驚きながら、子供たちと一緒に楽しい時間を過ごしました doubutsuen de zou no ookina mimi to nagai hana ni odoroki nagara, kodomotachi to issho ni tanoshii jikan o sugoshimashita (While marveling at the elephant’s huge ears and long trunk at the zoo, I spent a fun time with the children) 動物園の飼育員さんが、象の食事や習性について詳しく説明してくれました doubutsuen no shiikuin-san ga, zou no shokujii ya shuusei ni tsuite kuwashiku setsumei shite kuremashita (The zookeeper at the zoo gave us a detailed explanation about the elephant’s diet and habits)

Word/Phrase: 演劇
Romaji: engeki
Meaning: theater
Example: 演劇は古代ギリシアから続く、人間の感情や社会の問題を深く掘り下げる芸術形式です engeki wa kodai Girisha kara tsuzuku, ningen no kanjou ya shakai no mondai o fukaku horisageru geijutsu keishiki desu (Theater is an art form that has continued since ancient Greece, deeply exploring human emotions and social issues) 大学の演劇サークルでシェークスピアの作品を上演し、観客から熱い拍手を受けました daigaku no engeki saakuru de Sheekusupia no sakuhin o jouen shi, kankyaku kara atsui hakushu o ukemashita (In our university theater club, we performed a Shakespeare play and received warm applause from the audience)

Word/Phrase: 府
Romaji: fu
Meaning: prefektur (khusus osaka + kyoto)
Example: 京都府は古都として知られ、多くの寺院や神社があります Kyōto-fu wa kotoshi toshite shirare, ōku no tera ya jinja ga arimasu. (Kyoto Prefecture is known as an ancient capital and has many temples and shrines) 大阪府は商業の街として発展し、食文化でも有名です Ōsaka-fu wa shōgyō no machi toshite hattenshi, shoku bunka demo yūmei desu. (Osaka Prefecture has developed as a commercial city and is also famous for its food culture)

Word/Phrase: 府
Romaji: fu
Meaning: prefektur kota
Example: 大阪府は関西地方のほぼ中央に位置し、古くから商業がさかんな地域として発展してきました。 そのため、今でも国内外から多くの企業が集まり、活気ある街並みが広がっています。 Ōsaka-fu wa Kansai-chihō no hobo chūō ni ichi shi, inishie kara shōgyō ga sakan'na chiiki toshite hatten shite kimashita. Sono tame, ima demo kokunai-gai kara ōku no kigyō ga atsumari, katsugeki aru machinami ga hirogatte imasu. (Osaka Prefecture, located almost in the center of the Kansai region, has developed since ancient times as a thriving commercial area. For this reason, even now many companies from Japan and abroad gather there, creating a lively urban landscape.) 京都府や兵庫府と隣り合う大阪府は、交通網も整っているため、 観光客だけでなく、ビジネスでの訪問者も年々増加の一途をたどっています。 Kyōto-fu ya Hyōgo-fu to tonariau Ōsaka-fu wa, kōtsūmō mo totonoite iru tame, kankōkyaku dake de naku, bijinesu de no hōmonsha mo nen'nen zōka no itto o tadotte imasu. (Bordering Kyoto and Hyogo prefectures, Osaka Prefecture also has a well-developed transportation network, which has led to a steady yearly increase in not only tourists but also business visitors.)

Word/Phrase: 側
Romaji: gawa
Meaning: sebelah
Example: あなたの右側に大きな本屋があり、店内はとても明るいです anata no migigawa ni ookina hon'ya ga ari, tennai wa totemo akarui desu (ada toko buku besar di sebelah kananmu, dan bagian dalamnya sangat terang) この建物の左側に入口があり、案内板も設置されています kono tatemono no hidarigawa ni iriguchi ga ari, annaiban mo setchi sarete imasu (pintu masuk ada di sebelah kiri bangunan ini, dan papan petunjuk juga dipasang)

Word/Phrase: 玄関
Romaji: genkan
Meaning: entrance
Example: 玄関のドアを開けて、靴を脱いだ後、左側にあるスリッパに履き替えてください genkan no doa o akete, kutsu o nuide ato, hidarigawa ni aru surippa ni hakikaete kudasai (After opening the front door and taking off your shoes, please change into the slippers located on the left side) 玄関で荷物を整理してから、リビングルームへお進みください genkan de nimotsu o seiri shite kara, ribingu rūmu e o susumi kudasai (Please organize your belongings in the entrance before proceeding to the living room)

Word/Phrase: 銀行
Romaji: ginko
Meaning: bank
Example: 銀行でお金を下ろすときは、暗証番号を入力してからカードを挿入し、 ginkō de okane o orosu toki wa, anshō bangō o nyūryoku shite kara kādo o sōnyū shi, (When withdrawing money at the bank, you enter your PIN and then insert your card) 銀行の窓口で口座を開設する際には、身分証明書と印鑑が必要です。 ginkō no madoguchi de kōza o kaisetsu suru sai ni wa, mibun shōmeisho to inkan ga hitsuyō desu. (To open an account at the bank’s teller window, you need identification and a personal seal.)

Word/Phrase: 浜辺
Romaji: hamabe
Meaning: beach
Example: 浜辺で貝を拾う子供たちが、波打ち際を走り回りながら楽しそうに遊んでいます hamabe de kai o hirou kodomotachi ga, namiuchigiwa o hashirimawari nagara tanoshisō ni asonde imasu (Children happily play at the beach, running around the shoreline while picking up shells) 浜辺の夕焼けに照らされながら、家族で砂のお城を作って笑い合っています hamabe no yūyake ni terasare nagara, kazoku de suna no oshiro o tsukutte waraiatte imasu (A family laughs together while building a sandcastle under the sunset glow at the beach)

Word/Phrase: 半島
Romaji: hantou
Meaning: peninsula
Example: 半島の近くに小さな町があり、地元の漁師たちは毎日新鮮な魚を市場に運んでいます hantou no chikaku ni chiisana machi ga ari, jimoto no ryoushitachi wa mainichi shinsen'na sakana o ichiba ni hondo no desu (A small town near the peninsula has local fishermen who bring fresh fish to the market every day) 半島の先端には古い灯台が立ち、夜になるとその光が遠くまで届きます hantou no sentan ni wa furui toutou ga tachi, yoru ni naru to sono hikari ga tooku made todookimasu (At the tip of the peninsula stands an old lighthouse, whose light reaches far into the night)

Word/Phrase: 橋
Romaji: hashi
Meaning: bridge
Example: 川の近くに大きな橋があって、毎日たくさんの人が通っています kawa no chikaku ni ōkina hashi ga atte, mainichi takusan no hito ga kayōtte imasu (There is a large bridge near the river, and every day many people pass through it) この地域の経済発展に欠かせない重要な橋が、去年完成しました kono chiiki no keizai hattatsu ni kakasenai jūyō na hashi ga, kyonen kanseishimashita (An essential bridge for the economic development of this region was completed last year)

Word/Phrase: 林
Romaji: hayashi
Meaning: hutan kecil
Example: 林の近くに小さな川があり、子供たちがよく遊びに来ます Hayashi no chikaku ni chiisana kawa ga ari, kodomotachi ga yoku asobi ni kimasu (Near the small forest, there is a little river where children often come to play) 夏になると、林の木陰でピクニックをする家族連れが増えます Natsu ni naru to, hayashi no kokage de pikunikku o suru kazoku-zure ga fuemasu (When summer arrives, more families gather in the shade of the small forest for picnics)

Word/Phrase: 辺
Romaji: hen
Meaning: sekitar
Example: 駅の辺にある小さな喫茶店で、大学時代の友人と3年ぶりに再会し、昔の思い出話に花を咲かせた。 Eki no hen ni aru chiisana kissaten de, daigaku jidai no yūjin to 3-nen buri ni saikai shi, mukashi no omoide-banashi ni hana o sakaseta. (Saya bertemu kembali dengan teman kuliah setelah 3 tahun tidak berjumpa di kedai kopi kecil di sekitar stasiun, dan kami berbincang-bincang mengenang kenangan lama.)

Word/Phrase: 広場
Romaji: hiroba
Meaning: alun2
Example: 公園の広場で子供たちが元気に走り回り、笑顔で鬼ごっこをしています kōen no hiroba de kodomotachi ga genki ni hashirimawari, egao de onigokko o shite imasu (Anak-anak berlari-larian ceria di lapangan taman sambil bermain petak umpet dengan senyuman lebar) 祭りの夜、広場は提灯の明かりに照らされ、屋台で食べ物を楽しむ人々で賑わっています matsuri no yoru, hiroba wa chōchin no akari ni terasare, yatai de tabemono o tanoshimu hitobito de niwaotte imasu (Malam festival, lapangan diterangi cahaya lentera kertas, dipadati orang-orang menikmati makanan dari kios-kios pinggir jalan)

Word/Phrase: 歩道
Romaji: hodo
Meaning: sidewalk
Example: 歩道を歩いていると、突然自転車が猛スピードで横切り、 hodō o aruite iru to, totsuzen jitensha ga mōsupīdo de yokogiri, (Just as I was walking along the sidewalk, a bicycle suddenly cut across at high speed,) 歩道の端に咲く花々は、毎朝通勤途中の人々の心を和ませてくれる。 hodō no hashi ni saku hanabana wa, maiasa tsūkin tochū no hitobito no kokoro o yawaragase te kureru. (The flowers blooming along the edge of the sidewalk soothe the hearts of commuters every morning.)

Word/Phrase: 本社
Romaji: honsha
Meaning: kantor pusat
Example: 本社は東京の渋谷区に位置し、国内外の全事業を統括しています Honsha wa Tōkyō no Shibuya-ku ni ichi shi, kokunai gai no zen jigyō o tōkatsu shite imasu (Kantor pusat kami berlokasi di Shibuya, Tokyo, dan mengawasi seluruh operasi domestik maupun internasional) 本社ビルの最上階には、従業員が利用できるラウンジとフィットネスセンターが設置されています Honsha biru no saijōkai ni wa, jūgyōin ga riyō dekiru raunji to fittonesu sentā ga setchi sarete imasu (Di lantai teratas gedung kantor pusat terdapat lounge dan pusat kebugaran yang dapat digunakan oleh seluruh karyawan)

Word/Phrase: 本店
Romaji: honten
Meaning: toko utama
Example: 本店は東京駅の近くにあり、地下鉄の出口から徒歩3分です Honten wa Tōkyō-eki no chikaku ni ari, chikatetsu no deguchi kara toho san-pun desu (The main store is near Tokyo Station, just a 3-minute walk from the subway exit) 本店では毎週土曜日に限定セールを開催しており、地域のお客様に人気です Honten de wa maishū doyōbi ni gentei sēru o kaisai shite ori, chiiki no okyakusama ni ninki desu (Our main store holds an exclusive sale every Saturday, which is very popular with local customers)

Word/Phrase: 星
Romaji: hoshi
Meaning: star
Example: 夜空にきれいな星が瞬きながら、宇宙の神秘を語りかけているようです yorozora ni kirei na hoshi ga matataki nagara, uchū no shinpi o katarikakete iru yō desu (Beautiful stars twinkling in the night sky seem to whisper the mysteries of the universe) 古代の人々は星の位置を頼りに季節の変わり目を知り、農作業の時期を決めていました kodai no hitobito wa hoshi no ichi o tanomi ni kisetsu no kawarime o shiri, nōsagyō no jiki o kimete imashita (Ancient people relied on the positions of the stars to recognize seasonal changes and determine the timing of agricultural work)

Word/Phrase: 市場
Romaji: ichiba
Meaning: pasar
Example: 市場で新鮮な魚や野菜を買い、その日の夕食の準備をしました ichiba de shinsen na sakana ya yasai o kai, sono hi no yūshoku no junbi o shimashita (I bought fresh fish and vegetables at the market and prepared them for that evening’s dinner) この市場は地元の農家や漁師が直接商品を売っており、とても活気があります kono ichiba wa jimoto no nōka ya ryōshi ga chokusetsu shōhin o utte ori, totemo katsuki ga arimasu (This market is lively because local farmers and fishermen sell their products directly)

Word/Phrase: 家
Romaji: ie
Meaning: house (the building)
Example: 家に帰ると、いつもお母さんが温かいご飯と味噌汁を用意して待っていてくれます Ie ni kaeru to, itsumo okāsan ga atatakai gohan to misoshiru o junbi shite matte ite kuremasu (Whenever I return home, my mother always has warm rice and miso soup prepared and waiting for me) この古い家は、代々先祖から受け継がれてきた大切な財産です Kono furui ie wa, daidai senzo kara uketsugararete kita taisetsu na zaisan desu (This old house has been passed down through generations and is a precious family inheritance.)

Word/Phrase: 池
Romaji: ike
Meaning: pond
Example: 公園の奥にある静かな池では、 小さなカエルが石から石へ飛び移るたび、 水面に小さな波紋が広がっていく。 kōen no oku ni aru shizuka na ikede wa, chiisa na kaeru ga ishi kara ishi e tobiu tsuru tabi, suimen ni chiisa na hamon ga hirogatte iku. (In the quiet pond located deep in the park, every time a small frog leaps from stone to stone, tiny ripples spread across the water’s surface.) 近所の人々が散歩の途中で立ち止まり、 池の周りに植えられた桜の木陰で、 コイがゆっくりと泳ぐ姿を楽しそうに見つめている。 kinjo no hitobito ga sanpo no tochū de tachidomari, ike no mawari ni uerareta sakura no kokage de, koi ga yukkuri to oyogu sugata o tanoshisō ni mitsumete iru. (Local residents pause during their walks and, in the shade of cherry trees planted around the pond, watch the carp swimming leisurely with delight.)

Word/Phrase: 田舎
Romaji: inaka
Meaning: desa
Example: 田舎の祖母の家は広い庭があり、季節ごとに美しい花が咲き誇ります inaka no soba no ie wa hiroi niwa ga ari, kisetsugoto ni utsukushī hana ga sakihokorimasu (My grandmother's house in the countryside has a spacious garden where beautiful flowers bloom in every season) 田舎で育った私は、自然の中で過ごす時間が何よりも大切だと感じています inaka de sodatta watashi wa, shizen no naka de sugosu jikan ga nani yori mo taisetsu da to kanjite imasu (Having grown up in the countryside, I feel that time spent in nature is more precious than anything else)

Word/Phrase: 地元
Romaji: jimoto
Meaning: local
Example: 地元のスーパーは安くて品揃えも豊富で、毎日利用する主婦たちにとって欠かせない存在です jimoto no sūpā wa yasuku te shinasoroe mo hōfu de, mainichi riyō suru shufutachi ni totte kakasenai sonzai desu (The local supermarket is not only affordable but also well-stocked, making it an indispensable part of daily life for housewives)

Word/Phrase: 事務所
Romaji: jimusho
Meaning: office
Example: 事務所で働いている人たちは、毎日多くの書類を処理し、クライアントとの打ち合わせもこなしています jimusho de hataraite iru hitotachi wa, mainichi ooku no shorui o shori shi, kuraianto to no uchiawase mo konashite imasu (The people working in the office handle many documents daily and also manage meetings with clients) 事務所の受付には、常に笑顔で対応するスタッフがいて、訪問者に安心感を与えています jimusho no uketsuke ni wa, tsune ni egao de taio suru sutaffu ga ite, hōmon-sha ni anshin-kan o ataete imasu (At the office reception, there is always staff responding with a smile, giving visitors a sense of reassurance)

Word/Phrase: 神社
Romaji: jinja
Meaning: kuil shinto
Example: 神社でお参りをしてから、新しいお守りを買い、家族の無病息災を願いました jinja de o-mairi o shite kara, atarashii o-mamori o kai, kazoku no mubyō sokusai o negaimashita (Saya membeli omamori baru setelah berdoa di kuil Shinto dan mendoakan kesehatan keluarga)

Word/Phrase: 塾
Romaji: juku
Meaning: bimbel
Example: 小学生の頃から塾に通い、先生の丁寧な指導を受けながら、 苦手な算数を克服した子どもたちが、今では自信を持って試験に挑んでいる。 shougakusei no koro kara juku ni kayoi, sensei no teinei na shidou o ukena gara, nigate na sansuu o kokufuku shita kodomotachi ga, ima dewa jishin o motte shiken ni idondeiru. (Children who have attended cram school since elementary school and, through their teachers' careful guidance, overcame their struggles with arithmetic now confidently tackle exams.) 最近は、大学受験だけでなく、プログラミングや資格取得を目指す社会人も、 夜間の塾で専門講師から直接アドバイスをもらっている。 saikin wa, daigaku juken dake de naku, puroguramingu ya shikaku shutoku o mezasu shakaijin mo, yakan no juku de senmon koushi kara chokusetsu adobaisu o moratteiru. (These days, not only high school students preparing for university exams, but also working adults aiming to learn programming or earn certifications receive direct advice from specialist tutors at evening cram schools.)

Word/Phrase: 住宅
Romaji: juutaku
Meaning: housing
Example: 住宅の近くに大きな公園と図書館があり、子供たちが遊んだり勉強したりするのに最適な環境です juutaku no chikaku ni ōkina kōen to toshokan ga ari, kodomotachi ga asondari benkyō shitari suru no ni saitekina kankyō desu (There is a large park and library near the housing, making it an ideal environment for children to play and study)

Word/Phrase: 角
Romaji: kado
Meaning: sudut (jalan)
Example: 角の近くに大きな木が立っていて、その枝が道路に張り出している kado no chikaku ni ōkina ki ga tatte ite, sono edi ga dōro ni haridashite iru (A large tree stands near the corner, its branches stretching over the road) 角を曲がった先に、古い石造りの教会が静かに建っている kado o magatta saki ni, furui ishizukuri no kyōkai ga shizuka ni tatte iru (Just around the corner, an old stone church stands quietly)

Word/Phrase: 海外
Romaji: kaigai
Meaning: overseas
