Example: 海外で働く人は、日本の文化と違って、休みの日も仕事をすることが多いです kaigai de hataraku hito wa, nihon no bunka to chigatte, yasumi no hi mo shigoto o suru koto ga ōi desu (People who work overseas often have to work even on holidays, unlike the culture in Japan where weekends are usually respected) 海外旅行に行く前に、パスポートやビザの準備だけでなく、現地の習慣や法律についても調べておくことが大切です kaigai ryokō ni iku mae ni, pasupōto ya biza no junbi dake de naku, genchi no shūkan ya hōritsu ni tsuite mo shirabete oku koto ga taisetsu desu (Before traveling abroad, it is important to prepare not only your passport and visa but also to research local customs and laws)

Word/Phrase: 海岸
Romaji: kaigan
Meaning: pesisir
Example: 海岸に立つと、遠くまで続く白い砂浜と、打ち寄せる波の音が心を落ち着かせてくれます kaigan ni tatsu to, tōku made tsuzuku shiroi sunahama to, uchiyoseru nami no oto ga kokoro o ochitsukasete kuremasu (Standing on the coast, the white sandy beach stretching into the distance and the sound of the crashing waves soothe the mind) 海岸沿いの道は、夏になると多くの家族連れで賑わい、夕焼けを眺めながら散歩する人々の姿が見られます kaigan-zoi no michi wa, natsu ni naru to ōku no kazoku-zure de nigawai, yūyake o nagame nagara sanpo suru hitobito no sugata ga miraremasu (The road along the coast bustles with families in summer, where people can be seen strolling while admiring the sunset)

Word/Phrase: 会場
Romaji: kaijou
Meaning: venue, stadium
Example: 会場は駅から歩いて10分ほどの場所にあるため、電車で来られる方にも便利です kaijō wa eki kara aruite jūppun hodo no basho ni aru tame, densha de korareru kata ni mo benri desu (The venue is a 10-minute walk from the station, which makes it convenient for those arriving by train) イベント当日は会場の入口でスタッフが案内するので、迷わずに入場できます ibento toujitsu wa kaijō no iriguchi de sutaffu ga annai suru node, mayo wazu ni nyūjō dekimasu (On the day of the event, staff will guide you at the venue entrance, so you can enter without getting lost)

Word/Phrase: 改札
Romaji: kaisatsu
Meaning: ticket gate
Example: 改札を通る前に、切符を買わなければなりませんでした kaisatsu o tōru mae ni, kippu o kawanakereba narimasen deshita (Before passing through the ticket gate, I had to buy a train ticket at the station) 改札で切符を確認された後、電車に乗りました kaisatsu de kippu o kakunin sareta nochi, densha ni norimashita (After my ticket was checked at the ticket gate, I boarded the train heading to my destination)

Word/Phrase: 会社
Romaji: kaisha
Meaning: company
Example: 会社は毎日忙しいですけど、仕事が終わると友達と飲みに行きます kaisha wa mainichi isogashii desu kedo, shigoto ga owattara tomodachi to nomi ni ikimasu (The company is busy every day, but once work is over, I go out drinking with friends) 会社の近くにおいしいラーメン屋さんがあり、昼休みにはよく行きます kaisha no chikaku ni oishii rāmen-ya-san ga ari, hiruyasumi ni wa yoku ikimasu (There is a delicious ramen shop near the company, and I often go there during lunch breaks)

Word/Phrase: 環境
Romaji: kankyou
Meaning: environment
Example: 自然を大切にするため、多くの市民が環境保護活動に参加し、公園の清掃や植林を行っています。 Shizen o taisetsu ni suru tame, ōku no shimin ga kankyō hogo katsudō ni sanka shi, kōen no seisō ya shokurin o okonatte imasu. (To cherish nature, many citizens join environmental protection activities, conducting park cleanups and tree planting.) 近年、企業も環境への配慮を強め、廃棄物の削減やエコ製品の開発に力を入れています。 Kin’nen, kigyō mo kankyō e no hairyo o tsuyome, haikibutsu no sakugen ya eko seihin no kaihatsu ni chikara o irete imasu. (In recent years, companies have also intensified their environmental considerations, focusing on waste reduction and eco-product development.)

Word/Phrase: 家庭
Romaji: katei
Meaning: home
Example: 家庭では、家族みんなで一緒にご飯を食べることが大切です。 Katei de wa, kazoku minna de issho ni gohan o taberu koto ga taisetsu desu. (At home, it is important for the whole family to gather and eat meals together.) 週末は、家庭で子供たちと一緒に料理を作ったり、ボードゲームをしたり、庭の手入れをするのが私たちの楽しみです。 Shūmatsu wa, katei de kodomotachi to issho ni ryōri o tsukuttari, bōdo gēmu o shitari, niwa no teire o suru no ga watashitachi no tanoshimi desu. (On weekends, our joy at home is cooking with the kids, playing board games, or taking care of the garden.)

Word/Phrase: 火山
Romaji: kazan
Meaning: volcano
Example: 日本には活発な火山が多く、その周辺で暮らす住民は、噴火による災害に備えて、避難経路の確認や非常用品の点検を定期的に行っている。 nihon ni wa kappatsu na kazan ga ōku, sono shūhen de kurasu jūmin wa, funka ni yoru saigai ni sonaete, hinan keiro no kakunin ya hijōyōhin no tenken o teikiteki ni okonatte iru. (In Japan, where there are many active volcanoes, residents living nearby regularly check evacuation routes and emergency supplies to prepare for eruption-related disasters.) 火山の噴火が起きると、火山灰が遠くまで飛び、空港の閉鎖や農業の被害など、経済活動に深刻な影響を及ぼすことがある。 kazan no funka ga okoru to, kazanbai ga tōku made tobi, kūkō no heisa ya nōgyō no higai nado, keizai katsudō ni shinkoku na eikyō o oyobosu koto ga aru.

Word/Phrase: 県
Romaji: ken
Meaning: prefektur biasa
Example: 京都府と大阪府は近いですが、京都府は歴史が深く、大阪府は経済が活発です Kyōto-fu to Ōsaka-fu wa chikai desu ga, Kyōto-fu wa rekishi ga fukaku, Ōsaka-fu wa keizai ga kappatsu desu (Kyoto Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture are geographically close, but Kyoto Prefecture is rich in historical heritage, while Osaka Prefecture thrives as a bustling economic hub) 京都府には有名な神社や寺が数多くあり、国内外から年間を通じて多くの観光客が訪れます Kyōto-fu ni wa yūmei na jinja ya tera ga kazuōku ari, kokunai-gai kara nenjū o tsūjite ōku no kankōkyaku ga otozuremasu (Kyoto Prefecture is home to many famous shrines and temples, attracting a large number of tourists from both Japan and abroad throughout the year)

Word/Phrase: 県庁
Romaji: kenchou
Meaning: kantor prefektur
Example: 県庁の近くに大きな公園があり、市民の憩いの場となっています。 Kenchō no chikaku ni ōkina kōen ga ari, shimin no ikoi no ba to natte imasu. (The prefectural office has a large park nearby, which serves as a place of relaxation for the citizens.) その公園は週末になると、家族連れやペットと散歩する人たちで賑わい、時には屋台も出店します。 Sono kōen wa shūmatsu ni naru to, kazokuzure ya petto to sanpo suru hitotachi de nigiwai, tokini wa yatai mo shutten shimasu. (On weekends, the park is bustling with families and people walking their pets, and sometimes food stalls are set up.)

Word/Phrase: 禁煙
Romaji: kin’en
Meaning: non smoking area
Example: 禁煙の看板が駅の至るところに掲示されていたので、喫煙者たちは不満そうに建物の外へ向かっていった Kin’en no kanban ga eki no itaru tokoro ni keiji sarete ita node, kitsuen-sha-tachi wa fumansō ni tatemono no soto e mukatte itta (Since "no smoking" signs were posted everywhere in the station, smokers reluctantly headed outside the building) この病院は患者とスタッフの健康を考慮し、敷地内を完全に禁煙としていますので、喫煙は指定された屋外喫煙所でお願いします Kono byōin wa kanja to sutaffu no kenkō o kōryo shi, shikichi-nai o kanzen ni kin’en to shite imasu node, kitsuen wa shitei sareta okugai kitsuen-jo de onegai shimasu (For the health of patients and staff, this hospital is entirely a non-smoking area, so please smoke only in the designated outdoor smoking sections)

Word/Phrase: 近所
Romaji: kinjo
Meaning: neighborhood
Example: 近所の公園で子供たちが遊んでいるのを見ると、季節を感じて心が安らぎます Kinjo no kōen de kodomotachi ga asonde iru no o miru to, kisetsu o kanjite kokoro ga yasuragimasu (When I see children playing in the neighborhood park, I feel the changing seasons and my heart finds peace) 近所の人たちと一緒に地域の祭りの準備をすることで、絆が深まっていきます Kinjo no hitotachi to issho ni chiiki no matsuri no junbi o suru koto de, kizuna ga fukamatte ikimasu (By preparing for the local festival together with the people in my neighborhood, our bonds continue to grow stronger)

Word/Phrase: 喫茶店
Romaji: kissaten
Meaning: kafe
Example: 喫茶店でコーヒーを飲みながら、窓の外を眺めつつ、ノートパソコンで原稿の執筆を続けていた。時折、カウンターの奥からマスターの笑い声が聞こえてくる。 Kissaten de kōhī o nomi nagara, mado no soto o nagametsutsu, nōtopasokon de genkō no shippitsu o tsuzukete ita. Tokidoki, kauntā no oku kara masutā no waraigoe ga kikoete kuru. (While drinking coffee at the kissaten and gazing out the window, I continued writing my manuscript on my laptop. Occasionally, I could hear the master’s laughter from behind the counter.) 喫茶店の古びた木製のテーブルに座り、ホットサンドと紅茶のセットを注文した。店内にはジャズのレコードがかすかに流れ、時間がゆったりと過ぎていくような錯覚を覚えた。 Kissaten no furubita mokusei no tēburu ni suwari, hotto sando to kōcha no setto o chūmon shita. Tennai ni wa jazzu no rekōdo ga kasuka ni nagare, jikan ga yuttari to sugite iku yō na sakkaku o oboeta. (Sitting at the kissaten’s aged wooden table, I ordered a hot sandwich and tea set. A faint jazz record played inside, giving the illusion of time passing leisurely.)

Word/Phrase: 喫煙
Romaji: kitsuen
Meaning: smoking area
Example: 喫煙は健康に悪いと知っているのに、ストレスがたまるとついタバコを吸ってしまいます kitsuen wa kenkō ni warui to shitte iru no ni, sutoresu ga tamaru to tsui tabako o sutte shimaimasu (Even though I know smoking is bad for my health, I end up lighting a cigarette without thinking whenever stress builds up) 喫煙所は駅のホームの端にあり、喫煙者が列を作って待っている kitsuenjo wa eki no hōmu no hashi ni ari, kitsuensha ga retsu o tsukutte matte iru (The smoking area is located at the end of the station platform, where smokers line up and wait their turn)

Word/Phrase: 国内
Romaji: kokunai
Meaning: domestik
Example: 国内で制作されるアニメは、世界中でファンを増やしているものの、登場人物の細かい表情や背景に込められた文化的な意味合いを十分に味わうには、やはり日本に住みながら観るのが一番です。 kokunai de seisaku sareru anime wa, sekaijū de fan o fuya shite iru mono no, tōjō jinbutsu no komakai hyōjō ya haikei ni komerareta bunka-teki na imi ai o jūbun ni ajiwau ni wa, yahari Nihon ni sumi nagara miru no ga ichiban desu. (While anime produced domestically are gaining fans worldwide, the subtle expressions of characters and culturally embedded meanings in the backgrounds are best fully appreciated by watching them while living in Japan.) 国内には、都会の活気あふれる街並みから、自然豊かな田舎の風景まで、多様な魅力が詰まっており、訪れる外国人たちがそれぞれの季節に合わせた旅の計画を立てるほどです。 kokunai ni wa, tokai no katsuki afureru machinami kara, shizen yutaka na inaka no fūkei made, tayō na miryoku ga tsumatte ori, otozureru gaikokujin-tachi ga sorezore no kisetsu ni awaseta tabi no keikaku o tateru hodo desu. (Japan is packed with diverse attractions—from bustling urban streets to nature-rich rural landscapes—so much so that visiting foreigners plan their trips around each distinct season.)

Word/Phrase: 校/学校
Romaji: kou/gakkou
Meaning: school
Example: 学校の近くに大きな図書館があり、生徒たちは放課後によく勉強に訪れます gakkō no chikaku ni ōkina toshokan ga ari, seito-tachi wa hōkago ni yoku benkyō ni otozuremasu (There is a large library near the school, and students often visit to study after classes) 学校の先生は優しく、質問に丁寧に答えてくれるので、生徒たちから信頼されています gakkō no sensei wa yasashiku, shitsumon ni teinei ni kotaete kureru node, seito-tachi kara shinrai sarete imasu (The school teacher is kind and answers questions politely, so they are trusted by the students)

Word/Phrase: 公園
Romaji: kouen
Meaning: taman
Example: 公園で子供たちが楽しそうに遊んでいます、そして木の下でお母さんが本を読んでいます kouen de kodomotachi ga tanoshisō ni asonde imasu, soshite ki no shita de okāsan ga hon o yonde imasu (At the park, children are playing joyfully, and under the tree, a mother is quietly reading a book.)

Word/Phrase: 郊外
Romaji: kougai
Meaning: suburb
Example: 郊外にある大きな公園は、週末になると家族連れで賑わい、ピクニックや散策を楽しむ人々であふれます。 Kōgai ni aru ōkina kōen wa, shūmatsu ni naru to kazoku-zure de niwai, pikunikku ya sansaku o tanoshimu hitobito de afuremasu. (The large park in the suburbs bustles with families on weekends, filled with people enjoying picnics and strolls.) 都会の喧騒を離れ、郊外の静かなカフェで本を読みながらゆったりとした時間を過ごすのが私の趣味です。 Tokai no kensō o hanare, kōgai no shizukana kafe de hon o yominagara yuttari to shita jikan o sugosu no ga watashi no shumi desu. (One of my hobbies is leaving the city’s noise behind and spending relaxed time reading books at a quiet café in the suburbs.)

Word/Phrase: 交差点
Romaji: kousaten
Meaning: perempatan
Example: 交差点で赤信号を無視すると、思わぬ事故を引き起こす可能性があり、周りの人々に危険を及ぼすことになる。 kōsaten de aka shingō o mushi suru to, omowanu jiko o hikiosu kanōsei ga ari, mawari no hitobito ni kiken o oyobosu koto ni naru. (If you ignore a red light at an intersection, you may cause an unexpected accident and endanger those around you.) この交差点は、通勤時間帯に車が行き交うため、横断歩道を渡る際には左右の確認を怠らないようにしなければならない。 kono kōsaten wa, tsūkin jikan-tai ni kuruma ga yukikau tame, ōdan hodō o wataru sai ni wa sayū no kakunin o okotaranai yō ni shinakereba narani. (Since cars frequently pass through this intersection during commuting hours, you must always check both ways before crossing the pedestrian crossing.)

Word/Phrase: 教会
Romaji: kyoukai
Meaning: church
Example: この町で一番古い教会の隣にある小さなカフェは、ステンドグラスから差し込む光と静けさが、読書好きな人々に愛されている。 kono machi de ichiban furui kyōkai no tonari ni aru chiisana kafe wa, sutendo-gurasu kara sashikomu hikari to shizukesa ga, dokushozuki na hitobito ni aisarete iru. (The small café next to the oldest church in town, where light filters through stained glass into the quiet space, is beloved by book lovers.) 結婚式を明日控えた教会では、花嫁が神父と最後の打ち合わせをしながら、祭壇の飾りつけやゲストの席順について真剣に話し合っていた。 kekkon-shiki o ashita hikaeta kyōkai de wa, hanayome ga shinpu to saigo no uchiawase o shinagara, saidan no kazari-tsuke ya gesuto no sekijun ni tsuite shinken ni hanashiatte ita. (At the church where the wedding would be held the next day, the bride was seriously discussing the altar decorations and guest seating with the priest during their final meeting.)

Word/Phrase: 教室
Romaji: kyoushitsu
Meaning: classroom
Example: 教室の掃除は、みんなで協力して、机や椅子を動かしたり、ホコリを取ったりして、きれいにしましょう。 Kyōshitsu no sōji wa, minna de kyouryoku shite, tsukue ya isu o ugokashitari, hokori o toritari shite, kirei ni shimashō. ("Let's all work together to clean the classroom by moving desks and chairs and dusting to make it spotless.") 先生が言いました「教室をきれいにすることが、勉強するためにも大切です。窓を開けて空気の入れ替えをするのも忘れないでください」 Sensei ga iimashita, "Kyōshitsu o kirei ni suru koto ga, benkyō suru tame ni mo taisetsu desu. Mado o akete kūki no irekae o suru no mo wasurenai de kudasai." ("The teacher said, 'Keeping the classroom clean is also important for studying. Don’t forget to open the windows to ventilate the air as well'.")

Word/Phrase: 町
Romaji: machi
Meaning: town
Example: 町の図書館は静かで、多くの学生が日々勉強に励んでいます machino toshokan wa shizuka de, ōku no gakusei ga hibi benkyō ni hagende imasu (The town library is quiet, and many students work hard studying there every day) 町の商店街は、夕方になると地元の人々で賑わい、様々な屋台が並びます machino shōtengai wa, yūgata ni naru to jimoto no hitobito de nigawai, samazama na yatai ga narabimasu (The shopping district in the town becomes lively with locals in the evening, and various food stalls line up.)

Word/Phrase: 真ん中
Romaji: mannaka
Meaning: tengah2
Example: 部屋の真ん中に大きなテーブルがあります そのテーブルの上には季節の花が美しく飾ってあります heya no mannaka ni ōkina tēburu ga arimasu sono tēburu no ue ni wa kisetsu no hana ga utsukushiku kazatte arimasu (In the center of the room, there is a large table, and on top of that table, seasonal flowers are beautifully arranged) 図書館の真ん中に歴史ある巨大な時計が設置されており 来館者はその存在に圧倒されることでしょう toshokan no mannaka ni rekishi aru kyodai na tokei ga setchi sarete ori raikan-sha wa sono sonzai ni attō sareru koto deshō (In the middle of the library stands a massive, historic clock, and visitors are sure to be overwhelmed by its presence)

Word/Phrase: 道
Romaji: michi
Meaning: road
Example: 人生の道を進むうちに、思いがけぬ出会いが、その先の景色を一変させることがある。 jinsei no michi o susumu uchi ni, omoigakenu deai ga, sono saki no keshiki o ippen saseru koto ga aru. (As you advance along life’s path, unexpected encounters can sometimes completely transform the landscape ahead.) 登山家たちが口をそろえて語るのは、この道がもたらす不思議な充足感—終点よりも、その過程にこそ価値があると。 tozankatachi ga kuchi o soroete kataru no wa, kono michi ga motarasu fushigi na jūsokukan—shūten yori mo, sono katei ni koso kachi ga aru to. (What climbers unanimously speak of is the strange fulfillment this path brings—that its true value lies not in the destination, but in the journey itself.)

Word/Phrase: 港
Romaji: minato
Meaning: pelabuhan
Example: 港に面したこの町では、朝早くから漁船が戻ってくるたび、活気ある声が響き渡り、その光景は訪れる人々を魅了してやみません。 Minato ni mukashita kono machi de wa, asa hayaku kara gyosen ga modotte kuru tabi, katsugeki aru koe ga hibikiwataru, sono kōkei wa otozureru hitobito o miryoku shite yamimasen. (In this town facing the port, lively voices echo each time fishing boats return early in the morning, captivating visitors with its vibrant scene.) 港からほど近い市場では、地元の漁師が水揚げしたばかりの魚介類が並び、その鮮度の高さから遠方からも買い付けに訪れる人が絶えない。 Minato kara hodochikai ichiba de wa, jimoto no ryōshi ga mizuage shitabakari no gyokairui ga narabi, sono sendo no takasa kara tōhō kara mo kaitsuke ni otozureru hito ga taenai. (At the market near the port, freshly unloaded seafood by local fishermen lines the stalls, drawing buyers from afar due to its exceptional freshness.)

Word/Phrase: 店
Romaji: mise
Meaning: toko
Example: 店の前で友達と会って、一緒にランチを食べに行きました mise no mae de tomodachi to atte, issho ni ranchi o tabeni ikimashita (I met my friend in front of the shop, and we went to have lunch together) 店のメニューを見ても、どの料理を選べばいいのか全然決められませんでした mise no menyū o mite mo, dono ryōri o erabeba ii no ka zenzen kimeraremasen deshita (Even after looking at the restaurant’s menu, I couldn’t decide at all which dish to choose)

Word/Phrase: 湖
Romaji: mizuumi
Meaning: lake
Example: 湖の近くにある公園は、春になると桜が咲いてとてもきれいです mizuumi no chikaku ni aru kōen wa, haru ni naru to sakura ga saite totemo kirei desu (The park located near the lake becomes incredibly beautiful in spring when the cherry blossoms bloom in full glory) この地域の湖は透明度が高く、夏には多くの観光客が水泳やボートを楽しみに訪れます kono chiiki no mizuumi wa tōmeido ga takaku, natsu ni wa ōku no kankōkyaku ga suiei ya bōto o tanoshimi ni otozuremasu (The lakes in this area have high clarity, attracting many tourists in summer who come to enjoy swimming and boating)

Word/Phrase: 森
Romaji: mori
Meaning: hutan lebat
Example: 森の近くに住んでいるので、朝は鳥のさえずりで目が覚め、新鮮な空気を吸いながら一日を始めます Mori no chikaku ni sunde iru node, asa wa tori no saezuri de me ga samete, shinsen'na kūki o suī nagara ichinichi o hajimemasu (Karena tinggal dekat hutan, saya terbangun oleh kicauan burung di pagi hari dan memulai hari dengan menghirup udara segar) 森の中を散歩すると、木々の香りに包まれて、心が落ち着き、日々の疲れが癒されます Mori no naka o sanpo suru to, kogi no kaori ni tsutsumarete, kokoro ga ochitsuki, hibino tsukare ga iyasareru masu (Ketika berjalan-jalan di dalam hutan, terbungkus aroma pohon-pohonan, hati menjadi tenang dan kelelahan sehari-hari pun terobati)

Word/Phrase: 村役場
Romaji: murayakuba
Meaning: balai desa
Example: 村役場で住民票を取りに行きましたが、窓口の職員が丁寧に手続きを説明してくれて助かりました murayakuba de jūminhyō o torini ikimashita ga, madoguchi no shokuin ga teinei ni tetsuzuki o setsumei shite kurete tasukarimashita (I went to the village office to get my residence certificate, and the staff at the counter kindly explained the procedures, which was very helpful) 村役場の近くにある公民館では、毎週末に地域の住民向けに無料の法律相談会が開かれています murayakuba no chikaku ni aru kōminkan de wa, maishūmatsu ni chiiki no jūmin-muke ni muryō no hōritsu sōdan-kai ga hirakarete imasu (Near the village office, the community center holds free legal consultations for local residents every weekend)

Word/Phrase: 庭
Romaji: niwa
Meaning: halaman
Example: 庭で花を育てるのが好きです。そして、毎朝、庭の手入れをしながら、家族と一緒に朝ごはんを食べます。 niwa de hana o sodateru no ga suki desu. soshite, maiasa, niwa no teire o shinagara, kazoku to issho ni asagohan o tabemasu. (I like growing flowers in the garden, and every morning, I do some gardening while eating breakfast with my family.) 庭にある木はとても大きくて、祖父が植えたものだそうです。子供の頃から見ているので、季節ごとの変化と共に、たくさんの思い出が詰まっています。 niwa ni aru ki wa totemo ōkikute, sofu ga ueta mono da sō desu. kodomo no koro kara mite iru node, kisetsugoto no henka to tomo ni, takusan no omoide ga tsumatte imasu. (The tree in the garden is very big, and I’ve been told my grandfather planted it. Since I’ve been seeing it since childhood, it holds many memories along with the changes of each season.)

Word/Phrase: 乗り場
Romaji: noriba
Meaning: boarding point
Example: 空港から市内へ行くバスの乗り場は、到着ロビーを出てすぐ右側にあります。 Kūkō kara shinai e iku basu no noriba wa, tchaku robī o dete sugu migigawa ni arimasu. (The boarding point for the bus heading into the city from the airport is located immediately to the right after exiting the arrival lobby.) 観光客が多いこの時期、駅前のバス乗り場は混雑するので、時間に余裕を持って来てください。 Kankōkyaku ga ōi kono jiki, ekimae no basu noriba wa konzatsu suru node, jikan ni yoyū o motte kite kudasai. (During this busy tourist season, the bus boarding point in front of the station gets crowded, so please arrive with extra time.)

Word/Phrase: 農村
Romaji: nouson
Meaning: rural, farm village
Example: 農村では、伝統的な祭りや行事が今も受け継がれ、地域の人々が一丸となって準備に取り組みます。 Nōson de wa, dentōteki na matsuri ya gyōji ga ima mo uketsugare, chiiki no hitobito ga ichigan to natte junbi ni torikummimasu. (In rural villages, traditional festivals and events are still passed down, and the local people work together as one to prepare for them.) 農村の風景は季節ごとに変わり、春の新緑、夏の青田、秋の紅葉、冬の雪景色と、訪れる人々を魅了します。 Nōson no fūkei wa kisetsugoto ni kawari, haru no shinryoku, natsu no aota, aki no kōyō, fuyu no yukigeshi to, otozureru hitobito o miryoku shimasu. (The rural landscape changes with each season—fresh greenery in spring, green rice fields in summer, autumn foliage, and snowy winter scenery—captivating visitors throughout the year.)

Word/Phrase: 入国管理局
Romaji: nyuukoku kanri kyoku
Meaning: kantor imigrasi
Example: 入国管理局での手続き中、パスポートに記載されたビザ有効期限が既に過ぎていると指摘され、直ちに更新のための必要書類を提示するよう求められた。 nyuukoku kanri kyoku de no tetsuzuki-chū, pasupōto ni kisai sareta biza yūkō kigen ga sude ni sugiteiru to siteisare, tadachi ni kōshin no tame no hitsuyō shorui o teiji suru yō motomera reta. (During the immigration office procedure, it was pointed out that the visa validity period listed in my passport had already passed, and I was immediately asked to present the required documents for renewal.) 入国管理局を訪れた際、ビザ申請用の書類セットを受領した後、窓口の職員が申請から許可までの流れを図解入りのパンフレットを用いて分かりやすく解説してくれた。 nyuukoku kanri kyoku o otozureta sai, biza shinsei-yō no shorui setto o juryō shita ato, madoguchi no shokuin ga shinsei kara kyoka made no nagare o zukai-iri no panfuretto o mochiite wakariyasuku kaisetsu shite kureta. (When I visited the immigration office, after receiving the visa application document set, the counter staff clearly explained the process from application to approval using an illustrated pamphlet.)

Word/Phrase: 屋上
Romaji: okujou
Meaning: rooftop
Example: 屋上で小さな菜園を作り、家族みんなでトマトやバジルを育てるのはとても楽しいです Okujō de chiisana saien o tsukuri, kazoku minna de tomato ya bajiru o sodateru no wa totemo tanoshii desu (Growing tomatoes and basil in a small rooftop garden with the whole family is a lot of fun) 屋上から見える夜景は息をのむほど美しく、特にクリスマスシーズンのイルミネーションは幻想的です Okujō kara mieru yakei wa iki o nomu hodo utsukushiku, tokuni Kurisumasu shīzun no iruminēshon wa gensōteki desu (The night view from the rooftop is breathtakingly beautiful, especially the fantastical Christmas season illuminations)

Word/Phrase: 温泉
Romaji: onsen
Meaning: pemandian air panas (alami)
Example: 温泉に行った時、私はゆっくりとお湯につかりながら、周りの自然の音を楽しみました onsen ni itta toki, watashi wa yukkuri to oyu ni tsukarinagara, mawari no shizen no oto o tanoshimimashita (When I visited the hot springs, I relaxed in the warm bath while enjoying the soothing sounds of nature around me)

Word/Phrase: お城
Romaji: oshiro
Meaning: castle
Example: 京都のお城は、江戸時代から残る貴重な建造物で、今も多くの人がその美しさに魅了されています。広い庭園と共に、四季を通して訪れる人々の心を豊かにしています。 Kyōto no oshiro wa, Edo jidai kara nokoru kichō na kenzōbutsu de, ima mo ōku no hito ga sono utsukushisa ni miryō sarete imasu. Hiroi teien to tomo ni, shiki o tōshite otozureru hitobito no kokoro o yutaka ni shite imasu. (The castle in Kyoto, a precious structure remaining since the Edo period, continues to captivate many with its beauty, enriching the hearts of visitors throughout the seasons with its expansive gardens.) お城の近くで育った友人は、小さい頃から地元の人々が語り継ぐ戦いの話や、石垣の役割について詳しく知っています。夏休みには、その友人と一緒に堀の跡を歩きながら、歴史の息吹を感じたいと思っています。 Oshiro no chikaku de sodatta yūjin wa, chiisai koro kara jimoto no hitobito ga katari tsugu tatakai no hanashi ya, ishigaki no yakuwari ni tsuite kuwashiku shitte imasu. Natsuyasumi ni wa, sono yūjin to issho ni hori no ato o arukinagara, rekishi no ibuki o kanjitai to omotte imasu. (My friend who grew up near the castle has known in detail since childhood the stories of battles passed down by locals and the role of the stone walls, and during summer vacation, I want to walk along the remains of the moat with them to feel the breath of history.)

Word/Phrase: お寺
Romaji: otera
Meaning: wihara
Example: お寺でお祈りをしてから、近くの公園で桜の木の下で友達と一緒にお弁当を食べました Otera de oinori o shite kara, chikaku no kōen de sakura no ki no shita de tomodachi to issho ni obentō o tabemashita (Setelah berdoa di wihara, saya makan bento bersama teman di bawah pohon sakura di taman terdekat) お寺の庭には古い石灯籠があり、夕方になると幻想的な雰囲気に包まれます Otera no niwa ni wa furui ishidōrō ga ari, yūgata ni naru to gensōteki na fun'iki ni tsutsumarimasu (Halaman wihara terdapat lentera batu kuno yang menciptakan suasana magis saat senja tiba)

Word/Phrase: 陸
Romaji: riku
Meaning: daratan
Example: 海から遠く離れた陸で、エラの代わりに肺呼吸をするようになった生き物たちが、今も繁栄しています。 umi kara tōku hanareta riku de, era no kawari ni haikokyū o suru yō ni natta ikimono-tachi ga, ima mo han'ei shite imasu. (On land far from the sea, creatures that evolved to breathe with lungs instead of gills continue to thrive even now.) 陸に打ち上げられた貝殻は、長い年月をかけて風や砂に磨かれ、やがて美しい化石となります。 riku ni uchia ge rareta kaigara wa, nagai nengetsu o kake kaze ya suna ni migakare, yagate utsukushī kaseki to narimasu. (Shells washed ashore onto the land are polished by wind and sand over time, eventually becoming beautiful fossils.)

Word/Phrase: 廊下
Romaji: rouka
Meaning: koridor
Example: 学校の廊下は、授業の合間に生徒たちが行き交う場所ですが、走ると滑って転ぶこともあるため、注意が必要です。 gakkō no rōka wa, jugyō no aima ni seito-tachi ga yukikau basho desu ga, hashiru to suberi korobu koto mo aru tame, chūi ga hitsuyō desu. (School hallways are places where students pass each other between classes, but running can cause slipping and falling, so caution is required.) 図書館の廊下では、本を探しに来た人もいれば、静かに読書を楽しむ人もいるので、足音を立てないよう気をつけましょう。 toshokan no rōka de wa, hon o sagashi ni kita hito mo ireba, shizuka ni dokusho o tanoshimu hito mo iru node, ashioto o tatenai yō ki o tsukemashō. (In library hallways, some people come to find books while others quietly enjoy reading, so be careful not to make noise with your footsteps.)

Word/Phrase: 旅館
Romaji: ryokan
Meaning: inn
Example: 旅館に泊まった時、お風呂がとても広くて、温泉が気持ちよかったです ryokan ni tomatta toki, ofuro ga totemo hirokute, onsen ga kimochi yokatta desu (When I stayed at the traditional Japanese inn, the bath was very spacious, and the hot spring felt wonderful) 旅館の部屋は和室で、畳の上で寝るととても快適でした。朝食は和定食で、地元の新鮮な食材を使った料理が並び、心温まるもてなしを受けました ryokan no heya wa washitsu de, tatami no ue de neru to totemo kaiteki deshita. chōshoku wa wateishoku de, jimoto no shinsen na shokuzai o tsukatta ryōri ga narabi, kokoro atatamaru motenashi o uke mashita (The room at the inn was a traditional Japanese-style room, and sleeping on the tatami was very comfortable. Breakfast was a Japanese set meal featuring fresh local ingredients, and I experienced heartwarming hospitality)

Word/Phrase: 寮
Romaji: ryou
Meaning: dorm
Example: 大学の寮で過ごした二年間は、共同キッチンで世界各国の留学生と料理を競い合い、深夜の談笑が朝まで続くことも珍しくなかった。 daigaku no ryō de sugoshita ninenkan wa, kyōdō kicchin de sekai kakoku no ryūgakusei to ryōri o kisoiai, shinya no danjō ga asa made tsuzuku koto mo mezurashikunakatta. (The two years spent in the university dorm—where international students from around the world would compete in cooking in the shared kitchen, and late-night conversations often lasted until morning—were anything but ordinary.) 就職後も懐かしく思い出すのは、寮の一室で先輩から受け継いだ古びたレシピ集を片手に、試行錯誤しながら作ったカレーの味だ。 shūshoku-go mo natsukashiku omoidasu no wa, ryō no hitoshitsu de senpai kara uketsuida furubita reshipi-shū o kata-te ni, shikōsakugo shinagara tsukutta karē no aji da. (Even after starting work, what I fondly recall is the taste of the curry we made in that dorm room—clutching a worn recipe book passed down from seniors, through trial and error.)

Word/Phrase: 沢
Romaji: sawa
Meaning: sungai kecil
Example: 沢に沿って歩くと、清らかな水の音と緑の香りに包まれ、心が癒されます sawa ni sototte aruku to, kiyraka na mizu no oto to midori no kaori ni tsutsumare, kokoro ga iyasareru desu (When you walk along the stream, the sound of pure water and the scent of greenery envelop you, soothing your heart) 山奥の沢では、透き通った水が岩を優しく洗い、小さな滝が静かなメロディーを奏でています yamaoku no sawa de wa, sukitootta mizu ga iwa o yasashiku arai, chiisa na taki ga shizukana merodī o kanadete imasu (Deep in the mountain stream, clear water gently washes over the rocks, and a small waterfall plays a quiet melody)

Word/Phrase: 世界
Romaji: sekai
Meaning: world
Example: 世界中の人々は、お互いに助け合うことが大切だと考えています sekaijū no hitobito wa, otagai ni tasukeau koto ga taisetsu da to kangaete imasu (People around the world believe that it is important to help and support each other in times of need) 世界の多くの国では、環境保護のために再生可能エネルギーの導入や森林保全など、具体的な取り組みを積極的に進めています sekai no ōku no kuni de wa, kankyō hogo no tame ni saisei kanō enerugī no dōnyū ya shinrin hozen nado, gutaiteki na torikumi o sekkyokuteki ni susumete imasu (Many countries in the world are actively promoting specific initiatives such as introducing renewable energy and conserving forests to protect the environment)

Word/Phrase: 席
Romaji: seki
Meaning: seat
Example: 新しくオープンした喫茶店の窓際の席は、 いつでも予約で埋まってしまうほど人気だが、 今日だけは運よく空いていたので、友人と二人でゆっくり過ごすことができた。 Atarashīku ōpun shita kissaten no madogiwa no seki wa, itsudemo yoyaku de umatte shimau hodo ninki da ga, kyō dake wa un ga yoku aite ita node, yūjin to futari de yukkuri sugosu koto ga dekita. (The window-side seat at the newly opened café is so popular that it’s always booked, but today it was luckily free, so my friend and I could spend time there leisurely.) 会議室の一番奥の席には、 前回のミーティングで使った書類がまだ置いたままになっていたが、 彼はそれを片付けもせず、自分の資料を広げて準備を始めた。 Kaigishitsu no ichiban oku no seki ni wa, zenkai no mītingu de tsukatta shorui ga mada oita mama ni natte ita ga, kare wa sore o katazuke mo sezu, jibun no shiryō o hirogete junbi o hajimeta. (At the very back seat of the meeting room, the documents from the last meeting were still left untouched, but he, without tidying them up, spread out his own materials and started preparing.)

Word/Phrase: 志賀高原
Romaji: shigakougen
Meaning: taman nasional
Example: 志賀高原は長野県の奥深くにあり、標高2,000メートルを超える場所も多い日本有数の高原です。 Shigakōgen wa Nagano-ken no okufukaku ni ari, hyōkō ni-sen mētoru o koeru basho mo ōi Nihon yūsū no kōgen desu. (Located deep in Nagano Prefecture, Shiga Kogen is one of Japan’s leading highlands, with many areas exceeding 2,000 meters in elevation.) 四季を通じて美しい景色が楽しめる志賀高原は、特に冬になるとスキー客で賑わうことで知られています。 Shiki o tsūjite utsukushii keshiki ga tanoshimeru Shigakōgen wa, tokuni fuyu ni naru to sukīkyaku de nigiwau koto de shirarete imasu. (Famous for its beautiful scenery year-round, Shiga Kogen is especially known for bustling with skiers in winter.)

Word/Phrase: 島
Romaji: shima
Meaning: island
Example: 島の近くに小さな漁村があります。その村では毎日新鮮な魚を食べられます。 shima no chikaku ni chiisana gyoson ga arimasu. sono mura de wa mainichi shinsen na sakana o taberaremasu. (There is a small fishing village near the island, where you can eat fresh fish every day.)

Word/Phrase: 森林
Romaji: shinrin
Meaning: hutan (istilah resmi)
Example: 森林は自然の宝庫で、多様な生態系を支える動物や植物が数多く生息しています。 Shinrin wa shizen no houko de, tayou na seitaikei o sasaeru doubutsu ya shokubutsu ga kazuooku seikoku shite imasu. (Forests are a treasure trove of nature, where a diverse ecosystem supports countless animals and plants that thrive there.) 森林は四季折々の美しさを持ち、夏の緑の木陰は涼しさを提供し、秋には鮮やかな紅葉が訪れる人々を魅了します。 Shinrin wa shiki oriori no utsukushisa o mochi, natsu no midori no kokage wa suzushisa o teikyou shi, aki ni wa azayaka na kouyou ga otozure ru hitobito o miryou shimasu. (Forests hold seasonal beauty—green shade offers coolness in summer, while vibrant autumn foliage enchants visitors in fall.)

Word/Phrase: 支店
Romaji: shiten
Meaning: kantor cabang
Example: この支店は駅直結の商業施設内にあり、平日はサラリーマンでごった返す一方、週末は家族連れで賑わうため、いつ訪れても店員の対応が行き届いている。 kono shiten wa eki chokketsu no shōgyō shisetsu-nai ni ari, heijitsu wa sararīman de gottagaesu ippō, shūmatsu wa kazoku-zure de niwau tame, itsu otozurete mo ten'in no taiō ga ikitodoi te iru. (Located inside a commercial facility directly connected to the station, this branch is packed with salarymen on weekdays and bustling with families on weekends, ensuring that staff service remains attentive no matter when you visit.) 先月オープンしたばかりの支店では、地元産の食材を活用したオリジナルメニューの開発に力を入れているが、その品質管理のため、店長自らが毎朝市場へ足を運んでいるという。 sengetsu ōpun shita bakari no shiten de wa, jimoto-san no shokuzai o katsuyō shita orijinaru menyū no kaihatsu ni chikara o irete iru ga, sono hinshitsu kanri no tame, tenchō jizura ga maiasa ichiba e ashi o hakonde iru to iu.

Word/Phrase: 室
Romaji: shitsu
Meaning: room
Example: 室のドアを開けると、中には大きな木製の机と古びた本棚が並び、窓からは夕日の光が差し込んでいた Shitsu no doa o akeru to, naka ni wa ōkina mokusei no tsukue to furubita hondana ga narabi, mado kara wa yūhi no hikari ga sashikondeita (When I opened the door to the room, inside there was a large wooden desk and an old bookshelf lined up, with the light of the setting sun streaming in through the window) 室の温度と湿度を快適なレベルに保つため、最新型のエアコンを設置し、リモコンで細かく設定を調整した Shitsu no ondo to shitsudo o kaiteki na reberu ni tamotsu tame, saishingata no eakon o setchi shi, rimokon de komakaku settei o chōsei shita (To maintain the room’s temperature and humidity at a comfortable level, I installed a state-of-the-art air conditioner and adjusted the settings precisely with the remote control)

Word/Phrase: 市役所
Romaji: shiyakusho
Meaning: balai kota
Example: 市役所で住民票を取りに行きましたが、混んでいて待つ時間が長かったです shiyakusho de jūminhyō o torini ikimashita ga, kondeite matsu jikan ga nagakatta desu (I went to the city hall to get my residence certificate, but it was so crowded that I had to wait for an unusually long time before being served.) 市役所の窓口で手続きをする時は、必ず予約をしておいた方がいいです shiyakusho no madoguchi de tetsuzuki o suru toki wa, kanarazu yoyaku o shite oita hō ga ii desu (When you need to complete administrative procedures at the city hall counter, it is highly recommended to make an appointment beforehand to avoid delays.)

Word/Phrase: 自然
Romaji: shizen
Meaning: alam
Example: 自然の美しさは、山や川、森などの風景から感じられます Shizen no utsukushisa wa, yama ya kawa, mori nado no fuukei kara kanjiraremasu (The beauty of nature can be felt from landscapes such as mountains, rivers, and forests that stretch as far as the eye can see) この公園は自然が豊かで、都会の喧騒を忘れて心からリラックスできる貴重な場所です Kono koen wa shizen ga yutaka de, tokai no kensou o wasurete kokoro kara rirakkusu dekiru kichou na basho desu (This park, rich in nature, is a precious place where one can forget the noise of the city and truly relax from the heart)

Word/Phrase: 書店
Romaji: shouten
Meaning: bookstore (formal)
Example: 書店で新しい本を買いましたが、家に帰ってから読み始めました shouten de atarashii hon o kaimashita ga, ie ni kaette kara yomihajimemashita (I bought a new book at the bookstore and started reading it after returning home) 書店で働いている友達に偶然会い、一緒にコーヒーを飲みながら最近のベストセラーについて話しました shouten de hataite iru tomodachi ni guuzen ai, issho ni koohii o nomi nagara saikin no besutoseraa ni tsuite hanashimashita (I accidentally met a friend who works at the bookstore, and we drank coffee together while discussing recent bestsellers)

Word/Phrase: 首都
Romaji: shuto
Meaning: capital
Example: 東京は日本の首都で、現代的なビルが立ち並び、世界中から多くのビジネスマンや観光客が訪れます Tōkyō wa Nihon no shuto de, gendai-teki na biru ga tachinaranbi, sekaijū kara ōku no bijinesuman ya kankōkyaku ga otozuremasu (Tokyo is the capital of Japan, lined with modern buildings, and visited by many businesspeople and tourists from around the world) この国の首都は1000年以上の歴史を持ち、伝統的な祭りや古い城跡が今も残っています Kono kuni no shuto wa sen-nen ijō no rekishi o mochi, dentō-teki na matsuri ya furui jōato ga ima mo nokotte imasu (The capital of this country has a history of over 1,000 years, and traditional festivals and old castle ruins still remain today)

Word/Phrase: 終点
Romaji: shuuten
Meaning: last stop
Example: 電車の終点まで行きましたが、そこは静かな田舎で、駅前には小さな店しかありませんでした densha no shuuten made ikimashita ga, soko wa shizukana inaka de, eki-mae ni wa chiisa na mise shika arimasen deshita (We took the train all the way to the last stop, only to find a peaceful rural area with nothing but tiny shops near the station entrance.) このバス路線の終点は、山間の温泉街で、観光客が多く訪れる人気の場所です kono basu rosen no shuuten wa, sankan no onsen-machi de, kankōkyaku ga ōku otozureru ninki no basho desu (The final stop on this bus route is a popular hot spring town nestled in the mountains, attracting many tourists throughout the year.)

Word/Phrase: 空
Romaji: sora
Meaning: sky
Example: 空が青くて、雲が少なくて、とてもきれいな日でした sora ga aokute, kumo ga sukunakute, totemo kirei na hi deshita (The sky was a clear blue with only a few clouds, making it an exceptionally beautiful day) 空を見上げると、白い雲の間を鳥が自由に飛び回っているのが見えました sora o miageru to, shiroi kumo no aida o tori ga jiyū ni tobimawatteiru no ga miemashita (When I looked up at the sky, I could see birds flying freely between the white clouds)

Word/Phrase: 隅
Romaji: sumi
Meaning: sudut (ruangan)
Example: 部屋の隅に積み上げられた古いアルバムを見つけ、懐かしい写真に時間を忘れた heya no sumi ni tsumiagerareta furui arubamu o mitsuke, natsukashii shashin ni jikan o wasureta (I found old photo albums piled up in the corner of the room and lost track of time looking at nostalgic pictures) この図書館の最も奥の隅には、絶版になった貴重な文学作品が静かに眠っている kono toshokan no mottomo oku no sumi ni wa, zeppan ni natta kichō na bungaku sakuhin ga shizuka ni nemutte iru (In the very back corner of this library, out-of-print valuable literary works rest quietly)

Word/Phrase: 体育館
Romaji: taiikukan
Meaning: gor
Example: 体育館で毎週末バレーボールの練習をしており、チームメイトと共に大会優勝を目指しています taiikukan de maishūmatsu barēbōru no renshū o shite ori, chīmumeito to tomo ni taikai yūshō o mezashite imasu (I practice volleyball in the gym every weekend and aim to win the tournament with my teammates) 体育館は学校の中央に位置し、生徒たちが体育の授業や部活動で利用する重要な施設です taiikukan wa gakkō no chūō ni ichi shi, seito-tachi ga taiiku no jugyō ya bukatsudō de riyō suru jūyō na shisetsu desu (The gym is located in the center of the school and is an important facility used by students for physical education classes and club activities)

Word/Phrase: 大使館
Romaji: taishikan
Meaning: embassy
Example: 大使館でビザの申請をする前に、必要な書類を全部準備しておくことが大切です taishikan de biza no shinsei o suru mae ni, hitsuyō na shorui o zenbu junbi shite oku koto ga taisetsu desu (Before applying for a visa at the embassy, it is crucial to prepare all the necessary documents in advance) 大使館のスタッフは、複雑な申請手続きを一つ一つ丁寧に説明し、質問にも親切に答えてくれました taishikan no sutaffu wa, fukuzatsu na shinsei tetsuzuki o hitotsu hitotsu teinei ni setsumei shi, shitsumon ni mo shinsetsu ni kotaete kuremashita (The embassy staff carefully explained each step of the complicated application process and kindly answered all my questions)

Word/Phrase: 太陽
Romaji: taiyou
Meaning: sun
Example: 太陽が空高く昇り、温かい光が大地を包むと、心まで温まるような気がします。 Taiyou ga soradaka takaku nobori, atatakai hikari ga daichi o tsutsumu to, kokoro made atatamaru you na ki ga shimasu. (When the sun rises high in the sky and its warm light envelops the earth, it feels as though my heart is warmed as well.) 朝の散歩をするとき、太陽の光を浴びながら公園のベンチで本を読むと、その一日がとても充実したものになるのです。 Asa no sanpo o suru toki, taiyou no hikari o abi nagara kouen no benchi de hon o yomu to, sono ichinichi ga totemo juujitsu shita mono ni naru no desu. (When I take a morning walk and read a book on a park bench while basking in the sunlight, it makes my whole day feel incredibly fulfilling.)

Word/Phrase: 宅
Romaji: taku
Meaning: house (orang lain)
Example: 友人の宅で過ごした夜は、 手作りピザの香りとボードゲームの笑い声で、 いつの間にか深夜になっていた。 yūjin no taku de sugoshita yoru wa, tezukuri piza no kaori to bōdo gēmu no waraigoe de, itsu no ma ni ka shinya ni natte ita. (The night spent at my friend’s house, filled with the aroma of homemade pizza and laughter from board games, had unknowingly turned into late night.) --- 先日宅に届いた小包の中身は、 祖母の温かみが詰まった手編みのセーターと、 心のこもった手紙だった。 senjitsu taku ni todoita kozutsumi no nakami wa, sobo no nukumami ga tsumatta teami no sētā to, kokoro no komotta tegami datta. (The contents of the package delivered to their house the other day were a hand-knitted sweater brimming with my grandmother’s warmth and a heartfelt letter.)

Word/Phrase: 短大
Romaji: tandai
Meaning: junior college
Example: 短大を卒業したら、就職する人もいるし、大学に編入する人もいます。 tandai o sotsugyō shitara, shūshoku suru hito mo iru shi, daigaku ni hennyū suru hito mo imasu. (After completing their studies at a junior college, some students enter the workforce immediately, while others choose to transfer to a four-year university for further education.) 短大は4年制の大学よりも短い期間で学べるので、時間やお金を節約できます。 tandai wa yonensei no daigaku yori mo mijikai kikan de manaberu node, jikan ya okane o setsuyaku dekimasu. (Since junior colleges offer programs that can be completed in a shorter duration compared to traditional four-year universities, students can save both time and tuition expenses.)

Word/Phrase: 建物
Romaji: tatemono
Meaning: gedung
Example: この建物はとても古くて、壁にひびが入っているので、修理が必要です kono tatemono wa totemo furukute, kabe ni hibi ga haitte iru node, shūri ga hitsuyō desu (This old building has cracks in the walls, so it urgently requires professional repairs to prevent further damage) この建物の近くに、先月オープンした新しいレストランは、地元住民の間で大人気です kono tatemono no chikaku ni, sengetsu ōpun shita atarashii resutoran wa, jimoto jūmin no aida de daijinki desu (The new restaurant that opened last month near this building has become extremely popular among local residents)

Word/Phrase: 天
Romaji: ten
Meaning: heaven
Example: 空が青くて、高く広がる秋の天は、心まで澄み渡るような清々しさを感じさせる sora ga aoku te, takaku hirogaru aki no ten wa, kokoro made sumiwataru you na sayo sayo shisa o kanjisaseru (The clear blue sky spreading high in the autumn heavens makes me feel a refreshing purity that cleanses even my heart) 古代の人々は天を神聖な存在と考え、祭りや儀式を通じてその恩恵に感謝した kodai no hitobito wa ten o shinsei na sonzai to kangaete, matsuri ya gishiki o toujite sono onkei ni kansha shita (Ancient people regarded the heavens as a sacred being and expressed gratitude for its blessings through festivals and rituals)

Word/Phrase: 天国
Romaji: tengoku
Meaning: heaven
Example: 天国のような味わいを持つこのケーキは、食べた瞬間、幸せな気持ちにさせられる。ふわふわの食感と甘さが、これまでのスイーツとは全く違う。 tengoku no yōna ajiwai o motsu kono kēki wa, tabeta shunkan, shiawase na kimochi ni saserareru. fuwafuwa no shokkan to amasa ga, kore made no suītsu to wa mattaku chigau. (This cake, with its heavenly taste, makes you feel happy the moment you eat it—the fluffy texture and sweetness are completely different from any other dessert.) 多くの人が天国を、青く広がる空と温かい光に満ちた場所だと想像する。そこでは、争いもなく、みんなが笑顔で過ごしているという。 ōku no hito ga tengoku o, aoku hirogaru sora to atatakai hikari ni michita basho da to sōzō suru. soko de wa, arasoi mo naku, minna ga egao de sugoshite iru to iu. (Many people imagine heaven as a place filled with endless blue skies and warm light—a place where everyone spends their days smiling, without any conflict.)

Word/Phrase: 都
Romaji: to
Meaning: prefektur metropolitan
Example: 東京は日本で最も有名な都の一つで、世界中から観光客が訪れるだけでなく、ビジネスの中心地でもある。 Tōkyō wa Nihon de mottomo yūmei na to no hitotsu de, sekaijū kara kankōkyaku ga otozureru dake de naku, bijinesu no chūshinchi de mo aru. (Tokyo is one of Japan’s most famous metropolitan prefectures, attracting tourists from around the world while also serving as a business hub.) 京都の都には古い寺や神社が多く、四季折々の美しさを楽しめる場所として、多くの人に親しまれている。 Kyōto no to ni wa furui tera ya jinja ga ōku, shikioriori no utsukushisa o tanoshimeru basho to shite, ōku no hito ni shitashimarete iru. (Kyoto’s metropolitan prefecture, with its many old temples and shrines, is cherished by people as a place to enjoy the beauty of each season.)

Word/Phrase: 途中で
Romaji: tochuude
Meaning: during the journey
Example: 途中で電車が故障してしまい、予定より3時間も遅れて目的地に到着した Tochū de densha ga koshō shite shimai, yotei yori san-jikan mo okurete mokuteki-chi ni tochaku shita (During the journey, the train broke down, causing us to arrive at our destination three hours later than planned) 途中で興味深い本を見つけたので、予定を変更してその書店で2時間過ごした Tochū de kyōmi-bukai hon o mitsuketa node, yotei o henkō shite sono shoten de ni-jikan sugoshita (While on the way, I found an interesting book, so I changed my plans and spent two hours in that bookstore)

Word/Phrase: 都会
Romaji: tokai
Meaning: metropolitan
Example: 都会では交通網が整っているため、短時間で目的地に着けますが、朝夕の通勤時間帯は人や車であふれ、ストレスを感じることも少なくありません Tokai de wa kōtsūmō ga totonotte iru tame, tanka-jikan de mokutekichi ni tsuke masu ga, chōyū no tsūkin jikan-tai wa hito ya kuruma de afure, sutoresu o kanjiru koto mo sukunaku arimasen (While metropolitan areas have well-developed transportation that allows quick travel, mornings and evenings during commuting hours are often overflowing with people and cars, making stress hard to avoid) 都会に住む利点は何でも手に入る便利さですが、コンクリートのビルが並ぶ風景ばかりで、季節の変化を感じにくく、心の休まりにくさを覚えることがあります Tokai ni sumu ritten wa nan demo te ni hairu benrisa desu ga, konkurīto no biru ga narabu fūkei bakari de, kisetsu no henka o kanji nikui, kokoro no yasumari nikusa o oboeru koto ga arimasu (The advantage of living in a metropolitan area is the convenience of having everything at hand, but with nothing but rows of concrete buildings, it’s hard to sense the changing seasons, and one may feel a lingering restlessness in the heart)

Word/Phrase: 所
Romaji: tokoro
Meaning: place
Example: この所、毎日忙しくて、新しいプロジェクトの準備で残業が続き、家族と過ごす時間もほとんどありません Kono tokoro, mainichi isogashikute, atarashī purojekuto no junbi de zangyō ga tsuzuki, kazoku to sugosu jikan mo hotondo arimasen (Lately, I’ve been so busy every day preparing for a new project, working overtime constantly, and barely have any time to spend with my family) この所、近所の公園で毎朝ジョギングをして、心身の健康を維持するように努めています Kono tokoro, kinjo no kōen de maiasa jogingu o shite, shinshin no kenkō o ijisuru yō ni tsutomete imasu (Recently, I’ve been jogging every morning in the neighborhood park to actively maintain my physical and mental health)

Word/Phrase: 都市
Romaji: toshi
Meaning: city
Example: 都市の朝は、時間との戦いが始まる。サラリーマンやOLたちが駅の改札を抜け、満員電車に飛び乗る姿が、活気ある都市の日常を物語っている。 toshi no asa wa, jikan to no tatakai ga hajimaru. Sararīman ya ōēru-tachi ga eki no kaisatsu o nuke, man'in densha ni tobinoru sugata ga, katsuki aru toshi no nichijō o monogatatte iru. (In the city’s morning, a battle against time begins. The sight of salarymen and office ladies rushing through ticket gates and boarding packed trains tells the story of the city’s lively daily routine.) 都市の夜は、ネオンの光が交差する。世界中から集まった人々が、異なる言語や文化を背負いながら、同じ空の下で交流し、新しい価値を生み出している。 toshi no yoru wa, neon no hikari ga kōsa suru. Sekaijū kara atsumatta hitobito ga, kotonaru gengo ya bunka o seoinagara, onaji sora no shita de kōryū shi, atarashii kachi o umidashite iru. (At night in the city, neon lights intersect. People gathered from around the world, each carrying different languages and cultures, interact under the same sky, creating new values.)

Word/Phrase: 月
Romaji: tsuki
Meaning: moon
Example: 月が綺麗ですね。今夜の月は特に大きくて明るく、空全体を照らしているようです Tsuki ga kirei desu ne. Konya no tsuki wa tokuni ōkiku te akaruku, sora zentai o terashite iru yō desu (The moon is beautiful tonight. It appears especially large and bright, as if illuminating the entire sky) 月見は日本の伝統的な行事で、秋の夜に家族や友達と一緒に月を鑑賞しながら、団子やススキを供えて過ごすことが多いです Tsukimi wa Nihon no dentōteki na gyōji de, aki no yoru ni kazoku ya tomodachi to issho ni tsuki o kanshō shinagara, dango ya susuki o sonae te sugosu koto ga ōi desu (Moon-viewing is a traditional Japanese event where families and friends gather on autumn evenings to admire the moon while offering rice dumplings and pampas grass)

Word/Phrase: 通路
Romaji: tsuuro
Meaning: aisle
Example: 駅の通路は混んでいて、電車に乗る前に少し待たなければなりませんでした eki no tsuuro wa kondeite, densha ni noru mae ni sukoshi matanakereba narimasen deshita (The station's aisle was crowded, so I had to wait a little before boarding the train) この病院の通路は広くて清潔で、車いすの患者さんや面会客が快適に移動できるように設計されています kono byōin no tsuuro wa hirokute seiketsu de, kurumaisu no kansya-san ya menkaikyaku ga kaiteki ni idō dekiru yō ni sekkei sarete imasu (The hospital's aisles are spacious and clean, designed so that wheelchair patients and visitors can move around comfortably)

Word/Phrase: 家
Romaji: uchi
Meaning: home (includes the residents)
Example: 家に帰ったら、まずお風呂に入りました。その後、家族と一緒に夕ご飯を食べました。うちはとても静かで、リラックスできました uchi ni kaettara, mazu ofuro ni hairimashita. sono ato, kazoku to issho ni yūgohan o tabemashita. uchi wa totemo shizuka de, rirakkusu dekimashita (When I returned home, I first took a bath. After that, I had dinner with my family. My home was very quiet, and I could relax) うちの近くに大きな公園があります。週末には家族と一緒に散歩に行きます。うちから公園まで歩いて10分くらいです uchi no chikaku ni ōkina kōen ga arimasu. shūmatsu ni wa kazoku to issho ni sanpo ni ikimasu. uchi kara kōen made aruite jūppun kurai desu (There is a large park near my home. On weekends, I go for a walk with my family. It takes about a 10-minute walk from my home to the park)

Word/Phrase: 宇宙
Romaji: uchuu
Meaning: angkasa
Example: 宇宙はとても広大で、無数の銀河や星々、そして謎に満ちたブラックホールが存在しています。 uchuu wa totemo koudai de, musuu no ginga ya hoshiboshi, soshite nazo ni michita burakku hōru ga sonzai shite imasu. (The universe is incredibly vast, filled with countless galaxies, stars, and mysterious black holes.) 私たち人間は青く美しい地球に生まれ、宇宙の果てしない広がりやその神秘について日々研究を重ねていますが、まだ解明されていない謎が数多く残されています。 watashitachi ningen wa aoku utsukushii chikyuu ni umare, uchuu no hateshinai hirogari ya sono shinpi ni tsuite hibi kenkyuu o kasanete imasu ga, mada kaimei sarete inai nazo ga kazōoku nokosarete imasu. (We humans are born on the beautiful blue Earth and continuously study the endless expanse and mysteries of the universe, yet many unsolved enigmas remain.)

Word/Phrase: 受付
Romaji: uketsuke
Meaning: front desk
Example: 病院に着いたら、まず受付で予約の確認をし、その後、看護師の案内を待つ間に、受付の隣にある自動販売機で飲み物を買うことができます。 byōin ni tsuitara, mazu uketsuke de yoyaku no kakunin o shi, sono go, kangoshi no annai o matsu aida ni, uketsuke no tonari ni aru jidōhanbaiki de nomimono o kau koto ga dekimasu. (When you arrive at the hospital, first confirm your reservation at the front desk, and while waiting for the nurse’s guidance, you can buy a drink from the vending machine next to the front desk.) ホテルに入ったら、受付でチェックインの手続きを済ませ、その後、案内係の人が来るまでの間に、受付の近くにある自動販売機で飲み物を購入することが可能です。 hoteru ni haittara, uketsuke de chekkuin no tetsuzuki o sumasete, sono go, annaigakari no hito ga kuru made no aida ni, uketsuke no chikaku ni aru jidōhanbaiki de nomimono o kōnyū suru koto ga kanō desu. (After entering the hotel, complete the check-in procedure at the front desk, and while waiting for the attendant to arrive, you can purchase a drink from the vending machine located near the front desk.)

Word/Phrase: 売り場
Romaji: uriba
Meaning: counter jualan
Example: 売り場で新しい商品のサンプルを試した後、店員に質問して詳しい説明を聞いた uriba de atarashī shōhin no sanpuru o tameshita ato, ten'in ni shitsumon shite kuwashī setsumei o kiita (Telah mencoba sampel produk baru di bagian penjualan, lalu bertanya kepada pegawai toko untuk mendapatkan penjelasan detail) 売り場のレイアウトが変わってから、お目当ての商品を見つけるのに時間がかかるようになった uriba no reiauto ga kawatte kara, omedate no shōhin o mitsukeru no ni jikan ga kakaru yō ni natta (Tata letak bagian penjualan berubah, sehingga sekarang membutuhkan waktu lebih lama untuk menemukan produk yang dicari)

Word/Phrase: 屋
Romaji: ya
Meaning: store/house
Example: 店の前の屋根が風で壊れてしまったので、すぐに修理屋さんを呼ばないといけません ten no mae no yane ga kaze de kowarete shimatta node, sugu ni shūriya-san o yobanai to ikemasen (The roof above the shop entrance was damaged by strong winds, so we urgently need to contact a repair specialist.) この町で一番美味しいラーメンを出している店は、あの小さなラーメン屋です kono machi de ichiban oishii rāmen o dashite iru mise wa, ano chiisana rāmenya desu (The most delicious ramen in this town is served at that tiny ramen shop on the corner.)

Word/Phrase: 屋台
Romaji: yatai
Meaning: stall
Example: 屋台でたこ焼きを食べた後、友達と一緒に夜の街を散歩し、途中で見つけたライヴハウスに立ち寄りました Yatai de takoyaki o tabeta ato, tomodachi to issho ni yoru no machi o sanpo shi, tochū de mitsuketa raivuhausu ni tachiyorimashita (After eating takoyaki at a street stall, my friends and I strolled through the nighttime city and stopped by a live music venue we found along the way) 屋台の明かりが美しくて、温かい料理の香りと人々の笑い声が混ざり合い、とても賑やかな雰囲気でした Yatai no akari ga utsukushikute, atatakai ryōri no kaori to hitobito no waraigoe ga mazariai, totemo nigiyaka na fun'iki deshita (The glow of the street stalls was beautiful, and the warm aroma of food blended with people’s laughter, creating a very lively atmosphere)

Word/Phrase: 幼稚園
Romaji: youchien
Meaning: kindergarten
Example: 幼稚園で過ごした日々は、砂場で夢中になって城を作る子どもたちの笑い声や、鬼ごっこで走り回る元気な姿が今も目に浮かぶ。 youchien de sugoshita hibi wa, sunaba de muchuu ni natte shiro o tsukuru kodomotachi no waraigoe ya, onigokko de hashirimawaru genki na sugata ga ima mo me ni ukabu. (The days spent in kindergarten still vividly bring to mind the laughter of children absorbed in building sandcastles and the lively figures running around playing tag.) 先生のピアノに合わせて歌ったり踊ったりする時間は、幼稚園ならではの楽しさを教えてくれた、忘れられない思い出の一つだ。 sensei no piano ni awasete utattari odottari suru jikan wa, youchien narade no tanoshisa o oshiete kureta, wasurerarenai omoide no hitotsu da. (The time we sang and danced to the teacher’s piano was one of those unforgettable memories that taught us the unique joy of kindergarten.)

Word/Phrase: 遊園地
Romaji: yuuenchi
Meaning: amusement park
Example: 遊園地で友達と一緒にジェットコースターに乗り、絶叫した後、綿菓子を食べながら観覧車に乗りました yuuenchi de tomodachi to issho ni jetto kōsutā ni nori, zekkyō shita ato, watagashi o tabenagara kanransha ni norimashita (At the amusement park, I rode the roller coaster with my friends, screamed at the top of my lungs, and then ate cotton candy while riding the Ferris wheel.) 遊園地の入場券を買ってから、まず最初にメリーゴーラウンドで温まり、その後、迷路のお化け屋敷に挑戦しました yuuenchi no nyūjōken o katte kara, mazu sajio ni merīgōrando de atatamari, sono go, meiro no obakeyashiki ni chōsen shimashita (After buying the admission ticket for the amusement park, we started by warming up on the carousel, then challenged ourselves to the haunted house maze.)

Word/Phrase: 海苔
Romaji: nori
Meaning: seaweed
Example: 海苔はお寿司やおにぎりに使われることが多いですけど、私は海苔を使った味噌汁やサラダの方が好きです nori wa osushi ya onigiri ni tsukawareru koto ga ōi desu kedo, watashi wa nori o tsukatta misoshiru ya sarada no hō ga suki desu (While seaweed is often used in sushi and rice balls, I prefer miso soup and salads made with seaweed) 海苔は健康に良い食品で、ビタミンA、C、Eやカルシウム、鉄分などのミネラルを豊富に含んでいます nori wa kenkō ni yoi shokuhin de, bitamin ē, shī, ī ya karushiumu, tetsubun nado no mineraru o hōfu ni fukunde imasu (Seaweed is a healthy food rich in vitamins A, C, and E, as well as minerals like calcium and iron)

Word/Phrase: 葡萄
Romaji: budo
Meaning: grape
Example: 夏になるとスーパーに並ぶ葡萄は、甘さが増して子どもたちのおやつにぴったりだが、皮をむくのが面倒だという声もよく聞く。 Natsu ni naru to suupaa ni narabu budou wa, amasa ga mashite kodomotachi no oyatsu ni pittari da ga, kawao muku no ga mendou da to iu koe mo yoku kiku. (When summer comes, the grapes lined up in supermarkets get sweeter, making them perfect for children’s snacks, but you often hear people say peeling them is a hassle.) 葡萄を冷やして食べるとより美味しいが、冷やしすぎると風味が失われるため、食べる30分前くらいに冷蔵庫に入れるのがコツだ。 Budou o hiyashite taberu to yori oishii ga, hiyashisugiru to fuumi ga ushinawareru tame, taberu 30-pun mae kurai ni reizouko ni ireru no ga kotsu da. (Chilled grapes taste even better, but if you over-chill them, they lose their flavor, so the trick is to put them in the fridge about 30 minutes before eating.)

Word/Phrase: 大豆
Romaji: daizu
Meaning: soybean
Example: 大豆から作られる豆腐や味噌は、日本の食卓に欠かせないだけでなく、世界中で健康食品として注目されています。 daizu kara tsukurareru tōfu ya miso wa, nihon no shokutaku ni kakasenai dake de naku, sekaijū de kenkō shokuhin to shite chūmoku sarete imasu. (The tofu and miso made from soybeans are not only essential to Japanese dining tables but are also gaining attention worldwide as health foods.) 大豆油は料理に使われるだけではなく、工業製品の原料としても利用され、その用途は非常に広いです。 daizu abura wa ryōri ni tsukawareru dake de wa naku, kōgyō seihin no genryō to shite mo riyō sare, sono yōto wa hijō ni hiroi desu. (Soybean oil is used not only in cooking but also as a raw material for industrial products, making its applications extremely wide.)

Word/Phrase: 葉
Romaji: ha
Meaning: leaf
Example: 秋の葉が風に舞い落ちるのを見ると、とても静かで美しい気持ちになります aki no ha ga kaze ni mai ochiru no o miru to, totemo shizuka de utsukushii kimochi ni narimasu (Whenever I watch the autumn leaves swaying gently in the breeze before drifting to the ground, a deep sense of tranquility and beauty fills my heart) 庭のこの木の葉は非常に大きく、朝から夕方までたっぷりと日光を浴びている niwa no kono ki no ha wa hijō ni ōkikute, asa kara yūgata made tappuri to nikkō o abite iru (The leaves on this tree in the garden are exceptionally large, basking abundantly in sunlight from morning until evening)

Word/Phrase: 花
Romaji: hana
Meaning: bunga
Example: 花が咲く季節になると、公園は色とりどりの花々で覆われ、たくさんの人でにぎわいます hana ga saku kisetsu ni naru to, kōen wa irotoridori no hanabana de ōware, takusan no hito de nigiwai masu (When the season arrives for flowers to bloom, the park is covered in a riot of colorful blossoms and bustles with many people) 春の花を見るため、家族と一緒に近くの山へハイキングに行き、桜やツツジの美しさを楽しみました haru no hana o miru tame, kazoku to issho ni chikaku no yama e haikingu ni iki, sakura ya tsutsuji no utsukushisa o tanoshimimashita (To see the spring flowers, we went hiking with our family to a nearby mountain and enjoyed the beauty of cherry blossoms and azaleas)

Word/Phrase: 苺
Romaji: ichigo
Meaning: strawberry
Example: 苺のジャムを作るなら、赤くて大きい実を選び、砂糖と一緒に煮れば、甘い香りが部屋に広がる。 Ichigo no jamu o tsukuru nara, akakute ōkii mi o erabi, satō to issho ni nireba, amai kaori ga heya ni hirogaru. (If you make strawberry jam, pick red, plump berries and cook them with sugar—the sweet aroma will fill the room.) スーパーで苺を見つけたら、ヘタが緑で張りがあるものを選ぼう。冷蔵庫に入れず、その日に食べると一番おいしい。 Sūpā de ichigo o mitsuketara, heta ga midori de hari ga aru mono o erabō. Reizōko ni irezu, sono hi ni taberu to ichiban oishii. (When you find strawberries at the supermarket, choose ones with green stems and firmness—eating them the same day without refrigeration is the tastiest.)

Word/Phrase: ジャガイモ
Romaji: jagaimo
Meaning: potato
Example: 日本の食文化に欠かせないジャガイモは、北海道の肥沃な土壌で育ち、全国の食卓へ安定供給される重要な作物です Nihon no shokubunka ni kakasenai jagaimo wa, Hokkaidō no hiyoku na dojō de sodachi, zenkoku no shokutaku e antei kyūkyū sareru jūyō na sakumotsu desu (Indispensable to Japan’s food culture, potatoes grown in Hokkaido’s fertile soil are a vital crop that ensures stable supply to dining tables nationwide) カレーや天ぷら、スープなど、ジャガイモを使った料理はそのホクホクした食感で多くの人に愛され、日々の食事に彩りを添えています Karē ya tempura, sūpu nado, jagaimo o tsukatta ryōri wa sono hokuhoku shita shokkan de ōku no hito ni aisare, hinichi no shokiji ni irodori o soete imasu (Dishes like curry, tempura, and soup that use potatoes are cherished for their fluffy texture, adding richness to everyday meals)

Word/Phrase: 茸
Romaji: kinoko
Meaning: jamur
Example: 森の奥に足を踏み入れると、湿った土から姿を現した茸が群生し、秋の訪れを感じさせた。 mori no oku ni ashi o fumii reru to, shimetta tsuchi kara sugata o arawashita kinoko ga gunsei shi, aki no otozure o kanjiseta. (Stepping deep into the forest, clusters of mushrooms emerging from the damp earth signaled the arrival of autumn.) 茸料理は和食の定番だが、見た目が似た毒キノコも多いため、採取する際は細心の注意が必要となる。 kinoko ryōri wa washoku no teiban da ga, mitame ga nita doku-kinoko mo ōi tame, saitoru suru sai wa saishin no chūi ga hitsuyō to naru. (While mushroom dishes are a staple of Japanese cuisine, many poisonous varieties resemble edible ones, requiring extreme caution when foraging.)

Word/Phrase: 米
Romaji: kome
Meaning: beras
Example: 米は健康に良い食べ物で、栄養バランスが優れており、毎日適量を食べることでエネルギーが持続します kome wa kenkou ni ii tabemono de, eiyou baransu ga sugurete ori, mainichi tekiryō o taberu koto de enerugī ga jizoku shimasu (Rice is a nutritious and healthy food with excellent balance, and eating an appropriate amount daily helps sustain energy.) 日本の食文化において、米は古くから主食として重視され、朝昼晩の食事に欠かせない存在です Nihon no shokubunka ni oite, kome wa inishie kara shushoku toshite juushi sare, asa hiru ban no shokujini kakasenai sonzai desu (In Japanese food culture, rice has long been valued as a staple and remains an indispensable part of breakfast, lunch, and dinner.)

Word/Phrase: 草
Romaji: kusa
Meaning: grass
Example: 公園の草は夏になると青々として生い茂り、子供たちの隠れ家になることもあります。 Kōen no kusa wa natsu ni naru to aoaoshite oishige, kodomotachi no kakurega ni naru koto mo arimasu. (The grass in the park grows lush and green in summer, sometimes becoming a hiding place for children.) 草を切るのは手間がかかりますが、整然とした庭は心を落ち着かせ、訪れる人々に安らぎを与えます。 Kusa o kiru no wa temae ga kakari masu ga, seitentoshita niwa wa kokoro o ochitsukase, otozureru hitobito ni yasuragi o ataemasu. (Mowing the grass takes effort, but a well-kept garden soothes the mind and brings peace to visitors.)

Word/Phrase: 胡瓜
Romaji: kyuuri
Meaning: cucumber
Example: 夏の食卓に欠かせない胡瓜は、さわやかな歯ごたえと共に体を冷やす効果があるため、 natsu no shokutaku ni kakasenai kyuuri wa, sawayaka na hagotae to tomo ni karada o hiyasu kōka ga aru tame, (Indispensable to summer tables, cucumbers—with their refreshing crunch—help cool the body, which is why...) サラダはもちろん、酢の物や冷製パスタに加えると、暑い日にぴったりの一品となる。 sarada wa mochiron, su no mono ya reisei pasuta ni kuwaeru to, atsui hi ni pittari no ippin to naru. (...they become a perfect dish for hot days when added to salads, vinegared sides, or chilled pasta.) 胡瓜を選ぶ際は、いぼがとがっていてハリのあるものが新鮮だが、大きすぎると種が硬くなりやすい。 kyuuri o erabu sai wa, ibo ga togatte ite hari no aru mono ga shinsen da ga, ōkisugiru to tane ga kataku nari yasui. (When choosing cucumbers, fresh ones have firm, prickly bumps, though overly large ones tend to develop hard seeds.) そのため、用途に合わせて中程度のサイズを選び、早めに調理するのが賢い使い方である。 sore tame, yōto ni awasete chū-teido no saizu o erabi, hayame ni chōri suru no ga kashikoi tsukaikata de aru. (Thus, wisely selecting medium-sized ones for the intended use and cooking them promptly is ideal.)

Word/Phrase: 豆
Romaji: mame
Meaning: bean
Example: 日本人は古くから大豆を使った食品、例えば豆腐や納豆、味噌などを食べてきましたが、 Nihonjin wa inishie kara daizu o tsukatta shokuhin, tatoeba tōfu ya nattō, miso nado o tabete kimashita ga, (Japanese people have long consumed soybean-based foods like tofu, fermented soybeans, and miso, 最近では黒豆やひよこ豆など、世界中の豆を取り入れる人が増えています。 saikin de wa kuromame ya hiyokomame nado, sekaijū no mame o toriireru hito ga fuete imasu. and recently, more people have started incorporating global varieties like black beans and chickpeas.) 世界の料理には豊かな豆の文化があり、例えばインドのダールやメキシコのチリコンカルネは、 Sekai no ryōri ni wa yutaka na mame no bunka ga ari, tatoeba Indo no dāru ya Mekishiko no chirikonkāne wa, (The world’s cuisines boast rich bean traditions—Indian dal and Mexican chili con carne, for instance, それぞれの国で愛される豆料理として、長い歴史を持っています。 sorezore no kuni de aisareru mame ryōri toshite, nagai rekishi o motte imasu. are beloved dishes with long histories in their respective countries.)

Word/Phrase: 麦
Romaji: mugi
Meaning: gandum
Example: 麦は健康に良いと聞いたので、最近パンや麺類をよく食べるようになりました Mugi wa kenkou ni ii to kiita node, saikin pan ya menrui o yoku taberu you ni narimashita (I heard that wheat is good for health, so I’ve started eating bread and noodles often lately) 麦畑が風に揺れる様子は、夏の夕暮れに特に美しく、田園地帯の風物詩となっています Mugibata ga kaze ni yureru yousu wa, natsu no yuugure ni tokuni utsukushiku, den’en chitai no fuubutsushi to natte imasu (The sight of wheat fields swaying in the wind is especially beautiful at summer dusk, becoming a symbol of rural landscapes)

Word/Phrase: 人参
Romaji: ninjin
Meaning: carrot
Example: 人参に含まれるビタミンAは、目や肌の健康を保つのに欠かせない栄養素で、風邪予防にも効果があると言われています。 ninjin ni fukumareru bitamin Ē wa, me ya hada no kenkō o tamotsu no ni kakasenai eiyōso de, kazeyobō ni mo kōka ga aru to iwarete imasu. (The vitamin A found in carrots is an essential nutrient for maintaining eye and skin health, and is said to be effective in preventing colds.) 人参は生で食べるほか、煮ることで甘みが増し、スープやカレーなどの料理に幅広く使われています。 ninjin wa nama de taberu hoka, niru koto de amami ga mashi, sūpu ya karē nado no ryōri ni habahiroku tsukawarete imasu. (Carrots can be eaten raw, but when cooked, their sweetness increases, making them versatile in dishes like soups and curries.)

Word/Phrase: 大蒜
Romaji: ninniku
Meaning: garlic
Example: 大蒜は料理に使うと、味がとても深くなりますが、においが強いので、食べる前に歯を磨いた方がいいです ninniku wa ryōri ni tsukau to, aji ga totemo fukaku narimasu ga, nioi ga tsuyoi node, taberu mae ni ha o migaita hō ga ii desu (When garlic is used in cooking, it adds a rich depth of flavor, but because of its strong odor, it’s best to brush your teeth before eating) 大蒜は健康にいいと聞きましたが、私はにおいが苦手なので、サプリメントで代用することが多いです ninniku wa kenkō ni ii to kikimashita ga, watashi wa nioi ga nigate na node, sapurimento de daiyō suru koto ga ōi desu (I’ve heard garlic is good for health, but since I dislike the smell, I often substitute it with supplements instead)

Word/Phrase: 林檎
Romaji: ringo
Meaning: apel
Example: 林檎のジュースを飲むと、夏の暑さが少し和らぐ気がする ringo no jūsu o nomu to, natsu no atsusa ga sukoshi yawaragu ki ga suru (Drinking cold apple juice on a scorching afternoon makes the summer heat feel slightly more tolerable, as if refreshing my body from within) 林檎の木の下で本を読むのは、とても静かで心地よい時間を過ごせる ringo no ki no shita de hon o yomu no wa, totemo shizuka de kokochi-yoi jikan o sugoseru (Spending time reading a book under the shade of an apple tree offers a peaceful and comforting experience, as the gentle breeze carries the faint sweetness of ripe apples)

Word/Phrase: 植物
Romaji: shokubutsu
Meaning: plant
Example: 公園の一角には、四季を通じて色とりどりの植物が育ち、特に春には桜やチューリップが一斉に花を開きます。 kōen no ikkaku ni wa, shiki o tsūjite irodoridori no shokubutsu ga sodachi, tokuni haru ni wa sakura ya chūrippu ga issei ni hana o hirakimasu. (In one corner of the park, plants of various colors grow throughout the four seasons, and in spring, cherry blossoms and tulips bloom all at once.) この植物は乾燥に強い一方で、元気に育つには日当たりの良い場所と栄養のある土が欠かせません。 kono shokubutsu wa kansō ni tsuyoi ichimen de, genki ni sodatsu ni wa hitari no yoi basho to eiyō no aru tsuchi ga kakasemasen. (While this plant is strong against drought, a sunny location and nutrient-rich soil are indispensable for it to grow vigorously.)

Word/Phrase: 竹
Romaji: take
Meaning: bamboo
Example: 竹林の中を歩くと、風に揺れる竹の葉の音がとても静かで心が落ち着きます takelin no naka o aruku to, kaze ni yureru take no ha no oto ga totemo shizuka de kokoro ga ochitsukimasu (When you walk through the bamboo grove, the gentle rustling of the bamboo leaves in the wind creates a serene atmosphere that soothes the mind) この公園には太くて高い竹が群生しており、夏の強い日差しから訪れる人々に快適な休憩場所を提供しています kono kōen ni wa futokute takai take ga gunsei shite ori, natsu no tsuyoi hizashi kara otozureru hitobito ni kateinai kyūkeiba o teikyō shite imasu (In this park, thick and tall bamboo grows in clusters, offering visitors a comfortable place to rest and escape the harsh summer sun)

Word/Phrase: 玉葱
Romaji: tamanegi
Meaning: onion
Example: 玉葱は料理の味を引き立てるのにとても役立ち、特に煮込み料理や炒め物に欠かせない食材です tamanegi wa ryōri no aji o hikitateteru no ni totemo yakudachi, tokuni nikomi ryōri ya itame mono ni kakasenai shokuzai desu (Onions are very helpful in enhancing the flavor of dishes and are indispensable ingredients, especially in stews and stir-fries) このサラダには新鮮な玉葱を細かく刻んで加え、さわやかな風味と食感のアクセントに仕上げました kono sarada ni wa shinsen'na tamanegi o hosokaku kizande kuwae, sawayaka na fūmi to shokkan no akusento ni shiagemashita (For this salad, freshly chopped onions were finely minced and added to create a refreshing accent in both flavor and texture)

Word/Phrase: 初心者
Romaji: shoshinsha
Meaning: pemula
Example: 初心者の私でも、このレシピなら簡単に作れると思います shoshinsha no watashi demo, kono reshipi nara kantan ni tsukureru to omoimasu (Even though I’m a beginner, I think I can make this recipe easily) このゲームは初心者にも優しいので、ぜひ挑戦してみてください kono gēmu wa shoshinsha ni mo yasashii node, zehi chōsen shite mite kudasai (This game is beginner-friendly, so please give it a try)

Word/Phrase: 社会
Romaji: shakai
Meaning: masyarakat
Example: 社会は、一人一人が役割を果たしながら、助け合うことで成り立っている。例えば、公園の掃除や地域の行事など、小さな協力が積み重なって、住みよい環境が生まれる。 Shakai wa, hitori hitori ga yakuwari o hatashinagara, tasukeau koto de naritatte iru. Tatoeba, kōen no sōji ya chiiki no gyōji nado, chiisa na kyōryoku ga tsumikasanatte, sumiyoi kankyō ga umareru. (Society functions through each individual fulfilling their role and helping one another. For instance, small acts of cooperation like cleaning parks or participating in local events accumulate to create a comfortable living environment.) 学校の社会科では、私たちが生活する上で必要な知識を学ぶ。歴史や政治だけでなく、地域の特色や経済の流れを理解することで、将来、社会の一員として活躍できるようになる。 Gakkō no shakai-ka de wa, watashitachi ga seikatsu suru ue de hitsuyō na chishiki o manabu. Rekishi ya seiji dake de naku, chiiki no tokushoku ya keizai no nagare o rikai suru koto de, shōrai, shakai no ichiin toshite katsuyaku dekiru yō ni naru. (In social studies at school, we learn essential knowledge for daily life. By understanding not only history and politics but also local characteristics and economic trends, we can become active members of society in the future.)

Word/Phrase: 先輩
Romaji: senpai
Meaning: senpai
Example: 先輩は大学でよく勉強を教えてくれましたので、難しい試験にも合格することができました Senpai wa daigaku de yoku benkyō o oshiete kuremashita node, muzukashii shiken ni mo gōkaku suru koto ga dekimashita (Because senpai often taught me how to study at university, I was even able to pass difficult exams) 先輩は仕事でいつも細かいところまで気を配って助けてくれるので、心から感謝しています Senpai wa shigoto de itsumo komakai tokoro made ki o kubatte tasukete kureru node, kokoro kara kansha shite imasu (I am truly grateful because senpai always helps me at work, paying attention to even the smallest details)

Word/Phrase: お年寄り
Romaji: otoshiyori
Meaning: elderly
Example: 公園の片隅で、お年寄りが笑顔で話し合っている光景は、この町の穏やかな日常を象徴しています kōen no katazumi de, o-toshiyori ga egao de hanashiatte iru kōkei wa, kono machi no odayaka na nichijō o shōchō shite imasu (In a corner of the park, the sight of elderly people chatting with smiles symbolizes the peaceful daily life of this town) 健康を第一に考える家族は、お年寄りが安心して暮らせるよう、食事や検診の計画を立てています kenkō o daiichi ni kangaeru kazoku wa, o-toshiyori ga anshin shite kuraseru yō, shokuji ya kenshin no keikaku o tatete imasu (Families who prioritize health make plans for meals and check-ups so that the elderly can live with peace of mind)

Word/Phrase: 政府
Romaji: seifu
Meaning: government
Example: 政府が国民の声を政策に反映させようと、先月実施したアンケートの集計結果が公表され、そのデータをもとに来年度の予算案が検討されている。 Seifu ga kokumin no koe o seisaku ni han'ei saseyō to, sengetsu jisshi shita ankēto no shūkei kekka ga kōhyō sare, sono dēta o moto ni rai nendo no yosan'an ga kentō sarete iru. (The government published the results of last month's survey aimed at reflecting citizens' voices in policy, and is now deliberating next year's budget based on that data.) 環境問題に取り組む新法が施行されてから1年、政府は市民の協力を得て、リサイクル率の向上や再生エネルギーの普及など、具体的な成果が現れ始めていると報告した。 Kankyō mondai ni torikumu shinpō ga shikō sarete kara ichi-nen, seifu wa shimin no kyōryoku o ete, risaikuru-ritsu no kōjō ya saisei enerugī no fukyū nado, gutaiteki na seika ga araware hajime te iru to hōkoku shita. (One year after the new environmental law was enforced, the government reported that tangible results—such as improved recycling rates and expanded renewable energy—are emerging through citizen cooperation.)

Word/Phrase: 教徒
Romaji: kyouto
Meaning: believer
Example: この町で長年続けられている日曜日の集まりは、教徒たちが信仰を分かち合い、互いの生活を支え合う貴重な時間となっている。 kono machi de naganen tsudukarete iru nichiyōbi no atsumari wa, kyōto-tachi ga shinkō o wakachi-ai, tagai no seikatsu o sasae-au kichō na jikan to natte iru. (The Sunday gatherings held in this town for many years have become a precious time for believers to share their faith and support each other’s lives.) 教徒の多いこの地域では、信仰に基づくボランティア活動が盛んで、特に高齢者の支援や子どもの学習サポートが積極的に行われている。 kyōto no ōi kono chiiki de wa, shinkō ni motoduku borantia katsudō ga sakande, tokuni kōreisha no shien ya kodomo no gakushū sapōto ga sekkyoku-teki ni okonawarete iru. (In this area with many believers, faith-based volunteer activities thrive, with active support for the elderly and children’s learning.)

Word/Phrase: 姉
Romaji: ane
Meaning: older sis
Example: 姉は毎日学校から帰ると、すぐに宿題を始めます。でも、時々テレビを見ながら勉強することもあります。 Ane wa mainichi gakkō kara kaeru to, sugu ni shukudai o hajimemasu. Demo, tokidoki terebi o minagara benkyō suru koto mo arimasu. (My older sister always starts her homework as soon as she gets home from school, but sometimes she also studies while watching TV.) 姉は勉強が好きで、いつも真面目に取り組んでいます。特に数学の問題を解くときは、誰よりも集中して時間を忘れてしまうほどです。 Ane wa benkyō ga suki de, itsumo majime ni torikumonde imasu. Toku ni suugaku no mondai o toku toki wa, dare yori mo shūchū shite jikan o wasurete shimau hodo desu. (My older sister loves studying and always approaches it seriously—especially when solving math problems, she concentrates more than anyone else and even loses track of time.)

Word/Phrase: 兄
Romaji: ani
Meaning: older bro
Example: 小学生のときから勉強家で知られる兄は、学校の課題に加え、来週の試験範囲を先取りするため、図書館で夜遅くまで机に向かっている。 Shōgakusei no toki kara benkyōka de shirareru ani wa, gakkō no kadai ni kuwae, raishū no shiken hani o sakidori suru tame, toshokan de yoru osoku made tsukue ni mukatte iru. (My older brother, known for being studious since elementary school, stays at the library late into the night working on school assignments and getting ahead on next week’s exam material.) 兄が教えてくれた「問題を解く前に全体を読む」という方法を実践してから、テストでのケアレスミスが減り、成績表に明らかな変化が現れた。 Ani ga oshiete kureta "mondai o toku mae ni zentai o yomu" to iu hōhō o jissen shite kara, tesuto de no kearesumisu ga heri, seisekihyō ni akaraka na henka ga arawareta. (Since I started practicing the method my brother taught me—“read the entire problem before solving it”—careless mistakes on tests have decreased, and my report card shows noticeable improvement.)

Word/Phrase: 長男
Romaji: chounan
Meaning: eldest son
Example: 家族の期待を一身に受け、東大医学部に合格した長男の田中さんでしたが、芸術への情熱を捨てきれず、親の反対を押し切り渡米を決意しました Kazoku no kitai o isshin ni uke, Tōdai igakubu ni gōkaku shita chōnan no Tanaka-san deshita ga, geijutsu e no jōnetsu o sutekirezuni, oya no hantai o oshikiri tobē o ketsui shimashita (Though Tanaka, the eldest son, had passed the University of Tokyo’s medical school with his family’s full expectations on his shoulders, he could not abandon his passion for art and resolved to go to America despite his parents’ opposition) 家業を継ぐべき長男としての重圧に悩みながらも、海外留学で得た経験が彼の視野を広げ、父との対話を通じてようやく自分の道を切り開く勇気を手にしました Kagyō o tsugu beki chōnan to shite no jūatsu ni nayaminagara mo, kaigai ryūgaku de eta keiken ga kare no shiya o hiroge, chichi to no taiwa o tsūjite yōyaku jibun no michi o kirihiraku yūki o te ni shimashita (While struggling under the heavy burden of being the eldest son expected to take over the family business, the experiences he gained studying abroad broadened his perspective, and through dialogue with his father, he finally found the courage to forge his own path)

Word/Phrase: 代表
Romaji: daihyou
Meaning: representative
Example: このチームの代表は、メンバー全員の意見を聞いた上で、最も合理的な解決策を提案し、皆が納得できるよう努めている Kono chīmu no daihyō wa, menbā zen'in no iken o kiita ue de, motto gōriteki na kaiketsusaku o teian shi, mina ga nattoku dekiru yō tsutomete iru (Perwakilan tim ini, setelah mendengarkan pendapat semua anggota, berusaha mengajukan solusi paling rasional agar semua bisa menerima) 企業の代表として、彼は国際会議で自社の技術革新を紹介し、海外パートナーとの協力関係強化に積極的に取り組んでいる Kigyō no daihyō to shite, kare wa kokusai kaigi de jisha no gijutsu kakushin o shōkai shi, kaigai pātonā to no kyōryoku kankei kyōka ni sekkyokuteki ni torikumonde iru (Sebagai perwakilan perusahaan, ia secara aktif memperkenalkan inovasi teknologi perusahaan dalam konferensi internasional dan berupaya memperkuat hubungan kerja sama dengan mitra asing)

Word/Phrase: 独身
Romaji: dokushin
Meaning: bujangan
Example: 独身の生活は自由だと思っていたけど、実はとても寂しい時もある dokushin no seikatsu wa jiyū da to omotteita kedo, jitsu wa totemo sabishī toki mo aru (At first, I believed living as a single person meant complete freedom, but in reality, there are moments when the loneliness becomes overwhelming) 独身の友達は、仕事や趣味に時間を使う人が多いが、中には将来のパートナー探しに積極的な人もいる dokushin no tomodachi wa, shigoto ya shumi ni jikan o tsukau hito ga ōi ga, naka ni wa shōrai no pātonā sagashi ni sekkyokuteki na hito mo iru (Many of my single friends dedicate their time to work or hobbies, but some are actively searching for a future partner)

Word/Phrase: 双子
Romaji: futago
Meaning: kembar
Example: 双子の兄はよく私に似ていて、よく間違えられますが、弟は全然違います futago no ani wa yoku watashi ni nite ite, yoku machigaeraremasu ga, otōto wa zenzen chigaimasu (The older twin brother looks very much like me, so people often mistake us, but the younger brother is completely different in both appearance and temperament) 双子の姉妹は同じ学校に通っていて、同じクラスにも所属していますが、趣味や将来の夢は全く異なっています futago no shimai wa onaji gakkō ni kayotte ite, onaji kurasu ni mo shozoku shite imasu ga, shumi ya shōrai no yume wa mattaku kotonatte imasu (The twin sisters attend the same school and are even in the same class, but their hobbies and dreams for the future are entirely different)

Word/Phrase: 義理の~
Romaji: giri no
Meaning: ~ ipar
Example: 義理の母は毎週日曜日に家に来て、手作りの料理をたくさん作ってくれます。 Giri no haha wa maishū nichiyōbi ni uchi ni kite, tezukuri no ryōri o takusan tsukutte kuremasu. (My stepmother comes to our house every Sunday and cooks many homemade dishes for us) 義理の家族との関係は、血の繋がりがない分、時には複雑でデリケートなものになります。 Giri no kazoku to no kankei wa, chi no tsunagari ga nai bun, tokini wa fukuzatsu de derikēto na mono ni narimasu. (The relationship with a stepfamily can sometimes become complicated and delicate because there is no blood connection.)

Word/Phrase: ご主人
Romaji: goshujin
Meaning: suami (orang lain)
Example: ご主人が会社から帰ってきた時、いつもお風呂の準備をして、温かい食事と一緒にお茶を淹れてあげます Goshujin ga kaisha kara kaette kita toki, itsumo ofuro no junbi o shite, atatakai shokujito issho ni ocha o irete agemasu (Ketika suami pulang dari kantor, saya selalu menyiapkan bak mandi, serta menyajikan teh bersama makanan hangat untuknya) ご主人の誕生日が来週なので、今日デパートへ行って、ネクタイと好きなコロンのプレゼントを選びました Goshujin no tanjōbi ga raishū nano de, kyō depāto e itte, nekutai to suki na koron no purezento o erabimashita (Karena ulang tahun suami minggu depan, hari ini saya pergi ke toko serba ada dan memilih dasi serta parfum kesukaannya sebagai hadiah)

Word/Phrase: 犯人
Romaji: hannin
Meaning: criminal
Example: 犯人はまだ捕まっていないので、警察は関連する証拠を集めながら、広範囲にわたる捜査を継続しています hannin wa mada tsukamatte inai node, keisatsu wa kanren suru shōko o atsumenagara, kōhan'i ni wataru sōsa o keizoku shite imasu (Since the criminal hasn’t been caught yet, the police are continuing their extensive investigation while gathering related evidence) 犯人を特定するため、目撃者の詳細な証言と監視カメラの映像が捜査の鍵となっています hannin o tokutei suru tame, mokugekisha no shōsai na shōgen to kanshi kamera no eizō ga sōsa no kagi to natte imasu (To identify the criminal, the detailed testimonies of witnesses and surveillance camera footage have become crucial to the investigation)

Word/Phrase: 姫
Romaji: hime
Meaning: princess
Example: 昔からこの国に伝わる話によると、姫は誰にでも優しく、困っている人を見ると、自分のことより先に手を差し伸べたそうです Mukashi kara kono kuni ni tsutawaru hanashi ni yoruto, hime wa dare ni demo yasashiku, komatteiru hito o miru to, jibun no koto yori saki ni te o sashinobeta sou desu (According to a story passed down in this country since ancient times, the princess was kind to everyone, and whenever she saw someone in trouble, she would help them before thinking of herself) 城の庭で姫が一年をかけて育てた花は、春の桜、夏の向日葵、秋のコスモス、冬のスノードロップと、季節ごとに人々の心を和ませています Shiro no niwa de hime ga ichinen o kakete sodateta hana wa, haru no sakura, natsu no himawari, aki no kosumosu, fuyu no sunōdoroppu to, kisetsugoto ni hitobito no kokoro o yasumasete imasu (The flowers the princess cultivated over the course of a year in the castle garden—cherry blossoms in spring, sunflowers in summer, cosmos in autumn, and snowdrops in winter—soothe people’s hearts with each changing season)

Word/Phrase: 妹
Romaji: imouto
Meaning: younger sis
Example: 私たちの家では、妹が朝食の準備を担当していて、毎朝家族のためにパンや卵を用意してくれますが、焦げた匂いが台所に漂うことも珍しくありません。 Watashitachi no ie de wa, imōto ga chōshoku no junbi o tantō shite ite, maiasa kazoku no tame ni pan ya tamago o youi shite kuremasu ga, kogeta nioi ga daidokoro ni tadayou koto mo mezurashiku arimasen. (In our household, my younger sister is in charge of preparing breakfast, making toast and eggs for the family every morning, but it’s not uncommon for the smell of burnt food to linger in the kitchen.) 妹は誰よりも早く起きて朝食を作るので、私たちは毎朝温かい食事を食べられますが、時々黒くなったパンを見つけ、冷蔵庫の奥に隠してある予備の食材を使うことになります。 Imōto wa dare yori mo hayaku okite chōshoku o tsukuru node, watashitachi wa maiasa atatakai shokujī o taberaremasu ga, tokidoki kuroku natta pan o mitsuke, reizōko no oku ni kakushite aru yobi no shokuzai o tsukau koto ni narimasu. (My younger sister wakes up earlier than anyone to make breakfast, so we get to eat a warm meal every morning, but sometimes we find burnt toast and end up using the spare ingredients hidden in the back of the fridge.)

Word/Phrase: 従兄弟
Romaji: itoko
