Meaning: cousin
Example: 小学生の頃、よく従兄弟と近所の川で魚を捕まえては、おばさんの家で一緒に焼いて食べたものだ。 shōgakusei no koro, yoku itoko to kinjo no kawade sakana o tsukamaete wa, obasan no ie de issho ni yaite tabeta monoda. (When I was in elementary school, I often caught fish in the river near my cousin’s house, and we’d all grill and eat them together at my aunt’s place.) 従兄弟が大学受験に失敗したと聞いた時、一緒に勉強した夜を思い出し、励ましのメールを送った。 itoko ga daigaku juken ni shippai shita to kiita toki, issho ni benkyō shita yoru o omoidashi, hagemashi no mēru o okutta. (When I heard my cousin failed his university entrance exams, I remembered the nights we studied together and sent him an encouraging email.)

Word/Phrase: 上司
Romaji: joushi
Meaning: boss
Example: 会社で働く田中さんは、上司から急な指示を受けた。書類の対応が遅れると、今日の夕方までに提出できないため、焦りながら作業を始めた。 Tanaka-san wa kaisha de hataraku ga, jōshi kara kyū na shiji o uketa. Shorui no taiō ga okurete wa, kyō no yūgata made ni teishutsu dekinai tame, aseri nagara sagyō o hajimeta. (While working at the company, Tanaka received an urgent instruction from his boss. Since delaying the document response would prevent submission by evening, he began working anxiously.) 上司は部下に、明日発表するプレゼンテーションの準備を細かく確認した。最新データの活用と、クライアントの質問に備えた資料作りを忘れないよう、強く伝えた。 Jōshi wa buka ni, ashita happyō suru purezentēshon no junbi o komakaku kakunin shita. Saishin dēta no katsuyō to, kuraiento no shitsumon ni sonaeta shiryō-zukuri o wasurenai yō, tsuyoku tsutaeta. (The boss carefully checked the preparations for tomorrow’s presentation with his subordinate, strongly reminding him not to forget using the latest data and preparing materials for potential client questions.)

Word/Phrase: 住民
Romaji: juumin
Meaning: resident
Example: この町で暮らす住民たちは、朝の公園で体を動かすことから始まる規則正しい生活を、長年続けている人が多い。 Kono machi de kurasu juumin-tachi wa, asa no kōen de karada o ugokasu koto kara hajimaru kisoku tadashii seikatsu o, naganen tsuzuke te iru hito ga ōi. (Many residents in this town have maintained a disciplined lifestyle for years, starting each day with exercise in the morning park.) 住民会館で開かれるイベントは、地域の人々が自ら企画し、子どもから高齢者までが交流できる場として、皆に親しまれている。 Juumin kaikan de hiraka reru ibento wa, chiiki no hitobito ga mizukara kikaku shi, kodomo kara kōreisha made ga kōryū dekiru ba to shite, minna ni shitashima re te iru.

Word/Phrase: 会員
Romaji: kaiin
Meaning: anggota
Example: この図書館の会員は、新刊を優先的に借りられる特典がある一方で、返却期限を守らないと自動的に資格を停止されることもある。 kono toshokan no kaiin wa, shinkan o yūsen-teki ni karirareru tokuten ga aru ippō de, henkyaku kigen o mamoranai to jidō-teki ni shikaku o teishi sareru koto mo aru. (While members of this library enjoy the privilege of priority access to new releases, their membership may be automatically suspended if they fail to meet return deadlines.) スポーツクラブの会員であれば、会員証を提示するだけで、月１回の無料レッスンや設備の優先利用権が与えられるため、常に携帯するようにしている。 supōtsu kurabu no kaiin de areba, kaiinshō o teiji suru dake de, tsuki ichikai no muryō ressun ya setsubi no yūsen riyōken ga ataerareru tame, tsune ni keitai suru yō ni shite iru. (As a member of this sports club, simply presenting your membership card grants you one free lesson per month and priority use of facilities, which is why I always carry it with me.)

Word/Phrase: 係
Romaji: kakari
Meaning: PIC
Example: 受付係の田中さんは今日も笑顔でお客様を迎え、丁寧な対応で会社の評判を高めています Uketsuke-gakari no Tanaka-san wa kyō mo egao de o-kyakusama o mukae, teineina taiō de kaisha no hyōban o takame te imasu (Staf penerimaan Tanaka tidak hanya menyambut tamu dengan senyum setiap hari, tetapi juga meningkatkan reputasi perusahaan melalui pelayanannya yang sopan) 彼は新しいプロジェクト管理係に任命されてから、チームの生産性向上に積極的に取り組み、上司からも高く評価されています Kare wa atarashī purojekuto kanri-gakari ni ninmei sa rete kara, chīmu no seisansei jōjō ni sekkyoku-teki ni torikumi, jōshi kara mo takaku hyōka sa re te imasu (Sejak ditunjuk sebagai PIC pengelolaan proyek baru, dia aktif berkontribusi pada peningkatan produktivitas tim dan mendapatkan penilaian tinggi dari atasan)

Word/Phrase: 家族
Romaji: kazoku
Meaning: family
Example: 家族は毎日一緒にご飯を食べます。私たちは家族の時間を大切にしています kazoku wa mainichi issho ni gohan o tabemasu. watashitachi wa kazoku no jikan o taisetsu ni shite imasu (My family eats meals together every day, and we cherish the time we spend as a family) 家族の写真を見ると、旅行や誕生日など、幸せな思い出がたくさん浮かびます kazoku no shashin o miru to, ryokō ya tanjōbi nado, shiawase na omoide ga takusan ukabimasu (When I look at family photos, many happy memories like trips and birthdays come to mind)

Word/Phrase: 貴様
Romaji: kisama
Meaning: you bastard
Example: 貴様のような人間は、この世界から消えてしまえばいい kisama no yō na ningen wa, kono sekai kara kiete shimaeba ii (You bastard and people like you should just disappear from this world) 貴様の行動は、誰も許さないぞ kisama no kōdō wa, dare mo yurusanai zo (No one will ever forgive your actions, you bastard)

Word/Phrase: 恋人
Romaji: koibito
Meaning: pacar
Example: 恋人は毎日私に手紙を書いてくれます その手紙はとても優しくて、私の心を温かくします koibito wa mainichi watashi ni tegami o kaite kuremasu sono tegami wa totemo yasashikute, watashi no kokoro o atatakaku shimasu (My lover writes me a letter every day, and those gentle words always warm my heart deeply) 恋人と一緒に美術館で過ごした午後は、時間があっという間に過ぎていきました koibito to issho ni bijutsukan de sugoshita gogo wa, jikan ga attōiu ma ni sugite ikimashita (Spending the afternoon with my lover at the art museum made time fly by in an instant)

Word/Phrase: 国民
Romaji: kokumin
Meaning: rakyat
Example: 日本の国民が持つ権利の一つに、法律作りへの参加があり、政府はその声に耳を傾けるため、全国で意見交換の場を設けている。 Nihon no kokumin ga motsu kenri no hitotsu ni, hōritsu-zukuri e no sanka ga ari, seifu wa sono koe ni mimi o katamukeru tame, zenkoku de iken kōkan no ba o motte iru. (One of the rights held by the Japanese people is participation in lawmaking, and to listen to their voices, the government creates opportunities for exchanging opinions nationwide.) 選挙で代表を選ぶ権利は憲法で守られているが、最近の国民、特に若者の投票離れが深刻化し、社会全体の課題となっている。 Senkyo de daihyō o erabu kenri wa kenpō de mamorarete iru ga, saikin no kokumin, tokuni wakamono no tōhyō-banare ga shinkokuka shi, shakai zentai no kadai to natte iru. (While the right to elect representatives is protected by the constitution, the growing disinterest in voting among citizens—especially the youth—has become a societal challenge.)

Word/Phrase: 客
Romaji: kyaku
Meaning: customer
Example: 客が店に入ってきた時、店員はすぐに「いらっしゃいませ」と挨拶をし、テーブルへ案内しました kyaku ga mise ni haitte kita toki, ten'in wa sugu ni "irasshaimase" to aisatsu o shi, tēburu e annai shimashita (When the customer entered the store, the staff immediately greeted them with "Welcome" and guided them to a table) 客はメニューを見ながら、どの料理を注文すればいいのか、アレルギーの有無も確認しつつ迷っていました kyaku wa menyū o mi nagara, dono ryōri o chūmon sureba ii no ka, arerugī no umu mo kakunin shitsutsu mayotte imashita (The customer was looking at the menu, hesitating over what dish to order while also checking for allergies)

Word/Phrase: 兄弟
Romaji: kyoudai
Meaning: siblings
Example: 兄弟は小さい頃から仲が良く、よく一緒に遊んだものだ kyōdai wa chiisai koro kara naka ga yoku, yoku issho ni asonda mono da (My siblings and I have been close since childhood, and we often played together) 兄弟の一人は大学に進学し、もう一人は社会人として働き始めた kyōdai no hitori wa daigaku ni shingaku shi, mō hitori wa shakaijin toshite hatarakihajimeta (One of my siblings went on to university, while the other started working as a full-time employee)

Word/Phrase: 教授
Romaji: kyouju
Meaning: professor
Example: 教授は大学で学生に高度な数学理論を教えながら、研究室では最先端の数学研究にも取り組んでいます Kyōju wa daigaku de gakusei ni kōdo na suugaku riron o oshienagara, kenkyūshitsu de wa saisentan no suugaku kenkyū ni mo torikunde imasu (The professor teaches advanced mathematical theories to students at the university while also engaging in cutting-edge mathematical research in the lab) 教授は長年にわたり学生から深く尊敬されており、その厳しくも温かい指導は多くの卒業生に影響を与え続けています Kyōju wa naganen ni watari gakusei kara fukaku sonkei sarete ori, sono kibishiku mo atatakai shidō wa ōku no sotsugyōsei ni eikyō o ataetsuzukete imasu (The professor has been deeply respected by students for many years, and their strict yet warm guidance continues to influence many graduates)

Word/Phrase: 孫
Romaji: mago
Meaning: cucu
Example: 孫は毎週日曜日に祖父母の家に遊びに来て、一緒に庭の手入れをしたり、昔の写真を見せてもらったりします。 Mago wa maishū nichiyōbi ni sofubo no ie ni asobi ni kite, issho ni niwa no teire o shitari, mukashi no shashin o misete morattari shimasu. (Every Sunday, the grandchild visits their grandparents' house to help with gardening and look at old family photos together.) 祖父母は孫が来るたびに、手作りの料理を用意し、昔話を聞かせながら、家族の歴史について教えています。 Sofubo wa mago ga kuru tabi ni, tezukuri no ryōri o yōi shi, mukashibanashi o kikase nagara, kazoku no rekishi ni tsuite oshiete imasu. (Whenever the grandchild visits, the grandparents prepare homemade meals, share old stories, and teach them about the family’s history.)

Word/Phrase: 迷子
Romaji: maigo
Meaning: lost kid
Example: 公園で迷子になった子供が泣いていて、近くの警察官に助けを求めました kōen de maigo ni natta kodomo ga naite ite, chikaku no keisatsukan ni tasuke o motomemashita (A lost child in the park was crying and asking a nearby police officer for help) その子は親から離れてしまい、とても心配そうに周りを見回していました sono ko wa oya kara hanarete shimai, totemo shinpai sō ni mawari o mimawashite imashita (The child had wandered away from their parents and was looking around anxiously, clearly very worried)

Word/Phrase: 姪
Romaji: mei
Meaning: niece
Example: 姪の結婚式は来月で、私は新しいドレスを探すために週末を使ってデパートへ行きました Mei no kekkonshiki wa raigetsu de, watashi wa atarashī doresu o sagasu tame ni shūmatsu o tsukatte depāto e ikimashita (My niece’s wedding is next month, so I spent the weekend shopping at a department store to find a new dress) 姪は大学を卒業して初めての仕事に就き、その成功を心から願っています Mei wa daigaku o sotsugyō shite hajimete no shigoto ni tsuki, sono seikō o kokoro kara negatte imasu (My niece just started her first job after graduating from university, and I sincerely wish for her success)

Word/Phrase: 皆
Romaji: minna
Meaning: everyone
Example: 皆さんが学校で熱心に授業を受け、質問し合っている間、先生は教室の外で静かに休憩を取っていました Minna-san ga gakkō de nesshin ni jugyō o uke, shitsumon shiatteru aida, sensei wa kyōshitsu no soto de shizuka ni kyūkei o totte imashita (While everyone was eagerly attending the lesson and asking each other questions, the teacher was quietly taking a break outside the classroom) 皆の意見を一つ一つ丁寧に聞き、メモを取った後、私たちはチーム全員の合意を得て新しい環境保護プロジェクトを正式に開始することに決定しました Minna no iken o hitotsu hitotsu teinei ni kiki, memo o totta ato, watashitachi wa chīmu zen'in no gōi o ete atarashī kankyō hogo purojekuto o seishiki ni kaishi suru koto ni kettei shimashita (After carefully listening to everyone’s opinions one by one and taking notes, we decided to officially launch our new environmental protection project with the full agreement of the entire team)

Word/Phrase: 人間
Romaji: ningen
Meaning: human
Example: 人間は時々、自分のことを考えすぎてしまい、それが原因で行動できなくなることもあります Ningen wa tokidoki, jibun no koto o kangaesugite shimai, sore ga gen'in de kōdō dekinakunaru koto mo arimasu (Humans sometimes overthink their own actions, which can even prevent them from taking action at all) 人間の心は複雑で、簡単に理解できないこともあり、その奥深さが人間関係を難しくしていることも少なくありません Ningen no kokoro wa fukuzatsu de, kantan ni rikai dekinai koto mo ari, sono okubukasa ga ningen kankei o muzukashiku shiteiru koto mo sukunaku arimasen (The human heart is complex, and its depth—difficult to easily understand—often makes interpersonal relationships challenging)

Word/Phrase: 甥
Romaji: oi
Meaning: nephew
Example: 近所の公園でボールを蹴っている元気な男の子は、私の甥で、毎週日曜日になれば、手作りのおやつを持って家にやって来ます。 Kinjo no kōen de bōru o keteru genki na otoko no ko wa, watashi no oi de, maishū nichiyōbi ni nareba, tezukuri no oyatsu o motte ie ni yatte kimasu. (The energetic boy kicking a ball in the neighborhood park is my nephew, who comes to my house every Sunday with homemade snacks.) 職場で宿題を見せに来るこの小学生は甥ですが、いつも楽しい話で周りの人を笑顔にさせる、本当に明るい子です。 Shokuba de shukudai o mise ni kuru kono shōgakusei wa oi desu ga, itsumo tanoshii hanashi de mawari no hito o egao ni saseru, hontō ni akarui ko desu. (This elementary school student who comes to my workplace to show his homework is my nephew, a truly cheerful child who always makes people around him smile with fun stories.)

Word/Phrase: 奥
Romaji: oku
Meaning: wife/interior
Example: この家の一番奥にある部屋は、祖父が集めた古い本や写真でいっぱいだ。誰もめったに来ないから、時間が止まったように静かだ kono ie no ichiban oku ni aru heya wa sofu ga atsumeta furui hon ya shashin de ippai da dare mo mettani konai kara jikan ga tomatta yō ni shizuka da (The room at the very back of this house is filled with old books and photos my grandfather collected. Since no one hardly ever comes, it’s as quiet as if time had stopped) 町から遠い奥の山では、人間がほとんど近づかないため、珍しい花や鳥が今も平和に暮らしている machi kara tōi oku no yama de wa ningen ga hotondo chikazukanai tame mezurashii hana ya tori ga ima mo heiwa ni kurashiteiru (In the mountains far from town, rare flowers and birds still live peacefully because humans rarely approach)

Word/Phrase: 奥さん
Romaji: okusan
Meaning: istri (orang lain)
Example: 奥さんは毎朝、お茶を入れてくれて、その温かみで一日の始まりがとても穏やかになります。 Oku-san wa maiasa, ocha o irete kurete, sono nukumide ichinichi no hajimari ga totemo odayaka ni narimasu. (My neighbor’s wife always makes tea in the morning, and her warmth makes the start of the day very peaceful.) 奥さんの手料理はどれも絶品で、特に週末に作るカレーは近所の人たちにも評判です。 Oku-san no te-ryōri wa dore mo zeppin de, tokuni shūmatsu ni tsukuru karē wa kinjo no hitotachi ni mo hyōban desu. (Every dish my friend’s wife cooks is exquisite, and her weekend curry is especially famous among the neighbors.)

Word/Phrase: 大家
Romaji: ooya
Meaning: landlord
Example: 大家は毎日学校で勉強し、その後友達と公園でサッカーをして楽しみます Ōya wa mainichi gakkō de benkyō shi, sono ato tomodachi to kōen de sakkā o shite tanoshimimasu (The landlord studies at school every day and then enjoys playing soccer with friends in the park) 大家は朝ごはんを家族と一緒に食べてから、自転車で学校に通っています Ōya wa asagohan o kazoku to issho ni tabete kara, jitensha de gakkō ni kayotte imasu (The landlord eats breakfast with the family every morning before commuting to school by bicycle)

Word/Phrase: 大勢
Romaji: oozei
Meaning: large crowd
Example: 公園の広場では、大勢の家族連れが集まり、それぞれが持ってきた手作りの料理を並べていた。子どもたちの走り回る声と、大人たちの和やかな話し声が混ざり合い、春の一日を彩っていた。 kōen no hiroba de wa, ōzei no kazokuzure ga atsumari, sorezore ga motte kita tezukuri no ryōri o narabete ita. kodomotachi no hashirimawaru koe to, otonatachi no nago-yaka na hanashigoe ga mazari ai, haru no ichinichi o irodotte ita. (In the park plaza, a large crowd of families had gathered, each laying out homemade dishes they had brought. The children’s running voices and the adults’ cheerful chatter blended together, filling a spring day with color.) 旅行の計画を立てるとき、いつも大勢のメンバーの希望を聞くのが難しい。しかし、みんなで話し合って決めた行先は、誰か一人では味わえないような、特別な楽しさを与えてくれるものだ。 ryokō no keikaku o tateru toki, itsumo ōzei no menbā no kibō o kiku no ga muzukashii. shikashi, minna de hanashiatte kimeta ikisaki wa, dareka hitori de wa ajiwaenai yō na, tokubetsu na tanoshisa o ataete kureru mono da. (When planning a trip, it’s always hard to consider the wishes of a large group. But the destinations chosen after everyone discusses together bring a special kind of joy that one could never experience alone.)

Word/Phrase: 大人
Romaji: otona
Meaning: adult
Example: 大人になると、いろいろな責任が増えてきますが、その分、自由も増えます otona ni naru to, iroiro na sekinin ga fuete kimasu ga, sono bun, jiyū mo fuemasu (When you become an adult, your responsibilities increase, but so does your freedom in return) 大人になる前に、親の言うことをよく聞いておいた方がいいですよ otona ni naru mae ni, oya no iu koto o yoku kiite oita hō ga ii desu yo (Before you grow up, it’s better to listen carefully to what your parents say, as it will help you later in life)

Word/Phrase: 弟
Romaji: otouto
Meaning: younger bro
Example: 弟は小さい頃からスポーツが好きで、毎日放課後に友達と公園でサッカーの練習をしていました Otouto wa chiisai koro kara supōtsu ga suki de, mainichi hōkago ni tomodachi to kōen de sakkā no renshuu o shite imashita (Since he was little, my younger brother loved sports and practiced soccer with his friends in the park every day after school) 弟は今医学部の大学生ですが、将来は海外で医療ボランティアとして働きながら、現地の人々の健康を支えたいと真剣に考えています Otouto wa ima igakubu no daigakusei desu ga, shōrai wa kaigai de iryō borantia toshite hatarakinagara, genchi no hitobito no kenkou o sasaetai to shinken ni kangaete imasu (My younger brother is now a medical student, and he seriously plans to work as a medical volunteer abroad in the future to support the health of local people)

Word/Phrase: 夫
Romaji: otto
Meaning: suami (sendiri)
Example: 夫は毎朝6時に起きて、コーヒーを飲みながら新聞を読むのが日課です otto wa maiasa roku-ji ni okite, kōhī o nomi nagara shinbun o yomu no ga nikka desu (Suaminya selalu bangun pukul 6 setiap pagi, minum kopi sambil membaca koran sebagai rutinitas hariannya) 夫の趣味は釣りで、週末にはよく海に行き、新鮮な魚を持ち帰って家族で食べます otto no shumi wa tsuri de, shūmatsu ni wa yoku umi ni iki, shinsen na sakana o mochikaette kazoku de tabemasu (Hobi suaminya adalah memancing, dan dia sering pergi ke laut pada akhir pekan untuk membawa pulang ikan segar yang kemudian dimakan bersama keluarga)

Word/Phrase: 労働者
Romaji: roudousha
Meaning: buruh
Example: 労働者は毎日長い時間働いていますが、給料が安いので大変です。特に夜勤の労働者は体調を崩しやすいです rōdōsha wa mainichi nagai jikan hataraite imasu ga, kyūryō ga yasui node taihen desu. Toku ni yakin no rōdōsha wa taichō o kuzushi yasui desu (Workers toil for extended hours daily, yet their meager salaries make life difficult, particularly for those on night shifts who often suffer from deteriorating health.) 労働者の権利を守るため、政府は新しい法律を制定し、労働環境の改善に取り組んでいます rōdōsha no kenri o mamoru tame, seifu wa atarashī hōritsu o seitei shi, rōdō kankyō no kaizen ni torikumunde imasu (To protect workers' rights, the government has enacted new laws and is actively working to improve labor conditions.)

Word/Phrase: 様
Romaji: sama
Meaning: tn.
Example: 山田様は毎朝七時までに出社されるため、部署の誰よりも早く仕事を始められます Yamada-sama wa maiasa shichiji made ni shussha sareru tame, busho no dare yori mo hayaku shigoto o hajimera remasu (Mr. Yamada arrives at the office by seven every morning, so he starts work earlier than anyone else in the department) 山田様がいつも丁寧に対応してくださるので、新入社員たちも安心して質問できます Yamada-sama ga itsumo teinei ni taiō shite kudasaru node, shinnyūshain-tachi mo anshin shite shitsumon dekimasu (Because Mr. Yamada always responds to everyone so politely, even new employees feel at ease asking questions)

Word/Phrase: 社会
Romaji: shakai
Meaning: society
Example: 社会は、一人ひとりの力が集まって初めて成り立つもので、助け合うことでよりよく機能する。 Shakai wa, hitori-hitori no chikara ga atsumatte hajimete naritatsu mono de, tasukeau koto de yori yoku kinō suru. (Society is something that functions better through mutual support, formed only when the strengths of each individual come together.) 会社や地域の活動では、自分の役割を果たしながら、他の人と協力することが社会の発展につながっている。 Kaisha ya chiiki no katsudō de wa, jibun no yakuwari o hatashinagara, hoka no hito to kyōryoku suru koto ga shakai no hatten ni tsunagatte iru. (In company and community activities, fulfilling one's role while cooperating with others contributes to the development of society.)

Word/Phrase: 姉妹
Romaji: shimai
Meaning: sisters
Example: 姉妹はよく一緒に買い物に行きます。姉は妹の服を選ぶのが好きで、妹は姉のアドバイスを信じています shimai wa yoku isshoni kaimono ni ikimasu. ane wa imōto no fuku o erabu no ga suki de, imōto wa ane no adobaisu o shinjite imasu (The sisters often go shopping together. The older sister enjoys picking out clothes for her younger sister, and the younger sister trusts her older sister’s advice.) 姉妹の関係はとても大切で、お互いに支え合い、困難な時も協力して乗り越えています shimai no kankei wa totemo taisetsu de, otagai ni sasaeai, kon'nan na toki mo kyōryoku shite norikoete imasu (The bond between sisters is very precious, as they support each other and work together to overcome difficult times.)

Word/Phrase: 新婦
Romaji: shinpu
Meaning: bride
Example: 新婦は白いドレスを着て、花嫁のベールが風にそよぎ、その純白の姿に参列者全員が息をのんだ shinpu wa shiroi doresu o kite, hanayome no bēru ga kaze ni soyogi, sono junpaku no sugata ni sanretsusha zen'in ga iki o nonda (Bride wore a white dress, and as the veil swayed in the wind, her pure white figure left all the guests breathless) 新婦の父は娘の結婚式でスピーチを行い、幼い頃の思い出を語りながら、幸せそうな新郎新婦の姿に胸を熱くした shinpu no chichi wa musume no kekkonshiki de supīchi o okonai, osanai koro no omoide o katari nagara, shiawase-sō na shinrō shinpu no sugata ni mune o atsuku shita (The bride’s father gave a speech at his daughter’s wedding, reminiscing about her childhood, and his heart swelled with warmth seeing the happy bride and groom)

Word/Phrase: 新郎
Romaji: shinrou
Meaning: groom
Example: 結婚式の前日、新郎は緊張でほとんど眠れませんでしたが、式当日、花嫁と目が合った瞬間、不思議と落ち着きを取り戻しました kekkonshiki no zenjitsu, shinrō wa kinchō de hotondo nemuremasen deshita ga, shiki tōjitsu, hanayome to me ga atta shunkan, fushigi to ochitsuki o torimodoshimashita (The night before the wedding, the groom was so nervous he could barely sleep, but on the day of the ceremony, the moment he met the bride’s eyes, he strangely regained his composure) 披露宴では、新郎が花嫁と手を取り合いながら、集まったゲスト一人ひとりに感謝の気持ちを伝え、会場を温かい雰囲気に包みました hiroen de wa, shinrō ga hanayome to te o toriainagara, atsumatta gesuto hitori-hitori ni kansha no kimochi o tsutae, kaijō o atatakai fun’iki ni tsutsumimashita (At the reception, the groom held the bride’s hand as they expressed gratitude to each guest, filling the venue with a warm atmosphere)

Word/Phrase: 親戚
Romaji: shinseki
Meaning: relatives
Example: 親戚の家を訪ねると、いつも祖母が作ってくれた手作りの菓子の甘い香りが玄関まで漂ってきて、心がほっこり和む瞬間だ shinseki no ie o tazunetaru to, itsumo sobo ga tsukutte kureta tezukuri no kashi no amai kaori ga genkan made tadayotte kite, kokoro ga hokkori yawaru shunkan da (Whenever I visit my relatives’ home, the sweet scent of homemade sweets my grandmother always prepares drifts all the way to the entrance, filling my heart with warmth in an instant) 地方に住む親戚と会うためには、新幹線からバスへと乗り換えなければならず、移動だけで半日を費やすこともあるので、事前の準備が欠かせない chihō ni sumu shinseki to au tame ni wa, shinkansen kara basu e to norikaenakereba naranaku, idō dake de han'nichi o tsuiyasu koto mo aru node, jizen no junbi ga kakasenai (To meet relatives living in rural areas, one must transfer from the bullet train to a bus, and the journey alone can take half a day, making prior preparation indispensable)

Word/Phrase: 祖母
Romaji: sobo
Meaning: grandma
Example: 祖母は毎週日曜日に私たちの家に来て、手作りのお菓子を焼いてくれるだけでなく、昔話も聞かせてくれます Sobo wa maishū nichiyōbi ni watashitachi no ie ni kite, tezukuri no okashi o yaite kureru dake de naku, mukashibanashi mo kikase te kuremasu (My grandmother not only comes to our house every Sunday to bake homemade sweets but also tells us old folktales) 祖母の作るクッキーやケーキは、近所の人たちにも評判で、よくおすそ分けを頼まれています Sobo no tsukuru kūki ya kēki wa, kinjo no hitotachi ni mo hyōban de, yoku osusowake o tanomarete imasu (The cookies and cakes my grandmother makes are so famous in the neighborhood that people often ask her to share some with them)

Word/Phrase: 祖父
Romaji: sofu
Meaning: grandpa
Example: 私たちの町にある小さな公園では、毎朝白い帽子をかぶった祖父が、鳥に餌をやりながらゆっくり歩いている姿が見られます。 watashitachi no machi ni aru chiisana kōen de wa, maiasa shiroi bōshi o kabutta sofu ga, tori ni esa o yari nagara yukkuri aruite iru sugata ga miraremasu. (In the small park in our town, you can see a grandfather in a white hat leisurely walking while feeding the birds every morning.) 祖父が子どものころに経験したことや、今では忘れられつつある風習について話してくれるので、その話に耳を傾けるたびに新しい発見があります。 sofu ga kodomo no koro ni keikenshita koto ya, ima de wa wasurareretsutsu aru fūshū ni tsuite hanashite kureru node, sono hanashi ni mimi o katamukeru tabi ni atarashī hakken ga arimasu. (Whenever my grandfather shares stories about his childhood experiences and customs that are gradually being forgotten today, I make new discoveries each time I listen carefully.)

Word/Phrase: 走者
Romaji: sousha
Meaning: runner
Example: マラソンで走者たちがゴールを目指す中、前方の選手は突然足を押さえ、苦しそうに立ち止まった。 marason de sōsha-tachi ga gōru o mezasu naka, zenpō no senshu wa totsuzen ashi o osae, kurushisō ni tachidomatta. (As the runners aimed for the finish line in the marathon, the leading athlete suddenly clutched their leg and stopped in pain.) 記録更新を目標に、走者は朝から夜までトレーニングを続け、体調管理にも気を配っている。 kiroku kōshin o mokuhyō ni, sōsha wa asa kara yoru made torēningu o tsuzuke, taichō kanri ni mo ki o kubatte iru. (Aiming to break the record, the runner continues training from morning to night while carefully managing their physical condition.)

Word/Phrase: 友達
Romaji: tomodachi
Meaning: friend
Example: 小学生のとき、毎週土曜日に近所の友達と公園でサッカーをしていました。その友達は今でも連絡を取り合っている、大切な存在です。 Shōgakusei no toki, mai-shū doyōbi ni kinjo no tomodachi to kōen de sakkā o shite imashita. Sono tomodachi wa ima demo renraku o toriai te iru, taisetsu na sonzai desu. (When I was in elementary school, I played soccer in the park every Saturday with a friend from my neighborhood. That friend is still someone I keep in touch with, an important presence in my life.) 先月、大学時代の友達が突然訪ねてきました。一緒に過ごした学生寮での思い出を話しながら、夜遅くまで語り明かしました。 Sengetsu, daigaku jidai no tomodachi ga totsuzen taznete kimashita. Issho ni sugoshita gakusei ryō de no omoide o hanashinagara, yoru osoku made katariakashimashita. (Last month, a friend from my university days suddenly came to visit. We talked about our memories from the dormitory we shared and stayed up late into the night reminiscing.)

Word/Phrase: 妻/家内
Romaji: tsuma/kanai
Meaning: istri (sendiri)
Example: 妻は今日、スーパーで買い物をしてから、夕ご飯の準備をしています tsuma wa kyō, sūpā de kaimono o shite kara, yūgohan no junbi o shite imasu (Istri saya hari ini pergi berbelanja di supermarket, lalu sekarang sedang menyiapkan makan malam) 家内は来週、実家に帰る前に大掃除をして、荷物の整理も済ませなければならないそうです kanai wa raishū, jikka ni kaeru mae ni ōsōji o shite, nimotsu no seiri mo sumasenakereba naranai sō desu (Kata isteri saya, sebelum pulang ke rumah orang tua minggu depan, dia harus membersihkan rumah secara besar-besaran dan juga merapikan barang-barang)

Word/Phrase: 都合がいい
Romaji: tsugou ga ii
Meaning: gak ada halangan (waktu)
Example: この時間なら、私にとって都合がいいです。仕事も休みで、ゆっくりできるからです Kono jikan nara, watashi ni totte tsugō ga ii desu. Shigoto mo yasumi de, yukkuri dekiru kara desu (At this time, it's convenient for me because I have a day off from work and can take my time to relax) 来週の会議は金曜日に変更になったので、私のスケジュール的に都合がいいです Raishū no kaigi wa kinyōbi ni henkō ni natta node, watashi no sukejūru-teki ni tsugō ga ii desu (The meeting next week has been rescheduled to Friday, which works well with my schedule)

Word/Phrase: 都合が悪い
Romaji: tsugou ga warui
Meaning: ada halangan (waktu)
Example: この時間は都合が悪いです。明日ならいつでも大丈夫です。 kono jikan wa tsugou ga warui desu. ashita nara itsudemo daijoubu desu. (Waktu ini tidak sesuai karena saya ada rapat penting, tetapi besok kapan saja saya bisa.)

Word/Phrase: 気分がいい
Romaji: kibun ga ii
Meaning: moodnya lagi baik
Example: 朝起きてカーテンを開けると、さわやかな風が入ってきたので、自然と気分がよくなった。 Asa okite kāten o akeru to, sawayaka na kaze ga haitte kita node, shizen to kibun ga yokunatta. (When I woke up and opened the curtains, a refreshing breeze came in, and naturally, my mood became good.) 仕事の前に公園で深呼吸をしながら歩いていたら、空気がきれいで、心も体も気分がよくなった。 Shigoto no mae ni kōen de shinkokyū o shinagara aruite itara, kūki ga kirei de, kokoro mo karada mo kibun ga yokunatta. (While taking deep breaths and walking in the park before work, the air was clean, and both my mind and body felt refreshed.)

Word/Phrase: ご苦労様です
Romaji: go kurou sama desu
Meaning: thanks for your hard work (atasan → bawahan)
Example: 今日もお仕事ご苦労様です 疲れていないですか 何か手伝えることがあれば遠慮なく言ってくださいね Kyō mo o-shigoto go-kurōsama desu. Tsukarete inai desu ka? Nanika tetsudaeru koto ga areba enryo naku itte kudasai ne. (Thank you for your hard work today as always. Are you not tired? Please don’t hesitate to let me know if there’s anything I can help with.) この長期プロジェクトは本当に大変だったでしょう ご苦労様です 皆さんの並々ならぬ努力のおかげで無事に成功を収めることができました Kono chōki purojekuto wa hontō ni taihen datta deshō. Go-kurōsama desu. Minna-san no naminanaranu doryoku no okage de buji ni seikō o osameru koto ga dekimashita. (This long-term project must have been extremely tough for you. Thank you for your hard work. Thanks to everyone’s extraordinary efforts, we managed to achieve success safely.)

Word/Phrase: お疲れ様です
Romaji: otsukare sama desu
Meaning: thanks for your hard work (setara/bawahan → atasan)
Example: 今日も一日お疲れ様です。仕事が大変だったと思いますが、明日も頑張ってくださいね Kyō mo ichinichi otsukare sama desu. Shigoto ga taihen datta to omoimasu ga, ashita mo ganbatte kudasai ne. (Thank you for your hard work today. I know the work was tough, but please keep it up tomorrow as well.) このプロジェクトは本当にお疲れ様でした。みんなの協力があったからこそ、無事に完成することができました Kono purojekuto wa hontō ni otsukare sama deshita. Minna no kyōryoku ga atta kara koso, buji ni kansei suru koto ga dekimashita. (Thank you all for your hard work on this project. It was truly everyone’s cooperation that allowed us to complete it successfully and safely.)

Word/Phrase: 申し訳ありません
Romaji: moshiwake arimasen
Meaning: sorry
Example: この度は大変ご迷惑をおかけしました。本当に申し訳ありません。 Kono tabi wa taihen go meiwaku o okake shimashita. Hontō ni mōshiwake arimasen. (I sincerely apologize for causing you so much trouble this time.) 申し訳ありませんが、急な用事ができてしまいましたので、今日は約束通りお会いすることができなくなりました。 Mōshiwake arimasen ga, kyūna yōji ga dekite shimaimashita node, kyō wa yakusoku dōri o ai suru koto ga dekinaku narimashita. (I’m very sorry, but something urgent came up, so I won’t be able to meet you as we promised today.)

Word/Phrase: x によると
Romaji: ni yoru to
Meaning: menurut x
Example: 最近の新聞記事によると、働く世代の6割以上が睡眠不足に悩み、 saikin no shinbun kiji ni yoru to, hataraku sedai no 6-wari ijō ga suimin busoku ni nayami, (According to a recent newspaper article, over 60% of the working generation suffers from sleep deprivation,) 特に都市部の20代から40代では、生活リズムの乱れが深刻化している。 toku ni toshi-bu no 20-dai kara 40-dai de wa, seikatsu rizumu no midare ga shinkokuka shite iru. 専門書によると、ストレスが続くと免疫力が低下し、病気にかかりやすくなる。 senmonsho ni yoru to, sutoresu ga tsuzuku to men’ekiryoku ga teika shi, byōki ni kakariyasuku naru. そのため、規則正しい生活とバランスの良い食事が推奨されている。 sono tame, kisoku tadashii seikatsu to baransu no yoi shokiji ga suishō sarete iru.

Word/Phrase: お邪魔します
Romaji: ojamashimasu
Meaning: maaf ganggu (dipake ketika masuk rumah orang)
Example: 家を訪れるときは、ドアを開ける前に「お邪魔します」と声をかけるのが、日本のマナーです。 Ie o otozureru toki wa, doa o akeru mae ni "ojamashimasu" to koe o kakeru no ga, nihon no manā desu. (When visiting someone’s home, it is Japanese etiquette to say "Excuse me for intruding" before opening the door.) 近所の人との付き合いが長いほど、「お邪魔します」の一言で、相手に安心感を与えることができます。 Kinjo no hito to no tsukiai ga nagai hodo, "ojamashimasu" no hitokoto de, aite ni anshinkan o ataeru koto ga dekimasu. (The longer your relationship with neighbors, the more a simple "Excuse me for coming over" can give them a sense of reassurance.)

Word/Phrase: ~という意味です
Romaji: to iu imi desu
Meaning: artinya ~
Example: 「希望」は将来への明るい気持ちを表す言葉で、目標に向かって進むときに使われることが多い。 「きぼう」は「心に光」という漢字の意味から、前向きな気持ちを表す。 (“Kibō” expresses a bright feeling toward the future and is often used when moving toward a goal. The kanji meaning “light in the heart” conveys a positive mindset.) 「勇気」は怖いことや難しいことに立ち向かう力で、強い心を持つ人を表す言葉だ。 「ゆうき」という漢字の意味は、心の強さを示している。 (“Yūki” is the strength to face scary or difficult things, a word describing someone with a strong heart. The kanji meaning shows inner strength.)

Word/Phrase: 拝啓
Romaji: haikei
Meaning: dengan hormat
Example: 拝啓の一文から始まる手紙は、相手への敬意を表すと同時に、 重要な用件があることを暗に伝えています。 haikei no bun kara hajimaru tegami wa, aite e no keii o arawasu to douji ni, juuyou na youken ga aru koto o an ni tsutaete imasu. (A letter beginning with "haikei" not only expresses respect to the recipient, but also subtly conveys that the matter at hand is of significance.) 先日の面談で伺った新規事業に関し、協力の可能性を探るため、 改めて拝啓の言葉と共に具体案を提示する。 senjitsu no mendan de ukagatta shinki jigyou ni kanshi, kyōryoku no kanōsei o saguru tame, aratamete haikei no kotoba to tomo ni gutaian o teiji suru. (Regarding the new venture discussed in the previous meeting, to explore potential collaboration, a concrete proposal is presented anew, accompanied by the formal greeting "haikei.")

Word/Phrase: 敬具
Romaji: keigu
Meaning: hormat saya
Example: 拝啓 時候の挨拶も兼ねてお手紙を差し上げております この度はプロジェクトの遂行にあたり、格別のご高配を賜り心より感謝申し上げます 今後とも変わらぬご指導のほどよろしくお願いいたします 敬具 Haikei jikō no aisatsu mo kanete otegami o sashiagete orimasu Konodo wa purojekuto no suikō ni atari, kakubetsu no go-kōhai o tamawari kokoro yori kansha mōshiagemasu Kongo tomo kawaranu go-shidō no hodo yoroshiku onegai itashimasu keigu (With seasonal greetings, I am writing this letter to express my sincere gratitude for your exceptional support during our project. I kindly ask for your continued guidance in the future. Respectfully yours) ビジネス文書や公的な書類の締めくくりに「敬具」を用いることで、 相手への敬意を表すと同時に、文章全体の礼儀正しさを保つ役割を果たします Kōjitsu na shokai no mōshikomi ni okeru tegami ni okete wa, aite e no keii o arawasu to dōji ni, bunshō zentai no reigi-tadashisa o tamotsu yakuwari o hatashimasu (In formal business letters or official documents, using "keigu" at the end not only shows respect to the recipient but also maintains the overall politeness of the writing.)

Word/Phrase: いくら+Vても
Romaji: ikura + v temo
Meaning: no matter how much v

(In this project, no matter how much the leader tried to explain the importance of the plan to the team members, they showed no interest, so he had no choice but to change the approach.) いくら新しい機械の取扱説明書を読んでも、細かい設定が分からず、結局メーカーのサポートに問い合わせることにした。 ikura atarashii kikai no toriatukai setsumeisho o yon demo, komakai settei ga wakaranaku, kekkyoku meikā no sapōto ni toiawaseru koto ni shita. (No matter how many times I read the new machine’s instruction manual, I couldn’t understand the detailed settings, so in the end, I decided to contact the manufacturer’s support.)

Word/Phrase: くれぐれも
Romaji: kureguremo
Meaning: sincerely, please be careful
Example: この薬は効き目が強い分、くれぐれも服用時間—朝食・夕食後30分以内—を守らないと、副作用のリスクが高まるため、アラーム設定を怠らないよう。 kono kusuri wa kikime ga tsuyoi bun, kureguremo fukuyō jikan—chōshoku/yūshoku-go sanjūppun inai—o mamoranai to, fukusayō no risuku ga takamaru tame, arāmu settei o okotaranai yō. (As this medicine is potent, failing to strictly adhere to the dosage times—within 30 minutes after breakfast and dinner—heightens the risk of side effects, so please be absolutely sure not to neglect setting an alarm.) 期限間際の提出は信用問題に直結するため、くれぐれも余裕を持って最終チェック—誤字脱字はもちろん、データの整合性まで—を行い、万全を期すべきだ。 kigen madogiwa no teishutsu wa shin’yō mondai ni chokusetsu suru tame, kureguremo yoyū o motte saishū chekku—goshi datsuj wa mochiron, dēta no seigōsei made—o okonai, banzenshiki o kisubeki da. (Since last-minute submissions directly impact credibility, you must sincerely conduct a thorough final check—covering not just typos but also data consistency—with time to spare to ensure perfection.)

Word/Phrase: えばよかった
Romaji: v eba yokatta
Meaning: should have v
Example: この本を読めばよかったと後悔していますが、もう時間がありません kono hon o yomeba yokatta to kōkai shite imasu ga, mō jikan ga arimasen (I regret not having read this book earlier, but now there’s no time left.) あの時もっと真剣に勉強すればよかったと、試験の結果を見て思いました ano toki motto shinken ni benkyō sureba yokatta to, shiken no kekka o mite omoimashita (Looking at my exam results, I thought I should have studied more seriously back then.)

Word/Phrase: それによって
Romaji: sore ni yotte
Meaning: as a result
Example: この都市では、2020年に新しい地下鉄網が整備されたが、 それによって、中心部へのアクセスが向上し、観光客の増加につながった。 Kono toshi de wa, 2020-nen ni atarashī chikatetsu-mō ga seibi sa re ta ga, sore ni yotte, chūshin-bu e no akusesu ga kōjō shi, kankōkyaku no zōka ni tsunagatta. (In this city, a new subway network was developed in 2020, as a result of which access to the downtown area improved, leading to an increase in tourists.) 先月発表された調査報告書によると、 それによって、リモートワークの普及が進み、働き方の多様化が進んだという。 Sengetsu happyō sa re ta chōsa hōkokusho ni yoru to, sore ni yotte, rimōto wāku no fukyū ga susumi, hatarakikata no tayōka ga sunda to iu. (According to the survey report released last month, as a result, the spread of remote work advanced, leading to greater diversity in working styles.)

Word/Phrase: にとって

Meaning: bagi

(For me, this job is one of the most important experiences in my life.) この決定は、チーム全員にとって大きな転機となるだろう。 kono kettei wa, chiimu zen'in ni totte ookina tenki to naru darou. (This decision will likely be a major turning point for everyone on the team.)

Word/Phrase: ため
Romaji: tame
Meaning: untuk

(To pass next month's exam, college student Yamada solves past problems in the library and studies with friends.) 近頃、健康を維持するため、サラリーマンの鈴木さんは昼休みに散歩をし、夜は早めに寝るように努めています。 Chikagoro, kenkō o ijisuru tame, sararīman no Suzuki-san wa hiruyasumi ni sanpo o shi, yoru wa hayame ni neru yō ni tsutomete imasu. (Recently, to maintain his health, office worker Mr. Suzuki takes walks during lunch breaks and tries to go to bed early at night.)

Word/Phrase: どして

Do you or your teacher often do the cleaning?) どして この 料理は そんなに おいしいのですか 材料は 普通なのに 秘密の 調味料でも 使っているのですか dōshite kono ryōri wa sonna ni oishī nodesu ka zairyō wa futsū na noni himitsu no chōmiryō demo tsukatte iru nodesu ka (Why is this dish so delicious? Meaning: jenis apa

Word/Phrase: どうやって

Word/Phrase: いつ

(When I first watched this movie, the director’s name caught my attention, so I immediately looked up who made it.) 友だちと話していて、その監督がどんな人か知りたくなったが、だれも詳しく知らなかった。 tomodachi to hanashite ite, sono kantoku ga donna hito ka shiritaku natta ga, dare mo kuwashiku shiranakatta. (While talking with friends, I wanted to know what kind of person that director is, but no one knew the details.)

Word/Phrase: 何

Meaning: what

(Although I found this book at the bookstore last week, I couldn’t quite understand the title on the cover, so I’m curious about what kind of content it has.) 友達が「何でも食べられる」と言っていましたが、実際に辛い料理や生魚を出したら、困った顔をしていました。 Tomodachi ga "nan demo taberareru" to itte imashita ga, jissai ni karai ryōri ya nama sakana o dashitara, komatta kao o shite imashita. (My friend said, "I can eat anything," but when I actually served spicy food and raw fish, they looked troubled.)

Word/Phrase: いかが

Have you decided on your order yet?) 先週観たこの映画はいかがでしたか？ストーリーの展開や出演者の演技は面白かったですか senshū mita kono eiga wa ikaga deshita ka? sutōrī no tenkai ya shutsuen-sha no engi wa omoshirokatta desu ka (How did you like this movie we watched last week? Also, please explain why you chose that product) この三つの旅行プランを見て、どれが一番興味がありますか。まだ決めかねているのですが kono mittsu no ryokō puran o mite, dore ga ichiban kyōmi ga arimasu ka? mada kimekanete iru no desu ga (Looking at these three travel plans, which one interests you the most? I’m still undecided)

Word/Phrase: いくつ
Romaji:
Meaning: how many

(In this restaurant's dessert menu, items like ice cream and pudding line up, and there are several types of cake alone.) 友達と話し合いながら、チョコレートケーキとイチゴケーキのどちらを注文するか、なかなか決められなかった。 Tomodachi to hanashiai nagara, chokorēto kēki to ichigo kēki no dochira o chūmon suru ka, nakanaka kimerarenakatta. (While discussing with friends, we couldn’t easily decide whether to order chocolate cake or strawberry cake.)

Word/Phrase: いくら

Word/Phrase: どの + benda

Meaning: which

(There were three books I found at the library, but I couldn’t easily decide which one to choose.) この棚に並んでいる本は全部、今月出版されたものです。どの本があなたの研究に役立つか、よく考えて選んでください。 Kono tana ni narande iru hon wa zenbu, kongetsu shuppan sareta mono desu. dono hon ga anata no kenkyū ni yakudatsu ka, yoku kangaete erande kudasai. (All the books lined up on this shelf were published this month. Think carefully about which one will be useful for your research.)

Word/Phrase: なぜ
Romaji:
Meaning: why
Example: 先生が昨日説明したプレゼンテーションがある日、 なぜ彼は欠席したのか、クラスメイトは心配そうに話し合った。 (kōshō ga kinō setsumei shita purezentēshon ga aru hi, naze kare wa kesseki shita no ka, kurasumeito wa shinpai sō ni hanashiatta.) (On the day of the presentation the teacher explained yesterday, classmates worriedly discussed why he was absent.) 計画も人材も十分だったのに、なぜこのプロジェクトは 期日までに完成できなかったのか、まだ誰にも分からない。 (keikaku mo jinzai mo jūbun datta noni, naze kono purojekuto wa kijitsu made ni kansei dekunakatta no ka, mada dare ni mo wakaranai.) (Even though the planning and personnel were sufficient, no one still understands why this project couldn’t be completed by the deadline.)

Word/Phrase: いくつ目
Romaji: ikutsume
Meaning: which, what number
Example: 電車に乗ったとき、目的地までに通る駅が何駅もあるので、どの駅で降りるか迷って、「いくつ目の駅で降りればいいですか」と聞きました。 densha ni notta toki, mokutekichi made ni tōru eki ga nani eki mo aru node, dono eki de oriru ka mayotte, "ikutsume no eki de orireba ī desu ka" to kikimashita. (When I got on the train, there were many stations to pass before my destination, so I was confused about where to get off and asked, "At which number station should I get off?") 問題集を手に取ったとき、最初からやるかどうか迷い、友達に「この問題集はいくつ目の問題から始めればいい？」と質問しました。 mondai-shū o te ni totta toki, saisho kara yaru ka dō ka mayoi, tomodachi ni "kono mondai-shū wa ikutsume no mondai kara hajimeba ī?" to shitsumon shimashita. (When I picked up the problem set, I was unsure whether to start from the beginning, so I asked my friend, "From which number question should I start in this problem set?")

Word/Phrase: 米国
Romaji: beikoku
Meaning: US
Example: 米国の大学はとても有名で、多くの学生が留学したいと考えていますが、費用が高くて難しいです Beikoku no daigaku wa totemo yūmei de, ōku no gakusei ga ryūgaku shitai to kangaete imasu ga, hiyō ga takakute muzukashii desu (American universities are very famous, and many students want to study abroad there, but the high tuition fees make it difficult to realize their dreams) 米国の文化は日本と違って、個人の自由が大切にされており、自己表現や多様性も重視される傾向があります Beikoku no bunka wa Nihon to chigatte, kojin no jiyū ga taisetsu ni sa rete ori, jiko hyōgen ya tayōsei mo jūshi sareru keikō ga arimasu (Unlike Japan, American culture highly values individual freedom, and there is also a strong tendency to emphasize self-expression and diversity)

Word/Phrase: 韓国

Word/Phrase: 中国
Romaji: chuugoku
Meaning: china
Example: 中国で特に人気のある北京ダックは、伝統的な調理法で作られ、皮のパリパリ感と肉のジューシーさが絶妙に調和している。 Chūgoku de tokuni ninki no aru Pekin Dakku wa, dentōteki na chōrihō de tsukurare, kawa no pari pari-kan to niku no jūshī-sa ga zetsumyō ni chōwa shite iru. (Among China’s most popular dishes, Peking Duck—prepared with traditional methods—perfectly balances its crispy skin and succulent meat.) 中国の書道や絵画は、長い歴史を持ち、墨を使った山水画は繊細な筆遣いと深い思想で世界中の人々を引きつけている。 Chūgoku no shodō ya kaiga wa, nagai rekishi o mochi, sumi o tsukatta sansuiga wa sensai na fudezukai to fukai shisō de sekai-jū no hitobito o hikitsukete iru. (Chinese calligraphy and painting, with their long history, captivate people worldwide—especially ink wash landscapes, which combine delicate brushwork with profound philosophical ideas.)

Word/Phrase: 中米

Word/Phrase: 東京
Romaji: tokyo
Meaning:

(Tokyo is known as one of the world’s leading metropolises, bustling with business district energy by day, while at night, the glow of neon lights envelops the entire city in a dreamlike atmosphere.) 東京の下町には古い商店街が残っており、地元の人々が日々の買い物を楽しみながら、伝統的な祭りが季節ごとに開催される。 Tōkyō no shitamachi ni wa furui shōtengai ga nokotteori, jimoto no hitobito ga nichijō no kaimono o tanoshiminagara, dentōteki na matsuri ga kisokigoto ni kaisai sareru. (In Tokyo’s old downtown areas, traditional shopping streets remain, where locals enjoy daily shopping while seasonal festivals celebrating age-old traditions are held.)

Word/Phrase: 京都
Romaji: kyoto
Meaning:

Word/Phrase: 千葉
Romaji: chiba
Meaning:

(Chiba Prefecture, located about an hour by train from Tokyo, is an area where many people want to live because it offers an escape from urban noise while being surrounded by nature.) 千葉県は海に近く、夏は海水浴、冬は温泉と四季折々の楽しみがあり、ディズニーランドや成田空港もあることから、観光客が絶えない人気スポットです。 Chiba-ken wa umi ni chikaku, natsu wa kaisuiyoku, fuyu wa onsen to shiki oriori no tanoshimi ga ari, Dizunīrando ya Narita Kūkō mo aru koto kara, kankōkyaku ga taenai ninki supotto desu. (Chiba, close to the sea, offers seasonal joys like swimming in summer and hot springs in winter, and with attractions like Disneyland and Narita Airport, it remains a constantly popular tourist destination.)

Word/Phrase: 英国
Romaji: eikoku
Meaning: uk
Example: 英国は多くの観光客が訪れる国で、古い城や美術館が今も残っており、歴史を感じさせます。 Eikoku wa ōku no kankōkyaku ga otozureru kuni de, furui shiro ya bijutsukan ga ima mo nokotte ori, rekishi o kanjisase masu. (The UK, a country visited by many tourists, still retains old castles and museums that evoke a sense of history.) ロンドンにあるビッグベンは、時間を知らせるだけでなく、英国の象徴として世界中に知られています。 Rondon ni aru Biggu Ben wa, jikan o shiraseru dake de naku, eikoku no shōchō to shite sekai-jū ni shirarete imasu. (Big Ben in London, beyond telling time, is known worldwide as a symbol of the UK.)

Word/Phrase: 国連
Romaji: kokuren
Meaning: UN
Example: 国連は1945年に設立され、戦争を防ぎ、人権を守るために世界中の国が協力する組織です。 Kokuren wa 1945-nen ni setsuritsu sare, sensō o fusegi, jinken o mamoru tame ni sekai-jū no kuni ga kyōryoku suru soshiki desu. (The UN was established in 1945 as an organization where countries worldwide cooperate to prevent war and protect human rights.) 国連の活動には、貧困削減や教育支援など、持続可能な開発目標の達成も含まれています。 Kokuren no katsudō ni wa, hinkon sakugen ya kyōiku shien nado, jizoku kanō na kaihatsu mokuhyō no tassei mo fukumarete imasu. (The UN’s activities also include achieving sustainable development goals, such as poverty reduction and educational support.)

Word/Phrase: 学位
Romaji: gakui
Meaning: gelar
Example: 大学で医者になるために勉強して学位を取得したいです Daigaku de isha ni naru tame ni benkyō shite gakui o shutoku shitai desu (I want to study at university and earn a degree because I want to become a doctor in the future) この大学の学位取得プログラムでは、専門分野の単位だけでなく、教養科目も多く履修しなければなりません Kono daigaku no gakui shutoku puroguramu de wa, senmon bun'ya no tan'i dake de naku, kyōyō kamoku mo ōku rishū shinakereba narimasen (In this university's degree program, you must complete not only specialized course credits but also many liberal arts subjects)

Word/Phrase: 文学
Romaji: bungaku
Meaning: sastra
Example: 文学を勉強すると、世界のいろいろな文化や考え方を知ることができ、人間の感情や歴史への理解も深まります Bungaku o benkyō suru to, sekai no iroirona bunka ya kangaekata o shiru koto ga deki, ningen no kanjō ya rekishi e no rikai mo fukamarimasu (Studying literature allows you to learn about diverse cultures and ways of thinking, while also deepening your understanding of human emotions and history) 文学の名作に触れるたび、自分の価値観が揺さぶられ、新たな視点で物事を見つめ直すきっかけになります Bungaku no meisaku ni fureru tabi, jibun no kachikan ga yusaburare, arata na shiten de monogoto o mitsumenaosu kikkake ni narimasu (Each time you encounter a literary masterpiece, your values are shaken, giving you an opportunity to re-examine things from a fresh perspective)

Word/Phrase: 文化
Romaji: bunka
Meaning: budaya
Example: 日本の文化はとても豊かで、伝統的な祭りや美しい芸術作品がたくさんあります Nihon no bunka wa totemo yutaka de, dentōteki na matsuri ya utsukushī geijutsu sakuhin ga takusan arimasu (Japanese culture is incredibly rich, filled with traditional festivals and breathtaking works of art that reflect centuries of heritage) この文化を学ぶことで、日本人の考え方や歴史を深く理解でき、現代社会におけるその影響も見えてきます Kono bunka o manabu koto de, Nihonjin no kangaekata ya rekishi o fukaku rikai deki, gendai shakai ni okeru sono eikyō mo miete kimasu (By studying this culture, you can deeply understand the Japanese way of thinking and history, while also recognizing its influence on modern society)

Word/Phrase: 物理
Romaji: butsuri
Meaning: fisika
Example: 物理の授業では、力やエネルギーの仕組みを詳しく分析し、自然界の法則を理解するために努力します Butsuri no jugyō de wa, chikara ya enerugī no shikumi o kuwashiku bunseki shi, shizenkai no hōsoku o rikai suru tame ni doryoku shimasu (In physics class, we carefully analyze the mechanisms of force and energy and strive to understand the laws of nature) 物理の実験では、仮説を立てた後、実際に装置を操作してデータを収集し、理論の正しさを検証します Butsuri no jikken de wa, kasetsu o tate ta go, jissai ni sōchi o sōsa shite dēta o shūshū shi, riron no tadashisa o kenshō shimasu (In physics experiments, after forming a hypothesis, we operate equipment to collect data and verify the correctness of the theory)

Word/Phrase: 地理
Romaji: chiri
Meaning: geography
Example: 日本の地理は複雑で、山地が多く、季節ごとに気候も大きく変化するため、研究する価値があります。 Nihon no chiri wa fukuzatsu de, sanchi ga ōku, kisetsugoto ni kikō mo ōkiku henka suru tame, kenkyū suru kachi ga arimasu. (Japan's geography is complex, with many mountainous regions and significant climate changes by season, making it worth studying.) 例えば、北海道の広大な平野は農業に適している一方、沖縄のサンゴ礁に囲まれた島々は独特の生態系を持っています。 Tatoeba, Hokkaidō no kōdai na heiya wa nōgyō ni tekishiteiru ippō, Okinawa no sangosho ni kakomareta shimajima wa dokutoku no seitaikei o motte imasu. (For example, Hokkaido's vast plains are suitable for agriculture, while Okinawa's coral-reef-surrounded islands have a unique ecosystem.)

Word/Phrase: 地質
Romaji: chishitsu
Meaning: geology
Example: 地質調査の結果、この地域は地震に弱い地質構造を持っていることが分かりました chishitsu chōsa no kekka, kono chiiki wa jishin ni yowai chishitsu kōzō o motte iru koto ga wakarimashita (The results of the geological survey revealed that this region has a geological structure highly susceptible to seismic activity due to its unstable fault lines and sediment composition) この山の地質は数百万年にわたる火山活動の影響を強く受けており、独特の鉱物層と地層の変化が観察されます kono yama no chishitsu wa sūhyakuman'nen ni wataru kazankatsudō no eikyō o tsuyoku ukete ori, dokutoku no kōbutsu-sō to chisō no henka ga kansoku saremasu (The geology of this mountain has been profoundly shaped by millions of years of volcanic activity, resulting in distinctive mineral deposits and visible stratigraphic transformations that provide insights into its dynamic geological history)

Word/Phrase: 伝説
Romaji: densetsu
Meaning: legend
Example: 伝説によると、この森には不思議な力を持つ動物が住んでおり、夜になると青白く光る姿が目撃されるそうです Densetsu ni yoruto, kono mori ni wa fushigi na chikara o motsu dōbutsu ga sunde ori, yoru ni naru to aojiroku hikaru sugata ga mokugeki sareru sō desu (According to legend, this forest is home to animals with mysterious powers, and their bluish-glowing figures are said to be witnessed at night) この伝説は、村の祖先たちが何世紀にもわたって守り続けてきた口承文芸の一部であり、今も祭りの際に語り継がれています Kono densetsu wa, mura no sosentachi ga nan-seiki ni mo watatte mamori tsudukete kita kōshō bungei no ichibu de ari, ima mo matsuri no sai ni kataritsugarete imasu (This legend is part of the oral literature that the village ancestors preserved for centuries, and it continues to be passed down during festivals even today)

Word/Phrase: 土木
Romaji: doboku
Meaning: civil eng
Example: 土木の仕事に携わる人は、橋や道路を作るだけでなく、災害で壊れた町を元に戻す仕事もしています doboku no shigoto ni kakawaru hito wa, hashi ya dōro o tsukuru dake de naku, saigai de kowareta machi o moto ni modosu shigoto mo shite imasu (Those involved in civil engineering not only build bridges and roads but also restore towns damaged by disasters) 土木の現場で働く時、安全のためのルールを守ることは、自分だけでなく周りの人の命を守ることにもつながります doboku no genba de hataraku toki, anzen no tame no rūru o mamoru koto wa, jibun dake de naku mawari no hito no inochi o mamoru koto ni mo tsunagari masu (When working at a civil engineering site, following safety rules protects not only yourself but also the lives of those around you)

Word/Phrase: 独学
Romaji: dokugaku
Meaning: self-study
Example: 日本語を独学で学んでいる人は、辞書や参考書を使いながら、難しい文法や言葉の細かい違いを一つ一つ克服していくことで、着実に力をつけていくものだ。 Nihongo o dokugaku de manande iru hito wa, jisho ya sankosho o tsukainagara, muzukashī bunpō ya kotoba no komakai chigai o hitotsu hitotsu kokufuku shite iku koto de, chakujitsu ni chikara o tsukete iku mono da. (Those who study Japanese through self-study steadily build their skills by overcoming difficult grammar and subtle word differences one by one, using dictionaries and reference books.) 独学には、自分のペースで学べる自由がある一方で、計画を立てて続ける強い意志が求められるが、その分、目標を達成した時の喜びは格別なものとなる。 Dokugaku ni wa, jibun no pēsu de manaberu jiyū ga aru ichimen de, keikaku o tate tsuzukeru tsuyoi ishi ga motomerareru ga, sono bun, mokuhyō o tassei shita toki no yorokobi wa kakubetsu na mono to naru. (Self-study offers the freedom to learn at one’s own pace, but it also demands strong willpower to plan and persist—yet, precisely because of this, the joy of achieving one’s goals becomes extraordinary.)

Word/Phrase: 外科
Romaji: geka
Meaning: surgery
Example: 病院の外科チームは、夜を徹して難しい手術を行うこともあるが、患者の不安を和らげるため、常に笑顔で細かい質問にも親身に答えている。 byōin no geka chīmu wa, yoru o tesshite muzukashī shujutsu o okonau koto mo aru ga, kanja no fuan o yawarageru tame, tsune ni egao de komakai shitsumon ni mo shinmi ni kotaete iru. (The hospital’s surgical team sometimes performs difficult surgeries through the night, but to ease patients’ anxiety, they always respond warmly with smiles, even to the smallest questions.) 地域に根ざした外科クリニックでは、高齢者向けの手術後のケアに力を入れているだけでなく、若い医師の育成にも積極的に取り組んでいる。 chiiki ni nezashita geka kurinikku de wa, kōreisha-muke no shujutsu-go no kea ni chikara o irete iru dake de naku, wakai ishi no ikusei ni mo sekkyokuteki ni torikumonde iru. (The community-based surgical clinic not only focuses on postoperative care for the elderly but also actively trains young doctors.)

Word/Phrase: 法律
Romaji: houritsu
Meaning: law
Example: 法律は社会のルールを守り、全ての人が安全で平和な生活を送れるようにするために不可欠です。 Hōritsu wa shakai no rūru o mamori, subete no hito ga anzen de heiwa na seikatsu o okureru yō ni suru tame ni fukaketsu desu. (Law is essential for protecting society's rules and ensuring that everyone can live a safe and peaceful life.) 法律を守らない人は処罰の対象となります。そのため、私たちは社会の秩序を維持するために法律を遵守する責任があります。 Hōritsu o mamoranai hito wa sho-batsu no taishō to narimasu. Sono tame, watashitachi wa shakai no chitsujo o ijisuru tame ni hōritsu o jūnshu suru sekinin ga arimasu. (Those who do not obey the law are subject to punishment, so we have a responsibility to comply with the law to maintain social order.)

Word/Phrase: 医学
Romaji: igaku
Meaning: kedokteran
Example: 医学の進歩は人類の健康に大きな影響を与えており、平均寿命の延伸や疾病の克服に貢献しています Igaku no shinpo wa jinrui no kenkō ni ōkina eikyō o atae te ori, heikin jumyō no enshin ya shippitsu no kokufuku ni kōken shite imasu (Kemajuan dalam bidang kedokteran memberikan dampak besar terhadap kesehatan manusia, berkontribusi pada peningkatan harapan hidup dan pengatasan penyakit) この病院では最新の医学技術を駆使し、がんや難病の治療に取り組む専門医チームが患者の生活の質向上に努めています Kono byōin de wa saishin no igaku gijutsu o kushi shi, gan ya nanbyō no chiryō ni torikumu senmon'i chīmu ga kanja no seikatsu no shitsu jōjō ni tsutomete imasu (Rumah sakit ini memanfaatkan teknologi kedokteran terkini, di mana tim dokter spesialis berupaya meningkatkan kualitas hidup pasien melalui pengobatan kanker dan penyakit langka)

Word/Phrase: 化学
Romaji: kagaku
Meaning: chemistry
Example: 化学の実験室では、先生が危険な薬品を扱う際の注意点を繰り返し説明した後、生徒たちが正しい手順で実験を行えるよう、一つ一つ確認しながら指導した。 kagaku no jikkenshitsu de wa, sensei ga kiken na yakuhin o atsukau sai no chūi-ten o kurikaeshi setsumei shita ato, seito-tachi ga tadashī tetsuzuki de jikken o okonae ru yō, hitotsu hitotsu kakunin shinagara shidō shita. (In the chemistry lab, after the teacher repeatedly explained the precautions for handling dangerous chemicals, they guided the students step by step to ensure they could conduct the experiment correctly.) 化学の分野では、理論だけでなく実験を通して得られるデータが重要で、そのデータを分析することで、新しい発見や技術の開発につながることが多い。 kagaku no bun’ya de wa, riron dake de naku jikken o tōshite erareru dēta ga jūyō de, sono dēta o bunseki suru koto de, atarashī hakken ya gijutsu no kaihatsu ni tsunagaru koto ga ōi. (In the field of chemistry, not only theory but also the data obtained through experiments is crucial, and analyzing that data often leads to new discoveries and technological advancements.)

Word/Phrase: 科学
Romaji: kagaku
Meaning: science
Example: 科学の発展がもたらした技術革新は、日常の利便性を飛躍的に高めるだけでなく、未知の領域への探求を加速させている。 kagaku no hatten ga motarashita gijutsu kakushin wa, nichijō no ribensei o hiyakuteki ni takameru dake de naku, michi no ryōiki e no tankyū o kasoku sasete iru. (The technological innovations brought by scientific advancement not only dramatically enhance daily convenience but also accelerate the exploration of unknown realms.) 医療現場における科学の応用は、AI診断や個別治療法の開発を通じ、患者の生存率向上に直結する成果を次々と生み出している。 iryō genba ni okeru kagaku no ōyō wa, AI shindan ya kobetsu chiryōhō no kaihatsu o tsūji, kanja no seizonritsu kōjō ni chokketsu suru seika o tsugitsugi to umidashite iru.

Word/Phrase: 科目
Romaji: kamoku
Meaning: mapel
Example: 大学では、たくさんの科目がありますが、特に数学と英語は難しいです。 Daigaku de wa, takusan no kamoku ga arimasu ga, tokuni suugaku to eigo wa muzukashii desu. (At university, there are many subjects available, but especially mathematics and English are challenging for students.) 数学の科目は複雑な計算が多くて時間がかかり、英語の科目は細かい文法ルールが理解しづらいです。 Suugaku no kamoku wa fukuzatsu na keisan ga ookute jikan ga kakari, eigo no kamoku wa komakai bunpou ruuru ga rikai shizurai desu. (Math subjects require a lot of complex calculations that take time, while English subjects have intricate grammar rules that are difficult to grasp.)

Word/Phrase: 経済
Romaji: keizai
Meaning: ekonomi
Example: 経済の発展は国の力を強くしますが、同時にかなりの環境破壊や社会的な格差を引き起こすことがあります Keizai no hattten wa kuni no chikara o tsuyoku shimasu ga, dōji ni kanari na kankyō hakai ya shakaiteki na kakusa o hikiokosu koto ga arimasu (Economic development strengthens a country's power, but it can also cause significant environmental destruction and social inequality at the same time) 経済の成長は持続可能な未来を築くために不可欠ですが、その恩恵がすべての市民に公平に行き渡るよう、適切な政策と分配システムを整えることが同じくらい重要です Keizai no seichō wa jizoku kanō na mirai o kizuku tame ni fukaketsu desu ga, sono onkei ga subete no shimin ni kōhei ni ikiwataru yō, tekisetsu na seisaku to bunpai shisutemu o totonoeru koto ga onaji kurai jūyō desu (While economic growth is essential for building a sustainable future, it is equally important to establish proper policies and distribution systems to ensure its benefits reach all citizens fairly)

Word/Phrase: 工学
Romaji: kougaku
Meaning: engineering
Example: 工学の勉強は難しいけど、将来はロボットを作る仕事に就きたいです kōgaku no benkyō wa muzukashii kedo, shōrai wa robotto o tsukuru shigoto ni tsukitai desu (Studying engineering is challenging, but I aspire to work in robotics in the future because I want to create innovative machines) この大学では、工学と医学を組み合わせた研究が盛んです kono daigaku de wa, kōgaku to igaku o kumiawaseta kenkyū ga sakan desu (At this university, interdisciplinary research that integrates engineering and medicine is thriving, leading to groundbreaking advancements)

Word/Phrase: 音楽
Romaji: ongaku
Meaning: musik
Example: 音楽を聞きながら勉強するのはとても楽しいです。特にクラシック音楽を聴くと、集中力が高まります ongaku o kikinagara benkyō suru no wa totemo tanoshii desu. tokuni kurashikku ongaku o kiku to, shūchūryoku ga takamarimasu (Listening to music while studying is very enjoyable. Especially when I listen to classical music, my concentration improves) 音楽は私の生活にとても大切なものです。友達と一緒にライブに行くのが好きで、音楽を通じて多くの人と繋がれます ongaku wa watashi no seikatsu ni totemo taisetsu na mono desu. tomodachi to issho ni raibu ni iku no ga suki de, ongaku o tsūjite ōku no hito to tsunagaremasu (Music is very important in my life. I enjoy going to live concerts with friends, and it helps me connect with many people through music)

Word/Phrase: 歴史
Romaji: rekishi
Meaning: history
Example: その国で育まれた伝統が今も息づく背景には、千年を超える歴史があり、時代ごとの変遷が独特の美意識を形作っている。 Sono kuni de hagukumareta dentō ga ima mo ikizuku haikei ni wa, sennen o koeru rekishi ga ari, jidai-goto no hensen ga dokutoku no biishiki o katachizukutte iru. (The enduring traditions still thriving in this country are underpinned by a history spanning over a millennium, where each era’s transformations have sculpted a unique aesthetic sensibility.) 古文書や遺跡から読み解かれる歴史は、単なる過去の記録ではなく、現代の価値観や社会制度の起源を照らす鏡でもある。 Kobunsho ya iseki kara yomito kare ru rekishi wa, tan naru kako no kiroku de wa naku, gendai no kachikan ya shakai seido no kigen o terasu kagami de mo aru. (The history decoded from ancient documents and ruins is more than mere records of the past—it serves as a mirror illuminating the origins of modern values and social systems.)

Word/Phrase: 力学
Romaji: rikigaku
Meaning: mekanika
Example: 力学の勉強をしていると、物体の動きや力の働き方がよく分かってくる rikigaku no benkyō o shite iru to, buttai no ugoki ya chikara no hatarakikata ga yoku wakatte kuru (When you study mechanics, you gradually come to understand how objects move and the ways in which forces act upon them) 力学の原理を応用すれば、橋や建物の設計がより安全で効率的なものになる rikigaku no genri o ōyō sureba, hashi ya tatemono no sekkei ga yori anzen de kōritsuteki na mono ni naru (By applying the principles of mechanics, the design of bridges and buildings can become safer and more efficient)

Word/Phrase: 論文
Romaji: ronbun
Meaning: skripsi
Example: 大学の図書館で先週からの研究に役立つ論文を探しているうちに、関連する一節を見つけたものの、専門用語の多さに頭が痛くなってきた。 Daigaku no toshokan de senshū kara no kenkyū ni yakudatsu ronbun o sagashite iru uchi ni, kanren suru ichisetsu o mitsuketa mono no, senmon yōgo no ōsa ni atama ga itaku natte kita. (While searching for a thesis useful for my research since last week in the university library, I found a relevant passage, but the abundance of technical terms started giving me a headache.) この論文は、環境問題に関する最新の調査結果を基に、私たちのプロジェクトで必要なデータを具体的に示しているため、今後の分析作業が格段に進みそうだ。 Kono ronbun wa, kankyō mondai ni kansuru saishin no chōsa kekka o motoni, watashitachi no purojekuto de hitsuyō na dēta o gutaiteki ni shimeshite iru tame, kongoji no bunseki sagyō ga kakudan ni susumi sō da. (Since this thesis presents concrete data needed for our project based on the latest research on environmental issues, our future analysis work seems likely to progress significantly.)

Word/Phrase: 生物学
Romaji: seibutsugaku
Meaning: biology
Example: 生物学の勉強をしていると、細胞や遺伝子の仕組みがとても面白いと感じます seibutsugaku no benkyō o shite iru to, saibō ya idenshi no shikumi ga totemo omoshiroi to kanjimasu (When I study biology, I find the intricate mechanisms of cells and genetic inheritance incredibly fascinating) 生物学は自然界の複雑な生命システムや進化の過程を科学的に解明する学問分野です seibutsugaku wa shizenkai no fukuzatsu na seimei shisutemu ya shinka no katei o kagaku-teki ni kaimei suru gakumon bun'ya desu (Biology is the scientific field that systematically uncovers the complex life systems and evolutionary processes found in nature)

Word/Phrase: 政治
Romaji: seiji
Meaning: politics
Example: 政治の話を聞くのは難しいけど、国の未来を考えるためには必要なことだと思います seiji no hanashi o kiku no wa muzukashii kedo, kuni no mirai o kangaeru tame ni wa hitsuyō na koto da to omoimasu (Listening to political discussions is difficult, but I believe it’s essential for thinking about the future of the country) 政治に興味がある人は、ニュースを見たり、本を読んだりして勉強する必要があります seiji ni kyōmi ga aru hito wa, nyūsu o mitari, hon o yondari shite benkyō suru hitsuyō ga arimasu (Those interested in politics need to study by watching the news or reading books to deepen their understanding)

Word/Phrase: 専攻
Romaji: senkou
Meaning: major
Example: 大学で専攻しているのは経済学で、将来は国際的な企業で働きたいと思っています daigaku de senkou shiteiru no wa keizaigaku de, shōrai wa kokusaiteki na kigyō de hatarakitai to omotteimasu (I am majoring in economics at university and hope to work at an international company in the future) この大学では、専攻を選ぶ前に、基礎科目から専門分野まで幅広く学ぶ機会が与えられており、学生は自分の興味や将来の目標に合わせて計画的に単位を取得することができます kono daigaku de wa, senkou o erabu mae ni, kiso kamoku kara senmon bun’ya made hikohiroku manabu kikai ga ataerarete ori, gakusei wa jibun no kyōmi ya shōrai no mokuhyō ni awasete keikakuteki ni tan’i o shutoku suru koto ga dekimasu (At this university, before choosing a major, students have the opportunity to study a wide range of subjects from basic courses to specialized fields, allowing them to strategically earn credits based on their interests and future goals)

Word/Phrase: 数学
Romaji: suugaku
Meaning: math
Example: 学校で数学の授業が始まると、黒板に書かれた公式をただ写すだけの学生と、その成り立ちを考えながらノートにまとめる学生との差が、試験の結果に現れる。 gakkō de suugaku no jugyou ga hajimaru to, kokuban ni kakareta kōshiki o tada utsusu dake no gakusei to, sono naritachi o kangaenagara nōto ni matomeru gakusei to no sa ga, shiken no kekka ni arawareru. (When math class begins at school, the difference between students who merely copy formulas from the blackboard and those who organize their notes while thinking about how those formulas are derived becomes evident in their test results.) 数学の問題集を解く際、解答だけを暗記しても意味がない。なぜその手順で答えが導かれるのかを理解し、似た問題に応用できる力をつけることが、本当の実力を伸ばす近道だ。 suugaku no mondai shū o toku sai, kaitō dake o anki shite mo imi ga nai. naze sono tejun de kotae ga michibikareru no ka o rikai shi, nita mondai ni ōyō dekiru chikara o tsukeru koto ga, hontō no jitsuryoku o nobasu chikamichi da. (When working on math problem sets, memorizing only the answers is meaningless. Understanding why those steps lead to the solution and developing the ability to apply them to similar problems is the shortcut to truly improving your skills.)

Word/Phrase: 内緒
Romaji: naisho
Meaning: secret (personal/informal)
Example: 友達と一緒にケーキを食べたけど、お母さんに内緒にしてね Tomodachi to issho ni kēki o tabeta kedo, okāsan ni naisho ni shite ne (We ate cake with my friends earlier, so please don’t tell my mom—keep it a secret, okay?) この話は誰にも内緒だよ、絶対に言わないでね、約束して Kono hanashi wa dare ni mo naisho da yo, zettai ni iwanai de ne, yakusoku shite (Don’t tell anyone about this—keep it a complete secret from everyone, promise me, alright?)

Word/Phrase: 愛情
Romaji: aijou
Meaning: affection
Example: 愛情を感じるたびに、心が温かくなり、日常の些細な悩みも忘れてしまいます aijō o kanjiru tabi ni, kokoro ga atatakaku nari, nichijō no sasai na nayami mo wasurete shimaimasu (Every time I feel affection, my heart warms, and I even forget the trivial worries of daily life) 愛情が深まるにつれて、お互いの信頼も強くなり、未来への希望が広がっていきます aijō ga fukamaru ni tsurete, otagai no shinrai mo tsuyoku nari, mirai e no kibō ga hirogatte ikimasu (As affection deepens, trust in each other grows stronger, and hope for the future continues to expand)

Word/Phrase: 味
Romaji: aji
Meaning: taste
Example: このレストランの料理は味がとても深くて、食べるたびに新しい発見があります kono resutoran no ryōri wa aji ga totemo fukakute, taberu tabi ni atarashī hakken ga arimasu (The flavors in this restaurant’s dishes are incredibly rich, and every time I eat here, I discover something new) 味のバランスが良くて、甘さと酸っぱさが絶妙に調和しています aji no baransu ga yokute, amasa to suppasa ga zetsumyō ni chōwa shite imasu (The balance of flavors is excellent, with sweetness and sourness blending together in perfect harmony)

Word/Phrase: 力
Romaji: chikara
Meaning: power
Example: 力を出し切るために、毎日厳しいトレーニングを重ね、体力だけでなく精神力も鍛え上げています chikara o dashikiru tame ni, mainichi kibishī torēningu o kasane, tairyoku dake de naku seishinryoku mo kitaeagete imasu (To fully exert my strength, I stack intense daily training to build not just physical but also mental power) この仕事は単なる力仕事ではなく、戦略的思考と体力の両方が求められる複雑なタスクです kono shigoto wa tan'naru chikara shigoto de wa naku, senryakuteki shikō to tairyoku no ryōhō ga motomerareru fukuzatsu na tasuku desu (This job isn’t just about brute strength—it’s a complex task requiring both strategic thinking and physical endurance)

Word/Phrase: 知識
Romaji: chishiki
Meaning: knowledge
Example: 現代社会で活躍するには、幅広い知識が必要だ。そのため、多くの人が新聞や専門書を使い、日々学習を続けている。 Gendai shakai de katsuyaku suru ni wa, habahiroi chishiki ga hitsuyō da. Sono tame, ōku no hito ga shinbun ya senmonsho o tsukai, hibi gakushū o tsuzukete iru. (To be active in modern society, broad knowledge is essential. For that reason, many people use newspapers and specialized books to continue studying daily.) この参考書は、知識を深めるのに最適で、難しいテーマもわかりやすく整理されているので、学生から社会人まで評判だ。 Kono sankōsho wa, chishiki o fukameru no ni saiteki de, muzukashī tēma mo wakariyasuku seiri sarete iru node, gakusei kara shakaijin made hyōban da. (This reference book is ideal for deepening knowledge, and since even difficult topics are organized in an easy-to-understand way, it is popular among students and working adults alike.)

Word/Phrase: 調子
Romaji: choushi
Meaning: kondisi
Example: 最近、大学のサークルで久しぶりに彼と話した。いつもなら明るい彼が、今日はいつもより声の調子が低く、返事も短かったので、何かあったのかと気になってしまった。 Saikin, daigaku no sākuru de hisashiburi ni kare to hanashita. Itsumo nara akarui kare ga, kyō wa itsumo yori koe no chōshi ga hikuku, henji mo mijikakatta node, nani ka atta no ka to ki ni natte shimatta. (Lately, I talked to him for the first time in a while at a university club. He’s usually cheerful, but today his voice was lower than usual and his replies were short, so I couldn’t help but wonder if something was wrong.) 先月から体の調子が優れない日が続いていたが、医者に「ストレスが原因かもしれない」と言われ、生活習慣を見直すことに決めた。 Sengetsu kara karada no chōshi ga sugurenai hi ga tsuzuite ita ga, isha ni "sutoresu ga gen’in kamoshirenai" to iware, seikatsu shūkan o mi-naosu koto ni kimeta. (Since last month, I’ve had many days where I wasn’t feeling well, but after the doctor said, “Stress might be the cause,” I decided to review my lifestyle habits.)

Word/Phrase: 努力
Romaji: doryoku
Meaning: usaha
Example: 彼が大学に合格できたのは、毎日の勉強を怠らず、三年間努力を重ねてきた結果だ。 kare ga daigaku ni gōkaku dekita no wa, mainichi no benkyō o okotarazu, san'nenkan doryoku o kasanete kita kekka da. (Kehasilan dia lulus universitas adalah buah dari tidak mengabaikan belajar harian dan menumpuk usaha selama tiga tahun.) この会社が短期間で成長した理由は、社員全員が目標に向かって努力し続け、小さな改善を積み重ねたからである。 kono kaisha ga tankikan de seichō shita wake wa, shain zen'in ga mokuhyō ni mukatte doryoku shitsuzuke, chiisa na kaizen o tsumikasane ta kara de aru. (Alasan perusahaan ini tumbuh pesat dalam waktu singkat adalah karena seluruh karyawan terus berusaha menuju tujuan dan menumpuk perbaikan kecil.)

Word/Phrase: 影響
Romaji: eikyou
Meaning: effect
Example: この映画が公開されてから、若者の間で社会問題について話し合う機会が増え、その影響でボランティア活動に参加する学生の数も年々上昇している。 Kono eiga ga kōkai sa re te ka ra, wakamono no aida de shakai mondai ni tsuite hanashia u kikai ga fue, sono eikyō de borantia katsudō ni sanka suru gakusei no kazū mo nen’nen jōshō shi te i ru. (Since this film’s release, opportunities for young people to discuss social issues have increased, and under its effect, the number of students participating in volunteer activities has risen yearly.) 新しい環境法ができたことにより、多くの会社は生産方法を見直さざるを得なくなり、その結果、エコ製品の開発が進むという予想外の影響が現れた。 Atarashii kankyōhō ga deki ta ko to ni yori, ōku no kaisha wa seisan hōhō o mi naosa za ru o enaku nari, sono kekka, eo seihin no kaihatsu ga susumu to iu yosōgai no eikyō ga arawa re ta. (Due to the new environmental law, many companies had no choice but to re-examine their production methods, leading to the unexpected effect of accelerated eco-product development.)

Word/Phrase: 反応
Romaji: han’nou
Meaning: reaction
Example: 彼の発言に対して、クラスメイトは驚きの反応を示し、教室全体が一瞬静まり返った kare no hatsugen ni taishite, kurasumeito wa odoroki no han’nou o shimeshi, kyoushitsu zentai ga shunkan shizumarikaetta (At his statement, the classmates showed a reaction of surprise, and the entire classroom fell silent for a moment) 化学実験中に予期せぬ反応が起こり、教師はすぐに対応策を講じ始めた kagaku jikkennchuu ni yoki senu han’nou ga okori, kyoushi wa sugu ni taiousaku o kouji hajimeta (An unexpected reaction occurred during the chemistry experiment, and the teacher immediately began taking measures)

Word/Phrase: 秘密
Romaji: himitsu
Meaning: secret (formal/serius)
Example: この会社では、社員が顧客の個人情報を秘密に扱うことが、契約書に明記されているだけでなく、毎月の研修でも繰り返し強調されている。 kono kaisha de wa, shain ga kokyaku no kojin jōhō o himitsu ni atukau koto ga, keiyakusho ni meikisareteiru dake de naku, maitsuki no kenkyū de mo kurikaeshi kyōchō sareteiru. (At this company, not only is it explicitly stated in contracts that employees must handle customers' personal information as a secret, but it is also repeatedly emphasized in monthly training.) 子どもの頃、祖母は「人の秘密をばらす者は、心の扉も閉ざされてしまう」とよく言い、それが今でも私の行動の指針となっている。 kodomo no koro, soba wa "hito no himitsu o barasu mono wa, kokoro no tobira mo tozasarete shimau" to yoku ii, sore ga ima demo watashi no kōdō no shishin to natteiru. (When I was a child, my grandmother often said, "Those who reveal others' secrets will find the doors to their own hearts closed," and those words still guide my actions today.)

Word/Phrase: 自信
Romaji: jishin
Meaning: confidence
Example: 自信があるから、このテストは受かるために必要な準備を全て済ませたので、きっと合格すると確信しています jishin ga aru kara, kono tesuto wa ukaru tame ni hitsuyō na junbi o subete sumaseta node, kitto gōkaku suru to kakushin shite imasu (Because I am confident, I have completed all the necessary preparations to pass this test, so I am convinced I will succeed) この仕事は非常に難しい課題が多いですが、過去の経験から得た自信を持って、最後まで全力で取り組むつもりです kono shigoto wa hijō ni muzukashī kadai ga ōi desu ga, kako no keiken kara eta jishin o motte, saigo made zenryoku de torikumu tsumori desu (Although this job has many extremely difficult challenges, I intend to tackle it with full effort until the end, fueled by the confidence I’ve gained from past experiences)

Word/Phrase: 実力
Romaji: jitsuryoku
Meaning: real ability
Example: 彼が持つ実力は、誰もが認めるほど優れていて、実際に見せるといつも驚かれる。 Kare ga motsu jitsuryoku wa, dare mo ga mitomeru hodo sugurete ite, jissai ni miseru to itsumo odorokareru. (His ability, which everyone acknowledges as outstanding, always amazes people when he demonstrates it in practice.) このチームは、他と比べて実力が高いので、大会で毎回いい成績を残している。 Kono chīmu wa, hoka to kurabete jitsuryoku ga takai node, taikai de maikai ii seiseki o nokoshite iru. (Compared to other teams, this one has a higher level of skill, which is why they consistently achieve good results in competitions.)

Word/Phrase: 格好
Romaji: kakkou
Meaning: appearance
Example: 彼がパーティーに現れたとき、周りの人はその洗練された格好に驚きの声を上げた。 Kare ga pātii ni arawareta toki, mawari no hito wa sono senshukusareta kakkou ni odoroki no koe o ageta. (When he appeared at the party, the people around him gasped in surprise at his refined appearance.) この俳優はどんな役でも、その役にぴったりの格好で観客を引きつけることができる。 Kono haiyuu wa donna yaku demo, sono yaku ni pittari no kakkou de kyakkan o hikitsukeru koto ga dekiru. (No matter what role this actor plays, he can captivate the audience with an appearance perfectly suited to the character.)

Word/Phrase: 活動
Romaji: katsudou
Meaning: kegiatan
Example: 学校が終わると、生徒たちはそれぞれのクラブ活動に向かい、音楽やスポーツを通して友達と楽しい時間を過ごしている。 gakkō ga owaru to, seito-tachi wa sorezore no kurabu katsudō ni mukai, ongaku ya supōtsu o tōshite tomodachi to tanoshii jikan o sugoshiteiru. (When school ends, students head to their respective club activities, spending enjoyable time with friends through music and sports.) この町では、毎週末に住民たちが集まり、公園の掃除やリサイクル推進など、環境を守るための活動を積極的に続けている。 kono machi de wa, maishūmatsu ni jūmin-tachi ga atsumari, kōen no sōji ya risaikuru suishin nado, kankyō o mamoru tame no katsudō o sekkyokuteki ni tsuzuketeiru. (In this town, residents gather every weekend to actively continue activities like park cleaning and recycling promotion to protect the environment.)

Word/Phrase: 怪我
Romaji: kega
Meaning: injury
Example: スポーツを始める前に、怪我を防ぐためにウォームアップとストレッチを欠かさない人は、体の柔軟性が高まり、運動中の事故を避けやすくなる。 Supōtsu o hajimeru mae ni, kega o fusegu tame ni wōmuappu to sutorecchi o kakasanai hito wa, karada no jūnansei ga takamari, undōchū no jiko o sakeyasuku naru. (Those who never skip warm-ups and stretching before starting sports to prevent injuries will improve their flexibility and become less prone to accidents during exercise.) 転んで足をひねったとき、すぐに冷やすなどの応急処置をした後、怪我の程度に応じて病院で診てもらうことが、後遺症を残さないために重要だ。 Koronde ashi o hinetta toki, sugu ni hiyasu nado no ōkyū shochi o shita ato, kega no teido ni ōjite byōin de mitemorau koto ga, kōishō o nokosanai tame ni jūyō da. (When you fall and twist your ankle, after administering first aid such as immediately cooling it, it is crucial to see a doctor depending on the severity of the injury to avoid long-term complications.)

Word/Phrase: 健康
Romaji: kenkou
Meaning: health
Example: 健康のために、毎日野菜を食べたり、運動をしたりすることが大切です kenkou no tame ni, mainichi yasai o tabetari, undou o shitari suru koto ga taisetsu desu (For the sake of health, it is important to eat vegetables and exercise every day to maintain overall well-being) 健康を保つためには、十分な睡眠とバランスの取れた食事が必要です kenkou o tamotsu tame ni wa, juubun na suimin to baransu no toreta shokiji ga hitsuyou desu (To maintain good health, getting enough sleep and having a balanced diet are essential habits to cultivate)

Word/Phrase: 声
Romaji: koe
Meaning: voice (makhluk hidup)
Example: 声が聞こえないから、電話の向こうの人が何を言っているのか全然わからず、何度も聞き返す羽目になった koe ga kikoenai kara, denwa no mukō no hito ga nani o itte iru no ka zenzen wakarazu, nando mo kiki kaesu hame ni natta (Because I couldn’t hear the voice, I had no idea what the person on the other end of the phone was saying and ended up asking them to repeat themselves over and over) 先生の声がとても優しくて、生徒たちは授業中にリラックスできただけでなく、質問もしやすい雰囲気だった sensei no koe ga totemo yasashikute, jugyōchū ni rirakkusu dekita dake de naku, shitsumon mo shi yasui fun’iki datta (The teacher’s voice was so gentle that not only could the students relax during class, but they also felt comfortable asking questions)

Word/Phrase: 効果
Romaji: kouka
Meaning: effect
Example: この薬が持つ副作用の少なさと高い効果に着目し、多くの医師が処方箋に記載するようになり、今や幅広い世代に日常的に利用されるまでになった kono kusuri ga motsu fukusayō no sukunasa to takai kōka ni chakumoku shi, ōku no ishi ga shohōsen ni kisai suru yō ni nari, ima ya hikuhiroi sedai ni nichijōteki ni riyō sareru made ni natta (Noticing this medicine’s minimal side effects and high efficacy, many doctors began prescribing it, and now it has become a daily staple across generations) 効果が現れるまでに時間を要するこのトレーニングも、継続すれば半年後には身体の変化を実感できるため、根気よく取り組む価値がある kōka ga arawareru made ni jikan o yō suru kono torēningu mo, keizoku sureba hannengō ni wa karada no henka o jikkan dekiru tame, konki yoku torikumu kachi ga aru

Word/Phrase: 年齢
Romaji: nenrei
Meaning: umur
Example: 年齢を聞かれた時、私は正直に答えますが、時々年齢よりも見た目が若く見えると言われます nenrei o kikareta toki, watashi wa shōjiki ni kotaemasu ga, tokidoki nenrei yori mo mitame ga wakaku mieru to iwaremasu (When someone asks me how old I am, I always answer honestly, but occasionally I’m told that I look much younger than my actual age) この映画は年齢を問わず、子供から大人まで幅広い世代が共感できるストーリーと、心温まるメッセージが詰まった作品です kono eiga wa nenrei o towazu, kodomo kara otona made hibiroi sedai ga kyōkan dekiru sutōrī to, kokoro atatamaru messēji ga tsumatta sakuhin desu (This film, regardless of age, offers a story that resonates with all generations—from children to adults—and is packed with heartwarming messages that leave a lasting impression)

Word/Phrase: 匂い
Romaji: nioi
Meaning: smell
Example: 春の公園では、風に乗って花の匂いが静かに広がり、ベンチに座って本を読む人々の表情が和らいでいく。 haru no kōen de wa, kaze ni notte hana no nioi ga shizuka ni hirogari, benchi ni suwatte hon o yomu hitobito no hyōjō ga yawarade iku. (In the spring park, the scent of flowers gently spreads on the wind, and the expressions of those reading books on the benches begin to soften.) 仕事帰りに通りを歩いていると、レストランから漂う料理の匂いが鼻をくすぐり、その香りに包まれるだけで心が軽くなる。 shigoto-gaeri ni tōri o aruite iru to, resutoran kara tadayou ryōri no nioi ga hana o kusuguri, sono kaori ni tsutsumareru dake de kokoro ga karuku naru.

Word/Phrase: 温度
Romaji: ondo
Meaning: temperature
Example: 外が暗くなるにつれて、急に温度が下がり始めた。朝の天気予報では「暖かい一日」と伝えられていたが、実際には夕方から冷たい風が吹き、体感温度も低くなった。 Soto ga kuraku naru ni tsurete, kyū ni ondo ga sagarihajimeta. Asa no tenki yohō de wa "atatakai ichinichi" to tsutaerarete ita ga, jissai ni wa yūgata kara tsumetai kaze ga fuki, taikan ondo mo hikuku natta. (As it grew darker outside, the temperature suddenly began to drop. Though the morning weather forecast had promised a "warm day," in reality, cold winds started blowing from the evening, making it feel much colder.) このオフィスでは、温度管理が難しい。夏はエアコンを18度に設定しても涼しく感じられず、冬は25度にしても足元が冷えるため、従業員から不満の声がよく聞かれる。 Kono ofisu de wa, ondo kanri ga muzukashii. Natsu wa eakon o jū-hachi-do ni settei shite mo suzushiku kanjirarezu, fuyu wa ni-jū-go-do ni shite mo ashimoto ga hieru tame, jūgyōin kara fuman no koe ga yoku kikeru. (In this office, temperature control is challenging. Even when the air conditioner is set to 18 degrees in summer, it doesn’t feel cool enough, and in winter, even at 25 degrees, people’s feet get cold, leading to frequent complaints from employees.)

Word/Phrase: 音
Romaji: oto
Meaning: sound (benda mati)
Example: この音楽の音はとても美しく、心が癒されていくようだ。 Kono ongaku no oto wa totemo utsukushiku, kokoro ga iyasareru te iku you da. (The sound of this music is so beautifully soothing that it feels like my heart is being healed.) 古いグラモフォンから流れる音は、懐かしい時代の雰囲気を今に伝えている。 Furui guramofon kara nagareru oto wa, natsukashii jidai no fun'iki o ima ni tsutaete iru. (The sound emanating from the old gramophone carries the nostalgic atmosphere of a bygone era into the present.)

Word/Phrase: 理由
Romaji: riyuu
Meaning: reason
Example: この朝、彼が会社に遅刻したのは、 電車の故障で始発から遅れが続き、 通常の時刻表どおりの到着ができなかったためだ。 kono asa, kare ga kaisha ni chikoku shita no wa, densha no koshō de shihatsu kara okure ga tsuzuki, tsūjō no jikokuhyō dōri no tchaku ga dekunakatta tame da. (That morning, the reason he was late to work was that due to a train malfunction, delays persisted from the first train, making it impossible to arrive according to the regular schedule.) 先日、この映画を選んだのは、 友達との会話で偶然知った作品だったが、 研究テーマとの関連性に興味を持ったからである。 senjitsu, kono eiga o eranda no wa, tomodachi to no kaiwa de gūzen shitta sakuhin datta ga, kenkyū tēma to no kanren-sei ni kyōmi o motta kara de aru.

Word/Phrase: 才能
Romaji: sainou
Meaning: talent
