Example: 彼の才能は音楽の世界で長年にわたり多くのファンを魅了し続け輝いている kare no sainou wa ongaku no sekai de naganen ni watari ooku no fan o miryou shi tsudukete kagayaite iru (His talent has been shining in the music world, captivating many fans for years) 才能がある人は単に生まれ持った資質だけでなく、日々の努力を怠らず続けることでさらに技術と人間性を磨き成長する sainou ga aru hito wa tan ni umaremotta shitsuryoku dake de naku, hibijitsu no doryoku o okotarazu tsuzukeru koto de sarani gijutsu to ningensei o migaki seichō suru (Those with talent grow even further by not neglecting daily effort, honing both their skills and humanity beyond just their innate abilities)

Word/Phrase: 性格
Romaji: seikaku
Meaning: sifat
Example: 彼の性格は明るくて前向きで、初めて会う人でも短時間で深い信頼関係を築けるタイプです kare no seikaku wa akarukute maemukide, hajimete au hito demo tankan de fukai shinrai kankei o kizukeru taipu desu (He has a bright and positive personality, and even with people he meets for the first time, he can build deep trust quickly) 性格や価値観が似ている同僚とプロジェクトを進めるのは、意見の食い違いが少なく非常に効率的です seikaku ya kachikan ga niteiru dōryō to purojekuto o susumeru no wa, iken no kuichigai ga sukunaku hijō ni kōritsu-teki desu (Working on projects with colleagues who share similar personalities and values is highly efficient, as there are fewer disagreements)

Word/Phrase: 生活
Romaji: seikatsu
Meaning: life
Example: 生活は忙しいけど、毎日楽しく過ごすことが大切です seikatsu wa isogashii kedo, mainichi tanoshiku sugosu koto ga taisetsu desu (Even though life is busy, it’s important to spend each day happily and enjoy the little moments) 生活を楽にするために、時間を上手に使うことが必要です seikatsu o rasuni suru tame ni, jikan o jouzu ni tsukau koto ga hitsuyou desu (To make life easier, it’s essential to manage your time wisely and prioritize what truly matters)

Word/Phrase: 精神
Romaji: seishin
Meaning: mental
Example: 精神的な活動は、心の健康を保つためにとても大切であり、日々のストレスを軽減する効果も期待できます。 seishinteki na katsudō wa, kokoro no kenkō wo tamotsu tame ni totemo taisetsu de ari, hibijitsu no sutoresu wo keigen suru kōka mo kitai dekimasu. (Mental activities are very important for maintaining mental health and can also be expected to reduce daily stress.) 精神を安定させるためには、規則正しい生活リズムを維持し、趣味や創造的な作業に時間を割くことが推奨されています。 seishin wo antei saseru tame ni wa, kisokuchōshii seikatsu rizumu wo ijishi, shumi ya sōzōteki na sagyō ni jikan wo saku koto ga suisensarete imasu. (To stabilize the mind, it is recommended to maintain a regular lifestyle rhythm and dedicate time to hobbies or creative work.)

Word/Phrase: 趣味
Romaji: shumi
Meaning: hobi
Example: 趣味は読書と映画を見ることです 特に歴史や冒険の本が好きで、週末にはよく映画館に行きます shumi wa dokusho to eiga o miru koto desu tokuni rekishi ya būken no hon ga suki de, shūmatsu ni wa yoku eigakan ni ikimasu (My hobbies are reading books and watching films, with a particular fondness for historical and adventure novels, so I frequently visit the cinema on weekends) 趣味は料理をすることで、友達と一緒に新しいレシピを試したり、料理教室に通ったりしています shumi wa ryōri o suru koto de, tomodachi to issho ni atarashī reshipi o tameshite itari, ryōri kyōshitsu ni kayottari shite imasu (My hobby is cooking, and I enjoy experimenting with new recipes with friends as well as attending cooking classes to improve my skills)

Word/Phrase: 習慣
Romaji: shuukan
Meaning: kebiasaan
Example: 毎朝5時に起きて散歩するという習慣を続けた結果、体調が良くなり、仕事の効率も上がったそうで、周りの人たちも驚いています。 Maiasa go-ji ni okite sanpo suru to iu shūkan o tsuzuketa kekka, taichō ga yoku nari, shigoto no kōritsu mo agatta sō de, mawari no hitotachi mo odorokite imasu. (As a result of continuing the habit of waking up at 5 AM every morning to take a walk, his health improved and his work efficiency increased, which even surprised those around him.) 本を読む習慣がついたおかげで、以前は難しかった資格試験の勉強も、今では楽しく取り組めています。 Hon o yomu shūkan ga tsui ta okage de, izen wa muzukashikatta shikaku shiken no benkyō mo, ima de wa tanoshiku torikumete imasu. (Thanks to developing the habit of reading books, studying for the qualification exam—which used to be difficult—has now become enjoyable.)

Word/Phrase: 存在
Romaji: sonzai
Meaning: existence
Example: 深い森に足を踏み入れると、普段は気づかない生命の息吹や、時空を超えたかのような不思議な存在感に包まれる。 Fukai mori ni ashi o fumii reru to, fudan wa kizukanai inochi no ibuki ya, jiku o koeta ka no yōna fushigi na sonzaikan ni tsutsumareru. (Stepping into the deep forest, one is enveloped by the breath of life usually unnoticed and an eerie presence as if transcending time and space.) 未知の領域に挑む探検家たちが、科学の枠を超えた存在の証拠を掴もうと、命がけの調査を続けている。 Michi no ryōiki ni idomu tankenka-tachi ga, kagaku no waku o koeta sonzai no shōko o tsukamō to, inochigake no chōsa o tsudzukete iru. (Explorers venturing into unknown realms persist in life-risking investigations, striving to grasp evidence of existences beyond the bounds of science.)

Word/Phrase: 姿
Romaji: sugata
Meaning: penampilan
Example: その姿は夕暮れの公園で、孤独な影のように静かに佇んでいた Sono sugata wa yūgure no kōen de, kodoku na kage no yō ni shizuka ni tatazunde ita (His figure stood quietly like a lonely shadow in the park at dusk) その姿を見た瞬間、私は彼が長年抱えてきた重い過去を、言葉では言い表せないほど深く理解した Sono sugata o mita shunkan, watashi wa kare ga naganen kakaete kita omoi kako o, kotoba de wa iiarawasenai hodo fukaku rikai shita (The moment I saw his figure, I understood the heavy past he had carried for years in a way too deep to put into words)

Word/Phrase: 嘘
Romaji: uso
Meaning: lie
Example: 彼が私に嘘をついたから、信頼関係が完全に崩れてしまった kare ga watashi ni uso o tsita kara, shinrai kankei ga kanzen ni kuzurete shimatta (Because he lied to me, our relationship of trust completely collapsed) 嘘をつくのは良くないことだと思いますが、時々真実を隠すために必要な場合もあります uso o tsuku no wa yoku nai koto da to omoimasu ga, tokidoki shinjitsu o kakusu tame ni hitsuyō na baai mo arimasu (I think lying is not a good thing, but sometimes it may be necessary to hide the truth)

Word/Phrase: 様式
Romaji: youshiki
Meaning: style
Example: この会社が導入した書類の様式は、細かいルールに基づいているため、新入社員でも短期間で慣れることができるように工夫されている。 Kono kaisha ga dounyuu shita shorui no youshiki wa, komakai ruuru ni motozuite iru tame, shinnyuusha'in demo tankikan de nare ru koto ga dekiru you ni kuufu sarete iru. (The document formats introduced by this company are designed with detailed rules so that even new employees can quickly become accustomed to them.) 契約書の様式が決められた通りでないと、関係部署への確認作業が発生し、プロジェクトの進行に遅れが生じる可能性がある。 Keiyakusho no youshiki ga kimareta toori de nai to, kankei busho e no kakunin sagyou ga hassei shi, purojekuto no shinkou ni okure ga shoujiru kanousei ga aru. (If a contract’s format does not follow the prescribed style, confirmation work with relevant departments arises, potentially causing delays in project progress.)

Word/Phrase: 様子
Romaji: yousu
Meaning: behavior, state, appearance
Example: 病院で働く友人が、先週から様子が変だと言いました。忙しすぎて、先生も疲れているようです Byōin de hataraku yūjin ga, senshū kara yōsu ga kawa da to ii mashita. Isogashisugite, sensei mo tsukarete iru yō desu (My friend who works at the hospital said the situation has been different since last week. It seems even the doctor is exhausted from being too busy) 最近、彼が仕事中にぼんやりしている様子をよく見ます。何か悩みがあるのか、聞いてみようと思っています Saikin, kare ga shigoto-chū ni bonyari shite iru yōsu o yoku mi masu. Nanika nayami ga aru no ka, kiite miyō to omotte i masu (Lately, I often see him spacing out at work. I’m thinking of asking if he has something troubling him)

Word/Phrase: 夢
Romaji: yume
Meaning: dream
Example: 昨夜見た夢の風景が、目覚めてもまだ心に残っていて、仕事中も時々ぼんやりその光景を思い出してしまいました sakuya mita yume no fuukei ga, mezamete mo mada kokoro ni nokotte ite, shigotochuu mo tokidoki bonyari sono koukei o omoidashite shimaimashita (The scenery from the dream I had last night lingered in my heart even after waking up, and I found myself absentmindedly recalling those images even during work) 子供の頃に見た夢と同じような、温かい風と木の香りが混ざった不思議な夢だったので、朝からずっとその感覚が頭の中に残っていました kodomo no koro ni mita yume to onaji you na, atatakai kaze to ki no kaori ga mazatta fushigi na yume datta node, asa kara zutto sono kankaku ga atama no naka ni nokotte imashita (It was a strange dream similar to one I had as a child, filled with warm wind and the scent of trees, so that sensation stayed in my mind all morning)

Word/Phrase: 柔道
Romaji: juudou
Meaning: judo
Example: 柔道は体も心も強くするスポーツで、日本の伝統的な武道の一つです。 juudou wa karada mo kokoro mo tsuyoku suru supōtsu de, Nihon no dentōteki na budō no hitotsu desu. (Judo is a sport that strengthens both body and mind, and it is one of Japan's traditional martial arts.) 柔道の基本は礼儀と技術にあり、相手を投げる技術だけでなく、精神的な成長や相手への敬意を学ぶことも重視されています。 juudou no kihon wa reigi to gijutsu ni ari, aite o nageru gijutsu dake de naku, seishinteki na seichō ya aite e no keii o manabu koto mo juushi sarete imasu. (The foundation of judo lies in etiquette and technique, and it emphasizes not only the skill of throwing an opponent but also mental growth and learning respect for others.)

Word/Phrase: 陸上
Romaji: rikujo
Meaning: athletic (lari)
Example: 陸上競技の大会で、友達と一緒にリレーに出場するのが今から楽しみです rikujō kyōgi no taikai de, tomodachi to issho ni rirē ni shutsujō suru no ga ima kara tanoshimi desu (I'm already looking forward to competing in the relay with my friends at the track and field meet) 陸上の練習は体力的に大変ですが、目標達成のために毎日欠かさず続けています rikujō no renshū wa tairyokuteki ni taihen desu ga, mokuhyō tassei no tame ni mainichi kakasazu tsuzukete imasu (Though track and field training is physically demanding, I keep at it every day without fail to reach my goals)

Word/Phrase: 体操
Romaji: taisou
Meaning: gymnastic, warm up
Example: 体操は健康のために毎日続けることで、体力の向上やストレス解消にも役立ちます taisou wa kenkō no tame ni mainichi tsuzukeru koto de, tairyoku no koujou ya sutoresu kaishou ni mo yakudachimasu (Doing gymnastics daily for health not only improves physical strength but also helps relieve stress) 朝の体操を習慣にすると、一日の始まりがスムーズで活力に満ちたものになります asa no taisou o shuukan ni suru to, ichinichi no hajimari ga sumūzu de katsuryoku ni michita mono ni narimasu (Making morning gymnastics a habit leads to a smoother and more energetic start to your day)

Word/Phrase: 卓球
Romaji: takkyuu
Meaning: pingpong
Example: 卓球をするのは楽しいですけど、毎日練習するのは体力的にきついです takkyū o suru no wa tanoshii desu kedo, mainichi renshū suru no wa tairikuteki ni kitsui desu (Playing table tennis is fun, but practicing every day is physically demanding) 卓球の試合で勝つためには、速いボールを打つだけでなく、戦略的なプレーも重要です takkyū no shiai de katsu tame ni wa, hayai bōru o utsu dake de naku, senryakuteki na purē mo jūyō desu (To win in a table tennis match, not only do you need to practice hitting fast balls, but strategic play is also important)

Word/Phrase: 野球
Romaji: yakyuu
Meaning: baseball
Example: 野球の試合を見るのが大好きで、週末になると友達と一緒に球場へ行きます yakyuu no shiai o miru no ga daisuki de, shūmatsu ni naru to tomodachi to issho ni kyūjō e ikimasu (I love watching baseball games, and whenever the weekend comes, I go to the stadium with my friends)

Word/Phrase: 空手
Romaji: karate
Meaning: karate
Example: 空手を始めて3年の友人は、朝早くから道場で汗を流し、師範の指導を受けながら一つ一つの型を丁寧に練習している。 Karate o hajimete san-nen no tomodachi wa, asa hayaku kara dōjō de ase o nagashi, shihan no shidō o uke nagara hitotsu hitotsu no kata o teinei ni renshū shite iru. (The friend who has been practicing karate for three years sweats in the dojo early in the morning, carefully practicing each kata under the guidance of the instructor.) 空手の全国大会で優勝した選手は、インタビューで「負け続けた時期もあったが、諦めずに努力した結果だ」と話した。 Karate no zenkoku taikai de yūshō shita senshu wa, intabyū de "make tsuzuketa jiki mo attaga, akimezu ni doryoku shita kekka da" to hanashita. (The karate athlete who won the national tournament said in an interview, "There were times I kept losing, but this is the result of never giving up and working hard.")

Word/Phrase: 手袋
Romaji: tebukuro
Meaning: glove
Example: 冬になると、手袋を忘れずに持っていくことが大切です fuyu ni naru to, tebukuro o wasurezu ni motteiku koto ga taisetsu desu. (In Japan, when the cold winter season arrives, it's essential to always remember to bring gloves to protect your hands from the harsh temperatures) 特に寒い日に外出する時は、手袋をしていないと指が凍えてしまいます tokuni samui hi ni gaishutsu suru toki wa, tebukuro o shite inai to yubi ga kōgoete shimaimasu. (On particularly freezing days, if you go outside without wearing proper gloves, your fingers may become painfully numb or even frostbitten)

Word/Phrase: 針
Romaji: hari
Meaning: jarum
Example: 針が机の上に落ちていて、それを拾おうとした瞬間、誤って指先を深く刺してしまい、血がにじんでしまった hari ga tsukue no ue ni ochite ite, sore o hiroō to shita shunkan, ayamatte yubisaki o fukaku sashite shimai, chi ga nijinde shimatta (Saat jarum jatuh di atas meja dan saya mencoba memungutnya, tanpa sengaja ujung jari saya tertusuk dalam dan berdarah)

Word/Phrase: 鋏
Romaji: hasami
Meaning: gunting
Example: 鋏を使って髪を整えるのは初心者には難しいですが、繊細な動きを身につければ上手に切れるようになります hasami o tsukatte kami o totonoeru no wa shoshinsha ni wa muzukashii desu ga, sensai na ugoki o mi ni tsukereba umaku kireru yō ni narimasu (For beginners, using scissors to style hair is difficult, but you can cut well once you master delicate movements) 鋏は手入れを怠るとすぐに錆びて切れ味が悪くなるので、使った後は布で水気を拭き、定期的に専用の油で手入れすることが大切です hasami wa teire o okotaru to sugu ni sabite kireaji ga waruku naru node, tsukatta ato wa nuno de mizuke o fuki, teiki tekini sen'yō no abura de teire suru koto ga taisetsu desu (If you neglect scissors maintenance, they quickly rust and lose sharpness, so it’s important to wipe off moisture with a cloth after use and regularly oil them with dedicated oil)

Word/Phrase: 鞄
Romaji: kaban
Meaning: bag
Example: 学校へ行く準備をする時、鞄の中身をもう一度チェックする習慣があれば、筆箱やお弁当箱の忘れ物を防げます gakkō e iku junbi o suru toki, kaban no nakami o mō ichido chekku suru shūkan ga areba, fudebako ya obentōbako no wasuremono o fusegemasu (When preparing for school, having the habit of double-checking the contents of your bag can prevent forgetting items like your pencil case or lunch box) 長く愛用できる鞄を見つけるため、デザインだけではなく、丈夫な素材や使いやすさにも注意を払うべきです nagaku ai’yō dekiru kaban o mitsukeru tame, dezain dake de wa naku, jōbu na sozai ya tsukaiyasusa ni mo chūi o harau bekidesu (To find a bag that can be used for a long time, you should pay attention not only to the design but also to durable materials and ease of use)

Word/Phrase: 糸
Romaji: ito
Meaning: benang
Example: 糸を使って、母は伝統的な技法で複雑な模様の織物を丁寧に仕上げました。 ito o tsukatte, haha wa dentō-tekina gihō de fukuzatsu na moyō no orimono o teinei ni shiagemashita. (Using thread, my mother carefully finished a fabric with intricate patterns using traditional techniques.) 祖母から受け継いだ古い木製の織機で、糸を一本一本注意深く組み合わせ、季節ごとの着物地を作り上げています。 sobokara uketsuida furui mokusei no shokki de, ito o ippon ippon chūi bukaku kumiawase, kisetsugoto no kimono-ji o tsukuriagete imasu. (With an old wooden loom passed down from my grandmother, she meticulously weaves each thread to create seasonal kimono fabrics.)

Word/Phrase: 毛糸
Romaji: keito
Meaning: benang wol
Example: 毛糸で編んだマフラーと手袋のセットは、寒い冬の散歩に最適です Keito de amanda mafurā to tebukuro no setto wa, samui fuyu no sanpo ni tekitō desu (The scarf and gloves set knitted with wool is perfect for cold winter walks) 赤い毛糸で編んだセーターを着ると、クリスマスパーティーの雰囲気が一層高まります Akai keito de amanda sētā o kiru to, kurisumasu pāti no fun'iki ga issō takamarimasu (Wearing a sweater knitted with red wool enhances the Christmas party atmosphere even more)

Word/Phrase: 先日
Romaji: senjitsu
Meaning: beberapa hari lalu
Example: 先日訪れた隠れ家的な寿司屋は、駅から15分ほど歩くが、カウンター越しに見せる職人の手さばきが芸術の域に達していた。 Senjitsu otozureta kakurega-teki na sushiya wa, eki kara jūgo-fun hodo aruku ga, kauntā goshi ni miseru shokunin no tesabaki ga geijutsu no ikini tasshite ita. (The sushi bar I visited the other day, tucked away a 15-minute walk from the station, showcased the chef’s knife skills at an artistic level across the counter.) 先日届いた母の手紙には、弟の進学が決まった喜びとともに、祖父の書斎で見つかったという古い写真が同封されていた。 Senjitsu todoita haha no tegami ni wa, otōto no shingaku ga kimatta yorokobi to tomo ni, sofu no shosai de mitsukatta to iu furui shashin ga dōfū sarete ita. (The letter from my mother that arrived the other day included not only joy over my brother’s university acceptance but also an old photo found in my grandfather’s study.)

Word/Phrase: 時差
Romaji: jisa
Meaning: time difference
Example: 海外への出張で時差ぼけに苦しんだことがある人は多いだろう。朝の会議で頭が働かず、コーヒーを飲んでも集中力が続かないため、仕事の効率が落ちてしまう。 kaigai e no shucchō de jisaboke ni kurushinda koto ga aru hito wa ōi darō. asa no kaigi de atama ga hatarakazu, koohii o nondemo shūchūryoku ga tsuzukanai tame, shigoto no kōritsu ga ochite shimau. (Many people have suffered from jet lag on overseas business trips, where their minds don’t work well in morning meetings, and even after drinking coffee, their focus doesn’t last, causing work efficiency to drop.) 時差が10時間以上ある国に行くと、体がすぐには慣れず、夜中に目が覚めたり、昼間に強い眠気に襲われたりする。そのため、出張初日は予定を控えめにしておくのが賢明だ。 jisa ga jūjikan ijō aru kuni ni iku to, karada ga sugu ni wa narenazu, yonaka ni me ga sametari, hiruma ni tsuyoi nemuke ni osowaretari suru. sono tame, shucchō shonichi wa yotei o hikaeme ni shite oku no ga kenmei da. (When traveling to a country with a time difference of over 10 hours, the body doesn’t adjust immediately, causing one to wake up in the middle of the night or be overwhelmed by drowsiness during the day. Therefore, it’s wise to keep the first day’s schedule light.)

Word/Phrase: ある日
Romaji: aruhi
Meaning: suatu hari
Example: ある日、公園の片隅で風に揺れる大きな風船を追いかけては、子供たちの透き通った笑い声が秋の空に溶けていった。 Aru hi, kōen no kata-sumide kaze ni yureru ōkina fūsen o oikakete wa, kodomotachi no sukitootta waraigoe ga aki no sora ni tokete itta. (One day, as children chased a large balloon swaying in the wind at the corner of the park, their crystal-clear laughter dissolved into the autumn sky.) ある日、図書館の奥で偶然手にした写真集のページが、時を超えて戦前の東京の息吹を今に伝えるかのように、黄ばんだ紙から立ち上っていた。 Aru hi, toshokan no oku de gūzen te ni shita shashinshū no pēji ga, toki o koete senzen no Tōkyō no ibuki o ima ni tsutaeru ka no yō ni, kibanda kami kara tachinotte ita. (One day, the pages of a photo album I happened to pick up deep in the library seemed to rise from the yellowed paper, conveying the very breath of pre-war Tokyo across time.)

Word/Phrase: 朝
Romaji: asa
Meaning: pagi
Example: 朝ごはんを食べた後、私はバスに乗って学校へ行き、友達と待ち合わせをします asa gohan o tabeta nochi, watashi wa basu ni notte gakkō e iki, tomodachi to machiawase o shimasu (Setelah sarapan, saya naik bus ke sekolah dan bertemu teman-teman) 朝の散歩は体にいいですが、空気が澄んでいるので、特に気分が爽快になります asa no sanpo wa karada ni ii desu ga, kūki ga sundete iru node, tokuni kibun ga sōkai ni narimasu (Berjalan pagi baik untuk kesehatan, dan karena udaranya bersih, suasana hati menjadi sangat segar)

Word/Phrase: 晩
Romaji: ban
Meaning: evening
Example: 晩ご飯を食べた後、家族と一緒にテレビを見ながらお茶を飲みました ban gohan o tabeta no chi, kazoku to issho ni terebi o mi nagara ocha o nomimashita (After eating dinner, I drank tea while watching TV with my family) 晩ご飯の前に、近所の友達と公園でサッカーの練習試合をして汗を流しました ban gohan no mae ni, kinjo no tomodachi to kōen de sakkā no renshū jiai o shite ase o nagashimashita (Before dinner, I played a practice soccer match with my neighbors at the park and worked up a sweat)

Word/Phrase: 分
Romaji: bun
Meaning: minute/part/share
Example: 時間が分単位で管理されているプロジェクトでは、1分の遅れも許されない Jikan ga bun tani de kanri sa re te iru purojekuto de wa, ippun no okure mo yurusarenai (In a project where time is managed by the minute, even a one-minute delay is unacceptable) このレシピは材料の分量を分単位で正確に計る必要があるため、キッチンスケールが必須だ Kono reshipi wa zairyō no buryō o bun tani de seikaku ni hakaru hitsuyō ga aru tame, kitchin sukeēru ga hissuda (This recipe requires measuring the ingredient amounts precisely by the gram, so a kitchen scale is essential)

Word/Phrase: 学期
Romaji: gakki
Meaning: semester
Example: 夏休みが終わり、新しい学期が始まると、学校の廊下には生徒たちの活気ある声が響き始める。授業準備で忙しい毎日だが、部活動の新入生を迎える喜びもある。 Natsu yasumi ga owari, atarashii gakki ga hajimaru to, gakkō no rōka ni wa seito-tachi no katsugeki aru koe ga hibiki hajimeru. Jugyō junbi de isogashii mainichi da ga, bukatsudō no nyūsei o mukae yorokobi mo aru. (When summer vacation ends and the new semester begins, the school hallways echo with the lively voices of students. Though each day is busy with class preparations, there is also the joy of welcoming new club members.) 今学期はこれまでよりも課題の量が増え、難易度も上がったが、クラス全員で協力して問題を解決する姿勢が、先生から高く評価されている。 Kono gakki wa kore made yori mo kadai no ryō ga fue, nan’ido mo agatta ga, kurasu zen’in de kyōryoku shite mondai o kaiketsu suru shisei ga, sensei kara takaku hyōka sarete iru. (This semester, the workload and difficulty have increased compared to before, but the attitude of the entire class working together to solve problems is highly praised by the teacher.)

Word/Phrase: 午後
Romaji: gogo
Meaning: sore
Example: 午後の散歩はとても気持ちがいいです 特に公園で木々の緑を見ながら歩くと、心が落ち着きます gogo no sanpo wa totemo kimochi ga ii desu tokuni kōen de kigi no midori o minagara aruku to, kokoro ga ochitsukimasu (An afternoon stroll feels wonderfully pleasant, especially when you walk through the park observing the lush greenery of the trees—it brings a deep sense of calm to the heart.)

Word/Phrase: 半年
Romaji: hantoshi
Meaning: half a year
Example: 半年前に引っ越したので、新しい町の生活に慣れるのに時間がかかりました hantoshi mae ni hikkoshita node, atarashī machi no seikatsu ni nareru no ni jikan ga kakarimashita (I moved half a year ago, so it took me time to get used to living in this new town and adjust to the daily routines) 半年も日本語を勉強しているのに、まだ複雑な会話をするのは苦手で、時々自信をなくしてしまいます hantoshi mo nihongo o benkyō shite iru noni, mada fukuzatsu na kaiwa o suru no wa nigate de, tokidoki jishin o nakushite shimaimasu (Even though I’ve been studying Japanese for half a year, I still struggle with complex conversations and sometimes lose confidence)

Word/Phrase: 二十歳
Romaji: hatachi
Meaning: umur 20
Example: 二十歳の時、私は大学に入り、新しい友達や経験に出会いました。 hatachi no toki, watashi wa daigaku ni hai, atarashī tomodachi ya keiken ni deaimashita. (When I turned twenty, I entered university and met new friends and experiences.) 二十歳は人生の大きな変化の始まりで、自立の第一歩を踏み出す時期です。 hatachi wa jinsei no ōkina henka no hajimari de, jiritsu no daiippo o fumidasu jiki desu. (Twenty years old marks the beginning of major life changes and is a time to take the first step toward independence.)

Word/Phrase: 平日
Romaji: heijitsu
Meaning: weekdays
Example: 平日は忙しくて、週末にしか家族とゆっくり食事をする時間がなく、友達と会う余裕もありません heijitsu wa isogashikute, shūmatsu ni shika kazoku to yukkuri shokujī o suru jikan ga nakū, tomodachi to au yoyū mo arimasen (On weekdays, I’m so busy that I don’t even have time to eat leisurely with my family, let alone meet up with friends—it only happens on weekends) 平日も週末も関係なく、資格試験のために毎日図書館で4時間以上勉強を続けています heijitsu mo shūmatsu mo kankei naku, shikaku shiken no tame ni mainichi toshokan de yojikan ijō benkyō o tsuzuke te imasu (To prepare for my certification exam, I study for over four hours every day at the library, whether it’s a weekday or weekend)

Word/Phrase: 日にち
Romaji: hinichi
Meaning: tanggal
Example: 旅行の計画を立てている最中、参加者全員の都合が合う日にちを見つけるのは、思ったよりも時間がかかりそうだ。 ryokō no keikaku o tatete iru saichū, sanka-sha zen’in no tsugō ga au hinichi o mitsukeru no wa, omotta yori mo jikan ga kakari sō da. (While making travel plans, finding a date that suits everyone’s schedule seems to take longer than expected.) 先月発表されたプロジェクトの最終日にちが突然延期されたため、関係者は予定を一から組み直す必要に迫られている。 sengetsu happyō sa reta purojekuto no saishū hinichi ga totsuzen enki sa reta tame, kankei-sha wa yotei o ichi kara kuminaosu hitsuyō ni semararete iru. (Since the project’s final deadline, announced last month, was suddenly postponed, those involved are now forced to reorganize their schedules from scratch.)

Word/Phrase: 昼
Romaji: hiru
Meaning: noon
Example: 昼休みの時間に、私はよくおにぎりを手作りして、公園のベンチで食べながら小説を読むのが楽しみです Hiruyasumi no jikan ni, watashi wa yoku onigiri o tezukuri shite, kōen no benchi de tabenagara shōsetsu o yomu no ga tanoshimi desu (During lunchtime, I enjoy making handmade onigiri and reading novels on a park bench while eating them) 昼間は太陽がまぶしくて、街中の喧騒も活気に満ちているので、私はこの時間帯の散歩が特に好きです Hiruma wa taiyō ga mabushikute, machinaka no kensō mo katsuki ni michite iru node, watashi wa kono jikan-tai no sanpo ga tokuni suki desu (I particularly like taking walks during the day because the sunlight is bright and the city bustle is full of energy)

Word/Phrase: 昼間
Romaji: hiruma
Meaning: daytime
Example: 昼間は教室の窓から差し込む陽の光に照らされながら、黒板に書かれた複雑な数式と格闘する生徒たちの姿が見られた。 Hiruma wa kyōshitsu no mado kara sashikomu hi no hikari ni terasare nagara, kokuban ni kakareta fukuzatsu na sūshiki to kakutō suru seito-tachi no sugata ga mirareta. (During the daytime, students could be seen grappling with complex equations written on the blackboard, illuminated by sunlight streaming through the classroom windows.) --- 昼間の市場は、新鮮な野菜や果物を売る店とそれを買い求める主婦たちの活気に満ち、賑やかな声が行き交っていた。 Hiruma no ichiba wa, shinsen na yasai ya kudamono o uru mise to sore o kaimotomeru shufu-tachi no katsuki ni michi, nigiyaka na koe ga ikikatte ita. (The daytime market was filled with the lively energy of shops selling fresh vegetables and fruits and housewives buying them, bustling with cheerful voices.)

Word/Phrase: 今にも
Romaji: imanimo
Meaning: at any moment
Example: 空は重い雲に覆われ、今にも雪が降りそうな気配だ。駅に向かう人々は、足元に注意しながら急ぎ足で歩いている。 Kū wa omoi kumo ni ōware, ima nimo yuki ga furisō na kehai da. Eki ni mukau hitobito wa, ashimoto ni chūi shinagara isogiashi de aruite iru. (The sky is heavy with clouds, giving the feeling that it could snow at any moment. People heading to the station walk briskly, careful of their footing.) 地震の影響で、今にも崖が崩れそうな場所がある。作業員たちは、安全を確認しながら、注意深く復旧作業を進めている。 Jishin no eikyō de, ima nimo gake ga kuzuresō na basho ga aru. Sagyōin-tachi wa, anzen o kakunin shinagara, chūi bukaku fukkyū sagyō o susumete iru. (Due to the earthquake, there are areas where the cliff looks like it could collapse at any moment. Workers carefully proceed with restoration, ensuring safety at every step.)

Word/Phrase: いつか
Romaji: itsuka
Meaning: someday
Example: いつか家族と一緒に世界一周の旅に出て、色々な文化や風景をこの目で見てみたいです itsuka kazoku to issho ni sekaijū no tabi ni dete, iroirona bunka ya fūkei o kono me de mitemitaidesu (I want to go on a trip around the world with my family someday and see various cultures and landscapes with my own eyes) いつか地元のコミュニティのために、図書館や公園のような公共施設を自分で設計して建てたいと夢見ています itsuka jimoto no komyunitī no tame ni, toshokan ya kōen no yō na kōkyō shisetsu o jibun de sekkei shite tateru/tatetai to yumemiteimasu (I dream of designing and building public facilities like libraries and parks for my local community someday)

Word/Phrase: 時代
Romaji: jidai
Meaning: era
Example: この時代に生まれてよかったと感じることもあれば、逆に不安を覚えることもある kono jidai ni umarete yokatta to kanjiru koto mo areba, gyaku ni fuan o oboeru koto mo aru (Sometimes I feel glad to have been born in this era, but other times I feel anxious about it) 江戸時代の文化は現代にも多大な影響を与え続けている Edo jidai no bunka wa gendai ni mo tadai na eikyō o ataetsuzukete iru (The culture of the Edo era continues to have a tremendous influence even in modern times)

Word/Phrase: 今度
Romaji: kondo
Meaning: next time
Example: 今度の休みに、友達と一緒に映画を見に行って、その後カフェで最近読んだ本について話し合う予定です。 kondo no yasumi ni, tomodachi to issho ni eiga o mi ni itte, sono ato kafe de saikin yonda hon ni tsuite hanashiau yotei desu. (Next holiday, I’m going to watch a movie with my friends, and afterward, we’ll discuss the book we recently read at a café.) 今度の出張では、新しいプロジェクトのプレゼンテーションを準備しながら、現地の文化も体験したいと思っています。 kondo no shucchō de wa, atarashī purojekuto no purezentēshon o junbi shinagara, genchi no bunka mo taikenshitai to omotte imasu. (For my next business trip, I plan to prepare a presentation for the new project while also experiencing the local culture.)

Word/Phrase: この間
Romaji: kono aida
Meaning: lately, the other day
Example: この間、友達と一緒に新しくオープンしたイタリアンレストランでディナーを楽しみました kono aida, tomodachi to issho ni atarashiku ōpun shita itarian resutoran de dinā o tanoshimimashita (Lately, I enjoyed dinner with my friend at a newly opened Italian restaurant) この間、公園で読書をしていたら、突然知らない犬が近づいてきて一緒に遊ぶことになりました kono aida, kōen de dokusho o shite itara, totsuzen shiranai inu ga chikazuite kitte issho ni asobu koto ni narimashita (The other day, while I was reading in the park, a strange dog suddenly approached me and we ended up playing together)

Word/Phrase: この頃
Romaji: konogoro
Meaning: these days
Example: この頃、新しいレストランがたくさんオープンし、友達と週末に食べ歩きを楽しんでいます konogoro, atarashii resutoran ga takusan ōpun shi, tomodachi to shūmatsu ni tabearuki o tanoshinde imasu (These days, many new restaurants have opened, and I’ve been enjoying food tours with friends on weekends) この頃、仕事の合間に近所のカフェでランチを取るのが日課になりました konogoro, shigoto no aima ni kinjo no kafe de ranchi o toru no ga nikka ni narimashita (These days, grabbing lunch at a nearby café during work breaks has become my daily routine)

Word/Phrase: 今年
Romaji: kotoshi
Meaning: this year
Example: 今年の目標は日本語をもっと上手に話せるようになることです kotoshi no mokuhyō wa nihongo o motto jōzu ni hanaseru yō ni naru koto desu (My goal for this year is to become much more skilled at speaking Japanese fluently)

Word/Phrase: 後半
Romaji: kouhan
Meaning: second half
Example: 後半からは、友達と一緒に図書館で勉強し、試験対策を徹底的に行うことにしました Kōhan kara wa, tomodachi to issho ni toshokan de benkyō shi, shiken taisaku o tetsuiteki ni okonau koto ni shimashita (From the second half onward, I decided to study with friends at the library and thoroughly prepare for exams)

Word/Phrase: 今日
Romaji: kyou
Meaning: today
Example: 今日友達と公園でピクニックをしたのは、手作りのサンドイッチを食べながら、来月の旅行の話で盛り上がったからだ。 kyou tomodachi to kōen de pikunikku o shita no wa, tezukuri no sandoitchi o tabenagara, raigetsu no ryokou no hanashi de moriagatta kara da. (The reason we had a picnic in the park with friends today was because, while eating homemade sandwiches, we got excited discussing next month’s travel plans.) ピクニックの後、みんなでカフェに行き、今日一日の楽しかった思い出を話しながら、デザートを味わった。 pikunikku no ato, minna de kafe ni iki, kyou ichinichi no tanoshikatta omoide o hanashinagara, dezāto o ajiwatta. (After the picnic, we all went to a café and, while talking about the fun memories from today, savored our desserts.)

Word/Phrase: 毎月
Romaji: maitsuki
Meaning: every month
Example: 毎月決まった日に銀行を訪れ、生活費の支払いを済ませた後は、 maitsuki kimatta hi ni ginkō o otozure, seikatsuhi no shiharai o sumaseta ato wa, (On a fixed day every month, after visiting the bank and finishing utility payments, 残った予算でスーパーへ行き、必要な物を買い揃えるようにしている。 nokotta yosan de sūpā e iki, hitsuyō na mono o kaisoroe ni shite iru.) she carefully buys essential items at the supermarket with the remaining budget.) --- 毎月給料が入ると、まず家賃や電気代などの固定費を払い、 maitsuki kyūryō ga hairu to, mazu yachin ya denkidai nado no koteihi o harai, (Whenever her monthly salary arrives, she first pays fixed expenses like rent and electricity, その後、食費や貯金に回す金額を計画的に分けている。 sono go, shokuhi ya chokin ni mawasu kingaku o keikaku-teki ni wake te iru.) then systematically allocates funds for groceries and savings.)

Word/Phrase: 年後
Romaji: nengo
Meaning: years later
Example: 大学を出た直後ではなく、一度国内で経験を積んだ後、3年後に海外の支社へ赴任することになった。 Daigaku o deta chokugo dewa naku, ichido kokunai de keiken o tsunda ato, san-nengo ni kaigai no shisha e funin suru koto ni natta. (Setelah tidak langsung bekerja setelah lulus, dia memutuskan untuk terlebih dahulu mengumpulkan pengalaman di dalam negeri, lalu bertugas di cabang luar negeri tiga tahun kemudian.) 新しい公園の建設計画は、予算の問題で何度も延期されたが、ようやく7年後には地域の人に開放される予定だ。 Atarashii kōen no kenchiku keikaku wa, yosan no mondai de nando mo enki sareta ga, yōyaku shichi-nengo ni wa chiiki no hito ni kaihō sareru yotei da. (Rencana pembangunan taman baru beberapa kali tertunda karena masalah anggaran, tetapi akhirnya dijadwalkan akan dibuka untuk publik tujuh tahun lagi.)

Word/Phrase: 年前
Romaji: nenzen
Meaning: years ago
Example: 去年の夏休みに、友達と一緒に京都へ旅行に行きました kyonen no natsuyasumi ni, tomodachi to issho ni Kyōto e ryokō ni ikimashita (Last summer vacation, I went on a trip to Kyoto with my friends, and it was an unforgettable experience.) 特に、京都の古い寺院を訪れた時、その歴史的な建築美に圧倒されました tokuni, Kyōto no furui jiin o otozureta toki, sono rekishiteki na kenchiku bi ni attō saremashita (In particular, when I visited the ancient temples in Kyoto, I was overwhelmed by their historical architectural beauty.)

Word/Phrase: 一昨日
Romaji: ototoi
Meaning: kemarin lusa
Example: 一昨日友達と訪れた美術館の展示は、電車の遅延で予定より1時間遅く到着したため、ゆっくり見る時間が十分に取れませんでした ototoi tomodachi to otozureta bijutsukan no tenji wa, densha no chien de yotei yori ichijikan oso ku touchaku shita tame, yukkuri miru jikan ga juubun ni toremasen deshita (The exhibition at the art museum I visited with my friend the day before yesterday couldn’t be viewed leisurely because we arrived an hour later than planned due to train delays) 一昨日ネットで注文した家具は、今日届いたものの、説明書が複雑で、組み立てに3時間も費やすことになりました ototoi netto de chūmon shita kagu wa, kyō todoita mono no, setsumeisho ga fukuzatsu de, kumitate ni sanjikan mo tsuiyasu koto ni narimashita (The furniture I ordered online the day before yesterday arrived today, but the instructions were so complicated that assembling it ended up taking three whole hours)

Word/Phrase: 一昨年
Romaji: ototoshi
Meaning: dua taun lalu
Example: 一昨年に東京で働いていた時、大手企業の厳しい競争環境の中で、初めてマーケティング戦略を立てる重要な役割を担いました。 ototoshi ni Tōkyō de hataraite ita toki, ōte kigyō no kibishī kyōsō kankyō no naka de, hajimete māketingu senryaku o tateru jūyōna yakuwari o ninemashita. (Dua tahun lalu, ketika bekerja di Tokyo, saya pertama kali diberi peran penting menyusun strategi pemasaran di lingkungan persaingan ketat perusahaan besar.) 一昨年の冬、大学時代の友人たちと計画した北海道のスキー旅行は、雪の降り積もる山々の中で、今でも忘れられない思い出の一つとなっています。 ototoshi no fuyu, daigaku jidai no yūjin-tachi to keikaku shita Hokkaidō no sukī ryokō wa, yuki no furitsumoru yamayama no naka de, ima demo wasurerarenai omoide no hitotsu to natte imasu. (Dua tahun lalu di musim dingin, perjalanan ski ke Hokkaido yang direncanakan bersama teman-teman masa kuliah menjadi salah satu kenangan tak terlupakan di antara pegunungan bersalju.)

Word/Phrase: 零時
Romaji: reiji
Meaning: dini hari
Example: 零時を過ぎると、普段は賑やかな駅前も人通りが絶え、コンビニの自動ドアが開く音だけが時折響く。 reiji o sugiru to, fudan wa nigiyaka na ekimae mo hitodōri ga tae, konbini no jidōdoa ga aku oto dake ga tokidoki hibiku. (Sesudah jam nol lewat, depan stasiun yang biasanya ramai pun sepi dari pejalan kaki, hanya suara pintu otomatis minimarket yang sesekali terdengar) このカフェは零時まで営業しており、仕事を終えたサラリーマンや、次の日の準備をする学生たちで深夜にもかかわらず賑わっている。 kono kafe wa reiji made eigyō shite ori, shigoto o oeta sararīman ya, tsugi no hi no junbi o suru gakuseitachi de shinya ni mo kakawarazu nigawatte iru. (Kafe ini buka hingga dini hari, dan meski sudah larut malam tetap ramai oleh karyawan yang baru selesai bekerja atau mahasiswa yang mempersiapkan hari esok.)

Word/Phrase: さっき
Romaji: sakki
Meaning: a while ago
Example: さっき、スーパーで買った野菜を使って、今晩ご飯を作ろうと思っているんだ Sakki, sūpā de katta yasai o tsukatte, konban gohan o tsukurou to omotte iru n da (I was at the supermarket a while ago and bought some vegetables, so now I’m planning to cook dinner with them tonight.) さっき友達から電話があって、急に今週末に旅行に行こうって話になってさ Sakki tomodachi kara denwa ga atte, kyū ni konshūmatsu ni ryokō ni ikō tte hanashi ni natte sa (A friend called me a little while ago, and suddenly we ended up talking about going on a trip this weekend.)

Word/Phrase: 再来週
Romaji: saraishu
Meaning: the week after next
Example: 再来週の月曜日は、天気が良ければ、友達と一緒に公園でピクニックをする予定です saraishū no getsuyōbi wa, tenki ga yokereba, tomodachi to issho ni kōen de pikunikku o suru yotei desu (If the weather is nice next Monday the week after next, I plan to have a picnic in the park with my friends) 再来週は、学校のテストが終わるので、少し休みたいと思っています saraishū wa, gakkō no tesuto ga owaru node, sukoshi yasumitai to omotte imasu (Since school tests will be over the week after next, I’ve been thinking about taking a short break to relax)

Word/Phrase: 世紀
Romaji: seiki
Meaning: abad
Example: この本は20世紀の歴史について詳しく書かれています kono hon wa nijūseiki no rekishi ni tsuite kuwashiku kakarete imasu (This book provides a detailed account of the historical events that shaped the 20th century) 21世紀はテクノロジーがとても発達していますが、自然を守ることも大切です nijūisseiki wa tekunorojī ga totemo hattatsu shite imasu ga, shizen o mamoru koto mo taisetsu desu (While the 21st century has seen remarkable advancements in technology, preserving nature remains equally essential)

Word/Phrase: 正月
Romaji: shougatsu
Meaning: new year
Example: 正月は日本で一番大切な休みの時期で、家族と一緒に過ごす時間がとても楽しいです Shōgatsu wa Nihon de ichiban taisetsu na yasumi no jiki de, kazoku to issho ni sugoshu jikan ga totemo tanoshii desu (New Year is the most important holiday period in Japan, and spending time with family is truly joyful) 正月には初詣に行ったり、おせち料理を食べたり、お年玉をもらったりする習慣があります Shōgatsu ni wa hatsumōde ni ittari, osechi ryōri o tabetari, otoshidama o morattari suru shūkan ga arimasu (During New Year, there are customs like visiting a shrine for the first time in the year, eating osechi cuisine, and receiving monetary gifts called otoshidama)

Word/Phrase: 正午
Romaji: shougo
Meaning: 12pm
Example: 正午に学校の近くの公園で友達と会う約束をしました shougo ni gakkō no chikaku no kōen de tomodachi to au yakusoku o shimashita (I made plans to meet my friend at the park near the school at noon) 正午の太陽は真上から照りつけ、夏の暑さが一層厳しく感じられた shougo no taiyou wa massue kara teritsuke, natsu no atsusa ga issou kibishiku kanjirareta (The noon sun blazed directly overhead, making the summer heat feel even more intense)

Word/Phrase: 将来
Romaji: shourai
Meaning: future
Example: 将来は医者になりたいです。そして、病気の人を助けたいです。そのために、毎日勉強に励んでいます shōrai wa isha ni naritai desu. soshite, byōki no hito o tasuketai desu. sono tame ni, mainichi benkyō ni hagende imasu (In the future, I want to become a doctor and help sick people, so I work hard studying every day) 将来の夢は世界中を旅することです。だから、今から英語を勉強しています。また、現地の文化を学ぶために、様々な本も読んでいます shōrai no yume wa sekaijū o tabi suru koto desu. dakara, ima kara eigo o benkyō shite imasu. mata, genchi no bunka o manabu tame ni, samazama na hon mo yonde imasu (My dream for the future is to travel around the world, so I'm studying English starting now. I’m also reading various books to learn about local cultures.)

Word/Phrase: 週
Romaji: shu
Meaning: week
Example: 週末は忙しいですが、週の初めの月曜日は特に大変です shūmatsu wa isogashī desu ga, shū no hajime no getsuyōbi wa tokuni taihen desu (Weekends are always hectic, but the first day of the week, Monday, is particularly overwhelming because of work deadlines and meetings.) 週に一度、家族全員で夕食を手作りし、その時間を大切にしています shū ni ichido, kazoku zen’in de yūshoku o tezukuri shi, sono jikan o taisetsu ni shite imasu (Once a week, I make it a priority to cook dinner from scratch with my entire family and cherish that time together.)

Word/Phrase: 週末
Romaji: shuumatsu
Meaning: weekends
Example: 週末は家族で近くの温泉旅館に行き、ゆっくりと過ごしました shūmatsu wa kazoku de chikaku no onsen ryokan ni iki, yukkuri to sugoshimashita (Over the weekend, my family and I went to a nearby hot spring inn and spent our time relaxing) 週末に予定していたプロジェクトの準備が終わらなかったので、来週も引き続き取り組むことにしました shūmatsu ni yotei shite ita purojekuto no junbi ga owaranakatta node, raishū mo hikitsuzuki torikumu koto ni shimashita (The preparations for the project I had planned to finish over the weekend didn’t get done, so I decided to keep working on it next week)

Word/Phrase: 誕生日
Romaji: tanjoubi
Meaning: birthday
Example: 今年は、友達からもらった特別なプレゼントがあったため、誕生日を迎えるのがいつにも増して楽しみになり、小さなパーティーを開く準備を始めました Kotoshi wa, tomodachi kara moratta tokubetsu na purezento ga atta tame, tanjoubi o mukae ru no ga itsu ni mo mashite tanoshimi ni nari, chiisa na paatii o hiraku junbi o hajimemashita (This year, because I received a special gift from a friend, I became even more excited to celebrate my birthday than usual, so I started preparing for a small party) 去年の誕生日に家族と撮った写真は、今でもアルバムに貼ってあり、時々見返すたびに、あの日のケーキを食べた幸せな気持ちを思い出します Kyonen no tanjoubi ni kazoku to totta shashin wa, ima demo arubamu ni hatte ari, tokidoki mikaesu tabi ni, ano hi no kēki o tabeta shiawase na kimochi o omoidashimasu (The photos I took with my family on last year’s birthday are still pasted in the album, and every time I look back at them, I remember the happy feeling of eating that day’s cake)

Word/Phrase: 年
Romaji: toshi/nen
Meaning: year
Example: 来年の夏休みは、家族全員で沖縄のビーチリゾートへ1週間滞在する計画を立てています Rainen no natsu yasumi wa, kazoku zen'in de Okinawa no bīchi rizōto e isshūkan taizai suru keikaku o tatete imasu (Next year during summer vacation, we are planning a one-week stay at a beach resort in Okinawa with my entire family) 去年、日本語の勉強を始めてから、日々の練習を欠かさず続けた結果、会話も読解も驚くほど上達しました Kyonen, nihongo no benkyō o hajimete kara, hibijitsu no renshū o kakasazu tsuzuketa kekka, kaiwa mo dokkai mo odoroku hodo jōtatsu shimashita (Last year, after I started studying Japanese, I continued practicing daily without fail, and as a result, my conversation and reading skills improved remarkably)

Word/Phrase: 1日
Romaji: tsuitachi
Meaning: tanggal 1
Example: 毎月１日は、新しい目標を立ててその達成に向け、集中力を高めながら計画的に過ごす人が多いようです。 maitsuki tsuitachi wa, atarashii mokuhyou o tate sono tassei ni muke, shuuchuuryoku o takame nagara keikaku-teki ni sugosu hito ga ooi you desu. (Every month on the 1st, many people set new goals and spend their time methodically while increasing their focus to achieve them.) 今月の１日に、私は今年一番の難しいプロジェクトを始めましたが、その準備のために前の日から資料を整理していました。 kongetsu no tsuitachi ni, watashi wa kotoshi ichiban no muzukashii purojekuto o hajimemashita ga, sono junbi no tame ni mae no hi kara shiryou o seiri shite imashita. (On the 1st of this month, I started the most difficult project of the year, but I had been organizing materials for preparation since the day before.)

Word/Phrase: 曜日
Romaji: yobi
Meaning: day(in a week)
Example: 週末の日曜日は家族と一緒に公園へ散歩に行き、その後近くのカフェでお茶を飲みます shūmatsu no nichiyōbi wa kazoku to issho ni kōen e sanpo ni ikimasu, sono ato chikaku no kafe de ocha o nomimasu (On weekend Sundays, I go for a walk in the park with my family and then drink tea at a nearby café) 来週の日曜日に友達と美術館へ行って、新しい展示を見る予定です raishū no nichiyōbi ni tomodachi to bijutsukan e itte, atarashī tenji o miru yotei desu (Next Sunday, I plan to go to the art museum with my friends to see the new exhibition)

Word/Phrase: 夜中
Romaji: yonaka
Meaning: late night
Example: 夜中に突然大きな音がして、目が覚めました 近所の犬が激しく吠えているようで、しばらく眠れませんでした yonaka ni totsuzen ookina oto ga shite, me ga samemashita kinjo no inu ga hageshiku hoeteiru you de, shibaraku nemuremasen deshita (In the middle of the night, a loud noise suddenly woke me up. It seemed like the neighbor’s dog was barking fiercely, and I couldn’t sleep for a while) 夜中に起きて冷蔵庫をあさっていたら、久しぶりに食べたいものを見つけました それを温めて食べながら、懐かしい昔の思い出にふけってしまいました yonaka ni okite reizouko o asatte itara, hisashiburi ni tabetai mono o mitsukemashita sore o atatamete tabenagara, natsukashii mukashi no omoide ni fukette shimaimashita (After waking up in the middle of the night and rummaging through the fridge, I found something I hadn’t eaten in a long time. As I warmed it up and ate, I found myself lost in nostalgic memories of the past)

Word/Phrase: 夜
Romaji: yoru
Meaning: malem
Example: 夜は静かで、月明かりが湖の表面に反射し、星が無数に瞬いています Yoru wa shizuka de, tsukiakari ga mizuumi no hyōmen ni hansha shi, hoshi ga musū ni matataite imasu (The night is quiet, the moonlight reflects on the lake’s surface, and countless stars twinkle) 夜遅くまで研究論文を書き上げようと頑張り、最終的に目が疲れてしまいました Yoru osoku made kenkyū ronbun o kakiageyō to ganbari, saishūteki ni me ga tsukarete shimaimashita (I struggled to finish writing my research paper late into the night, and my eyes ended up exhausted)

Word/Phrase: 夕べ
Romaji: yuube
Meaning: last night (poetic)
Example: 夕べ銀座の高級レストランで友達とフルコースを味わった後、予想を超える会計に驚き、財布の重さを実感した yuube Ginza no kōkyū resutoran de tomodachi to furu kōsu o ajiwatta ato, yosō o koeru kaikei ni odoroki, saifu no omosa o jikkanshita (After savoring a full-course meal with friends at an upscale Ginza restaurant last night, I was shocked by the unexpectedly high bill and felt the weight of my wallet.) 夕べ公園のベンチで彼と話し続けた結果、気づいた時には空が白み始め、朝の訪れを告げていた yuube kōen no benchi de kare to hanashi tsudzuketa kekka, kizuita toki ni wa sora ga shiramihajime, asa no otozure o tsugete ita (As a result of talking with him on a park bench last night, when I noticed, the sky had begun to lighten, signaling the arrival of morning.)

Word/Phrase: 夕方
Romaji: yuugata
Meaning: evening
Example: 夕方になると、近所の公園で犬を連れてゆっくり歩き、一日の疲れを癒すのが習慣だ。 yūgata ni naru to, kinjo no kōen de inu o tsurete yukkuri aruki, ichinichi no tsukare o iyasu no ga shūkan da. (When evening comes, it has become my habit to walk my dog slowly in the neighborhood park and heal the fatigue of the day.) 日が沈む前の夕方にスーパーへ行くと、客が少ないため、必要なものを落ち着いて選べる。 hi ga shizumu mae no yūgata ni sūpā e iku to, kyaku ga sukunai tame, hitsuyō na mono o ochitsuite eraberu.

Word/Phrase: 前半
Romaji: zenhan
Meaning: first half
Example: 前半の試合はとても面白かったですけど、後半は少しつまらなかったです zenhan no shiai wa totemo omoshirokatta desu kedo, kōhan wa sukoshi tsumaranakatta desu (The first half of the match was very exciting, but the second half was a little boring) 前半の映画は緊張感があったけど、後半は少しゆっくりした感じだった zenhan no eiga wa kinchōkan ga atta kedo, kōhan wa sukoshi yukkuri shita kanji datta (The first half of the movie was full of suspense, but the second half felt a bit slow-paced)

Word/Phrase: 軍艦
Romaji: gunkan
Meaning: battleship
Example: 軍艦が港に入ってきたとき、空は曇り、波は静かだったが、みんなで見に行きました Gunkan ga minato ni haitte kita toki, sora wa kumori, nami wa shizuka datta ga, min'na de mi ni ikimashita (When the battleship entered the harbor, the sky was cloudy and the waves were calm, but we all went to see it) その軍艦はとても大きくて、黒光りする船体が太陽の光を反射し、子どもたちは驚嘆の声を上げていました Sono gunkan wa totemo ōkikute, kurobikari suru sentai ga taiyō no hikari o hansha shi, kodomotachi wa kyōtan no koe o agete imashita (The battleship was so large that its gleaming black hull reflected the sunlight, and the children exclaimed in amazement)

Word/Phrase: 番線
Romaji: —bansen
Meaning: peron nomor—
Example: 電車の番線は混雑しているため、次の電車を待つことにしました densha no bansen wa komitsu shite iru tame, tsugi no densha o matu koto ni shimashita (The train platform number was crowded, so I decided to wait for the next train) この駅では、複数の番線が設けられているため、乗り換えが非常に便利です kono eki de wa, fukusū no bansen ga mouke rarete iru tame, norikae ga hijō ni benri desu (At this station, multiple platforms are available, making transfers extremely convenient)

Word/Phrase: 歩いて
Romaji: aruite
Meaning: by foot
Example: 駅まで歩いて行きたいけど、遠すぎて疲れそうだから、バスに乗ることにしました Eki made aruite ikitai kedo, tō sugite tsukare sō dakara, basu ni noru koto ni shimashita (I wanted to walk to the station, but it’s too far and I’d probably get tired, so I decided to take the bus instead)

Word/Phrase: 馬車
Romaji: basha
Meaning: delman
Example: 馬車が公園をゆっくりと通るのを見た時、私は昔の映画の一場面を思い出した basha ga kōen o yukkuri to tōru no o mita toki, watashi wa mukashi no eiga no ichiba-men o omoidashita (When I saw the horse-drawn carriage slowly passing through the park, I was reminded of a scene from an old movie) その馬車は赤いビロードの布で華やかに飾られていて、祭りの日の王女のように美しかった sono basha wa akai birōdo no nuno de hanayaka ni kazara rete ite, matsuri no hi no ōjo no yō ni utsukushikatta (The carriage was adorned with luxurious red velvet cloth, as beautiful as a princess on festival day)

Word/Phrase: 地下鉄
Romaji: chikatetsu
Meaning: subway
Example: 地下鉄は便利ですが、特に朝夕の通勤時間帯は人が多くて、座ることも難しいほど混雑しています。 Chikatetsu wa benri desu ga, tokuni chōyū no tsūkin jikantai wa hito ga ōkute, suwaru koto mo muzukashī hodo kōsatsu shiteimasu. (The subway is convenient, but especially during morning and evening rush hours, it gets so crowded with people that even finding a seat is difficult.) 地下鉄の駅構内にはコンビニやカフェもあり、利用者にとって便利な空間が整備されています。 Chikatetsu no eki kōnai ni wa konbini ya kafe mo ari, riyōsha ni totte benri na kūkan ga seibi sareteimasu. (Inside subway stations, there are convenience stores and cafes, creating a convenient space for commuters.)

Word/Phrase: 中古車
Romaji: chuukosha
Meaning: mobil bekas
Example: 中古車を購入する際は、車検証に記載された走行距離や過去の修理履歴をよく調べ、信頼できる販売店で見つけることが賢明です。 chūkosha o kōnyū suru sai wa, shaken-shō ni kisai sareta sōkō kyori ya kako no shūri rireki o yoku shirabe, shinrai dekiru hanbaiten de mitsukeru koto ga kenmei desu. (When buying a used car, it’s wise to thoroughly check the mileage and repair history listed on the inspection certificate and find one at a trustworthy dealership.) 中古車市場では、同じ車種でも年式が新しいほど価格が高くなるため、予算と使い道を考慮してバランスよく選ぶ必要があります。 chūkosha shijō de wa, onaji shushu demo nenshiki ga atarashii hodo kakaku ga takaku naru tame, yosan to tsukaimichi o kōryo shite baransu yoku erabu hitsuyō ga arimasu. (In the used car market, newer model years of the same car type tend to be more expensive, so it’s important to choose carefully while balancing budget and intended use.)

Word/Phrase: 電車
Romaji: densha
Meaning: kereta
Example: 通勤時間に電車が混雑するため、切符を先に買っておく人が多いが、ICカードを使えばその手間を省ける。 tsūkin jikan ni densha ga konzatsu suru tame, kippu o saki ni katte oku hito ga ōi ga, IC kādo o tsukaeba sono teama o habukeru. (Karena kereta sering penuh saat jam sibuk, banyak orang membeli tiket terlebih dahulu, tetapi dengan kartu IC, kerumitan itu bisa dihindari.) 電車の遅延が続き、予定より30分以上遅れている場合、会社の規則によっては上司への報告が必要になる。 densha no chien ga tsuzuki, yotei yori sanjūppun ijō okurete iru baai, kaisha no kisoku ni yotte wa jōshi e no hōkoku ga hitsuyō ni naru. (Jika keterlambatan kereta berlanjut dan terlambat lebih dari 30 menit dari jadwal, tergantung aturan perusahaan, mungkin perlu melapor ke atasan.)

Word/Phrase: 船
Romaji: fune
Meaning: kapal
Example: 昔から、人々は船を使って遠い国と貿易をしたり、新しい土地を探したりしてきました。大きな帆を持つ船は、風の力だけで広い海を何週間も渡ることができたのです。 mukashi kara, hitobito wa fune o tsukatte tōi kuni to bōeki o shitari, atarashii tochi o sagashitari shite kimashita. Ōkina ho o motsu fune wa, kaze no chikara dake de hiroi umi o nan-shūkan mo wataru koto ga dekita no desu. (Since ancient times, people have used ships to trade with distant countries and explore new lands. Large ships with sails could cross vast oceans for weeks using only wind power.) 現代の客船の中には、レストランやプール、映画館まである豪華なものもあります。例えば、数千人の乗客を乗せた船が、夜になるとライトアップされ、海の上に浮かぶホテルのように見えることもあるのです。 gendai no kyakufune no naka ni wa, resutoran ya pūru, eigakan made aru gōka na mono mo arimasu. Tatoeba, sūsen’nin no jōkyaku o noseta fune ga, yoru ni naru to raito appu sare, umi no ue ni ukabu hoteru no yō ni mieru koto mo aru no desu. (Some modern passenger ships are luxuriously equipped with restaurants, pools, and even theaters. For instance, a ship carrying thousands of passengers may light up at night, resembling a floating hotel on the sea.)

Word/Phrase: 普通
Romaji: futsu
Meaning: kereta biasa (berhenti di setiap stasiun)
Example: このレシピは、料理に慣れていない普通の人が見ても、写真付きの説明があるので、失敗せずに作れるように工夫されています。 kono reshipi wa, ryōri ni narete inai futsū no hito ga mite mo, shashin tsuki no setsumei ga aru node, shippai sezu ni tsukureru yō ni kūfu sarete imasu. (This recipe is designed so that even someone with no cooking experience can follow the photo-illustrated instructions and prepare it without mistakes.) 仕事が忙しくても、健康を保つため、普通の生活リズムを崩さないよう、夜は早めに寝て朝は決まった時間に起きることを続けている。 shigoto ga isogashikute mo, kenkō o tamotsu tame, futsū no seikatsu rizumu o kuzusanai yō, yoru wa hayame ni nete asa wa kimatta jikan ni okiru koto o tsuzuke te iru. (Even when work is busy, to maintain health, I keep a regular daily rhythm by going to bed early and waking up at the same time every morning.)

Word/Phrase: 飛行機
Romaji: hikouki
Meaning: pesawat
Example: 空港へ向かう前に、飛行機のチケットを確認し、パスポートも忘れずにバッグに入れた。出発まであと3日しかないので、準備は急がなければならない。 kuukou e mukau mae ni, hikouki no chiketto o kakunin shi, pasupōto mo wasurezu ni baggu ni ireta. Shuppatsu made ato mittsu dake shika nai node, junbi wa isoganakereba naranai. (Sebelum berangkat ke bandara, saya memeriksa tiket pesawat dan memastikan paspor tidak lupa dimasukkan ke tas. Karena hanya tersisa 3 hari lagi, persiapan harus disegerakan.) 飛行機が滑走路を離れると同時に、窓の外に広がる雲海が旅のワクワク感を高めてくれた。この景色を見るたび、新しい場所への期待で胸がいっぱいになる。 hikouki ga kasshōro o hanareru to douji ni, mado no soto ni hirogaru unkai ga tabi no wakuwaku-kan o takamete kureta. Kono keshiki o miru tabi, atarashii basho e no kitai de mune ga ippai ni naru. (Saat pesawat meninggalkan landasan, pemandangan lautan awan di luar jendela semakin menambah kegembiraan perjalanan. Setiap kali melihat pemandangan ini, dada terasa penuh dengan harapan akan tempat baru.)

Word/Phrase: 自動車
Romaji: jidousha
Meaning: mobil
Example: 自動車は便利な交通手段ですが、特に朝夕のラッシュアワーには渋滞に巻き込まれてしまうことがあります jidousha wa benri na kōtsū shudan desu ga, tokuni chōyū no rasshu awā ni wa jūtai ni makikomarete shimau koto ga arimasu (Although cars are a convenient means of transportation, they can sometimes get caught in traffic jams, especially during morning and evening rush hours) 自動車の運転は風景を楽しみながら移動できるため楽しいですが、常に周囲の安全確認を怠らず、交通ルールを守ることが大切です jidousha no unten wa fūkei o tanoshimi nagara idō dekiru tame tanoshii desu ga, tsune ni shūi no anzen kakunin o okotarazu, kōtsū rūru o mamoru koto ga taisetsu desu (Driving a car can be enjoyable as you move while appreciating the scenery, but it is important to always check your surroundings for safety and follow traffic rules)

Word/Phrase: 自転車
Romaji: jitensha
Meaning: sepeda
Example: 自転車で公園を一周すると、風を感じながら景色を楽しむことができます jitensha de kōen o isshū suru to, kaze o kanjinagara keshiki o tanoshimu koto ga dekimasu (Dengan bersepeda mengelilingi taman, Anda dapat menikmati pemandangan sambil merasakan angin) 自転車通勤を始めてから、健康的な生活リズムが身につきました jitensha tsūkin o hajimete kara, kenkōteki na seikatsu rizumu ga mi ni tsukimashita (Sejak mulai bersepeda ke tempat kerja, saya telah mengembangkan ritme hidup yang lebih sehat)

Word/Phrase: 各駅
Romaji: kakueki
Meaning: kereta (berhenti tiap stasiun)
Example: 各駅で販売されているお土産は、その地域ならではの味や工芸品が揃い、旅行者が足を止めずにはいられないほどの魅力に満ちている。 kakueki de hanbai sareteiru omiyage wa, sono chiiki naradeha no aji ya kōgeihin ga soroi, ryokōsha ga ashi o tomezu ni wa irarenai hodo no miryoku ni michiteiru. (The souvenirs sold at each station are filled with local flavors and crafts so captivating that travelers cannot help but stop to take a look.) 各駅の構内には、短い乗り換え時間でも利用しやすいように、コンビニやカフェが配置され、利便性と快適さが両立されている。 kakueki no kōnai ni wa, mijikai norikae jikan demo riyō shiyasui yō ni, konbini ya kafe ga haichi sare, ribensei to kaiteki-sa ga ryōritsu sareteiru. (Inside each station, convenience stores and cafes are strategically placed for easy use even during short transfers, balancing both convenience and comfort.)

Word/Phrase: 機内
Romaji: kinai
Meaning: in-flight
Example: 飛行機に乗ると、まず機内での電子機器の取り扱いについて説明がありますが、離陸後は機内モードに切り替えることで、安全にスマホを使うことが許可されます。 hikōki ni noru to, mazu kinai de no denshi kiki no toriatukai ni tuite setsumei ga arimasu ga, riku-go wa kinai mōdo ni kirikaeru koto de, anzen ni sumaho o tsukau koto ga kyoka saremasu. (When boarding a plane, there is first an explanation about handling electronic devices in-flight, but after takeoff, switching to airplane mode allows safe smartphone use.) 今回のフライトでは、機内食として出されたエビのグラタンが予想以上に美味しく、空の上でこんなに満足できる食事が提供されるとは驚きでした。 konkai no furaito de wa, kinai shoku to shite dasareta ebi no guratan ga yosō ijō ni oishiku, sora no ue de konna ni manzoku dekiru shokiji ga teikyō sareru to wa odoroki deshita. (On this flight, the shrimp gratin served as an in-flight meal was unexpectedly delicious, and I was amazed that such a satisfying meal could be provided mid-air.)

Word/Phrase: 汽船
Romaji: kisen
Meaning: kapal api
Example: 汽船は海を渡るのに便利な乗り物で、大きな荷物も運べます。 kisen wa umi o wataru no ni benri na norimono de, ōkina nimotsu mo hakobemasu. (Steamships are convenient vehicles for crossing the ocean and can also carry large cargo.) 汽船は19世紀に国際貿易の発展に大きく貢献し、遠く離れた港同士を結ぶ重要な交通手段となりました。 kisen wa 19 seiki ni kokusai bōeki no hattatsu ni ōkiku kōken shi, tōku hanareta minato dōshi o musubu jūyō na kōtsū shudan to narimashita. (Steamships greatly contributed to the development of international trade in the 19th century, becoming a vital means of transportation connecting distant ports.)

Word/Phrase: 強行
Romaji: kyoukou
Meaning: kereta express
Example: 彼は強行な態度で、プロジェクトの期限を守るために、チームメンバーの意見を聞かずに作業を強引に進めた。 Kare wa kyoukou na taido de, purojekuto no kigen o mamoru tame ni, chiimu menbaa no iken o kikazu ni sagyou o gouin ni susumeta. (With a forceful attitude, he pushed the work aggressively without listening to the team members' opinions in order to meet the project deadline) 強行列車が定時を守るため、途中駅を通過し、目的地までノンストップで走り続けた。 Kyoukou ressha ga teiji o mamoru tame, tochuu eki o tsuuka shi, mokutekichi made nonsutoppu de hashiri tsuzuketa. (The express train skipped intermediate stations to stay on schedule and continued running nonstop to its destination.)

Word/Phrase: 救急車
Romaji: kyuukyuusha
Meaning: ambulan
Example: 救急車が到着するまでの間、彼は強い痛みに耐え続けていましたが、やがて息が苦しくなり、その場に倒れてしまったそうです。 kyuukyuusha ga tochaku suru made no aida, kare wa tsuyoi itami ni taezudzuke te imashita ga, yagate iki ga kurushiku nari, sono ba ni taore te shimaimashita sou desu. (It is said that until the ambulance arrived, he kept enduring the intense pain, but eventually had difficulty breathing and collapsed where he stood.) 遠くから救急車のサイレンが聞こえると、近くにいた人たちがすぐに道の両側に寄り、救急車がスムーズに通れるように協力しました。 tooku kara kyuukyuusha no sāiren ga kikoeru to, chikaku ni ita hitotachi ga sugu ni michi no ryōgawa ni yori, kyuukyuusha ga sumūzu ni tooreru you ni kyōryoku shimashita. (When the ambulance siren was heard from afar, the people nearby immediately moved to both sides of the road and cooperated to allow the ambulance to pass smoothly.)

Word/Phrase: 長閑
Romaji: nodoka
Meaning: peaceful
Example: 長閑な日曜日は、庭で本を読みながら、時折吹く風に耳を傾けていると、心まで穏やかになる nodoka na nichiyōbi wa, niwa de hon o yominagara, tokidoki fuku kaze ni mimi o katamuke te iru to, kokoro made odayaka ni naru (On a peaceful Sunday, reading a book in the garden while listening to the occasional breeze makes even my heart feel calm) この町の長閑な雰囲気は、古い木造家屋と石畳の路地が織りなす、時間が止まったような静けさにある kono machi no nodoka na fun'iki wa, furui mokuzō kaoku to ishidatami no roji ga orinasu, toki ga tomatta yō na shizukesa ni aru (The peaceful atmosphere of this town lies in its quietness as if time has stopped, woven by old wooden houses and cobblestone alleys)

Word/Phrase: 乗り物
Romaji: norimono
Meaning: kendaraan
Example: 電車やバスなどの乗り物に乗るたび、友達は窓から見える風景の変化を楽しみ、新しい路線の地図を広げては次にどこへ行こうかと考えている。 densha ya basu nado no norimono ni noru tabi, tomodachi wa mado kara mieru fūkei no henka o tanoshimi, atarashī rosen no chizu o hirogete wa tsugi ni doko e ikō ka to kangaete iru. (Every time my friend rides vehicles like trains or buses, they enjoy the changing scenery from the window and spread out a map of new routes, thinking about where to go next.) 公園の砂場では、子供たちが乗り物の形をしたおもちゃに乗っては、楽しそうに走り回り、時々転んでしまってもすぐに立ち上がる。 kōen no sunaba de wa, kodomotachi ga norimono no katachi o shita omocha ni notte wa, tanoshisō ni hashirimawari, tokidoki koronde shimatte mo sugu ni tachiagaru. (In the park’s sandbox, children ride toy vehicles, happily running around, and even if they occasionally fall, they quickly get back up.)

Word/Phrase: 往復
Romaji: oufuku
Meaning: round trip
Example: 東京から大阪まで往復するのに、新幹線を使えば約二時間半で着きます Tōkyō kara Ōsaka made ōfuku suru no ni, Shinkansen o tsukaeba yaku ni-jikan han de tsuki masu (It takes about two and a half hours to make a round trip from Tokyo to Osaka if you take the Shinkansen) 往復の航空券を予約する際は、出発と帰着の空港ターミナルが異なる場合があるので注意してください Ōfuku no kōkūken o yoyaku suru sai wa, shuppatsu to kichaku no kūkō tāminaru ga kotonaru baai ga aru node chūi shite kudasai (When booking a round-trip flight ticket, be careful as the departure and arrival airport terminals may sometimes differ)

Word/Phrase: 車両
Romaji: sharyou
Meaning: vehicle
Example: 駅の北側にある広い車両基地では、朝から夜まで電車が整備のために次々と入ってきます。 Eki no hokugawa ni aru hiroi sharyō kichi de wa, asa kara yoru made densha ga seibi no tame ni tsugi-tsugi to haitte kimasu. (At the spacious vehicle depot located north of the station, trains come in one after another from morning till night for maintenance.) 最近導入された車両は、事故を防ぐためのシステムが備わっているので、乗客からも評判です。 Saikin dōnyū sareta sharyō wa, jiko o fusegu tame no shisutemu ga sonawatte iru node, jōkyaku kara mo hyōban desu. (The recently introduced vehicles are well-received by passengers because they are equipped with systems to prevent accidents.)

Word/Phrase: 新幹線
Romaji: shinkansen
Meaning:
Example: 新幹線はとても速くて便利な交通手段で、日本の主要都市間を効率的に結んでいます Shinkansen wa totemo hayakute benri na kōtsū shudan de, Nihon no shuyō toshi-kan o kōritsuteki ni musunde imasu (The Shinkansen is a very fast and convenient mode of transportation, efficiently connecting major cities in Japan) 例えば東京から博多まで約5時間で移動できるため、ビジネスや観光に最適です Tatoeba Tōkyō kara Hakata made yaku go-jikan de idō dekiru tame, bijinesu ya kankō ni saiteki desu (For example, it takes about five hours to travel from Tokyo to Hakata, making it ideal for business and tourism)

Word/Phrase: 特急
Romaji: tokkyuu
Meaning: super express
Example: 特急を利用すれば目的地までの所要時間は半分以下になるが、急な出張で予算を大幅に超えたため、今回は普通列車での移動を余儀なくされた。 tokkyū o riyō sureba mokutekichi made no shoyō jikan wa hanbun ika ni naru ga, kyū na shucchō de yosan o ōhabi ni koeta tame, konkai wa futsū ressha de no idō o yogi naku sareta. (Though using the tokkyū would cut travel time to the destination by more than half, an unexpected business trip blew the budget, forcing a reluctant switch to local trains this time.) 東京行きの特急券を購入する余裕があれば、時間短縮のため新幹線すら検討の対象だったが、現実的には予算の関係で普通列車に頼るしかなかった。 Tōkyō-iki no tokkyūken o kōnyū suru yoyū ga areba, jikan tan-shuku no tame shinkansen sura kentō no taishō datta ga, genjitsuteki ni wa yosan no kankei de futsū ressha ni tayoru shika nakatta. (Had there been room in the budget for a tokkyū ticket to Tokyo, even the Shinkansen would have been under consideration for saving time—but in reality, financial constraints left no choice but to depend on local trains.)

Word/Phrase: 頭
Romaji: tou
Meaning: ekor (hewan besar)
Example: 頭の大きな鯨が海面で尾を打ち付ける光景は、自然の驚異の一つだ tou no ōkina kujira ga kaimen de o o uchitsukeru kōkei wa, shizen no kyōi no hitotsu da (Pemandangan paus besar yang menabrakkan ekornya di permukaan laut adalah salah satu keajaiban alam) 古代の壁画には、神聖な牛の頭が描かれていることが多い kodai no hekiga ni wa, shinsei na ushi no tou ga egakarete iru koto ga ōi (Banyak lukisan dinding kuno yang menggambarkan ekor sapi suci)

Word/Phrase: 倍
Romaji: bai
Meaning: kali lipat
Example: このケーキは普通のケーキよりも甘くて、砂糖の量が2倍、クリームも濃厚でカロリーは3倍近くになります Kono kēki wa futsū no kēki yori mo amakute, satō no ryō ga ni-bai, kurīmu mo nōkō de karorī wa san-bai chikaku ni narimasu (This cake is sweeter than a normal cake, with twice the sugar, richer cream, and nearly triple the calories) このスマートフォンは前のモデルよりもバッテリー容量が2倍で、処理速度も30%向上しています Kono sumātofon wa mae no moderu yori mo batterī yōryō ga ni-bai de, shori sokudo mo sanjū-pāsento kōjō shite imasu (This smartphone has twice the battery capacity of the previous model and a 30% faster processing speed)

Word/Phrase: 秒
Romaji: byou
Meaning: second
Example: プレゼンの締め切りが迫る中、時計の針は容赦なく進み、残り30秒という短い時間で最後のスライドを仕上げなければならない緊張感が部屋を包んだ。 purezentē no shimekiri ga semaru naka, tokei no hari wa yōsha naku susumi, nokori sanjūbyō to iu mijikai jikan de saigo no suraido o shiagenakereba naranai kinchōkan ga heya o kunda. (As the presentation deadline loomed, the clock’s hands advanced mercilessly, filling the room with tension—only 30 seconds remained to finalize the last slide.) このクイズアプリは、10秒という限られた時間内に正解を導き出せないと、即座に失格となり、次のステージへの挑戦権を失う厳しいルールが特徴だ。 kono kuizu apuri wa, jūbyō to iu kagirareta jikan-nai ni seikai o hikidase nai to, sokoku ni shikkaku to nari, tsugi no sutēji e no chōsenken o ushinau kibishī rūru ga tokuchō da. (This quiz app is known for its harsh rule: if a player cannot derive the correct answer within the limited 10-second window, they are instantly disqualified and lose the chance to advance to the next stage.)

Word/Phrase: 着
Romaji: chaku
Meaning: pakaian
Example: 冬の朝、着物を着て外に出ると、冷たい風が吹いても体が温かく保たれるので、祖母は毎日の散歩を楽しんでいます。 Fuyu no asa, kimono o kite soto ni deru to, tsumetai kaze ga fuitemo karada ga atatakaku tamotareru node, soba wa mainichi no sanpo o tanoshinde imasu. (On winter mornings, when my grandmother goes out wearing a kimono, she enjoys her daily walk because her body stays warm even in the cold wind.) 最近買ったコートは軽いのに暖かいので、着ると寒い日でも快適に仕事に行けるようになりました。 Saikin katta kōto wa karui noni atatakai node, kiru to samui hi demo kaiteki ni shigoto ni ikeru yō ni narimashita. (The coat I bought recently is light yet warm, so when I wear it, I can comfortably go to work even on cold days.)

Word/Phrase: 度
Romaji: do
Meaning: degree/kali
Example: この映画は、繰り返し見る度に、これまで気づかなかった細かい描写や、登場人物の心理が新たに見えてくる。 Kono eiga wa, kurikaeshi miru do ni, kore made kizukanakatta komakai byōsha ya, tōjō jinbutsu no shinri ga arata ni miete kuru. (Whenever I watch this movie repeatedly, subtle details and the psychology of the characters that I hadn’t noticed before gradually become clear.) この映画を見る度に、日常の小さな幸せを思い出し、胸の奥から自然と温かい気持ちが湧いてくる。 Kono eiga o miru do ni, nichijō no chiisa na shiawase o omoidashi, mune no oku kara shizen to atatakai kimochi ga waki te kuru. (Each time I watch this film, I recall the small joys of daily life, and a warm feeling naturally wells up from deep within my heart.)

Word/Phrase: 杯
Romaji: hai/pai
Meaning: cup
Example: 今日、友達と一緒にカフェでコーヒーを二杯注文し、窓際の席でゆっくりと楽しみました。 Kyō, tomodachi to issho ni kafe de kōhī o nihai chūmon shi, madogiwa no seki de yukkuri to tanoshimimashita. (Today, I ordered two cups of coffee with my friend and enjoyed them slowly by the window.) 私はホットコーヒーを一杯注文しましたが、店員さんに間違えてアイスコーヒーを持ってこられてしまいました。 Watashi wa hotto kōhī o ippai chūmon shimashita ga, ten’in-san ni machigaete aisukōhī o motte korarete shimaimashita. (I ordered one cup of hot coffee, but the staff mistakenly brought me iced coffee instead.)

Word/Phrase: 匹
Romaji: hiki
Meaning: ekor (hewan kecil)
Example: 犬が三匹、公園の広場でボールを追いかけっこしながら遊んでいました。 子供たちがはしゃぎながら、遠慮がちに犬たちに近づいていきました。 Inu ga sanbiki, kōen no hiroba de bōru o oikakkekkoshinagara asonde imashita. Kodomo-tachi ga hashaginagara, enryogachi ni inutachi ni chikazuite ikimashita. (Three dogs were energetically chasing a ball around the plaza in the park. The children, excited but hesitant, slowly approached them.)

Word/Phrase: 歩
Romaji: ho/po
Meaning: step
Example: この公園は一歩一歩確認しながら歩くのに最適な場所です Kono kōen wa ippo ippo kakunin shinagara aruku no ni saiteki na basho desu (This park is the perfect place to walk while carefully checking each step you take)

Word/Phrase: 本
Romaji: hon
Meaning: thin and long (pen, botol, train, email)
Example: 本棚にある本を読むのが好きです 特に小説や歴史の本が好きで、週に2冊ぐらい読みます hondana ni aru hon o yomu no ga suki desu tokuni shōsetsu ya rekishi no hon ga suki de, shū ni ni-satsu gurai yomimasu (I enjoy reading the books on my bookshelf, particularly novels and history books, and I usually finish about two of them every week) 図書館で新しく入った本を探すのが毎週の楽しみで、特に分厚い本を見つけるとワクワクします toshokan de atarashiku haitta hon o sagasu no ga maishū no tanoshimi de, tokuni buatsui hon o mitsukeru to wakuwaku shimasu (Searching for newly arrived books at the library is my weekly pleasure, and I get especially excited when I find thick, lengthy ones)

Word/Phrase: 位
Romaji: i
Meaning: ke-(urutan)
Example: 彼の位は会社の階級制度において上位3位にランクされ、経営陣への昇進も間近と見られている。 Kare no kurai wa kaisha no kaikyū seido ni oite jōi san'i ni ranku sare, keieijin e no shōshin mo makin to mirarete iru. (His rank is in the top three positions within the company's hierarchical system, and he is expected to be promoted to the executive team soon.) この大会では、彼の位は予選を突破した16人の中で5位という驚異的な成績だった。 Kono taikai de wa, kare no kurai wa yosen o toppa shita jūroku-nin no naka de go-i to iu kyōiteki na seiseki datta. (In this tournament, his rank was an impressive 5th among the 16 competitors who advanced past the preliminaries.)

Word/Phrase: 一部
Romaji: ichibu
Meaning: part
Example: 一部の学生は宿題を忘れてしまいましたが、先生は優しく注意し、次回から気をつけるよう助言しました Ichibu no gakusei wa shukudai o wasurete shimaimashita ga, sensei wa yasashiku chūi shi, jikai kara ki o tsukeru yō jogen shimashita (Some students forgot to do their homework, but the teacher gently reminded them and advised them to be careful next time) 一部の商品は在庫が少ないので、注文する前にウェブサイトで確認するか、店員にお問い合わせください Ichibu no shōhin wa zaiko ga sukunai node, chūmon suru mae ni webusaito de kakunin suru ka, ten’in ni otoiawase kudasai (Since some products have limited stock, please check the website or ask a staff member before placing an order)

Word/Phrase: 回
Romaji: kai
Meaning: kali
Example: この映画は三回も見たけど、友達と一緒の時が一番楽しかった。笑いが止まらなくて、お腹が痛くなったほどだ。 Kono eiga wa sankai mo mita kedo, tomodachi to issho no toki ga ichiban tanoshikatta. Warai ga tomaranakute, onaka ga itaku natta hodo da. (Though I watched this movie three times, it was most fun when I saw it with friends—I laughed so hard my stomach hurt.) 試験に合格するまで五回も受けたが、そのたびに勉強法を変えてみた。最後の回は、やっと自信が持てた。 Shiken ni goukaku suru made gokai mo uketa ga, sono tabi ni benkyouhou o kaete mita. Saigo no kai wa, yatto jishin ga moteta. (Until I passed the exam, I took it five times, changing my study method each time. On the last try, I finally felt confident.)

Word/Phrase: 階
Romaji: kai
Meaning: floor
Example: このビルの最上階から見渡すと、足下に広がる街の活気と、緑豊かな公園で遊ぶ子供たちの姿が一つの絵のように映りました Kono biru no saijōkai kara miwatasu to, ashimoto ni hirogaru machi no katsuki to, midori yutakana kōen de asobu kodomotachi no sugata ga hitotsu no e no yō ni hagorimashita (From the top floor of this building, the bustling city below and the children playing in the lush green park blend together like a single painting) 大学の近くにある、古本とコーヒーの香りが混ざり合う3階の空間で、久しく会っていない友人との再会を心待ちにしています Daigaku no chikaku ni aru, furuhon to kōhī no kaori ga mazariau sankai no kūkan de, hisashiku atte inai yūjin to no saikai o kokomachi ni shite imasu (In the third-floor space near the university, where the scents of old books and coffee intertwine, I eagerly await reuniting with a long-unseen friend)

Word/Phrase: 回目
Romaji: kaime
Meaning: urutan
Example: この旅行は私たちにとって3回目だが、毎回新しい発見があるのが楽しみだ。 kono ryokō wa watashitachi ni totte san kaime da ga, maikai atarashī hakken ga aru no ga tanoshimi da. (This trip is our third time, but the fun part is that we make new discoveries every time.) 先月行ったコンサートは2回目だったが、前回よりも感動してしまった。 sengetsu itta konsāto wa ni kaime datta ga, zenkai yori mo kandō shite shimatta. (The concert I went to last month was my second time, but I was even more moved than last time.)

Word/Phrase: 個
Romaji: ko
Meaning: barang small and compact
Example: このスーパーでは、果物のパック売りがお得で、りんごは1個100円、みかんは1個80円です kono sūpā de wa, kudamono no pakku uri ga otoku de, ringo wa 1-ko hyaku-en, mikan wa 1-ko hachijū-en desu (At this supermarket, fruit multipacks are a good deal, with apples priced at 100 yen each and mandarins at 80 yen each) レシピ通りに作るなら、ジャガイモを5個、ニンジンを3個、玉ねぎを2個用意してください reshipi doori ni tsukuru nara, jagaimo o 5-ko, ninjin o 3-ko, tamanegi o 2-ko yōi shite kudasai (If you're following the recipe, prepare 5 potatoes, 3 carrots, and 2 onions)

Word/Phrase: 組
Romaji: kumi
Meaning: set, group, pair
Example: 私たちはクラスでグループを組んで、共同で社会問題の解決に向けたプロジェクトを進めています Watashitachi wa kurasu de gurūpu o kuminde, kyōdō de shakai mondai no kaitō ni muketa purojekuto o susumete imasu (We form groups in class and work together on projects aimed at solving social issues) この大手企業では、部署ごとに専門家を組んで、国際的な市場展開戦略を練っています Kono ōte kigyō de wa, busho-goto ni senmonka o kuminde, kokusaiteki na shijō tenkai senryaku o neratte imasu (In this major company, experts are grouped by department to develop strategies for international market expansion)

Word/Phrase: 枚
Romaji: mai
Meaning: lembar
Example: この本は三百枚以上の写真が入っていますが、全部見るのは時間もかかるし、目も疲れてしまいます kono hon wa sanbyaku mai ijō no shashin ga haitte imasu ga, zenbu miru no wa jikan mo kakaru shi, me mo tsukarete shimaimasu (This book contains more than three hundred photos, but looking at all of them takes time and strains my eyes) この展覧会では、五十枚以上の貴重な絵画が展示されており、それぞれに詳細な説明が付けられています kono tenrankai de wa, gojū mai ijō no kichō na kaiga ga tenji sarete ori, sorezore ni shōsai na setsumei ga tsuke rarete imasu (At this exhibition, over fifty valuable paintings are on display, each accompanied by detailed explanations)

Word/Phrase: 歳
Romaji: sai
Meaning: age
Example: 来年は中学生になる弟は、小学生の頃から勉強に熱心で、毎日の宿題を早く終わらせるために努力を続けている。 Rainen wa chūgakusei ni naru otōto wa, shōgakusei no koro kara benkyō ni nesshin de, mainichi no shukudai o hayaku owaraseru tame ni doryoku o tsuzukete iru. (My younger brother, who will enter junior high next year, has been enthusiastic about studying since elementary school and continues to strive daily to finish his homework quickly.) 歳の差が3つある弟とは、休日に公園でサッカーをしたりボードゲームを楽しんだりして、よく時間を共に過ごしている。 Sai no sa ga mittsu aru otōto to wa, kyūjitsu ni kōen de sakkā o shitari bōdo gēmu o tanoshindari shite, yoku jikan o tomo ni sugoshite iru. (Though there’s a three-year age gap between my brother and me, we often spend time together on holidays playing soccer in the park or enjoying board games.)

Word/Phrase: 冊
Romaji: satsu
Meaning: buku
Example: 本棚にある本は全部で五十冊ありますが、まだ読んでいない本が三十冊もあります hon-tana ni aru hon wa zenbu de gojū-satsu arimasu ga, mada yonde inai hon ga sanjū-satsu mo arimasu (There are fifty books on the bookshelf in total, but I still have thirty unread books remaining) 大学の図書館で借りた参考書は十冊ありますが、試験までに全部読み終える必要があります daigaku no toshokan de karita sankōsho wa jū-satsu arimasu ga, shiken made ni zenbu yomi-oeru hitsuyō ga arimasu (I borrowed ten reference books from the university library, and I need to finish reading all of them before the exam)

Word/Phrase: 羽
Romaji: wa
Meaning: bulu (buat unggas)

(Taking a shower and keeping your body clean is important for your health.) 朝起きたら、まず冷たいシャワーを浴びて気分を爽快にします。 asa okitara, mazu tsumetai shawā o abite kibun o soukai ni shimasu. Word/Phrase: 歩く

(When I slowly walk along the narrow path in this park, the happy memories of playing with friends as a child return to my heart along with the wind.) 駅から家までの道を毎日歩くうちに、以前住んでいた町で見た夕焼けの美しさや、あの頃の静かな生活が懐かしくなる。 eki kara ie made no michi o mainichi aruku uchi ni, izen sunde ita machi de mita yūyake no utsukushisa ya, ano koro no shizuka na seikatsu ga natsukashiku naru. (As I walk the path from the station to my home every day, I grow nostalgic for the beauty of the sunsets I saw in the town where I used to live and the quiet life of that time.)

(At the park, just after winter break began, children can be seen energetically playing—making snowmen with the white snow or laughing as they chase each other around.) この町で毎年開催される雪祭りでは、家族連れが集まり、雪の上を転がったり、手作りのそりで滑ったりして、寒さを忘れて遊ぶ光景が広がっている。 kono machi de maitoshi kaisai sareru yukimatsuri de wa, kazokuzure ga atsumari, yuki no ue o korogattari, tezukuri no sori de suberittari shite, samusa o wasurete asobu kōkei ga hirogatte iru. (During yesterday's soccer match, when a player from the opposing team forcefully kicked the ball and it hit the head of a boy watching the game, he instinctively dropped to his knees from the pain.) 先月、学校の体育館でバレーボールの練習をしていた時、 上級生のスパイクが誤って後輩の肩に当たり、その場で倒れてしまった。 sengetsu, gakkou no taiikukan de bareebooru no renshuu o shiteita toki, joukyuusei no supaiku ga ayamatte kouhai no kata ni atari, sono ba de taorete shimatta. (at the end of autumn, leaves dyed red and yellow are dancing in the sky, blown by the strong wind) 北国の港では、漁船が出港するたび、海からの風が帆を力強く吹き抜けていく。 hokkoku no minato de wa, gyosen ga shukkō suru tabi, umi kara no kaze ga ho o chikarazuyoku fukinuketeiku.
