(On this unstable cliff edge, one wrong step could easily make you fall, so please be very careful.) 古い木製の階段は腐食が進んでいるため、上る際には手すりをしっかり握らないと落ちる危険性があります。 Furui mokusei no kaidan wa fushoku ga susunde iru tame, noboru sai ni wa tesuri o shikkari nigiranai to ochiru kiken-sei ga arimasu. (The old wooden stairs are badly corroded, so if you don’t hold the handrail firmly when climbing, there’s a risk you might fall.)

(When he announced the unexpected results during the meeting, everyone in the room was unanimously surprised, they say.) 駅のホームで突然知らない人が大きな荷物を落としたため、周りの人たちが一斉に驚いた。 Eki no hōmu de totsuzen shiranai hito ga ōkina nimotsu o otoshita tame, mawari no hitotachi ga issei ni odorokita. (When a stranger suddenly dropped a large bag on the station platform, the people around all gasped in surprise at once.)

(At the concert held in the park, the children, matching the bright tune, unconsciously began to move their bodies.) 夏祭りの夜、提灯の灯りに照らされた広場で、年齢を問わず多くの人が輪になって踊り続けた。 natsu matsuri no yoru, chōchin no akari ni terasa reta hiroba de, nenrei o towazu ōku no hito ga wa ni natte odoritsuzuketa.

Word/Phrase: 起きる

(Sesudah tiba di stasiun, setelah memastikan papan penunjuk tujuan, ia turun dari kereta bersama banyak penumpang lainnya.) 出張中の社員は、終点の駅でバスから降り、すぐ近くのコンビニで飲み物を買いました。 Shutchō-chū no shain wa, shūten no eki de basu kara orite, sugu chikaku no konbini de nomimono o kaimashita. If folded incorrectly, it may tear when opened.) --- 旅行のパンフレットは大きすぎてバッグに入らないので、注意深く三つ折りに折った。 ryokou no panfuretto wa ookisugite baggu ni hairanai node, chuui bukaku mittsuori ni orotta. (The unforgettable memory of staying at a seaside hotel during summer vacation and swimming far out every day while gazing at the blue ocean.) 水温が低くて最初はためらったが、一度泳ぎ始めると、体が水に慣れて、いつまでも泳ぎ続けたくなった。 suitō ga hikukute saisho wa tameratta ga, ichido oyoihajimetara, karada ga mizu ni narete, itsumade mo oyogi tsuzuketakunatta. (I searched thoroughly inside my bag, but my wallet was nowhere to be found, so I’m starting to think I might have left it at home by mistake.) 警察は失踪者の手がかりを捜すため、現場を徹底的に調査している。 keisatsu wa shissōsha no tegakari o sagasu tame, genba o tettōteki ni chōsa shite iru. (I’m looking for this book—do you happen to know where it is? I’d really appreciate your help if you could assist me.) 鍵をなくしてしまい、今必死で家中の引き出しや棚を一つ一つ探しています。 kagi o nakushite shimai, ima hisshi de iejū no hikidashi ya tana o hitotsu hitotsu sagashite imasu. Word/Phrase: 咲く

Present Tense: 誘います

Example: 友達に映画を見に誘われたけど、今日は仕事の締め切りが迫っていて、残業もしなければならないので行けない tomodachi ni eiga o mi ni sasowareta kedo, kyō wa shigoto no shimekiri ga sematte ite, zangyō mo shinakereba naranai node ikenai (My friend invited me to watch a movie, but I can't go today because I have a tight work deadline and need to work overtime) 友達が「一緒に美術館の新しい展示を見に行こう」と誘ってくれたので、週末の予定を調整して喜んで受けました tomodachi ga "issho ni bijutsukan no atarashī tenji o mi ni ikō" to sasotte kureta node, shūmatsu no yotei o chōsei shite yorokonde ukemashita (My friend invited me to see the new exhibition at the art museum together, so I happily accepted after adjusting my weekend plans)

Word/Phrase: 差す
Romaji: sasu
Meaning: buka, put up, stretch up
Present Tense: 差します
Te-form: 差して
Example: 彼女は窓から手を差して、春の暖かい風に触れながら外の美しい景色をゆっくりと楽しんだ。 kanojo wa mado kara te o sashite, haru no atatakai kaze ni fure nagara soto no utsukushii keshiki o yukkuri to tanoshinda. (She stretched her arm out the window, gently touching the warm spring breeze while slowly enjoying the beautiful view outside.)

Word/Phrase: 騒ぐ
Romaji: sawagu
Meaning: have fun, make noise
Present Tense: 騒ぎます
Te-form: 騒いで
Example: 公園のベンチで新聞を読んでいた老人は、遠くから聞こえてくる子供たちの騒ぐ声に眉をひそめ、ため息をついた kōen no benchi de shinbun o yonde ita rōjin wa, tōku kara kikoete kuru kodomo-tachi no sawagu koe ni mayu o hisome, tameiki o tsuitta (The elderly man reading a newspaper on the park bench frowned at the sound of children making noise in the distance and sighed deeply) 図書館の静かな空間に、突然隣の席で友達同士が大きな声で話し始め、周りの利用者たちが騒ぐ彼らを困った顔で見た toshokan no shizuka na kūkan ni, totsuzen tonari no seki de tomodachi-dōshi ga ōkina koe de hanashihajime, mawari no riyōsha-tachi ga sawagu karera o komatta kao de mita (The quiet atmosphere of the library was disrupted when a group of friends suddenly started talking loudly at the next table, and the surrounding patrons looked at them with troubled expressions)

Word/Phrase: 騒ぐ
Romaji: sawagu
Meaning: bikin onar
Present Tense: 騒ぎます
Te-form: 騒いで
Example: 子供たちが公園で大きな声で騒いでいるので、近所の人が苦情を言いに来るほどです kodomotachi ga kōen de ōkina koe de sawagide iru node, kinjo no hito ga kujō o ii ni kuru hodo desu (The children are making such a racket in the park with loud voices that neighbors are coming to complain) 教室で生徒たちが突然騒ぎ始めたので、先生は授業を一時中断して注意を与えなければなりませんでした kyōshitsu de seito-tachi ga totsuzen sawagihajimeta node, sensei wa jugyō o ichiji chūdan shite chūi o atae nakereba narimasen deshita (The students suddenly started making noise in the classroom, so the teacher had to temporarily stop the lesson to give them a warning)

Word/Phrase: 触る
Romaji: sawaru
Meaning: touch
Present Tense: 触ります
Te-form: 触って
Example: 触ると痛みが走るので、その火傷した部分には絶対に触らないでください sawaru to itami ga hashiru node, sono yakedo shita bubun ni wa zettai ni sawaranai de kudasai (Please do not touch the burned area at all, as it will send a sharp pain when touched) 図書館の貴重な古書は手袋を着用し、丁寧にページを触ってめくるように心がけてください toshokan no kichō na kosho wa tebukuro o chakuyō shi, teinei ni pēji o sawatte mekuru yō ni kokoro gake te kudasai (When handling the library’s valuable antique books, wear gloves and be careful to touch and turn the pages gently)

Word/Phrase: 背負う
Romaji: seou
Meaning: memanggul, gendong
Present Tense: 背負います
Te-form: 背負って
Example: 山田社長は、倒産の危機にある会社の将来を背負いながら、毎晩遅くまで仕事を続けている。 yamada shachō wa, tōsan no kiki ni aru kaisha no shōrai o seoinagara, maiban osoku made shigoto o tsuzukete iru. (President Yamada, who shoulders the future of a company on the brink of bankruptcy, continues working late every night.) 新製品の発売を任された田中さんは、その成功を背負うプレッシャーに負けず、チームを励まし続けた。 shin seihin no hatsubai o makasareta tanaka-san wa, sono seikō o seou pureshā ni makezu, chīmu o hagemashi tsuzuketa. (Tanaka, entrusted with the new product launch, refused to yield to the pressure of carrying its success and kept encouraging the team.)

Word/Phrase: 喋る
Romaji: shaberu
Meaning: chat
Present Tense: 喋ります
Te-form: 喋って
Example: 友達と色々な話題で喋るのが好きで、休み時間には教室の隅でよくクラスメイトと楽しく喋ります tomodachi to iroiro na wadai de shaberu no ga suki de, yasumi jikan ni wa kyōshitsu no sumi de yoku kurasumeeto to tanoshiku shaberimasu (I enjoy chatting with friends about various topics, and during breaks, I often happily chat with classmates in the corner of the classroom) 新しいクラスメイトと積極的に喋る機会を作って、共通の興味を見つけながら人間関係を少しずつ深めていきたいと思っています atarashii kurasumeeto to sekkyokuteki ni shaberu kikai o tsukutte, kyōtsū no kyōmi o mitsukenagara ningen kankei o sukoshi zutsu fukamete ikitai to omotte imasu (I want to proactively create opportunities to chat with new classmates, finding common interests and gradually deepening relationships)

Word/Phrase: 叱る
Romaji: shikaru
Meaning: scold
Present Tense: しかります
Te-form: 叱りて
Example: 子供の時、父は少しのことでも厳しく叱って、それが今の私を形成する大きな要因になったと思っています kodomo no toki, chichi wa sukoshi no koto demo kibishiku shikatte, sore ga ima no watashi o keisei suru ōkina yōin ni natta to omotteimasu (When I was a child, my father would scold me strictly even for small things, and I believe that became a major factor in shaping who I am today) 授業中に私語をしていた生徒たちを、先生は教室の前で一人一人理由を説明させながら叱りつけた jugyōchū ni shigo o shiteita seito-tachi o, sensei wa kyōshitsu no mae de hitori hitori rijū o setsumei sasenagara shikaritsuketa (The teacher scolded the students who were talking during class one by one in front of the classroom, making each explain their reasons)

Word/Phrase: 占める
Romaji: shimeru
Meaning: occupy
Present Tense: 占めます
Te-form: 占めて
Example: 日本の食事では、ご飯が主食としての役割を占め、栄養バランスの基礎となっている Nihon no shokuji de wa, gohan ga shushoku toshite no yakuwari o shime, eiyō baransu no kiso to natte iru (In Japanese meals, rice occupies the role of the staple food and forms the foundation of nutritional balance) その市場では、新鮮な野菜を扱う売り場が最も広いスペースを占めており、毎朝多くの客で賑わっている Sono ichiba de wa, shinsen na yasai o atukau uriba ga mottomo hiroi supēsu o shimete ori, maiasa ōku no kyaku de nigiwatte iru (In that market, the section selling fresh vegetables occupies the largest space and is bustling with many customers every morning)

Word/Phrase: 締める
Romaji: shimeru
Meaning: tighten, put on
Present Tense: 締めます
Te-form: 絞めて
Example: 契約書にハンコを押して、今日中に締める手続きを終えました keiyakusho ni hanko o oshite, kyōjū ni shimeru tetsuzuki o oemashita (After stamping the contract with a seal, we completed the finalization process by the end of today) 工場の安全基準を再確認して、全てのネジや部品を今月中に締めます kōjō no anzen kijun o saikakunin shite, subete no neji ya buhin o kongetsu jū ni shimerimasu (The factory's safety standards were double-checked, and all screws and components will be tightened by the end of this month)

Word/Phrase: 閉める
Romaji: shimeru
Meaning: close
Present Tense: 閉めます
Te-form: 閉めて
Example: 窓を閉める前に、部屋の中に新鮮な風を取り入れて、心地よい空気の流れを楽しんでみてください mado o shimeru mae ni, heya no naka ni shinsen’na kaze o toriirete, kokochiyoi kūki no nagare o tanoshinde mite kudasai (Before closing the window, let in some fresh air to enjoy the pleasant breeze flowing through the room) 冷蔵庫の扉をしっかり閉めないと、電気代が無駄になるだけでなく、保存している食材の鮮度も急速に低下してしまいます reizōko no tobira o shikkari shimenai to, denki-dai ga muda ni naru dake de naku, hozon shite iru shokuzai no sendo mo kyūsoku ni teika shite shimaimasu (If you don’t close the fridge door properly, not only will you waste electricity, but the freshness of the stored ingredients will also deteriorate rapidly)

Word/Phrase: 信じる
Romaji: shinjiru
Meaning: trust
Present Tense: 信じます
Te-form: 信じて
Example: 友達が「この薬は絶対に効くよ」と信じて、毎日欠かさず飲み続けている tomodachi ga "kono kusuri wa zettai ni kiku yo" to shinjite, mainichi kakasazu nomitsudukete iru (My friend believes "this medicine will definitely work" and continues to take it without fail every day) 警察は目撃者の証言を信じて、容疑者の行方を追跡し始めたが、新たな証拠が見つからないため捜査は難航している keisatsu wa mokugekisha no shōgen o shinjite, yōgisha no yukue o tsuiseki shihajimeta ga, aratana shōko ga mitsukaranai tame sōsa wa nankō shite iru (The police believed the eyewitness's testimony and began tracking the suspect’s whereabouts, but the investigation is struggling because no new evidence has been found)

Word/Phrase: 死ぬ
Romaji: shinu
Meaning: mati (gak sopan dipake untuk orang)
Present Tense: 死にます
Te-form: 死んで
Example: その事故で多くの人が死んだそうで、家族や友人たちに深い悲しみをもたらした。 Sono jiko de ooku no hito ga shinda sou de, kazoku ya yūjin-tachi ni fukai kanashimi o motarashita. (Many people reportedly died in that accident, bringing deep sorrow to their families and friends) 長い間病気と闘っていたが、結局彼は静かに息を引き取り、この世を去って死んだ。 Nagai aida byōki to tatakatte ita ga, kekkyoku kare wa shizuka ni iki o hikitori, kono yo o sarite shinda. (After a long battle with illness, he passed away quietly and left this world in death)

Word/Phrase: 調べる
Romaji: shiraberu
Meaning: investigate/search (non physical, e.g. googling)
Present Tense: 調べます
Te-form: 調べて
Example: 調べる前に、まずは図書館で本を借りて、必要な情報を集めることが大切です shiraberu mae ni, mazu wa toshokan de hon o karite, hitsuyō na jōhō o atsumeru koto ga taisetsu desu (Before conducting research, it's important to first borrow books from the library and gather the necessary information systematically) 歴史の授業で、江戸時代の文化について詳しく調べることになったので、古文書や資料を読み込んで準備を進めている rekishi no jugyō de, Edo jidai no bunka ni tsuite kuwashiku shiraberu koto ni natta node, kobunsho ya shiryō o yomikonde junbi o susumete iru (For history class, I had to thoroughly investigate the culture of the Edo period, so I’ve been reading old documents and materials to prepare)

Word/Phrase: 知らせる
Romaji: shiraseru
Meaning: inform
Present Tense: 知らせます
Te-form: 知らせて
Example: 明日、会議の時間が変更になったことを同僚に正確に知らせ、資料も共有しなければならない Ashita, kaigi no jikan ga henkō ni natta koto o dōryō ni seikaku ni shirasete, shiryō mo kyōyū shinakereba naranai (I need to accurately inform my colleague about the meeting time change tomorrow and also share the documents) 来週のイベントが台風接近により中止が決まったので、参加者全員に速やかに知らせ、払い戻し手続きについても説明した Raishū no ibento ga taifū sekkin ni yori chūshi ga kimatta node, sanka-sha zen'in ni sumiyaka ni shirasete, harai-modoshi tetsuzuki ni tsuite mo setsumei shita (I promptly informed all participants that next week's event was canceled due to an approaching typhoon and also explained the refund procedure)

Word/Phrase: 知り合う
Romaji: shiriau
Meaning: saling kenal
Present Tense: 知合います
Te-form: 知り合って
Example: 友達の友達を通じて、先月開催された国際交流パーティーで興味深い背景を持つ新しい人と知り合いました tomodachi no tomodachi o tsūjite, sengetsu kaisai sa re ta kokusai kōryū pātī de kyōmi bukai na haikei o motsu atarashii hito to shiriau mashita (Through a friend of a friend, I got to know an interesting new person with a unique background at an international exchange party held last month) その作家と知り合ってから、毎週土曜日の午後を利用して、近所のカフェで一緒に小説の構想を練るようになりました sono sakka to shiriatte kara, mai shū doyōbi no gogo o riyō shite, kinjo no kafe de issho ni shōsetsu no kōsō o neru yō ni narimashita (Since getting to know that novelist, we’ve started meeting every Saturday afternoon at a local café to work on plotting our novels together)

Word/Phrase: 生じる
Romaji: shoujiru
Meaning: occur

Te-form: 生じて
Example: 経済の変動により、予期せぬ支出が生じる場合がある Keizai no hendō ni yori, yoki senu shishutsu ga shōjiru baai ga aru (Due to economic fluctuations, unexpected expenses may occasionally occur in financial planning) 新しい法律が施行されると、社会に様々な変化が生じるでしょう Atarashii hōritsu ga shikō sareru to, shakai ni samazama na henka ga shōjiru deshō (When a new law is implemented, society will likely experience a wide range of changes in its structure and daily operations)

Word/Phrase: 育てる

Present Tense: 育てます
Te-form: 育てて
Example: 母は私を大切に育ててくれたので、今でも心から感謝の気持ちを抱いています Haha wa watashi o taisetsu ni sodatete kureta node, ima demo kokoro kara kansha no kimochi o idakte imasu (My mother raised me with great care, so even now I feel deep gratitude from the bottom of my heart) この希少な蘭の品種は、湿度と温度を細かく管理しながら丁寧に育てる必要があります Kono kisetsu na ran no hinshu wa, shitsudo to ondo o komakaku kanri shinagara teinei ni sodateru hitsuyō ga arimasu (This rare orchid variety requires careful cultivation with precise control of humidity and temperature)

Word/Phrase: 備える
Romaji: sonaeru
Meaning: prepare
Present Tense: 備えます
Te-form: 備えて
Example: この会社は災害に備えて非常食や水、医療キット、発電機を備蓄し、定期的な避難訓練も実施しています Kono kaisha wa saigai ni sonaete hijōshoku ya mizu, iryō kitto, hatsudenski o bichiku shi, teikiteki na hinan kunren mo jissi shite imasu (This company stocks emergency food, water, medical kits, and generators in preparation for disasters, and also conducts regular evacuation drills) 新入社員は将来の国際プロジェクトに備えて、語学研修と専門的な技術トレーニングを受け、海外の業務フローにも精通するよう努めています Shinnyūshain wa shōrai no kokusai purojekuto ni sonaete, gogaku kenshū to senmonteki na gijutsu torēningu o uke, kaigai no gyōmu furō ni mo seitsū suru yō tsutomete imasu (New employees are undergoing language training and specialized technical workshops to prepare for future international projects, while also striving to familiarize themselves with overseas operational workflows)

Word/Phrase: 滑る
Romaji: suberu
Meaning: terpeleset
Present Tense: 滑ります
Te-form: 滑って
Example: 雪が解けて濡れたアスファルトの上を急いで歩いていたら、気づかないうちに足が滑って、持っていた書類が空中に散らばってしまった。 yuki ga tokete nureta asufaruto no ue o isoide aruite ita ra, kizu ka nai uchi ni ashi ga suvette, motte ita shorui ga kūchū ni sanrabatte shimatta. (While hurrying across wet asphalt where the snow had melted, I slipped without noticing and sent the documents I was holding flying through the air.) 駅の階段を駆け下りようとした瞬間、誰かがこぼしたジュースで足を滑らせ、後ろ向きに倒れそうになって慌てて手すりを掴んだ。 eki no kaidan o kakeoriyō to shita shunkan, dare ka ga koboshita jūsu de ashi o suberase, ushiro-muki ni taore sō ni natte awatete tesuri o tsukanda. (Just as I tried to rush down the station stairs, my foot slipped on spilled juice, and I nearly fell backward, hastily grabbing the handrail.)

Word/Phrase: 過ぎる
Romaji: sugiru
Meaning: berlalu, melewati
Present Tense: 過ぎます
Te-form: 過ぎて
Example: この映画は長すぎて、途中で退屈になってしまい、結局最後まで見ずに寝てしまいました kono eiga wa nagasugite, tochū de taikutsu ni natte shimai, kekkyoku saigo made mizu ni nete shimaimashita (This movie was too long, and I got bored halfway through, so in the end, I fell asleep without watching it to the finish) この本は内容が難しすぎて、辞書を引きながら読んでも半分も理解できませんでした kono hon wa naiyō ga muzukashisugite, jisho o hikinagara yonde mo hanbun mo rikai dekimasen deshita (The content of this book was too difficult, and even while looking up words in the dictionary as I read, I couldn’t understand even half of it)

Word/Phrase: すぎる

Meaning: too much

Te-form: すぎて
Example: この本は難しすぎて、内容を完全に把握するまでに何時間も費やさなければならないでしょう kono hon wa muzukashisugite, naiyō o kanzen ni ahaku suru made ni nanjikan mo tsuiyasu nakereba naranai deshō (This book is too difficult, and it will probably take hours to fully grasp the content) この映画は長すぎる上に展開が遅すぎるので、クライマックスにたどり着く前に退屈で寝てしまいました kono eiga wa nagasugiru ue ni tenkai ga ososugiru node, kuraimakkusu ni tadoritsuku mae ni taikutsu de neteshimai mashita (This movie is too long and the plot develops too slowly, so I got bored and fell asleep before reaching the climax)

Word/Phrase: 過ごす
Romaji: sugosu
Meaning: spend (time)
Present Tense: 過ごします
Te-form: 過ごして
Example: 夏休みは家族と一緒に海で過ごしました。そして、毎日美味しい海の幸を食べました Natsu yasumi wa kazoku to issho ni umi de sugoshimashita. Soshite, mainichi oishii umi no sachi o tabemashita. (During my summer vacation, I spent time with my family at the beach, and we enjoyed delicious seafood every single day) 冬の休日は家でゆっくり過ごしたいです。友達と会うのも楽しみですが、時々一人で過ごす時間も大切です Fuyu no kyūjitsu wa ie de yukkuri sugoshitai desu. Tomodachi to au no mo tanoshimi desu ga, tokidoki hitori de sugosu jikan mo taisetsu desu. (During winter holidays, I want to spend my days relaxing at home, and though I enjoy meeting friends, I also value the quiet moments I spend by myself)

Word/Phrase: 済ませる
Romaji: sumaseru

Present Tense: 済ませます
Te-form: 済ませて
Example: 宿題を済ませてから、大学の図書館で必要な資料を探し、その後友達と映画を見に行きました shukudai o sumasete kara, daigaku no toshokan de hitsuyō na shiryō o sagashi, sono go tomodachi to eiga o mi ni ikimashita (after finishing my homework, I searched for the necessary materials at the university library, then went to watch a movie with my friends) この週末は、長時間放置していた買い物リストの品を全て買い、部屋の大掃除を済ませて、残りの時間をゆっくりと過ごしたいです kono shūmatsu wa, chōjikan hōchi shite ita kaimono risuto no shina o subete kai, heya no ōsōji o sumasete, nokori no jikan o yukkuri to sugoshitai desu (this weekend, I want to buy all the items on my long-neglected shopping list, finish deep-cleaning my room, then spend the remaining time relaxing)

Word/Phrase: 住む
Romaji: sumu
Meaning: live (reside)
Present Tense: 住みます
Te-form: 住んで
Example: 東京の近くに住んでいる友達は、毎日電車で一時間かかって会社に通っています Tōkyō no chikaku ni sumnde iru tomodachi wa, mainichi densha de ichijikan kakatte kaisha ni kayotte imasu (My friend who lives near Tokyo commutes to the office by train for an hour every day) この町では、多くの人が古い家に住んでいますが、私は新しいアパートに住みたいです Kono machi de wa, ōku no hito ga furui ie ni sumnde imasu ga, watashi wa atarashii apāto ni sumitai desu (In this town, many people live in old houses, but I want to live in a new apartment because modern spaces suit my lifestyle better.)

Word/Phrase: 勧める
Romaji: susumeru
Meaning: recommend
Present Tense: 勧めます
Te-form: 勧めて
Example: このレストランは新しい料理を勧めるので、いつも新鮮で独創的な味わいを楽しむことができます kono resutoran wa atarashii ryōri o susumeru node, itsumo senshin de dokusōteki na ajiwai o tanoshimu koto ga dekimasu (This restaurant recommends new dishes, so you can always enjoy fresh and original flavors) 先週、先生は私たちに大学院進学を強く勧め、将来のキャリアアップのために今から準備するよう助言しました senshū, sensei wa watashitachi ni daigakuin shingaku o tsuyoku susume, shōrai no kyaria appu no tame ni ima kara junbi suru yō jogen shimashita (Last week, the teacher strongly recommended that we pursue graduate studies and advised us to start preparing now for future career advancement)

Word/Phrase: 進む

Example: このプロジェクトは、チームの協力があれば、確実に進むでしょう kono purojekuto wa, chīmu no kyōryoku ga areba, kakujitsu ni susumu deshō (With the team's cooperation, this project will undoubtedly move forward steadily.)

Word/Phrase: 捨てる
Romaji: suteru
Meaning: buang
Present Tense: 捨てます

Example: この古い本はもう読まないから、捨ててしまおうと思います Kono furui hon wa mou yomanai kara, sutete shimau to omoimasu (I don’t read this old book anymore, so I think I’ll just throw it away instead of keeping it) 長年連絡を取っていなかった友人が、突然「もう過去は捨てて、新しい関係を築きたい」とメッセージを送ってきた Naganen renraku o totte inakatta yuujin ga, totsuzen "mou kako wa sutete, atarashii kankei o kizukitai" to messēji o okutte kita (An old friend I hadn’t spoken to in years suddenly sent me a message saying, “Let’s leave the past behind and build a new relationship.”)

Word/Phrase: 座る

(Ketika pertama kali makan nigiri di restoran sushi yang dikunjungi bersama teman minggu lalu, saya terkejut dengan rasa segarnya.) 忙しい朝でも、家族が集まって温かいご飯を食べることで、一日が明るく始まります。 Isogashii asa demo, kazoku ga atsumatte atatakai gohan o taberu koto de, ichinichi ga akaruku hajimarimasu. (It was only recently revealed that he had been secretly maneuvering behind the scenes for a long time to plot the takeover of the company.) そのプロジェクトは、最初から失敗するように誰かが企んだのではないかと、 疑わざるを得ない展開を見せていた。 sono purojekuto wa, saisho kara shippai suru yō ni dareka ga takuranda no dewa nai ka to, utagawa zaru o enai tenkai o misete ita. (The project’s progression was such that one could not help but suspect someone had conspired from the start to ensure its failure.)

Word/Phrase: 動かす

(When driving a car, it is necessary for safety to shift the gear to neutral and release the handbrake before starting the engine and moving.) この工場で使われている機械は、ハンドルを右に回すだけで重い荷物も簡単に動かすことができるように設計されている。 Kono koujou de tsukawarete iru kikai wa, handoru o migi ni mawasu dake de omoi nimotsu mo kantan ni ugokasu koto ga dekiru you ni sekkei sarete iru.

Word/Phrase: 伺う

Meaning: listen, ask, visit (kenjogo dari kiku dan iku)

Word/Phrase: 伺う

(has finally taken its first step toward resolving decades-long pollution issues.)

Word/Phrase: 売る

(The store’s strategy lies in offering both discounted new models and used products, thereby providing customers with options tailored to their budgets.) 近所の八百屋は、朝市で仕入れた野菜を正午までに完売させるため、開店前から行列ができるほどの人気を集めている。 kinjo no yaoya wa, asaichi de shiireta yasai o shōgo made ni kanbai saseru tame, kaiten mae kara gyōretsu ga dekiru hodo no ninki o atsumete iru. (The local greengrocer, which sells out all its market-fresh vegetables by noon, attracts such crowds that lines form even before opening.)

Word/Phrase: 歌う

(What always reaches the ears of people reading newspapers on the park bench every morning is that powerful voice singing along with the birds from between the trees.) 放課後、音楽準備室の前を通ると、ピアノの音色に乗せて歌う子供たちの声が聞こえてくる。その歌は、校舎の廊下を歩く生徒たちの足取りを、自然と軽やくしている。 hōkago, ongaku junbishitsu no mae o tōru to, piano no neiro ni nosete utau kodomotachi no koe ga kikoete kuru. sono uta wa, kōsha no rōka o aruku seito-tachi no ashidori o, shizen to karoyaku shite iru. (After school, when passing by the music preparation room, you can hear children singing along with the piano. Their song naturally lightens the steps of students walking through the school corridors.)

(As part of the city’s redevelopment plan, the post office’s operations will be relocated to the first floor of the new building in front of the station next year.) 二百年以上の歴史を持つこの町の神社は、来月、参拝者が増えるようにと、広い敷地のある新しい場所へ移る予定だ。 nihyaku-nen ijō no rekishi o motsu kono machi no jinja wa, raigetsu, sanpai-sha ga fueru yō ni to, hiroi shikichi no aru atarashii basho e utsuru yotei da. (Please transfer these documents from the file to the computer including the folders, and don’t forget to create a backup.) 先月、東京から大阪に事務所を移した際、従業員全員の引っ越し手続きも並行して行いました。 Sengetsu, Tōkyō kara Ōsaka ni jimusho o utsushita sai, jūgyōin zen’in no hikkoshi tetsuzuki mo heikōshite okonaimashita. Word/Phrase: 分かる

(We need to carefully divide this project's budget based on the needs and priorities of each department.)

Word/Phrase: 沸く

Once it starts boiling, I’ll prepare the tea for you.) 「このスープはまだ沸いていないので、もう少し強い火で煮込んでください」 kono suupu wa mada waite inai node, mou sukoshi tsuyoi hi de nikonde kudasai (This soup hasn’t started boiling yet, so please simmer it a bit longer over a stronger flame.)

Word/Phrase: 笑う

Example: 友達と一緒に面白い映画を見た後、私たちは笑いながら、そのシーンについて熱心に議論しました tomodachi to issho ni omoshiroi eiga o mita nochi, watashitachi wa warainagara, sono shīn ni tsuite nesshin ni gironshimashita (After watching a funny movie with friends, we laughed while enthusiastically discussing that scene) 先週のパーティーで、彼のジョークにみんな大声で笑った後、その話題でさらに盛り上がりました senshū no pātī de, kare no jōku ni minna ōgoe de waratta ato, sono wadai de sarani moriagari mashita (At last week's party, everyone laughed loudly at his jokes, and then the conversation got even livelier)

Word/Phrase: 割れる

Example: この本はとても面白いので、読んだ内容を決して忘れないようにしてください kono hon wa totemo omoshiroi node, yonda naiyō o keshite wasurenai yō ni shite kudasai (Because this book is very interesting, make sure you never forget what you’ve read) 試験の日に学生証を忘れてしまい、冷や汗をかきながら教室まで走って戻りました shiken no hi ni gakuseishō o wasurete shimai, hiyashi o kaki nagara kyōshitsu made hashitte modorimashita (On the day of the exam, I forgot my student ID and, breaking into a cold sweat, ran all the way back to the classroom)

Word/Phrase: 渡る

(When crossing the river, be careful where you step, as there are slippery rocks that require extra caution.) この橋は大型トラックも安全に渡ることができますが、制限速度を厳守してください。 Kono hashi wa ōgata torakku mo anzen ni wataru koto ga dekimasu ga, seisogen sokudo o genshu shite kudasai. (Even large trucks can cross this bridge safely, but you must strictly observe the speed limit.)

Word/Phrase: 渡す

Word/Phrase: 焼ける

(On days when the summer sun is particularly strong, forgetting to apply sunscreen can cause your skin to burn red and become painful.) この町に残る古い木の家は、火に弱く、火事が起きるとすぐ焼けてしまうため、住民は注意を呼びかけられている。 Kono machi ni nokoru furui ki no ie wa, hi ni yowaku, kaji ga okiru to sugu yakete shimau tame, jūmin wa chūi o yobikakarete iru.

Word/Phrase: 焼く
Romaji: yaku
Meaning: grill
Present Tense: 焼きます
Te-form: 焼いて
Example: このレシピで重要なのは、塩で味付けした魚を中火で均等に焼くことで、両面がきつね色になるまで10分間かかります。 kono reshipi de jūyō na no wa, shio de ajitsuke shita sakana o chūbi de kintō ni yaku koto de, ryōmen ga kitsuneiro ni naru made juppunkan kakari masu. (What’s important in this recipe is grilling the salt-seasoned fish evenly over medium heat until both sides turn golden brown, which takes 10 minutes.) 毎週日曜日にオーブンを180度に予熱し、生地を入れてから15分間焼いたパンは、朝食にバターと一緒に食べるのが私の楽しみです。 maishū nichiyōbi ni ōbun o 180-do ni yonetsu shi, namiji o irete kara 15-punkan yaita pan wa, chōshoku ni batā to issho ni taberu no ga watashi no tanoshimi desu. (The bread baked every Sunday—preheating the oven to 180 degrees, then grilling the dough for 15 minutes—is something I enjoy eating with butter for breakfast.)

Word/Phrase: 止む

(The cough so severe it kept me awake at night—caused by the cold that had persisted for a whole week—finally stopped last night.) 駅のアナウンスで、故障が修理されたと聞いた瞬間、待ち続けた乗客たちの間に安堵の空気が広がり、遅延も止んだ。 eki no anaundo de, koshou ga shuuri sareta to kiita shunkan, machitsuzuketa joukyaku-tachi no aida ni ando no kuuki ga hirogari, chien mo yanda. (The moment the station announcement confirmed the malfunction had been fixed, relief spread among the passengers who had been waiting, and the delays came to an end.)

Word/Phrase: やる

Meaning: give (kepada bawahan, binatang, tanaman)

(Ketika atasan menugaskan pekerjaan baru kepada bawahan, sering terlihat sikapnya yang berusaha menanamkan kepercayaan diri dengan menyerahkan dokumen yang diperlukan sambil berkata, "Kamu pasti bisa.") この植物は成長期に十分な水を与えないと、葉がすぐ枯れてしまうため、飼育する人は毎朝、決まった時間に水やりを行うように心がけている。 kono shokubutsu wa seichōki ni jūbun na mizu o yaenai to, ha ga sugu karete shimau tame, kaiiku suru hito wa maiasa, kimatta jikan ni mizu-yari o okonau yō ni kokorogakete iru. (Oleh karena daunnya mudah layu jika tidak diberi air cukup selama masa pertumbuhan, orang yang merawat tanaman ini berusaha menyiramnya pada waktu tetap setiap pagi.)

Word/Phrase: 瘦せる

Present Tense: 瘦せます

Example: 先月から食生活を見直して、頑張れば来月までに２キロは瘦せられそう Sengetsu kara shokuseikatsu o mi-naoshite, ganbareba raigetsu made ni ni-kiro wa yaserare sou (After reviewing my diet since last month, I think I can lose 2 kilos by next month if I keep trying) 健康のために、毎日運動して瘦せようと思っています Kenkou no tame ni, mainichi undou shite yaseyou to omotte imasu (I’ve been thinking of exercising daily to lose weight for the sake of my health)

Word/Phrase: 休む

Word/Phrase: 呼ぶ

(This restaurant, to express gratitude to its long-time patrons, carefully sent handwritten letters inviting them to the opening announcement.) 取引先のリストを見ながら、一人ひとりに合わせて、新しい店のオープンを知らせるために親しく呼びかける文面を考えた。 Torihikisaki no risuto o minagara, hitori hitori ni awasete, atarashii mise no ōpun o shiraseru tame ni shitashiku yobikakeru bummen o kangaeta. Word/Phrase: 汚れる

Word/Phrase: 汚す

Example: この服は汚すとすぐ汚れが目立つので、食事をするときや外出時には特に気をつけてください Kono fuku wa yogosu to sugu yogore ga medatsu node, shokiji o suru toki ya gaishutsu-ji ni wa tokuni ki o tsukete kudasai (If this clothing gets dirty, stains will be noticeable immediately, so please be especially careful when eating or going out) 公園のベンチにスプレーで落書きをして汚すのは、地域住民全員の共有財産を傷つける迷惑行為です Kōen no benchi ni supurē de rakugaki o shite yogosu no wa, chiiki jūmin zen’in no kyōyū zaisan o kizutsukeru meiwaku kōi desu (Defacing park benches with spray-paint graffiti and making them dirty is an act that damages the shared property of all local residents and causes nuisance)

Word/Phrase: 寄る

Word/Phrase: 揺れる

Word/Phrase: 存じる

Example: 私たちはその会社の社長を存じていますが、まだ直接お会いしたことはありません Watashitachi wa sono kaisha no shachō o zonjite imasu ga, mada chokusetsu o ai shita koto wa arimasen (While we are acquainted with the president of that company, we have not yet had the opportunity to meet them in person) 先日のセミナーでご紹介いただいた研究者のお名前は存じておりますが、詳しい業績までは把握しておりません Sendai no seminā de go shōkai itadaita kenkyūsha no o-namae wa zonjite orimasu ga, kuwashii gyōseki made wa haaku shite orimasen (I am familiar with the name of the researcher introduced at the recent seminar, though I am not fully aware of their detailed achievements)

Word/Phrase: 役に立つ

(If you read this material, even difficult papers will become easier to write, so it will surely be useful for advancing your research.) 大学生の頃から続けているボランティアは、人とのつながりを大切にすることが社会で役に立つと教えてくれた。 daigakusei no koro kara tsuduketeiru borantia wa, hito to no tsunagari o taisetu ni suru koto ga shakai de yaku ni tatsu to oshiete kureta. (The volunteer work I’ve been doing since my university days taught me that valuing connections with people is something truly useful in society.)

Word/Phrase: 気をつける

(When crossing the road, carefully paying attention to the movement of cars and bicycles approaching from both sides is the first step in preventing accidents.) 建物の改修工事が行われている区域では、散乱した資材や滑りやすい床に気をつけながら、ゆっくりと通過しなければならない。 tatemono no kaisū kōji ga okonawarete iru kuiki de wa, sanran shita shizai ya suberiyasui yuka ni ki o tsukenagara, yukkuri to tsūka shinakereba naranai. (In areas where building renovations are underway, one must be cautious of scattered materials and slippery floors while passing through slowly.)

Word/Phrase: 連れて来る

Meaning: ajak dateng bareng

Word/Phrase: 気が付く

Meaning: realize
Example: 電車を降りた瞬間、財布を家に忘れたことに気が付いて焦った densha o orita shunkan, saifu o ie ni wasureta koto ni ki ga tsuku to ajitta (Just as I got off the train, I realized I had left my wallet at home and panicked in a rush) レポートを提出した後で、大事なデータを入れ忘れたことに気が付いた repōto o teishutsu shita ato de, daiji na dēta o irewasureta koto ni ki ga tsuku to zenshō ga tsuyomatta (After submitting the report, I realized I had forgotten to include important data, and my sense of regret grew stronger)

Word/Phrase: 手に入る

Meaning: memperoleh

(This book is out of print and rarely found in stores, so even if you want to get it, it’s not easy.) 先月、長い間探し続けてきたアパートがやっと手に入り、引っ越しの準備で忙しい毎日だ。 sengetsu, nagai aida sagashitsudukete kita apāto ga yatto te ni hai ri, hikōshi no junbi de isogashii mainichi da. (Last month, I finally got the apartment I’d been searching for so long, and now I’m busy every day preparing to move.)

Word/Phrase: 帰って来る

Meaning: kembali lagi
Example: この映画は面白いから、今夜は残業せずに早く帰って来て、一緒にポップコーンを用意しながら見ようよ Kono eiga wa omoshiroi kara, konya wa zangyō sezu ni hayaku kaette kite, issho ni popukōn o yōi shinagara miyō yo (This movie is interesting, so don’t work overtime tonight—come back early, let’s prepare popcorn, and watch it together) 先週遠くの町に引っ越した大学時代の親友が、今日3年ぶりにうちに帰って来る予定で、昔の写真を見ながら一晩中話し込むつもりだ Senshū tōku no machi ni hikkoshita daigaku jidai no shinyū ga, kyō 3-nen buri ni uchi ni kaette kuru yotei de, mukashi no shashin o minagara hitobanjuu hanashikomu tsumori da (My best friend from college, who moved to a distant town last week, is coming back to my place today for the first time in three years, and we plan to stay up all night talking while looking at old photos)

Word/Phrase: 書類
Example: 会社への入社手続きで必要な書類は、本人確認書類や履歴書など複数あり、一つでも不備があると受理されないため、注意が必要だ。 nyūsha no tetsuzuki de hitsuyō na shorui wa, hon’nin kakunin shorui ya rirekisho nado fukusū ari, hitotsu demo fubi ga aru to juri sa renai tame, chūi ga hitsuyō da. (The documents required for company employment procedures include multiple items such as ID verification and resumes, and even a single deficiency can result in rejection, so caution is required.) 市役所で住民票を請求する際、書類の記入ミスが原因で手続きが遅れるケースが多いので、事前に確認することが大切である。 shiyakusho de jūminhyō o seikyū suru sai, shorui no kin’yū missu ga gen’in de tetsuzuki ga okureru kēsu ga ōi node, jizen ni kakunin suru koto ga taisetsu de aru. (When requesting a residence certificate at the city office, many cases experience delays due to errors in document entries, so prior verification is crucial.)
Romaji: shorui
Meaning: dokumen

Word/Phrase: 不具合
Example: このパソコンは最近、不具合が多くて使いにくいです Kono pasokon wa saikin, fuguai ga ōkute tsukai nikui desu (This computer has had many bugs lately, making it quite difficult to use efficiently) 新しいソフトウェアの不具合を詳細に報告するため、カスタマーサポートに直接連絡を取り、対応策について相談しました Atarashī sofutouea no fuguai o shōsai ni hōkoku suru tame, kasutamā sāpōto ni chokusetsu renraku o tori, taiōsaku ni tsuite sōdan shimashita (To report the bugs in the new software in detail, I contacted customer support directly and consulted them about possible solutions)

Word/Phrase: 給料
Example: 会社員の田中さんは、先月の昇給で給料が上がったおかげで、毎月の貯金額を増やすことができ、ついに新しいパソコンとスマートフォンを購入する決意を固めました。 kaishain no Tanaka-san wa, sengetsu no shoukyuu de kyuuryou ga agatta okage de, maitsuki no chokin-gaku o fuyasu koto ga deki, tsuini atarashii pasokon to sumaatofon o kounyuu suru ketsui o katamemashita. (Mr. Tanaka, a company employee, was able to increase his monthly savings thanks to last month's salary raise and finally made up his mind to buy a new computer and smartphone.) 給料日が近づくと、多くの人が外食を控えたり、映画やコンサートなどの娯楽費を減らしたりして、家計のやりくりに努めるようになります。 kyuuryoubi ga chikazuku to, ooku no hito ga gaishoku o hikae tari, eiga ya konsaato nado no goraku-hi o herashitari shite, kakei no yarikuri ni tsutomeru you ni narimasu. (As payday approaches, many people start cutting back on eating out and entertainment expenses like movies and concerts to better manage their household budgets.)
Romaji: kyuuryou
Meaning: gaji

Word/Phrase: 経験
Example: 私はいろいろな国で働いた経験がありますが、日本での仕事は一番難しかったです watashi wa iroiro na kuni de hataraita keiken ga arimasu ga, Nihon de no shigoto wa ichiban muzukashikatta desu (I have work experience in various countries, but my job in Japan was the hardest of all.) 大学時代にボランティア活動をした経験が、今の仕事に非常に役立っています daigaku jidai ni borantia katsudō o shita keiken ga, ima no shigoto ni hijō ni yakudatte imasu (The experience of volunteering during my university years has been extremely useful in my current job.)
Romaji: keiken
Meaning: experience

Word/Phrase: 分野
Example: 音楽の分野で、彼は数々の賞を受賞し、その才能を世界に認められています ongaku no bunya de, kare wa kazukazu no shō o jushō shi, sono Sainō o sekai ni mitomerarete imasu (in the field of music, he has won numerous awards and gained global recognition for his talent) 科学の分野で新しい発見が毎日のように報告され、研究者たちは未来への可能性を広げています kagaku no bunya de atarashī hakken ga mainichi no yō ni hōkoku sare, kenkyū-sha-tachi wa miraie no kanōsei o hirogete imasu (new discoveries in the field of science are reported almost daily, expanding researchers' possibilities for the future)
Romaji: bunya
Meaning: bidang

Word/Phrase: 協力
Example: 学校のグループワークで成功するには、メンバーがそれぞれの得意分野を生かして協力することが不可欠だ。例えば、資料集めが苦手な人はプレゼンテーションの練習を担当し、データ分析が得意な人が調査結果をまとめることで、短時間で質の高い成果物が完成する。 gakkō no gurūpuwāku de seikō suru ni wa, menbā ga sorezore no tokui bunya o ikashite kyouryoku suru koto ga fukaketsu da. Tatoeba, shiryā atsume ga niganate na hito wa purezentēshon no renshū o tantō shi, dēta bunseki ga tokui na hito ga chōsa kekka o matomeru koto de, tanjikan de shitsu no takai seikabutsu ga kanseisuru. (To succeed in school group work, it is essential that members cooperate by leveraging their respective strengths. For example, someone who struggles with gathering materials can handle presentation practice, while someone skilled in data analysis compiles the research results, allowing high-quality output to be completed in a short time.) 近年、企業間の協力が進み、環境問題の解決に向けた新しい技術が次々と開発されている。例えば、自動車メーカーとエネルギー会社が共同で電気自動車用の充電インフラを整備することで、持続可能な社会の実現に大きく貢献している。 kin’nen, kigyōkan no kyouryoku ga susumi, kankyō mondai no kaiketsu ni muketa atarashii gijutsu ga tsugitsugi to kaihatsu sarete iru. Tatoeba, jidōsha mékā to enerugī kaisha ga kyōdō de denki jidōsha-yō no jūden infura o seibi suru koto de, jizoku kanō na shakai no jitsugen ni ōkiku kōken shite iru. (In recent years, intercompany cooperation has advanced, leading to the successive development of new technologies aimed at solving environmental issues. For example, automobile manufacturers and energy companies jointly developing charging infrastructure for electric vehicles are making significant contributions to the realization of a sustainable society.)
Romaji: kyouryoku
Meaning: cooperation

Word/Phrase: 宿題
Example: 宿題を終わらせる前に、少し休みたいですけど、時間がないので、がんばってやります shukudai o owaraseru mae ni, sukoshi yasumitai desu kedo, jikan ga nai node, ganbatte yarimasu (Before finishing my homework, I’d like to take a short break, but since I don’t have time, I’ll push through and get it done) 先生に宿題を忘れないように、カレンダーに提出日を大きな字で書いておきました sensei ni shukudai o wasurenai you ni, karendā ni teishutsu bi o ookina ji de kaite okimashita (So I wouldn’t forget to submit my homework to the teacher, I wrote the due date in big letters on my calendar)
Romaji: shukudai
Meaning: homework

Word/Phrase: 品
Example: この工場で作られる品は、国内外の厳しい品質基準をクリアし、長年にわたり業界で最高の評価を得ています kono kōjō de tsukurareru shina wa, kokunai-gaide kiibiishii hinshitsu kijun o kuria shi, naganeniwatarigiōkai de saikō no hyōka o ete imasu (The products manufactured in this factory meet strict quality standards both domestically and internationally and have consistently received the highest praise in the industry for many years) 商品展示会では、各社の最新技術を駆使した革新的な品が多数展示され、来場者から熱い視線を集めています shōhin tenjikai de wa, kakusha no saishin gijutsu o kushi shita kakushinteki na shina ga tasū tenji sare, raijōsha kara atsui shisen o atsumete imasu (At the trade fair, many innovative products showcasing each company’s cutting-edge technology are on display, drawing intense attention from visitors)
Romaji: shina
Meaning: product

Word/Phrase: 締め切り
Example: 宿題の締め切りは明日ですが、まだ半分も終わっていないので、今晩は徹夜で取り組まなければなりません shukudai no shimekiri wa ashita desu ga, mada hanbun mo owaratte inai node, konban wa tetuya de torikumana kereba nari masen (The homework deadline is tomorrow, but I haven’t even finished half of it, so I’ll have to pull an all-nighter tonight) このプロジェクトの締め切りは来週の金曜日までですが、チームメンバー全員が協力して、予定通りに仕上げられるよう頑張っています kono purojekuto no shimekiri wa raishū no kinyōbi made desu ga, chīmu menbā zen’in ga kyōryoku shite, yotei dōri ni shiagerareru yō ganbatte imasu (The deadline for this project is until next Friday, but all team members are working together to meet the schedule)
Romaji: shimekiri
Meaning: deadline

Word/Phrase: 業
Example: 彼が勤めるIT業界の企業は、世界中で信頼されており、仕事量は多いものの、やりがいを感じて毎日頑張っている。 Kare ga tsutomaru IT gyōkai no kigyō wa, sekaijū de shinraisarete ori, shigotoryō wa ōi mono no, yarigai o kanjite mainichi ganbatte iru. (The IT company he works for is trusted worldwide, and though the workload is heavy, he feels a sense of fulfillment and works hard every day) 大学を出た後、彼は地元の建設業に飛び込み、今では大きな橋や道路の工事を任されるほど成長した。 Daigaku o deta ato, kare wa jimoto no kensetsugyō ni tobikomi, ima de wa ōkina hashi ya dōro no kōji o makaserareru hodo seichō shita. (After leaving university, he jumped into the local construction industry and has grown to the point where he’s now entrusted with major bridge and road projects.)
Romaji: gou
Meaning: business

Word/Phrase: 用事
Example: 学校が終わった後、図書館でグループの発表準備をするため、クラスメイトと待ち合わせる用事が入っている。 Gakkō ga owatta ato, toshokan de gurūpu no happyō junbi o suru tame, kurasumeito to machiawaseru yōji ga haitteiru. (After school ends, I have plans to meet my classmates at the library to prepare for our group presentation.) 明日の午前中に定期検診の用事があるため、上司に休暇の申請をして、仕事のスケジュールを調整してもらった。 Ashita no gozenchū ni teiki kenshin no yōji ga aru tame, jōshi ni kyūka no shinsei o shite, shigoto no sukejūru o chōsei shite moratta.　(Because I have a scheduled medical checkup tomorrow morning, I submitted a leave request to my boss and had my work schedule adjusted.)
Romaji: youji
Meaning: urusan

Word/Phrase: 詳細
Example: このプロジェクトの進捗状況や予算配分、そして最終的な納期についての詳細を教えてください Kono purojekuto no shinchoku jōkyō ya yosan haibun, soshite saishūteki na nōki ni tsuite no shōsai o oshiete kudasai (Please provide the details about the progress, budget allocation, and final deadline for this project) 新製品の仕様書に記載されている技術的な要件やデザインの基準、そして品質管理のプロセスに関する詳細を確認する Shin seihin no shiyōsho ni kisai sarete iru gijutsuteki na yōken ya dezain no kijun, soshite hinshitsu kanri no purosesu ni kansuru shōsai o kakunin suru (Check the details regarding the technical requirements, design standards, and quality control processes listed in the specifications of the new product)
Romaji: shousai
Meaning: details

Word/Phrase: 仏教
Romaji: bukkyou
Meaning: buddha
Example: 日本の町を歩くと、仏教の影響を受けた寺や神社が多く、その中で静かに手を合わせる人の姿がよく見られます。 Nihon no machi o aruito, bukkyō no eikyō o uketa tera ya jinja ga ōku, sono naka de shizuka ni te o awaseru hito no sugata ga yoku miraremasu. (When walking through Japanese towns, you often see many temples and shrines influenced by Buddhism, where people quietly clasp their hands in prayer.) 古いお寺に行けば、仏教の教えを伝える絵や彫刻が飾られていて、訪れる人々の心を落ち着かせる効果があるようです。 Furui otera ni ikeba, bukkyō no oshie o tsutaeru e ya chōkoku ga kazararete ite, otozureru hitobito no kokoro o ochitsukaseru kōka ga aru yō desu. (When you visit an old temple, there are paintings and sculptures conveying Buddhist teachings, which seem to have a calming effect on visitors.)

Word/Phrase: 宗教
Romaji: shuukyou
Meaning: religion
Example: 宗教は人々の心を支え、困難な時期に精神的な安らぎや目的意識を与える大切な要素です shuukyou wa hitobito no kokoro o sasae, konnan na jiki ni seishinteki na yasuragi ya mokuteki ishiki o ataeru taisetsu na youso desu (Religion is an important element that supports people's hearts and provides spiritual peace and a sense of purpose during difficult times.) 宗教は歴史や文化と密接に結びついており、世界各地で多様な信仰や儀式、伝統として現れています shuukyou wa rekishi ya bunka to mitsusetsu ni musubitsuiteori, sekai kakuchi de tayou na shinkou ya gishiki, dentou toshite arawarete imasu (Religion is closely tied to history and culture, manifesting as diverse beliefs, rituals, and traditions around the world.)
